Name: appstream.enable
Desc:
Whether to install files to support the
<a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/appstream/docs/index.html"  target="_top">AppStream metadata specification

Name: boot.enableContainers
Desc:
Whether to enable support for NixOS containers. Defaults to true
(at no cost if containers are not actually used).

Name: boot.bcache.enable
Desc: Whether to enable bcache mount support.

Name: boot.binfmt.addEmulatedSystemsToNixSandbox
Desc: Whether to add the <code class="option">boot.binfmt.emulatedSystems

Name: boot.binfmt.emulatedSystems
Desc:
List of systems to emulate. Will also configure Nix to
support your new systems.
Warning: the builder can execute all emulated systems within the same build, which introduces impurities in the case of cross compilation.

Name: boot.binfmt.preferStaticEmulators
Desc: Whether to use static emulators when available.

Name: boot.binfmt.registrations
Desc:
Extra binary formats to register with the kernel.
See https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/admin-guide/binfmt-misc.html for more details.

Name: boot.binfmt.registrations._name_.fixBinary
Desc:
Whether to open the interpreter file as soon as the
registration is loaded, rather than waiting for a
relevant file to be invoked.

Name: boot.binfmt.registrations._name_.interpreter
Desc: The interpreter to invoke to run the program.

Name: boot.binfmt.registrations._name_.magicOrExtension
Desc: The magic number or extension to match on.

Name: boot.binfmt.registrations._name_.mask
Desc: A mask to be ANDed with the byte sequence of the file before matching

Name: boot.binfmt.registrations._name_.matchCredentials
Desc:
Whether to launch with the credentials and security
token of the binary, not the interpreter (e.g. setuid
bit).

Name: boot.binfmt.registrations._name_.offset
Desc: The byte offset of the magic number used for recognition.

Name: boot.binfmt.registrations._name_.openBinary
Desc:
Whether to pass the binary to the interpreter as an open
file descriptor, instead of a path.

Name: boot.binfmt.registrations._name_.preserveArgvZero
Desc: Whether to pass the original argv[0] to the interpreter.

Name: boot.binfmt.registrations._name_.recognitionType
Desc: Whether to recognize executables by magic number or extension.

Name: boot.binfmt.registrations._name_.wrapInterpreterInShell
Desc: Whether to wrap the interpreter in a shell script.

Name: boot.blacklistedKernelModules
Desc:
List of names of kernel modules that should not be loaded
automatically by the hardware probing code.

Name: boot.bootspec.enableValidation
Desc:
Whether to enable the validation of bootspec documents for each build.
This will introduce Go in the build-time closure as we are relying on <a class="link" href="https://cuelang.org/"  target="_top">Cuelang

Name: boot.bootspec.extensions
Desc: User-defined data that extends the bootspec document.

Name: boot.consoleLogLevel
Desc: The kernel console <code class="literal">loglevel

Name: boot.crashDump.enable
Desc:
If enabled, NixOS will set up a kernel that will
boot on crash, and leave the user in systemd rescue
to be able to save the crashed kernel dump at
/proc/vmcore.
It also activates the NMI watchdog.

Name: boot.crashDump.kernelParams
Desc: Parameters that will be passed to the kernel kexec-ed on crash.

Name: boot.crashDump.reservedMemory
Desc:
The amount of memory reserved for the crashdump kernel.
If you choose a too high value, dmesg will mention
“crashkernel reservation failed”.

Name: boot.devShmSize
Desc:
Size limit for the /dev/shm tmpfs. Look at mount(8), tmpfs size option,
for the accepted syntax.

Name: boot.devSize
Desc:
Size limit for the /dev tmpfs. Look at mount(8), tmpfs size option,
for the accepted syntax.

Name: boot.extraModprobeConfig
Desc:
Any additional configuration to be appended to the generated
<code class="filename">modprobe.conf

Name: boot.extraModulePackages
Desc: A list of additional packages supplying kernel modules.

Name: boot.extraSystemdUnitPaths
Desc:
Additional paths that get appended to the SYSTEMD_UNIT_PATH environment variable
that can contain mutable unit files.

Name: boot.growPartition
Desc: Whether to enable growing the root partition on boot.

Name: boot.hardwareScan
Desc:
Whether to try to load kernel modules for all detected hardware.
Usually this does a good job of providing you with the modules
you need, but sometimes it can crash the system or cause other
nasty effects.

Name: boot.initrd.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable the NixOS initial RAM disk (initrd). This may be
needed to perform some initialisation tasks (like mounting
network/encrypted file systems) before continuing the boot process.

Name: boot.initrd.availableKernelModules
Desc:
The set of kernel modules in the initial ramdisk used during the
boot process.  This set must include all modules necessary for
mounting the root device.  That is, it should include modules
for the physical device (e.g., SCSI drivers) and for the file
system (e.g., ext3).  The set specified here is automatically
closed under the module dependency relation, i.e., all
dependencies of the modules list here are included
automatically.  The modules listed here are available in the
initrd, but are only loaded on demand (e.g., the ext3 module is
loaded automatically when an ext3 filesystem is mounted, and
modules for PCI devices are loaded when they match the PCI ID
of a device in your system).  To force a module to be loaded,
include it in <code class="option">boot.initrd.kernelModules

Name: boot.initrd.checkJournalingFS
Desc: Whether to run <span class="command"><strong>fsck

Name: boot.initrd.clevis.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Clevis in initrd.

Name: boot.initrd.clevis.package
Desc: Clevis package

Name: boot.initrd.clevis.devices
Desc: Encrypted devices that need to be unlocked at boot using Clevis

Name: boot.initrd.clevis.devices._name_.secretFile
Desc: Clevis JWE file used to decrypt the device at boot, in concert with the chosen pin (one of TPM2, Tang server, or SSS).

Name: boot.initrd.clevis.useTang
Desc: Whether the Clevis JWE file used to decrypt the devices uses a Tang server as a pin.

Name: boot.initrd.compressor
Desc: The compressor to use on the initrd image. May be any of:
Type: string or function that evaluates to a(n) string

Name: boot.initrd.compressorArgs
Desc: Arguments to pass to the compressor for the initrd image, or null to use the compressor’s defaults.

Name: boot.initrd.extraFiles
Desc: Extra files to link and copy in to the initrd.

Name: boot.initrd.extraFiles._name_.source
Desc: The object to make available inside the initrd.

Name: boot.initrd.includeDefaultModules
Desc:
This option, if set, adds a collection of default kernel modules
to <code class="option">boot.initrd.availableKernelModules

Name: boot.initrd.kernelModules
Desc: List of modules that are always loaded by the initrd.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.cryptoModules
Desc:
A list of cryptographic kernel modules needed to decrypt the root device(s).
The default includes all common modules.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices
Desc:
The encrypted disk that should be opened before the root
filesystem is mounted. Both LVM-over-LUKS and LUKS-over-LVM
setups are supported. The unencrypted devices can be accessed as
<code class="filename">/dev/mapper/«name»

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.allowDiscards
Desc:
Whether to allow TRIM requests to the underlying device. This option
has security implications; please read the LUKS documentation before
activating it.
This option is incompatible with authenticated encryption (dm-crypt
stacked over dm-integrity).

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.bypassWorkqueues
Desc:
Whether to bypass dm-crypt’s internal read and write workqueues.
Enabling this should improve performance on SSDs; see
<a class="link" href="https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Dm-crypt/Specialties#Disable_workqueue_for_increased_solid_state_drive_(SSD)_performance"  target="_top">here

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.device
Desc: Path of the underlying encrypted block device.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.fallbackToPassword
Desc:
Whether to fallback to interactive passphrase prompt if the keyfile
cannot be found. This will prevent unattended boot should the keyfile
go missing.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.fido2.credential
Desc: The FIDO2 credential ID.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.fido2.credentials
Desc: List of FIDO2 credential IDs.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.fido2.gracePeriod
Desc: Time in seconds to wait for the FIDO2 key.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.fido2.passwordLess
Desc: Defines whatever to use an empty string as a default salt.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.gpgCard
Desc:
The option to use this LUKS device with a GPG encrypted luks password by the GPG Smartcard.
If null (the default), GPG-Smartcard will be disabled for this device.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.gpgCard.encryptedPass
Desc: Path to the GPG encrypted passphrase.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.gpgCard.gracePeriod
Desc: Time in seconds to wait for the GPG Smartcard.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.gpgCard.publicKey
Desc: Path to the Public Key.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.header
Desc:
The name of the file or block device that
should be used as header for the encrypted device.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.keyFile
Desc:
The name of the file (can be a raw device or a partition) that
should be used as the decryption key for the encrypted device. If
not specified, you will be prompted for a passphrase instead.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.keyFileOffset
Desc:
The offset of the key file. Use this in combination with
<code class="literal">keyFileSize

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.keyFileSize
Desc:
The size of the key file. Use this if only the beginning of the
key file should be used as a key (often the case if a raw device
or partition is used as key file). If not specified, the whole
<code class="literal">keyFile

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.keyFileTimeout
Desc:
The amount of time in seconds for a keyFile to appear before
timing out and trying passwords.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.postOpenCommands
Desc: Commands that should be run right after we have mounted our LUKS device.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.preLVM
Desc: Whether the luksOpen will be attempted before LVM scan or after it.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.preOpenCommands
Desc:
Commands that should be run right before we try to mount our LUKS device.
This can be useful, if the keys needed to open the drive is on another partition.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.tryEmptyPassphrase
Desc:
If keyFile fails then try an empty passphrase first before
prompting for password.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.yubikey
Desc:
The options to use for this LUKS device in YubiKey-PBA.
If null (the default), YubiKey-PBA will be disabled for this device.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.yubikey.gracePeriod
Desc: Time in seconds to wait for the YubiKey.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.yubikey.iterationStep
Desc: How much the iteration count for PBKDF2 is increased at each successful authentication.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.yubikey.keyLength
Desc: Length of the LUKS slot key derived with PBKDF2 in byte.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.yubikey.saltLength
Desc: Length of the new salt in byte (64 is the effective maximum).

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.yubikey.slot
Desc: Which slot on the YubiKey to challenge.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.yubikey.storage.device
Desc:
An unencrypted device that will temporarily be mounted in stage-1.
Must contain the current salt to create the challenge for this LUKS device.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.yubikey.storage.fsType
Desc: The filesystem of the unencrypted device.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.yubikey.storage.path
Desc:
Absolute path of the salt on the unencrypted device with
that device’s root directory as “/”.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.devices._name_.yubikey.twoFactor
Desc: Whether to use a passphrase and a YubiKey (true), or only a YubiKey (false).

Name: boot.initrd.luks.fido2Support
Desc: Enables support for authenticating with FIDO2 devices.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.gpgSupport
Desc: Enables support for authenticating with a GPG encrypted password.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.mitigateDMAAttacks
Desc:
Unless enabled, encryption keys can be easily recovered by an attacker with physical
access to any machine with PCMCIA, ExpressCard, ThunderBolt or FireWire port.
More information is available at <a class="link" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DMA_attack"  target="_top">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DMA_attack

Name: boot.initrd.luks.reusePassphrases
Desc:
When opening a new LUKS device try reusing last successful
passphrase.

Name: boot.initrd.luks.yubikeySupport
Desc:
Enables support for authenticating with a YubiKey on LUKS devices.
See the NixOS wiki for information on how to properly setup a LUKS device
and a YubiKey to work with this feature.

Name: boot.initrd.network.enable
Desc:
Add network connectivity support to initrd. The network may be
configured using the <code class="literal">ip

Name: boot.initrd.network.flushBeforeStage2
Desc:
Whether to clear the configuration of the interfaces that were set up in
the initrd right before stage 2 takes over. Stage 2 will do the regular network
configuration based on the NixOS networking options.

Name: boot.initrd.network.openvpn.enable
Desc:
Starts an OpenVPN client during initrd boot. It can be used to e.g.
remotely accessing the SSH service controlled by
<code class="option">boot.initrd.network.ssh

Name: boot.initrd.network.openvpn.configuration
Desc: The configuration file for OpenVPN.

Name: boot.initrd.network.postCommands
Desc:
Shell commands to be executed after stage 1 of the
boot has initialised the network.

Name: boot.initrd.network.ssh.enable
Desc:
Start SSH service during initrd boot. It can be used to debug failing
boot on a remote server, enter pasphrase for an encrypted partition etc.
Service is killed when stage-1 boot is finished.

Name: boot.initrd.network.ssh.authorizedKeyFiles
Desc:
Authorized keys taken from files for the root user on initrd.
You can combine the <code class="literal">authorizedKeyFiles

Name: boot.initrd.network.ssh.authorizedKeys
Desc:
Authorized keys for the root user on initrd.
You can combine the <code class="literal">authorizedKeys

Name: boot.initrd.network.ssh.extraConfig
Desc: Verbatim contents of <code class="filename">sshd_config

Name: boot.initrd.network.ssh.hostKeys
Desc: Specify SSH host keys to import into the initrd.

Name: boot.initrd.network.ssh.ignoreEmptyHostKeys
Desc: Allow leaving <code class="option">config.boot.initrd.network.ssh.hostKeys

Name: boot.initrd.network.ssh.port
Desc: Port on which SSH initrd service should listen.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: boot.initrd.network.ssh.shell
Desc: Login shell of the remote user. Can be used to limit actions user can do.

Name: boot.initrd.network.udhcpc.enable
Desc:
Enables the udhcpc service during stage 1 of the boot process. This
defaults to <code class="option">networking.useDHCP

Name: boot.initrd.network.udhcpc.extraArgs
Desc:
Additional command-line arguments passed verbatim to
udhcpc if <code class="option">boot.initrd.network.enable

Name: boot.initrd.postDeviceCommands
Desc:
Shell commands to be executed immediately after stage 1 of the
boot has loaded kernel modules and created device nodes in
<code class="filename">/dev

Name: boot.initrd.postMountCommands
Desc:
Shell commands to be executed immediately after the stage 1
filesystems have been mounted.

Name: boot.initrd.postResumeCommands
Desc: Shell commands to be executed immediately after attempting to resume.

Name: boot.initrd.preDeviceCommands
Desc:
Shell commands to be executed before udev is started to create
device nodes.

Name: boot.initrd.preFailCommands
Desc: Shell commands to be executed before the failure prompt is shown.

Name: boot.initrd.preLVMCommands
Desc: Shell commands to be executed immediately before LVM discovery.

Name: boot.initrd.prepend
Desc: Other initrd files to prepend to the final initrd we are building.

Name: boot.initrd.secrets
Desc:
Secrets to append to the initrd. The attribute name is the
path the secret should have inside the initrd, the value
is the path it should be copied from (or null for the same
path inside and out).

Name: boot.initrd.services.bcache.enable
Desc: <span class="emphasis"><em>This will only be used when systemd is used in stage 1.

Name: boot.initrd.services.lvm.enable
Desc: <span class="emphasis"><em>This will only be used when systemd is used in stage 1.

Name: boot.initrd.services.resolved.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable resolved for stage 1 networking.
Uses the toplevel ‘services.resolved’ options for ‘resolved.conf’

Name: boot.initrd.services.udev.packages
Desc: <span class="emphasis"><em>This will only be used when systemd is used in stage 1.

Name: boot.initrd.services.udev.binPackages
Desc: <span class="emphasis"><em>This will only be used when systemd is used in stage 1.

Name: boot.initrd.services.udev.rules
Desc: <span class="command"><strong>udev

Name: boot.initrd.supportedFilesystems
Desc:
Names of supported filesystem types, or an attribute set of file system types
and their state. The set form may be used together with <code class="literal">lib.mkForce
Type: (attribute set of boolean) or (list of string) convertible to it

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable systemd in initrd. The unit options such as
<code class="option">boot.initrd.systemd.services

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.package
Desc: The systemd package to use.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.packages
Desc: Packages providing systemd units and hooks.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.additionalUpstreamUnits
Desc: Additional units shipped with systemd that shall be enabled.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.automounts
Desc:
Definition of systemd automount units.
This is a list instead of an attrSet, because systemd mandates the names to be derived from
the ‘where’ attribute.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.contents
Desc: Set of files that have to be linked into the initrd

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.contents._name_.enable
Desc: Whether to enable copying of this file and symlinking it.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.contents._name_.dlopen.features
Desc:
Features to enable via dlopen ELF notes. These will be in
addition to anything included via ‘usePriority’,
regardless of their priority.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.contents._name_.dlopen.usePriority
Desc:
Priority of dlopen ELF notes to include. “required” is
minimal, “recommended” includes “required”, and
“suggested” includes “recommended”.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.contents._name_.source
Desc: Path of the source file.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.contents._name_.target
Desc: Path of the symlink.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.contents._name_.text
Desc: Text of the file.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.dbus.enable
Desc: Whether to enable dbus in stage 1.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.dmVerity.enable
Desc: Mount verity-protected block devices in the initrd.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.emergencyAccess
Desc:
Set to true for unauthenticated emergency access, and false or
null for no emergency access.
Type: boolean or null or (string, not containing newlines or colons)

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.extraBin
Desc: Tools to add to /bin

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.extraConfig
Desc:
Extra config options for systemd. See systemd-system.conf(5) man page
for available options.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.groups
Desc: Groups to include in initrd.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.groups._name_.gid
Desc: ID of the group in initrd.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.initrdBin
Desc: Packages to include in /bin for the stage 1 emergency shell.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.managerEnvironment
Desc:
Environment variables of PID 1. These variables are
<span class="emphasis"><em>not
Type: attribute set of (null or string or path or package)

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.mounts
Desc:
Definition of systemd mount units.
This is a list instead of an attrSet, because systemd mandates the names to be derived from
the ‘where’ attribute.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.network.enable
Desc: Whether to enable networkd or not.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.network.config
Desc: Definition of global systemd network config.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.network.links
Desc: Definition of systemd network links.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.network.netdevs
Desc: Definition of systemd network devices.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.network.networks
Desc: Definition of systemd networks.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.network.wait-online.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the systemd-networkd-wait-online service.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.network.wait-online.anyInterface
Desc:
Whether to consider the network online when any interface is online, as opposed to all of them.
This is useful on portable machines with a wired and a wireless interface, for example.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.network.wait-online.extraArgs
Desc:
Extra command-line arguments to pass to systemd-networkd-wait-online.
These also affect per-interface <code class="literal">systemd-network-wait-online@

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.network.wait-online.ignoredInterfaces
Desc: Network interfaces to be ignored when deciding if the system is online.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.network.wait-online.timeout
Desc: Time to wait for the network to come online, in seconds. Set to 0 to disable.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.paths
Desc: Definition of systemd path units.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.repart.enable
Desc:
Grow and add partitions to a partition table at boot time in the initrd.
systemd-repart only works with GPT partition tables.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.repart.device
Desc: The device to operate on.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.root
Desc:
Controls how systemd will interpret the root FS in initrd. See
<a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/kernel-command-line.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">kernel-command-line

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.services
Desc: Definition of systemd service units.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.slices
Desc: Definition of slice configurations.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.sockets
Desc: Definition of systemd socket units.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.storePaths
Desc: Store paths to copy into the initrd as well.
Type: list of ((submodule) or ((optionally newline-terminated) single-line string or package) convertible to it)

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.storePaths._.enable
Desc: Whether to enable copying of this file and symlinking it.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.storePaths._.dlopen.features
Desc:
Features to enable via dlopen ELF notes. These will be in
addition to anything included via ‘usePriority’,
regardless of their priority.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.storePaths._.dlopen.usePriority
Desc:
Priority of dlopen ELF notes to include. “required” is
minimal, “recommended” includes “required”, and
“suggested” includes “recommended”.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.storePaths._.source
Desc: Path of the source file.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.storePaths._.target
Desc: Path of the symlink.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.strip
Desc: Whether to completely strip executables and libraries copied to the initramfs.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.suppressedStorePaths
Desc:
Store paths specified in the storePaths option that
should not be copied.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.suppressedUnits
Desc:
A list of units to skip when generating system systemd configuration directory. This has
priority over upstream units, <code class="option">boot.initrd.systemd.units

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.targets
Desc: Definition of systemd target units.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.timers
Desc: Definition of systemd timer units.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.tmpfiles.settings
Desc: Similar to <code class="option">systemd.tmpfiles.settings
Type: attribute set of attribute set of attribute set of (submodule)

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.tmpfiles.settings._name_._name_._name_.age
Desc: Delete a file when it reaches a certain age.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.tmpfiles.settings._name_._name_._name_.argument
Desc: An argument whose meaning depends on the type of operation.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.tmpfiles.settings._name_._name_._name_.group
Desc: The group of the file.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.tmpfiles.settings._name_._name_._name_.mode
Desc: The file access mode to use when creating this file or directory.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.tmpfiles.settings._name_._name_._name_.type
Desc: The type of operation to perform on the file.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.tmpfiles.settings._name_._name_._name_.user
Desc: The user of the file.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.tpm2.enable
Desc: Whether to enable systemd initrd TPM2 support.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.units
Desc: Definition of systemd units.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.users
Desc: Users to include in initrd.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.users._name_.group
Desc: Group the user belongs to in initrd.

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.users._name_.shell
Desc: The path to the user’s shell in initrd.
Type: path, not containing newlines or colons

Name: boot.initrd.systemd.users._name_.uid
Desc: ID of the user in initrd.

Name: boot.initrd.unl0kr.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the unl0kr on-screen keyboard in initrd to unlock LUKS.

Name: boot.initrd.unl0kr.package
Desc: The unl0kr package to use.

Name: boot.initrd.unl0kr.allowVendorDrivers
Desc: Whether to load additional drivers for certain vendors (I.E: Wacom, Intel, etc.)

Name: boot.initrd.unl0kr.settings
Desc: Configuration for <code class="literal">unl0kr
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: boot.initrd.verbose
Desc:
Verbosity of the initrd. Please note that disabling verbosity removes
only the mandatory messages generated by the NixOS scripts. For a
completely silent boot, you might also want to set the two following
configuration options:

Name: boot.isContainer
Desc:
Whether this NixOS machine is a lightweight container running
in another NixOS system.

Name: boot.iscsi-initiator.discoverPortal
Desc: iSCSI portal to boot from.

Name: boot.iscsi-initiator.extraConfig
Desc: Extra lines to append to /etc/iscsid.conf

Name: boot.iscsi-initiator.extraConfigFile
Desc: Append an additional file’s contents to <code class="literal">/etc/iscsid.conf

Name: boot.iscsi-initiator.extraIscsiCommands
Desc: Extra iscsi commands to run in the initrd.

Name: boot.iscsi-initiator.logLevel
Desc: Higher numbers elicits more logs.

Name: boot.iscsi-initiator.loginAll
Desc:
Do not log into a specific target on the portal, but to all that we discover.
This overrides setting target.

Name: boot.iscsi-initiator.name
Desc:
Name of the iSCSI initiator to boot from. Note, booting from iscsi
requires networkd based networking.

Name: boot.iscsi-initiator.target
Desc: Name of the iSCSI target to boot from.

Name: boot.kernel.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Linux kernel. This is useful for systemd-like containers which do not require a kernel.

Name: boot.kernel.randstructSeed
Desc: Provides a custom seed for the <code class="varname">RANDSTRUCT

Name: boot.kernel.sysctl
Desc:
Runtime parameters of the Linux kernel, as set by
<span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">sysctl

Name: boot.kernel.sysctl._net.core.rmem_max_
Desc: The maximum receive socket buffer size in bytes. In case of conflicting values, the highest will be used.

Name: boot.kernel.sysctl._net.core.wmem_max_
Desc: The maximum send socket buffer size in bytes. In case of conflicting values, the highest will be used.

Name: boot.kernelModules
Desc:
The set of kernel modules to be loaded in the second stage of
the boot process.  Note that modules that are needed to
mount the root file system should be added to
<code class="option">boot.initrd.availableKernelModules

Name: boot.kernelPackages
Desc:
This option allows you to override the Linux kernel used by
NixOS.  Since things like external kernel module packages are
tied to the kernel you’re using, it also overrides those.
This option is a function that takes Nixpkgs as an argument
(as a convenience), and returns an attribute set containing at
the very least an attribute <code class="varname">kernel

Name: boot.kernelParams
Desc: Parameters added to the kernel command line.
Type: list of string, with spaces inside double quotes

Name: boot.kernelPatches
Desc: A list of additional patches to apply to the kernel.

Name: boot.loader.efi.canTouchEfiVariables
Desc: Whether the installation process is allowed to modify EFI boot variables.

Name: boot.loader.efi.efiSysMountPoint
Desc: Where the EFI System Partition is mounted.

Name: boot.loader.external.enable
Desc: Whether to enable using an external tool to install your bootloader.

Name: boot.loader.external.installHook
Desc: The full path to a program of your choosing which performs the bootloader installation process.

Name: boot.loader.generationsDir.enable
Desc:
Whether to create symlinks to the system generations under
<code class="literal">/boot

Name: boot.loader.generationsDir.copyKernels
Desc:
Whether to copy the necessary boot files into /boot, so
/nix/store is not needed by the boot loader.

Name: boot.loader.generic-extlinux-compatible.enable
Desc:
Whether to generate an extlinux-compatible configuration file
under <code class="literal">/boot/extlinux.conf

Name: boot.loader.generic-extlinux-compatible.configurationLimit
Desc: Maximum number of configurations in the boot menu.

Name: boot.loader.generic-extlinux-compatible.mirroredBoots
Desc: Mirror the boot configuration to multiple paths.

Name: boot.loader.generic-extlinux-compatible.mirroredBoots._.path
Desc:
The path to the boot directory where the extlinux-compatible
configuration files will be written.

Name: boot.loader.generic-extlinux-compatible.populateCmd
Desc:
Contains the builder command used to populate an image,
honoring all options except the <code class="literal">-c <path-to-default-configuration>

Name: boot.loader.generic-extlinux-compatible.useGenerationDeviceTree
Desc:
Whether to generate Device Tree-related directives in the
extlinux configuration.

Name: boot.loader.grub.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the GNU GRUB boot loader.

Name: boot.loader.grub.enableCryptodisk
Desc:
Enable support for encrypted partitions. GRUB should automatically
unlock the correct encrypted partition and look for filesystems.

Name: boot.loader.grub.backgroundColor
Desc: Background color to be used for GRUB to fill the areas the image isn’t filling.

Name: boot.loader.grub.configurationLimit
Desc:
Maximum of configurations in boot menu. GRUB has problems when
there are too many entries.

Name: boot.loader.grub.configurationName
Desc: GRUB entry name instead of default.

Name: boot.loader.grub.copyKernels
Desc:
Whether the GRUB menu builder should copy kernels and initial
ramdisks to /boot.  This is done automatically if /boot is
on a different partition than /.

Name: boot.loader.grub.default
Desc:
Index of the default menu item to be booted.
Can also be set to “saved”, which will make GRUB select
the menu item that was used at the last boot.

Name: boot.loader.grub.device
Desc:
The device on which the GRUB boot loader will be installed.
The special value <code class="literal">nodev

Name: boot.loader.grub.devices
Desc:
The devices on which the boot loader, GRUB, will be
installed. Can be used instead of <code class="literal">device

Name: boot.loader.grub.efiInstallAsRemovable
Desc: Whether to invoke <code class="literal">grub-install

Name: boot.loader.grub.efiSupport
Desc: Whether GRUB should be built with EFI support.

Name: boot.loader.grub.entryOptions
Desc: Options applied to the primary NixOS menu entry.

Name: boot.loader.grub.extraConfig
Desc:
Additional GRUB commands inserted in the configuration file
just before the menu entries.

Name: boot.loader.grub.extraEntries
Desc: Any additional entries you want added to the GRUB boot menu.

Name: boot.loader.grub.extraEntriesBeforeNixOS
Desc: Whether extraEntries are included before the default option.

Name: boot.loader.grub.extraFiles
Desc: A set of files to be copied to <code class="filename">/boot

Name: boot.loader.grub.extraGrubInstallArgs
Desc: Additional arguments passed to <code class="literal">grub-install

Name: boot.loader.grub.extraInstallCommands
Desc:
Additional shell commands inserted in the bootloader installer
script after generating menu entries.

Name: boot.loader.grub.extraPerEntryConfig
Desc:
Additional GRUB commands inserted in the configuration file
at the start of each NixOS menu entry.

Name: boot.loader.grub.extraPrepareConfig
Desc:
Additional bash commands to be run at the script that
prepares the GRUB menu entries.

Name: boot.loader.grub.font
Desc: Path to a TrueType, OpenType, or pf2 font to be used by Grub.

Name: boot.loader.grub.fontSize
Desc: Font size for the grub menu. Ignored unless <code class="literal">font

Name: boot.loader.grub.forceInstall
Desc:
Whether to try and forcibly install GRUB even if problems are
detected. It is not recommended to enable this unless you know what
you are doing.

Name: boot.loader.grub.forcei686
Desc:
Whether to force the use of a ia32 boot loader on x64 systems. Required
to install and run NixOS on 64bit x86 systems with 32bit (U)EFI.

Name: boot.loader.grub.fsIdentifier
Desc:
Determines how GRUB will identify devices when generating the
configuration file. A value of uuid / label signifies that grub
will always resolve the uuid or label of the device before using
it in the configuration. A value of provided means that GRUB will
use the device name as show in <span class="command"><strong>df

Name: boot.loader.grub.gfxmodeBios
Desc: The gfxmode to pass to GRUB when loading a graphical boot interface under BIOS.

Name: boot.loader.grub.gfxmodeEfi
Desc: The gfxmode to pass to GRUB when loading a graphical boot interface under EFI.

Name: boot.loader.grub.gfxpayloadBios
Desc: The gfxpayload to pass to GRUB when loading a graphical boot interface under BIOS.

Name: boot.loader.grub.gfxpayloadEfi
Desc: The gfxpayload to pass to GRUB when loading a graphical boot interface under EFI.

Name: boot.loader.grub.ipxe
Desc:
Set of iPXE scripts available for
booting from the GRUB boot menu.

Name: boot.loader.grub.memtest86.enable
Desc:
Make Memtest86+, a memory testing program, available from the GRUB
boot menu.

Name: boot.loader.grub.memtest86.params
Desc:
Parameters added to the Memtest86+ command line. As of memtest86+ 5.01
the following list of (apparently undocumented) parameters are
accepted:

Name: boot.loader.grub.mirroredBoots
Desc:
Mirror the boot configuration to multiple partitions and install grub
to the respective devices corresponding to those partitions.

Name: boot.loader.grub.mirroredBoots._.devices
Desc:
The path to the devices which will have the GRUB MBR written.
Note these are typically device paths and not paths to partitions.

Name: boot.loader.grub.mirroredBoots._.efiBootloaderId
Desc:
The id of the bootloader to store in efi nvram.
The default is to name it NixOS and append the path or efiSysMountPoint.
This is only used if <code class="literal">boot.loader.efi.canTouchEfiVariables

Name: boot.loader.grub.mirroredBoots._.efiSysMountPoint
Desc:
The path to the efi system mount point. Usually this is the same
partition as the above path and can be left as null.

Name: boot.loader.grub.mirroredBoots._.path
Desc:
The path to the boot directory where GRUB will be written. Generally
this boot path should double as an EFI path.

Name: boot.loader.grub.splashImage
Desc:
Background image used for GRUB.
Set to <code class="literal">null

Name: boot.loader.grub.splashMode
Desc: Whether to stretch the image or show the image in the top-left corner unstretched.

Name: boot.loader.grub.storePath
Desc:
Path to the Nix store when looking for kernels at boot.
Only makes sense when copyKernels is false.

Name: boot.loader.grub.subEntryOptions
Desc: Options applied to the secondary NixOS submenu entry.

Name: boot.loader.grub.theme
Desc: Path to the grub theme to be used.

Name: boot.loader.grub.timeoutStyle
Desc: none

Name: boot.loader.grub.useOSProber
Desc: If set to true, append entries for other OSs detected by os-prober.

Name: boot.loader.grub.users
Desc:
User accounts for GRUB. When specified, the GRUB command line and
all boot options except the default are password-protected.
All passwords and hashes provided will be stored in /boot/grub/grub.cfg,
and will be visible to any local user who can read this file. Additionally,
any passwords and hashes provided directly in a Nix configuration
(as opposed to external files) will be copied into the Nix store, and
will be visible to all local users.

Name: boot.loader.grub.users._name_.hashedPassword
Desc:
Specifies the password hash for the account,
generated with grub-mkpasswd-pbkdf2.
This hash will be copied to the Nix store, and will be visible to all local users.

Name: boot.loader.grub.users._name_.hashedPasswordFile
Desc:
Specifies the path to a file containing the password hash
for the account, generated with grub-mkpasswd-pbkdf2.
This hash will be stored in /boot/grub/grub.cfg, and will
be visible to any local user who can read this file.

Name: boot.loader.grub.users._name_.password
Desc:
Specifies the clear text password for the account.
This password will be copied to the Nix store, and will be visible to all local users.

Name: boot.loader.grub.users._name_.passwordFile
Desc:
Specifies the path to a file containing the
clear text password for the account.
This password will be stored in /boot/grub/grub.cfg, and will
be visible to any local user who can read this file.

Name: boot.loader.grub.zfsSupport
Desc: Whether GRUB should be built against libzfs.

Name: boot.loader.initScript.enable
Desc:
Some systems require a /sbin/init script which is started.
Or having it makes starting NixOS easier.
This applies to some kind of hosting services and user mode linux.

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable the systemd-boot (formerly gummiboot) EFI boot manager.
For more information about systemd-boot:
https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/systemd/systemd-boot/

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.configurationLimit
Desc:
Maximum number of latest generations in the boot menu.
Useful to prevent boot partition running out of disk space.

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.consoleMode
Desc: The resolution of the console. The following values are valid:

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.editor
Desc:
Whether to allow editing the kernel command-line before
boot. It is recommended to set this to false, as it allows
gaining root access by passing init=/bin/sh as a kernel
parameter. However, it is enabled by default for backwards
compatibility.

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.edk2-uefi-shell.enable
Desc:
Make the EDK2 UEFI Shell available from the systemd-boot menu.
It can be used to manually boot other operating systems or for debugging.

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.edk2-uefi-shell.sortKey
Desc: <code class="literal">systemd-boot

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.extraEntries
Desc: Any additional entries you want added to the <code class="literal">systemd-boot
Type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n”

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.extraFiles
Desc: A set of files to be copied to <code class="filename">$BOOT

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.extraInstallCommands
Desc:
Additional shell commands inserted in the bootloader installer
script after generating menu entries. It can be used to expand
on extra boot entries that cannot incorporate certain pieces of
information (such as the resulting <code class="literal">init=

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.graceful
Desc: Invoke <code class="literal">bootctl install

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.installDeviceTree
Desc: Install the devicetree blob specified by <code class="literal">config.hardware.deviceTree.name

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.memtest86.enable
Desc:
Make Memtest86+ available from the systemd-boot menu. Memtest86+ is a
program for testing memory.

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.memtest86.sortKey
Desc: <code class="literal">systemd-boot

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.netbootxyz.enable
Desc: Make <code class="literal">netboot.xyz

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.netbootxyz.sortKey
Desc: <code class="literal">systemd-boot

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.rebootForBitlocker
Desc: Enable <span class="emphasis"><em>EXPERIMENTAL

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.sortKey
Desc:
The sort key used for the NixOS bootloader entries.
This key determines sorting relative to non-NixOS entries.
See also https://uapi-group.org/specifications/specs/boot_loader_specification/#sorting

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.windows
Desc:
Make Windows bootable from systemd-boot. This option is not necessary when Windows and
NixOS use the same EFI System Partition (ESP). In that case, Windows will automatically be
detected by systemd-boot.

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.windows._name_.efiDeviceHandle
Desc:
The device handle of the EFI System Partition (ESP) where the Windows bootloader is
located. This is the device handle that the EDK2 UEFI Shell uses to load the
bootloader.

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.windows._name_.sortKey
Desc: <code class="literal">systemd-boot
Default: "attribute name of this entry, prefixed with \"o_windows_\""

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.windows._name_.title
Desc: The title of the boot menu entry.
Default: "attribute name of this entry, prefixed with \"Windows \""

Name: boot.loader.systemd-boot.xbootldrMountPoint
Desc: Where the XBOOTLDR partition is mounted.

Name: boot.loader.timeout
Desc: Timeout (in seconds) until loader boots the default menu item. Use null if the loader menu should be displayed indefinitely.

Name: boot.modprobeConfig.enable
Desc: Whether to enable modprobe config. This is useful for systems like containers which do not require a kernel.

Name: boot.modprobeConfig.useUbuntuModuleBlacklist
Desc: Whether to enable Ubuntu distro’s module blacklist.

Name: boot.plymouth.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Plymouth boot splash screen.

Name: boot.plymouth.extraConfig
Desc: Literal string to append to <code class="literal">configFile

Name: boot.plymouth.font
Desc: Font file made available for displaying text on the splash screen.

Name: boot.plymouth.logo
Desc:
Logo which is displayed on the splash screen.
Currently supports PNG file format only.

Name: boot.plymouth.theme
Desc: Splash screen theme.

Name: boot.plymouth.themePackages
Desc: Extra theme packages for plymouth.

Name: boot.postBootCommands
Desc: Shell commands to be executed just before systemd is started.

Name: boot.readOnlyNixStore
Desc:
If set, NixOS will enforce the immutability of the Nix store
by making <code class="filename">/nix/store

Name: boot.resumeDevice
Desc:
Device for manual resume attempt during boot. This should be used primarily
if you want to resume from file. If left empty, the swap partitions are used.
Specify here the device where the file resides.
You should also use <code class="varname">boot.kernelParams

Name: boot.runSize
Desc:
Size limit for the /run tmpfs. Look at mount(8), tmpfs size option,
for the accepted syntax.

Name: boot.specialFileSystems._name_.depends
Desc:
List of paths that should be mounted before this one. This filesystem’s
<code class="option">device
Type: list of string (with check: non-empty without trailing slash)

Name: boot.specialFileSystems._name_.device
Desc: Location of the device.

Name: boot.specialFileSystems._name_.fsType
Desc: Type of the file system.

Name: boot.specialFileSystems._name_.mountPoint
Desc: Location of the mounted file system.
Type: string (with check: non-empty without trailing slash)

Name: boot.specialFileSystems._name_.options
Desc: Options used to mount the file system.

Name: boot.specialFileSystems._name_.stratis.poolUuid
Desc: UUID of the stratis pool that the fs is located in

Name: boot.supportedFilesystems
Desc:
Names of supported filesystem types, or an attribute set of file system types
and their state. The set form may be used together with <code class="literal">lib.mkForce
Type: (attribute set of boolean) or (list of string) convertible to it

Name: boot.swraid.enable
Desc: Whether to enable support for Linux MD RAID arrays.

Name: boot.swraid.mdadmConf
Desc: Contents of <code class="filename">/etc/mdadm.conf

Name: boot.systemdExecutable
Desc: The program to execute to start systemd.

Name: boot.tmp.cleanOnBoot
Desc: Whether to delete all files in <code class="filename">/tmp

Name: boot.tmp.tmpfsSize
Desc:
Size of tmpfs in percentage.
Percentage is defined by systemd.

Name: boot.tmp.useTmpfs
Desc: Whether to mount a tmpfs on <code class="filename">/tmp

Name: boot.uki.configFile
Desc: The configuration file passed to <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">ukify

Name: boot.uki.name
Desc: Name of the UKI

Name: boot.uki.settings
Desc:
The configuration settings for ukify. These control what the UKI
contains and how it is built.
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: boot.uki.tries
Desc: Number of boot attempts before this UKI is considered bad.

Name: boot.uki.version
Desc: Version of the image or generation the UKI belongs to

Name: boot.uvesafb.enable
Desc: Whether to enable uvesafb.

Name: boot.uvesafb.gfx-mode
Desc: Screen resolution in modedb format. See <a class="link" href="https://docs.kernel.org/fb/uvesafb.html"  target="_top">uvesafb

Name: boot.uvesafb.v86d.package
Desc: Which v86d package to use with uvesafb

Name: boot.vesa
Desc:
(Deprecated) This option, if set, activates the VESA 800x600 video
mode on boot and disables kernel modesetting. It is equivalent to
specifying <code class="literal">[ "vga=0x317" "nomodeset" ]

Name: boot.zfs.enabled
Desc: True if ZFS filesystem support is enabled

Name: boot.zfs.package
Desc: Configured ZFS userland tools package.

Name: boot.zfs.allowHibernation
Desc:
Allow hibernation support, this may be a unsafe option depending on your
setup. Make sure to NOT use Swap on ZFS.

Name: boot.zfs.devNodes
Desc: Name of directory from which to import ZFS device, this is passed to <code class="literal">zpool import

Name: boot.zfs.extraPools
Desc: Name or GUID of extra ZFS pools that you wish to import during boot.

Name: boot.zfs.forceImportAll
Desc: Forcibly import all ZFS pool(s).

Name: boot.zfs.forceImportRoot
Desc: Forcibly import the ZFS root pool(s) during early boot.

Name: boot.zfs.passwordTimeout
Desc: Timeout in seconds to wait for password entry for decrypt at boot.

Name: boot.zfs.pools
Desc: Configuration for individual pools to override global defaults.

Name: boot.zfs.pools._name_.devNodes
Desc: Name of directory from which to import ZFS device, this is passed to <code class="literal">zpool import

Name: boot.zfs.removeLinuxDRM
Desc:
Patch the kernel to change symbols needed by ZFS from
EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL to EXPORT_SYMBOL.

Name: boot.zfs.requestEncryptionCredentials
Desc:
If true on import encryption keys or passwords for all encrypted datasets
are requested. To only decrypt selected datasets supply a list of dataset
names instead. For root pools the encryption key can be supplied via both
an interactive prompt (keylocation=prompt) and from a file (keylocation=file://).

Name: console.enable
Desc: Whether to enable virtual console.

Name: console.packages
Desc:
List of additional packages that provide console fonts, keymaps and
other resources for virtual consoles use.

Name: console.colors
Desc:
The 16 colors palette used by the virtual consoles.
Leave empty to use the default colors.
Colors must be in hexadecimal format and listed in
order from color 0 to color 15.
Type: list of string matching the pattern [[:xdigit:]]{6}

Name: console.earlySetup
Desc: Enable setting virtual console options as early as possible (in initrd).

Name: console.font
Desc:
The font used for the virtual consoles.
Can be <code class="literal">null

Name: console.keyMap
Desc: The keyboard mapping table for the virtual consoles.

Name: console.useXkbConfig
Desc:
If set, configure the virtual console keymap from the xserver
keyboard settings.

Name: containers
Desc:
A set of NixOS system configurations to be run as lightweight
containers.  Each container appears as a service
<code class="literal">container-«name»

Name: containers._name_.enableTun
Desc:
Allows the container to create and setup tunnel interfaces
by granting the <code class="literal">NET_ADMIN

Name: containers._name_.additionalCapabilities
Desc:
Grant additional capabilities to the container.  See the
capabilities(7) and systemd-nspawn(1) man pages for more
information.

Name: containers._name_.allowedDevices
Desc: A list of device nodes to which the containers has access to.

Name: containers._name_.allowedDevices._.modifier
Desc:
Device node access modifier. Takes a combination
<code class="literal">r

Name: containers._name_.allowedDevices._.node
Desc: Path to device node

Name: containers._name_.autoStart
Desc: Whether the container is automatically started at boot-time.

Name: containers._name_.bindMounts
Desc: An extra list of directories that is bound to the container.

Name: containers._name_.bindMounts._name_.hostPath
Desc: Location of the host path to be mounted.

Name: containers._name_.bindMounts._name_.isReadOnly
Desc: Determine whether the mounted path will be accessed in read-only mode.

Name: containers._name_.bindMounts._name_.mountPoint
Desc: Mount point on the container file system.

Name: containers._name_.config
Desc:
A specification of the desired configuration of this
container, as a NixOS module.

Name: containers._name_.ephemeral
Desc:
Runs container in ephemeral mode with the empty root filesystem at boot.
This way container will be bootstrapped from scratch on each boot
and will be cleaned up on shutdown leaving no traces behind.
Useful for completely stateless, reproducible containers.

Name: containers._name_.extraFlags
Desc:
Extra flags passed to the systemd-nspawn command.
See systemd-nspawn(1) for details.

Name: containers._name_.extraVeths
Desc: Extra veth-pairs to be created for the container.

Name: containers._name_.extraVeths._name_.forwardPorts
Desc:
List of forwarded ports from host to container. Each forwarded port
is specified by protocol, hostPort and containerPort. By default,
protocol is tcp and hostPort and containerPort are assumed to be
the same if containerPort is not explicitly given.

Name: containers._name_.extraVeths._name_.forwardPorts._.containerPort
Desc: Target port of container

Name: containers._name_.extraVeths._name_.forwardPorts._.hostPort
Desc: Source port of the external interface on host

Name: containers._name_.extraVeths._name_.forwardPorts._.protocol
Desc: The protocol specifier for port forwarding between host and container

Name: containers._name_.extraVeths._name_.hostAddress
Desc:
The IPv4 address assigned to the host interface.
(Not used when hostBridge is set.)

Name: containers._name_.extraVeths._name_.hostAddress6
Desc:
The IPv6 address assigned to the host interface.
(Not used when hostBridge is set.)

Name: containers._name_.extraVeths._name_.hostBridge
Desc:
Put the host-side of the veth-pair into the named bridge.
Only one of hostAddress* or hostBridge can be given.

Name: containers._name_.extraVeths._name_.localAddress
Desc:
The IPv4 address assigned to the interface in the container.
If a hostBridge is used, this should be given with netmask to access
the whole network. Otherwise the default netmask is /32 and routing is
set up from localAddress to hostAddress and back.

Name: containers._name_.extraVeths._name_.localAddress6
Desc:
The IPv6 address assigned to the interface in the container.
If a hostBridge is used, this should be given with netmask to access
the whole network. Otherwise the default netmask is /128 and routing is
set up from localAddress6 to hostAddress6 and back.

Name: containers._name_.forwardPorts
Desc:
List of forwarded ports from host to container. Each forwarded port
is specified by protocol, hostPort and containerPort. By default,
protocol is tcp and hostPort and containerPort are assumed to be
the same if containerPort is not explicitly given.

Name: containers._name_.forwardPorts._.containerPort
Desc: Target port of container

Name: containers._name_.forwardPorts._.hostPort
Desc: Source port of the external interface on host

Name: containers._name_.forwardPorts._.protocol
Desc: The protocol specifier for port forwarding between host and container

Name: containers._name_.hostAddress
Desc:
The IPv4 address assigned to the host interface.
(Not used when hostBridge is set.)

Name: containers._name_.hostAddress6
Desc:
The IPv6 address assigned to the host interface.
(Not used when hostBridge is set.)

Name: containers._name_.hostBridge
Desc:
Put the host-side of the veth-pair into the named bridge.
Only one of hostAddress* or hostBridge can be given.

Name: containers._name_.interfaces
Desc: The list of interfaces to be moved into the container.

Name: containers._name_.localAddress
Desc:
The IPv4 address assigned to the interface in the container.
If a hostBridge is used, this should be given with netmask to access
the whole network. Otherwise the default netmask is /32 and routing is
set up from localAddress to hostAddress and back.

Name: containers._name_.localAddress6
Desc:
The IPv6 address assigned to the interface in the container.
If a hostBridge is used, this should be given with netmask to access
the whole network. Otherwise the default netmask is /128 and routing is
set up from localAddress6 to hostAddress6 and back.

Name: containers._name_.macvlans
Desc:
The list of host interfaces from which macvlans will be
created. For each interface specified, a macvlan interface
will be created and moved to the container.

Name: containers._name_.nixpkgs
Desc: A path to the nixpkgs that provide the modules, pkgs and lib for evaluating the container.

Name: containers._name_.path
Desc:
As an alternative to specifying
<code class="option">config

Name: containers._name_.privateNetwork
Desc:
Whether to give the container its own private virtual
Ethernet interface.  The interface is called
<code class="literal">eth0

Name: containers._name_.restartIfChanged
Desc:
Whether the container should be restarted during a NixOS
configuration switch if its definition has changed.

Name: containers._name_.specialArgs
Desc:
A set of special arguments to be passed to NixOS modules.
This will be merged into the <code class="literal">specialArgs

Name: containers._name_.timeoutStartSec
Desc:
Time for the container to start. In case of a timeout,
the container processes get killed.
See <a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.time.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">systemd.time

Name: containers._name_.tmpfs
Desc:
Mounts a set of tmpfs file systems into the container.
Multiple paths can be specified.
Valid items must conform to the --tmpfs argument
of systemd-nspawn. See systemd-nspawn(1) for details.

Name: documentation.enable
Desc:
Whether to install documentation of packages from
<code class="option">environment.systemPackages

Name: documentation.dev.enable
Desc: Whether to install documentation targeted at developers.

Name: documentation.doc.enable
Desc: Whether to install documentation distributed in packages’ <code class="literal">/share/doc

Name: documentation.info.enable
Desc: Whether to install info pages and the <span class="command"><strong>info

Name: documentation.man.enable
Desc:
Whether to install manual pages.
This also includes <code class="literal">man

Name: documentation.man.generateCaches
Desc:
Whether to generate the manual page index caches.
This allows searching for a page or
keyword using utilities like <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">apropos

Name: documentation.man.man-db.enable
Desc: Whether to enable man-db as the default man page viewer.

Name: documentation.man.man-db.package
Desc: The <code class="literal">man-db

Name: documentation.man.man-db.manualPages
Desc: The manual pages to generate caches for if <code class="option">documentation.man.generateCaches

Name: documentation.man.mandoc.enable
Desc: Whether to enable mandoc as the default man page viewer.

Name: documentation.man.mandoc.package
Desc: The <code class="literal">mandoc

Name: documentation.man.mandoc.cachePath
Desc: Change the paths where mandoc <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">makewhatis

Name: documentation.man.mandoc.extraConfig
Desc: Extra configuration to write to <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">man.conf

Name: documentation.man.mandoc.manPath
Desc:
Change the paths included in the MANPATH environment variable,
i. e. the directories where <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">man

Name: documentation.man.mandoc.settings
Desc: Configuration for <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">man.conf

Name: documentation.man.mandoc.settings.manpath
Desc: Override the default search path for <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">man

Name: documentation.man.mandoc.settings.output.fragment
documentation.man.mandoc.settings.output.includes
Desc:
A string of relative path used as a template for the output path of
linked header files (usually via the In macro) in HTML output.
Instances of <code class="literal">%I

Name: documentation.man.mandoc.settings.output.indent
Desc:
Number of blank characters at the left margin for normal text,
default of <code class="literal">5

Name: documentation.man.mandoc.settings.output.man
Desc:
A template for linked manuals (usually via the Xr macro) in HTML
output. Instances of ‘%N’ and ‘%S’ are replaced with the linked
manual’s name and section, respectively. If no section is included,
section 1 is assumed. The default is not to present a hyperlink.
If two formats are given and a file %N.%S exists in the current
directory, the first format is used; otherwise, the second format is used.

Name: documentation.man.mandoc.settings.output.paper
Desc:
This option is for generating PostScript and PDF output. The paper
size name may be one of <code class="literal">a3

Name: documentation.man.mandoc.settings.output.style
Desc:
Path to the file used for an external style-sheet. This must be a
valid absolute or relative URI.

Name: documentation.man.mandoc.settings.output.toc
Desc:
Whether to enable printing a table of contents near the beginning of the HTML output
of <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">mandoc

Name: documentation.man.mandoc.settings.output.width
Desc: The ASCII and UTF-8 output width, default is <code class="literal">78

Name: documentation.nixos.enable
Desc: Whether to install NixOS’s own documentation.

Name: documentation.nixos.extraModuleSources
Desc:
Which extra NixOS module paths the generated NixOS’s documentation should strip
from options.

Name: documentation.nixos.extraModules
Desc: Modules for which to show options even when not imported.

Name: documentation.nixos.includeAllModules
Desc:
Whether the generated NixOS’s documentation should include documentation for all
the options from all the NixOS modules included in the current
<code class="literal">configuration.nix

Name: documentation.nixos.options.splitBuild
Desc:
Whether to split the option docs build into a cacheable and an uncacheable part.
Splitting the build can substantially decrease the amount of time needed to build
the manual, but some user modules may be incompatible with this splitting.

Name: documentation.nixos.options.warningsAreErrors
Desc:
Treat warning emitted during the option documentation build (eg for missing option
descriptions) as errors.

Name: ec2.zfs.datasets
Desc: Datasets to create under the <code class="literal">tank

Name: ec2.zfs.datasets._name_.mount
Desc: Where to mount this dataset.

Name: ec2.zfs.datasets._name_.properties
Desc: Properties to set on this dataset.

Name: environment.enableAllTerminfo
Desc: Whether to install all terminfo outputs

Name: environment.enableDebugInfo
Desc:
Some NixOS packages provide debug symbols. However, these are
not included in the system closure by default to save disk
space. Enabling this option causes the debug symbols to appear
in <code class="filename">/run/current-system/sw/lib/debug/.build-id

Name: environment.budgie.excludePackages
Desc: Which packages Budgie should exclude from the default environment.

Name: environment.checkConfigurationOptions
Desc: Alias of <code class="option">_module.check

Name: environment.cinnamon.excludePackages
Desc: Which packages cinnamon should exclude from the default environment

Name: environment.deepin.excludePackages
Desc: List of default packages to exclude from the configuration

Name: environment.defaultPackages
Desc:
Set of default packages that aren’t strictly necessary
for a running system, entries can be removed for a more
minimal NixOS installation.

Name: environment.etc
Desc: Set of files that have to be linked in <code class="filename">/etc

Name: environment.etc._name_.enable
Desc:
Whether this /etc file should be generated.  This
option allows specific /etc files to be disabled.

Name: environment.etc._name_.gid
Desc:
GID of created file. Only takes effect when the file is
copied (that is, the mode is not ‘symlink’).

Name: environment.etc._name_.group
Desc:
Group name of created file.
Only takes effect when the file is copied (that is, the mode is not ‘symlink’).
Changing this option takes precedence over <code class="literal">gid

Name: environment.etc._name_.mode
Desc: If set to something else than <code class="literal">symlink

Name: environment.etc._name_.source
Desc: Path of the source file.

Name: environment.etc._name_.target
Desc:
Name of symlink (relative to
<code class="filename">/etc

Name: environment.etc._name_.text
Desc: Text of the file.

Name: environment.etc._name_.uid
Desc:
UID of created file. Only takes effect when the file is
copied (that is, the mode is not ‘symlink’).

Name: environment.etc._name_.user
Desc:
User name of created file.
Only takes effect when the file is copied (that is, the mode is not ‘symlink’).
Changing this option takes precedence over <code class="literal">uid

Name: environment.extraInit
Desc:
Shell script code called during global environment initialisation
after all variables and profileVariables have been set.
This code is assumed to be shell-independent, which means you should
stick to pure sh without sh word split.

Name: environment.extraOutputsToInstall
Desc: Entries listed here will be appended to the <code class="literal">meta.outputsToInstall

Name: environment.extraSetup
Desc: Shell fragments to be run after the system environment has been created. This should only be used for things that need to modify the internals of the environment, e.g. generating MIME caches. The environment being built can be accessed at $out.

Name: environment.freetds
Desc:
Configure freetds database entries. Each attribute denotes
a section within freetds.conf, and the value (a string) is the config
content for that section. When at least one entry is configured
the global environment variables FREETDSCONF, FREETDS and SYBASE
will be configured to allow the programs that use freetds to find the
library and config.

Name: environment.gnome.excludePackages
Desc: Which packages gnome should exclude from the default environment

Name: environment.homeBinInPath
Desc: Include ~/bin/ in $PATH.

Name: environment.interactiveShellInit
Desc:
Shell script code called during interactive shell initialisation.
This code is assumed to be shell-independent, which means you should
stick to pure sh without sh word split.

Name: environment.ldso
Desc: The executable to link into the normal FHS location of the ELF loader.

Name: environment.ldso32
Desc: The executable to link into the normal FHS location of the 32-bit ELF loader.

Name: environment.localBinInPath
Desc: Add ~/.local/bin/ to $PATH

Name: environment.loginShellInit
Desc:
Shell script code called during login shell initialisation.
This code is assumed to be shell-independent, which means you should
stick to pure sh without sh word split.

Name: environment.lxqt.excludePackages
Desc: Which LXQt packages to exclude from the default environment

Name: environment.mate.excludePackages
Desc: Which MATE packages to exclude from the default environment

Name: environment.memoryAllocator.provider
Desc: The system-wide memory allocator.

Name: environment.pantheon.excludePackages
Desc: Which packages pantheon should exclude from the default environment

Name: environment.pathsToLink
Desc: List of directories to be symlinked in <code class="filename">/run/current-system/sw

Name: environment.plasma5.excludePackages
Desc: List of default packages to exclude from the configuration

Name: environment.plasma6.excludePackages
Desc: List of default packages to exclude from the configuration

Name: environment.profileRelativeEnvVars
Desc:
Attribute set of environment variable.  Each attribute maps to a list
of relative paths.  Each relative path is appended to the each profile
of <code class="option">environment.profiles
Type: attribute set of list of string

Name: environment.profileRelativeSessionVariables
Desc:
Attribute set of environment variable used in the global
environment. These variables will be set by PAM early in the
login process.
Type: attribute set of list of string

Name: environment.profiles
Desc: A list of profiles used to setup the global environment.

Name: environment.sessionVariables
Desc:
A set of environment variables used in the global environment.
These variables will be set by PAM early in the login process.
Type: attribute set of ((list of (signed integer or string or path)) or signed integer or string or path)

Name: environment.shellAliases
Desc:
An attribute set that maps aliases (the top level attribute names in
this option) to command strings or directly to build outputs. The
aliases are added to all users’ shells.
Aliases mapped to <code class="literal">null
Type: attribute set of (null or string or path)

Name: environment.shellInit
Desc:
Shell script code called during shell initialisation.
This code is assumed to be shell-independent, which means you should
stick to pure sh without sh word split.

Name: environment.shells
Desc:
A list of permissible login shells for user accounts.
No need to mention <code class="literal">/bin/sh

Name: environment.stub-ld.enable
Desc:
Install a stub ELF loader to print an informative error message
in the event that a user attempts to run an ELF binary not
compiled for NixOS.

Name: environment.systemPackages
Desc:
The set of packages that appear in
/run/current-system/sw.  These packages are
automatically available to all users, and are
automatically updated every time you rebuild the system
configuration.  (The latter is the main difference with
installing them in the default profile,
<code class="filename">/nix/var/nix/profiles/default

Name: environment.unixODBCDrivers
Desc:
Specifies Unix ODBC drivers to be registered in
<code class="filename">/etc/odbcinst.ini

Name: environment.variables
Desc:
A set of environment variables used in the global environment.
These variables will be set on shell initialisation (e.g. in /etc/profile).
The value of each variable can be either a string or a list of
strings.  The latter is concatenated, interspersed with colon
characters.
Type: attribute set of ((list of (signed integer or string or path)) or signed integer or string or path)

Name: environment.wordlist.enable
Desc: Whether to enable environment variables for lists of words.

Name: environment.wordlist.lists
Desc:
A set with the key names being the environment variable you’d like to
set and the values being a list of paths to text documents containing
lists of words. The various files will be merged, sorted, duplicates
removed, and extraneous spacing removed.
Type: attribute set of non-empty (list of path)

Name: environment.wvdial.dialerDefaults
Desc:
Contents of the “Dialer Defaults” section of
<filename>/etc/wvdial.conf</filename>.

Name: environment.wvdial.pppDefaults
Desc: Default ppp settings for wvdial.

Name: environment.xfce.excludePackages
Desc: Which packages XFCE should exclude from the default environment

Name: fileSystems
Desc:
The file systems to be mounted.  It must include an entry for
the root directory (<code class="literal">mountPoint = "/"

Name: fileSystems._name_.autoFormat
Desc:
If the device does not currently contain a filesystem (as
determined by <span class="command"><strong>blkid

Name: fileSystems._name_.autoResize
Desc:
If set, the filesystem is grown to its maximum size before
being mounted. (This is typically the size of the containing
partition.) This is currently only supported for ext2/3/4
filesystems that are mounted during early boot.

Name: fileSystems._name_.depends
Desc:
List of paths that should be mounted before this one. This filesystem’s
<code class="option">device
Type: list of string (with check: non-empty without trailing slash)

Name: fileSystems._name_.device
Desc: Location of the device.

Name: fileSystems._name_.encrypted.enable
Desc: The block device is backed by an encrypted one, adds this device as a initrd luks entry.

Name: fileSystems._name_.encrypted.blkDev
Desc: Location of the backing encrypted device.

Name: fileSystems._name_.encrypted.keyFile
Desc:
Path to a keyfile used to unlock the backing encrypted
device. When systemd stage 1 is not enabled, at the time
this keyfile is accessed, the <code class="literal">neededForBoot

Name: fileSystems._name_.encrypted.label
Desc: Label of the unlocked encrypted device. Set <code class="literal">fileSystems.<name?>.device

Name: fileSystems._name_.fsType
Desc: Type of the file system.

Name: fileSystems._name_.label
Desc: Label of the device (if any).

Name: fileSystems._name_.mountPoint
Desc: Location of the mounted file system.
Type: string (with check: non-empty without trailing slash)

Name: fileSystems._name_.neededForBoot
Desc:
If set, this file system will be mounted in the initial ramdisk.
Note that the file system will always be mounted in the initial
ramdisk if its mount point is one of the following:
<code class="filename">/

Name: fileSystems._name_.noCheck
Desc: Disable running fsck on this filesystem.

Name: fileSystems._name_.options
Desc: Options used to mount the file system.

Name: fileSystems._name_.overlay.lowerdir
Desc: The list of path(s) to the lowerdir(s).
Type: null or (non-empty (list of (string or path in the Nix store)))

Name: fileSystems._name_.overlay.upperdir
Desc: The path to the upperdir.

Name: fileSystems._name_.overlay.workdir
Desc: The path to the workdir.

Name: fileSystems._name_.stratis.poolUuid
Desc: UUID of the stratis pool that the fs is located in

Name: fonts.enableDefaultPackages
Desc:
Enable a basic set of fonts providing several styles
and families and reasonable coverage of Unicode.

Name: fonts.enableGhostscriptFonts
Desc:
Whether to add the fonts provided by Ghostscript (such as
various URW fonts and the “Base-14” Postscript fonts) to the
list of system fonts, making them available to X11
applications.

Name: fonts.packages
Desc: List of primary font packages.

Name: fonts.fontDir.enable
Desc:
Whether to create a directory with links to all fonts in
<code class="filename">/run/current-system/sw/share/X11/fonts

Name: fonts.fontDir.decompressFonts
Desc:
Whether to decompress fonts in
<code class="filename">/run/current-system/sw/share/X11/fonts

Name: fonts.fontconfig.enable
Desc:
If enabled, a Fontconfig configuration file will be built
pointing to a set of default fonts.  If you don’t care about
running X11 applications or any other program that uses
Fontconfig, you can turn this option off and prevent a
dependency on all those fonts.

Name: fonts.fontconfig.allowBitmaps
Desc: Allow bitmap fonts. Set to <code class="literal">false

Name: fonts.fontconfig.allowType1
Desc: Allow Type-1 fonts. Default is <code class="literal">false

Name: fonts.fontconfig.antialias
Desc:
Enable font antialiasing. At high resolution (> 200 DPI),
antialiasing has no visible effect; users of such displays may want
to disable this option.

Name: fonts.fontconfig.cache32Bit
Desc: Generate system fonts cache for 32-bit applications.

Name: fonts.fontconfig.defaultFonts.emoji
Desc:
System-wide default emoji font(s). Multiple fonts may be listed
in case a font does not support all emoji.

Name: fonts.fontconfig.defaultFonts.monospace
Desc:
System-wide default monospace font(s). Multiple fonts may be
listed in case multiple languages must be supported.

Name: fonts.fontconfig.defaultFonts.sansSerif
Desc:
System-wide default sans serif font(s). Multiple fonts may be
listed in case multiple languages must be supported.

Name: fonts.fontconfig.defaultFonts.serif
Desc:
System-wide default serif font(s). Multiple fonts may be listed
in case multiple languages must be supported.

Name: fonts.fontconfig.hinting.enable
Desc:
Enable font hinting. Hinting aligns glyphs to pixel boundaries to
improve rendering sharpness at low resolution. At high resolution
(> 200 dpi) hinting will do nothing (at best); users of such
displays may want to disable this option.

Name: fonts.fontconfig.hinting.autohint
Desc:
Enable the autohinter in place of the default interpreter.
The results are usually lower quality than correctly-hinted
fonts, but better than unhinted fonts.

Name: fonts.fontconfig.hinting.style
Desc:
Hintstyle is the amount of font reshaping done to line up
to the grid.

Name: fonts.fontconfig.includeUserConf
Desc:
Include the user configuration from
<code class="filename">~/.config/fontconfig/fonts.conf

Name: fonts.fontconfig.localConf
Desc:
System-wide customization file contents, has higher priority than
<code class="literal">defaultFonts

Name: fonts.fontconfig.subpixel.lcdfilter
Desc:
FreeType LCD filter. At high resolution (> 200 DPI), LCD filtering
has no visible effect; users of such displays may want to select
<code class="literal">none

Name: fonts.fontconfig.subpixel.rgba
Desc:
Subpixel order. The overwhelming majority of displays are
<code class="literal">rgb

Name: fonts.fontconfig.useEmbeddedBitmaps
Desc: Use embedded bitmaps in fonts like Calibri.

Name: gtk.iconCache.enable
Desc: Whether to build icon theme caches for GTK applications.

Name: hardware.enableAllFirmware
Desc: Whether to enable all firmware regardless of license.

Name: hardware.enableRedistributableFirmware
Desc: Whether to enable firmware with a license allowing redistribution.

Name: hardware.acpilight.enable
Desc:
Enable acpilight.
This will allow brightness control via xbacklight from users in the video group

Name: hardware.alsa.enablePersistence
Desc:
Whether to enable ALSA sound card state saving on shutdown.
This is generally not necessary if you’re using an external sound server.

Name: hardware.amdgpu.amdvlk.enable
Desc: Whether to enable AMDVLK Vulkan driver.

Name: hardware.amdgpu.amdvlk.package
Desc: The amdvlk package to use.

Name: hardware.amdgpu.amdvlk.settings
Desc: Runtime settings for AMDVLK to be configured <code class="filename">/etc/amd/amdVulkanSettings.cfg
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer)

Name: hardware.amdgpu.amdvlk.support32Bit.enable
Desc: Whether to enable 32-bit driver support.

Name: hardware.amdgpu.amdvlk.support32Bit.package
Desc: The amdvlk package to use.

Name: hardware.amdgpu.amdvlk.supportExperimental.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Experimental features support.

Name: hardware.amdgpu.initrd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable loading <code class="literal">amdgpu

Name: hardware.amdgpu.legacySupport.enable
Desc: Whether to enable using <code class="literal">amdgpu

Name: hardware.amdgpu.opencl.enable
Desc: Whether to enable OpenCL support using ROCM runtime library.

Name: hardware.apple.touchBar.enable
Desc: Whether to enable support for the Touch Bar on some Apple laptops using tiny-dfr.

Name: hardware.apple.touchBar.package
Desc: The tiny-dfr package to use.

Name: hardware.apple.touchBar.settings
Desc: Configuration for tiny-dfr. See <a class="link" href="https://github.com/WhatAmISupposedToPutHere/tiny-dfr/blob/master/share/tiny-dfr/config.toml"  target="_top">example configuration

Name: hardware.bladeRF.enable
Desc:
Enables udev rules for BladeRF devices. By default grants access
to users in the “bladerf” group. You may want to install the
libbladeRF package.

Name: hardware.bluetooth.enable
Desc: Whether to enable support for Bluetooth.

Name: hardware.bluetooth.package
Desc: The bluez package to use.

Name: hardware.bluetooth.disabledPlugins
Desc: Built-in plugins to disable

Name: hardware.bluetooth.hsphfpd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable support for hsphfpd[-prototype] implementation.

Name: hardware.bluetooth.input
Desc:
Set configuration for the input service (/etc/bluetooth/input.conf).
See <a class="link" href="https://github.com/bluez/bluez/blob/master/profiles/input/input.conf"  target="_top">https://github.com/bluez/bluez/blob/master/profiles/input/input.conf
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: hardware.bluetooth.network
Desc:
Set configuration for the network service (/etc/bluetooth/network.conf).
See <a class="link" href="https://github.com/bluez/bluez/blob/master/profiles/network/network.conf"  target="_top">https://github.com/bluez/bluez/blob/master/profiles/network/network.conf
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: hardware.bluetooth.powerOnBoot
Desc: Whether to power up the default Bluetooth controller on boot.

Name: hardware.bluetooth.settings
Desc:
Set configuration for system-wide bluetooth (/etc/bluetooth/main.conf).
See <a class="link" href="https://github.com/bluez/bluez/blob/master/src/main.conf"  target="_top">https://github.com/bluez/bluez/blob/master/src/main.conf
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: hardware.brillo.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable brillo in userspace.
This will allow brightness control from users in the video group
.

Name: hardware.bumblebee.enable
Desc:
Enable the bumblebee daemon to manage Optimus hybrid video cards.
This should power off secondary GPU until its use is requested
by running an application with optirun.

Name: hardware.bumblebee.connectDisplay
Desc:
Set to true if you intend to connect your discrete card to a
monitor. This option will set up your Nvidia card for EDID
discovery and to turn on the monitor signal.

Name: hardware.bumblebee.driver
Desc: Set driver used by bumblebeed. Supported are nouveau and nvidia.

Name: hardware.bumblebee.group
Desc: Group for bumblebee socket

Name: hardware.bumblebee.pmMethod
Desc: Set preferred power management method for unused card.

Name: hardware.ckb-next.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Corsair keyboard/mouse driver.

Name: hardware.ckb-next.package
Desc: The ckb-next package to use.

Name: hardware.ckb-next.gid
Desc: Limit access to the ckb daemon to a particular group.

Name: hardware.coral.pcie.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Coral PCIe support.

Name: hardware.coral.usb.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Coral USB support.

Name: hardware.cpu.amd.ryzen-smu.enable
Desc: Whether to enable ryzen_smu, a linux kernel driver that exposes access to the SMU (System Management Unit) for certain AMD Ryzen Processors.

Name: hardware.cpu.amd.sev.enable
Desc: Whether to enable access to the AMD SEV device.

Name: hardware.cpu.amd.sev.group
Desc: Group to assign to the SEV device.

Name: hardware.cpu.amd.sev.mode
