Name: programs.streamcontroller.package
Desc: The streamcontroller package to use.

Name: programs.streamdeck-ui.enable
Desc: Whether to enable streamdeck-ui.

Name: programs.streamdeck-ui.package
Desc: The streamdeck-ui package to use.

Name: programs.streamdeck-ui.autoStart
Desc: Whether streamdeck-ui should be started automatically.

Name: programs.sway.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable Sway, the i3-compatible tiling Wayland compositor. You can manually launch
Sway by executing “exec sway” on a TTY. Copy /etc/sway/config to
~/.config/sway/config to modify the default configuration. See
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/swaywm/sway/wiki"  target="_top">https://github.com/swaywm/sway/wiki

Name: programs.sway.package
Desc: The sway package to use. If the package is not overridable with <code class="literal">extraSessionCommands

Name: programs.sway.extraOptions
Desc:
Command line arguments passed to launch Sway. Please DO NOT report
issues if you use an unsupported GPU (proprietary drivers).

Name: programs.sway.extraPackages
Desc:
Extra packages to be installed system wide. See
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/swaywm/sway/wiki/Useful-add-ons-for-sway"  target="_top">https://github.com/swaywm/sway/wiki/Useful-add-ons-for-sway

Name: programs.sway.extraSessionCommands
Desc:
Shell commands executed just before Sway is started. See
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/swaywm/sway/wiki/Running-programs-natively-under-wayland"  target="_top">https://github.com/swaywm/sway/wiki/Running-programs-natively-under-wayland

Name: programs.sway.wrapperFeatures.base
Desc:
Whether to enable the base wrapper to execute extra session commands and prepend a
dbus-run-session to the sway command.

Name: programs.sway.wrapperFeatures.gtk
Desc:
Whether to enable the wrapGAppsHook wrapper to execute sway with required environment
variables for GTK applications.

Name: programs.sway.xwayland.enable
Desc: Whether to enable XWayland.

Name: programs.sysdig.enable
Desc: Whether to enable sysdig, a tracing tool.

Name: programs.system-config-printer.enable
Desc: Whether to enable system-config-printer, a Graphical user interface for CUPS administration.

Name: programs.systemtap.enable
Desc: Install <span class="command"><strong>systemtap

Name: programs.tcpdump.enable
Desc:
Whether to configure a setcap wrapper for tcpdump.
To use it, add your user to the <code class="literal">pcap

Name: programs.thefuck.enable
Desc: Whether to enable thefuck, an app which corrects your previous console command.

Name: programs.thefuck.alias
Desc: <code class="literal">thefuck

Name: programs.thunar.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Thunar, the Xfce file manager.

Name: programs.thunar.plugins
Desc: List of thunar plugins to install.

Name: programs.thunderbird.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Thunderbird mail client.

Name: programs.thunderbird.package
Desc: The thunderbird package to use.

Name: programs.thunderbird.policies
Desc: Group policies to install.

Name: programs.thunderbird.preferences
Desc: Preferences to set from <code class="literal">about:config
Type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)

Name: programs.thunderbird.preferencesStatus
Desc: The status of <code class="literal">thunderbird.preferences

Name: programs.tmux.enable
Desc: Whenever to configure <span class="command"><strong>tmux

Name: programs.tmux.aggressiveResize
Desc: Resize the window to the size of the smallest session for which it is the current window.

Name: programs.tmux.baseIndex
Desc: Base index for windows and panes.

Name: programs.tmux.clock24
Desc: Use 24 hour clock.

Name: programs.tmux.customPaneNavigationAndResize
Desc: Override the hjkl and HJKL bindings for pane navigation and resizing in VI mode.

Name: programs.tmux.escapeTime
Desc: Time in milliseconds for which tmux waits after an escape is input.

Name: programs.tmux.extraConfig
Desc: Additional contents of /etc/tmux.conf, to be run after sourcing plugins.

Name: programs.tmux.extraConfigBeforePlugins
Desc: Additional contents of /etc/tmux.conf, to be run before sourcing plugins.

Name: programs.tmux.historyLimit
Desc: Maximum number of lines held in window history.

Name: programs.tmux.keyMode
Desc: VI or Emacs style shortcuts.

Name: programs.tmux.newSession
Desc: Automatically spawn a session if trying to attach and none are running.

Name: programs.tmux.plugins
Desc: List of plugins to install.

Name: programs.tmux.resizeAmount
Desc: Number of lines/columns when resizing.

Name: programs.tmux.reverseSplit
Desc: Reverse the window split shortcuts.

Name: programs.tmux.secureSocket
Desc:
Store tmux socket under /run, which is more secure than /tmp, but as a
downside it doesn’t survive user logout.

Name: programs.tmux.shortcut
Desc: Ctrl following by this key is used as the main shortcut.

Name: programs.tmux.terminal
Desc:
Set the $TERM variable. Use tmux-direct if italics or 24bit true color
support is needed.

Name: programs.tmux.withUtempter
Desc:
Whether to enable libutempter for tmux.
This is required so that tmux can write to /var/run/utmp (which can be queried with <code class="literal">who

Name: programs.traceroute.enable
Desc: Whether to configure a setcap wrapper for traceroute.

Name: programs.trippy.enable
Desc: Whether to enable trippy, a network diagnostic tool.

Name: programs.tsmClient.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable IBM Storage Protect (Tivoli Storage Manager, TSM)
client command line applications with a
client system-options file “dsm.sys”
.

Name: programs.tsmClient.package
Desc: The tsm-client package to use. It will be used with <code class="literal">.override

Name: programs.tsmClient.defaultServername
Desc:
If multiple server stanzas are declared with
<code class="option">programs.tsmClient.servers
Type: null or string matching the pattern [^[:space:]]{1,64}

Name: programs.tsmClient.dsmSysText
Desc:
This configuration key contains the effective text
of the client system-options file “dsm.sys”.
It should not be changed, but may be
used to feed the configuration into other
TSM-depending packages used on the system.

Name: programs.tsmClient.servers
Desc:
Server definitions (“stanzas”)
for the client system-options file.
The name of each entry will be used for
the internal <code class="literal">servername
Type: attribute set of (attribute set of (one of true, <null> or signed integer or path or (optionally newline-terminated) single-line string or list of (one of true, <null> or signed integer or path or (optionally newline-terminated) single-line string)))

Name: programs.tsmClient.servers._name_.genPasswd
Desc:
Whether to enable automatic client password generation.
This option does <span class="emphasis"><em>not

Name: programs.tsmClient.servers._name_.inclexcl
Desc: Text lines with <code class="literal">include.*
Type: (null or path) or strings concatenated with “\n” convertible to it

Name: programs.tsmClient.servers._name_.nodename
Desc: Target node name on the IBM TSM server.

Name: programs.tsmClient.servers._name_.passworddir
Desc:
Directory that holds the TSM
node’s password information.

Name: programs.tsmClient.servers._name_.servername
Desc:
Local name of the IBM TSM server,
must not contain space or more than 64 chars.

Name: programs.tsmClient.servers._name_.tcpport
Desc:
TCP port of the IBM TSM server.
TSM does not support ports above 32767.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: programs.tsmClient.servers._name_.tcpserveraddress
Desc: Host/domain name or IP address of the IBM TSM server.

Name: programs.tsmClient.wrappedPackage
Desc:
The tsm-client package to use. This option is to provide the effective derivation,
wrapped with the path to the
client system-options file “dsm.sys”.
It should not be changed, but exists
for other modules that want to call TSM executables.

Name: programs.turbovnc.ensureHeadlessSoftwareOpenGL
Desc:
Whether to set up NixOS such that TurboVNC’s built-in software OpenGL
implementation works.

Name: programs.tuxclocker.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable TuxClocker, a hardware control and monitoring program
.

Name: programs.tuxclocker.enableAMD
Desc:
Whether to enable AMD GPU controls.
Sets the <code class="literal">amdgpu.ppfeaturemask

Name: programs.tuxclocker.enabledNVIDIADevices
Desc:
Enable NVIDIA GPU controls for a device by index.
Sets the <code class="literal">Coolbits

Name: programs.tuxclocker.useUnfree
Desc:
Whether to use components requiring unfree dependencies.
Disabling this allows you to get everything from the binary cache.

Name: programs.udevil.enable
Desc: Whether to enable udevil, to mount filesystems without password.

Name: programs.usbtop.enable
Desc: Whether to enable usbtop and required kernel module, to show estimated USB bandwidth.

Name: programs.uwsm.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable uwsm, which wraps standalone Wayland compositors with a set
of Systemd units on the fly. This essentially
binds the wayland compositor into <code class="literal">graphical-session-pre.target

Name: programs.uwsm.package
Desc: The uwsm package to use.

Name: programs.uwsm.waylandCompositors
Desc:
Configuration for UWSM-managed Wayland Compositors. This
creates a desktop entry file which will be used by Display
Managers like GDM, to allow starting the UWSM managed session.

Name: programs.uwsm.waylandCompositors._name_.binPath
Desc: The wayland-compositor binary path that will be called by UWSM.

Name: programs.uwsm.waylandCompositors._name_.comment
Desc: The comment field of the desktop entry file.
Default: "An intelligent Wayland compositor managed by UWSM."

Name: programs.uwsm.waylandCompositors._name_.prettyName
Desc: The full name of the desktop entry file.

Name: programs.vim.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Vi IMproved, an advanced text.

Name: programs.vim.package
Desc: The vim package to use.

Name: programs.vim.defaultEditor
Desc: Whether to enable vim as the default editor.

Name: programs.virt-manager.enable
Desc: Whether to enable virt-manager, an UI for managing virtual machines in libvirt.

Name: programs.virt-manager.package
Desc: The virt-manager package to use.

Name: programs.wavemon.enable
Desc:
Whether to add wavemon to the global environment and configure a
setcap wrapper for it.

Name: programs.waybar.enable
Desc: Whether to enable waybar, a highly customizable Wayland bar for Sway and Wlroots based compositors.

Name: programs.waybar.package
Desc: The waybar package to use.

Name: programs.wayfire.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Wayfire, a wayland compositor based on wlroots.

Name: programs.wayfire.package
Desc: The wayfire package to use.

Name: programs.wayfire.plugins
Desc: Additional plugins to use with the wayfire window manager.

Name: programs.wayfire.xwayland.enable
Desc: Whether to enable XWayland.

Name: programs.wayland.miracle-wm.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable miracle-wm, a tiling Mir based Wayland compositor. You can manually launch miracle-wm by
executing “exec miracle-wm” on a TTY, or launch it from a display manager.
Consult the USERGUIDE.md at <a class="link" href="https://github.com/mattkae/miracle-wm"  target="_top">https://github.com/mattkae/miracle-wm

Name: programs.weylus.enable
Desc: Whether to enable weylus, which turns your smart phone into a graphic tablet/touch screen for your computer.

Name: programs.weylus.package
Desc: The weylus package to use.

Name: programs.weylus.openFirewall
Desc: Open ports needed for the functionality of the program.

Name: programs.weylus.users
Desc:
To enable stylus and multi-touch support, the user you’re going to use must be added to this list.
These users can synthesize input events system-wide, even when another user is logged in - untrusted users should not be added.

Name: programs.winbox.enable
Desc: Whether to enable MikroTik Winbox.

Name: programs.winbox.package
Desc: The winbox package to use.

Name: programs.winbox.openFirewall
Desc: Whether to open ports for the MikroTik Neighbor Discovery protocol. Required for Winbox neighbor discovery.

Name: programs.wireshark.enable
Desc:
Whether to add Wireshark to the global environment and configure a
setcap wrapper for ‘dumpcap’ for users in the ‘wireshark’ group.

Name: programs.wireshark.package
Desc: The wireshark-cli package to use.

Name: programs.wshowkeys.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable wshowkeys (displays keypresses on screen on supported Wayland
compositors). It requires root permissions to read input events, but
these permissions are dropped after startup.

Name: programs.wshowkeys.package
Desc: The wshowkeys package to use.

Name: programs.xastir.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Xastir Graphical APRS client.

Name: programs.xfconf.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Xfconf, the Xfce configuration storage system.

Name: programs.xfs_quota.projects
Desc: Setup of xfs_quota projects. Make sure the filesystem is mounted with the pquota option.

Name: programs.xfs_quota.projects._name_.fileSystem
Desc: XFS filesystem hosting the xfs_quota project.

Name: programs.xfs_quota.projects._name_.id
Desc: Project ID.

Name: programs.xfs_quota.projects._name_.path
Desc: Project directory.

Name: programs.xfs_quota.projects._name_.sizeHardLimit
Desc: Hard limit of the project size.

Name: programs.xfs_quota.projects._name_.sizeSoftLimit
Desc: Soft limit of the project size

Name: programs.xonsh.enable
Desc: Whether to configure xonsh as an interactive shell.

Name: programs.xonsh.package
Desc: The xonsh package to use.

Name: programs.xonsh.config
Desc: Control file to customize your shell behavior.

Name: programs.xss-lock.enable
Desc: Whether to enable xss-lock.

Name: programs.xss-lock.extraOptions
Desc:
Additional command-line arguments to pass to
<span class="command"><strong>xss-lock

Name: programs.xss-lock.lockerCommand
Desc: Locker to be used with xsslock

Name: programs.xwayland.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Xwayland (an X server for interfacing X11 apps with the Wayland protocol).

Name: programs.xwayland.package
Desc: The Xwayland package to use.

Name: programs.xwayland.defaultFontPath
Desc: Default font path. Setting this option causes Xwayland to be rebuilt.

Name: programs.yabar.enable
Desc: Whether to enable yabar, a status bar for X window managers.

Name: programs.yabar.package
Desc: The package which contains the <code class="literal">yabar

Name: programs.yabar.bars
Desc: List of bars that should be rendered by yabar.

Name: programs.yabar.bars._name_.extra
Desc: An attribute set which contains further attributes of a bar.

Name: programs.yabar.bars._name_.font
Desc: The font that will be used to draw the status bar.

Name: programs.yabar.bars._name_.indicators
Desc: Indicators that should be rendered by yabar.

Name: programs.yabar.bars._name_.indicators._name_.align
Desc: Whether to align the indicator at the left or right of the bar.

Name: programs.yabar.bars._name_.indicators._name_.exec
Desc: The type of the indicator to be executed.

Name: programs.yabar.bars._name_.indicators._name_.extra
Desc: An attribute set which contains further attributes of a indicator.
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer)

Name: programs.yabar.bars._name_.position
Desc: The position where the bar will be rendered.

Name: programs.yazi.enable
Desc: Whether to enable yazi terminal file manager.

Name: programs.yazi.package
Desc: The yazi package to use.

Name: programs.yazi.flavors
Desc: Pre-made themes.

Name: programs.yazi.initLua
Desc: The init.lua for Yazi itself.

Name: programs.yazi.plugins
Desc: Lua plugins.

Name: programs.yazi.settings
Desc: Configuration included in <code class="literal">$YAZI_CONFIG_HOME

Name: programs.yazi.settings.keymap
Desc: Configuration included in <code class="literal">keymap.toml

Name: programs.yazi.settings.theme
Desc: Configuration included in <code class="literal">theme.toml

Name: programs.yazi.settings.yazi
Desc: Configuration included in <code class="literal">yazi.toml

Name: programs.ydotool.enable
Desc: Whether to enable ydotoold system service and <span class="command"><strong>ydotool

Name: programs.ydotool.group
Desc: Group which users must be in to use <span class="command"><strong>ydotool

Name: programs.yubikey-touch-detector.enable
Desc: Whether to enable yubikey-touch-detector.

Name: programs.yubikey-touch-detector.libnotify
Desc: If set to true, yubikey-touch-detctor will send notifications using libnotify

Name: programs.yubikey-touch-detector.unixSocket
Desc: If set to true, yubikey-touch-detector will send notifications to a unix socket

Name: programs.yubikey-touch-detector.verbose
Desc: Enables verbose logging

Name: programs.zmap.enable
Desc: Whether to enable ZMap, a network scanner designed for Internet-wide network surveys.

Name: programs.zsh.enable
Desc:
Whether to configure zsh as an interactive shell. To enable zsh for
a particular user, use the <code class="option">users.users.<name?>.shell

Name: programs.zsh.enableBashCompletion
Desc: Enable compatibility with bash’s programmable completion system.

Name: programs.zsh.enableCompletion
Desc: Enable zsh completion for all interactive zsh shells.

Name: programs.zsh.enableGlobalCompInit
Desc: Enable execution of compinit call for all interactive zsh shells.

Name: programs.zsh.enableLsColors
Desc: Enable extra colors in directory listings (used by <code class="literal">ls

Name: programs.zsh.autosuggestions.enable
Desc: Whether to enable zsh-autosuggestions.

Name: programs.zsh.autosuggestions.async
Desc: Whether to fetch suggestions asynchronously

Name: programs.zsh.autosuggestions.extraConfig
Desc: Attribute set with additional configuration values

Name: programs.zsh.autosuggestions.highlightStyle
Desc: Highlight style for suggestions ({fore,back}ground color)

Name: programs.zsh.autosuggestions.strategy
Desc: <code class="literal">ZSH_AUTOSUGGEST_STRATEGY

Name: programs.zsh.histFile
Desc: Change history file.

Name: programs.zsh.histSize
Desc: Change history size.

Name: programs.zsh.interactiveShellInit
Desc: Shell script code called during interactive zsh shell initialisation.

Name: programs.zsh.loginShellInit
Desc: Shell script code called during zsh login shell initialisation.

Name: programs.zsh.ohMyZsh.enable
Desc: Enable oh-my-zsh.

Name: programs.zsh.ohMyZsh.package
Desc: The oh-my-zsh package to use.

Name: programs.zsh.ohMyZsh.cacheDir
Desc: Cache directory to be used by <code class="literal">oh-my-zsh

Name: programs.zsh.ohMyZsh.custom
Desc:
Path to a custom oh-my-zsh package to override config of oh-my-zsh.
(Can’t be used along with <code class="literal">customPkgs

Name: programs.zsh.ohMyZsh.customPkgs
Desc: List of custom packages that should be loaded into <code class="literal">oh-my-zsh

Name: programs.zsh.ohMyZsh.plugins
Desc: List of oh-my-zsh plugins

Name: programs.zsh.ohMyZsh.preLoaded
Desc: Shell commands executed before the <code class="literal">oh-my-zsh

Name: programs.zsh.ohMyZsh.theme
Desc: Name of the theme to be used by oh-my-zsh.

Name: programs.zsh.promptInit
Desc: Shell script code used to initialise the zsh prompt.

Name: programs.zsh.setOptions
Desc:
Configure zsh options. See
<span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">zshoptions

Name: programs.zsh.shellAliases
Desc: Set of aliases for zsh shell, which overrides <code class="option">environment.shellAliases
Type: attribute set of (null or string or path)

Name: programs.zsh.shellInit
Desc: Shell script code called during zsh shell initialisation.

Name: programs.zsh.syntaxHighlighting.enable
Desc: Whether to enable zsh-syntax-highlighting.

Name: programs.zsh.syntaxHighlighting.highlighters
Desc: Specifies the highlighters to be used by zsh-syntax-highlighting.

Name: programs.zsh.syntaxHighlighting.patterns
Desc: Specifies custom patterns to be highlighted by zsh-syntax-highlighting.

Name: programs.zsh.syntaxHighlighting.styles
Desc: Specifies custom styles to be highlighted by zsh-syntax-highlighting.

Name: programs.zsh.vteIntegration
Desc:
Whether to enable Zsh integration for VTE terminals.
This allows it to preserve the current directory of the shell
across terminals.

Name: programs.zsh.zsh-autoenv.enable
Desc: Whether to enable zsh-autoenv.

Name: programs.zsh.zsh-autoenv.package
Desc: The zsh-autoenv package to use.

Name: qt.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Qt configuration, including theming.

Name: qt.platformTheme
Desc: Selects the platform theme to use for Qt applications.

Name: qt.style
Desc: Selects the style to use for Qt applications.

Name: security.enableWrappers
Desc: Whether to enable SUID/SGID wrappers.

Name: security.acme.acceptTerms
Desc:
Accept the CA’s terms of service. The default provider is Let’s Encrypt,
you can find their ToS at <a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/repository/"  target="_top">https://letsencrypt.org/repository/

Name: security.acme.certs
Desc:
Attribute set of certificates to get signed and renewed. Creates
<code class="literal">acme-${cert}.{service,timer}

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.enableDebugLogs
Desc: Whether to enable debug logging for this certificate.

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.credentialFiles
Desc:
Environment variables suffixed by “_FILE” to set for the cert’s service
for your selected dnsProvider.
To find out what values you need to set, consult the documentation at
<a class="link" href="https://go-acme.github.io/lego/dns/"  target="_top">https://go-acme.github.io/lego/dns/

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.directory
Desc: Directory where certificate and other state is stored.

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.dnsPropagationCheck
Desc:
Toggles lego DNS propagation check, which is used alongside DNS-01
challenge to ensure the DNS entries required are available.

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.dnsProvider
Desc:
DNS Challenge provider. For a list of supported providers, see the “code”
field of the DNS providers listed at <a class="link" href="https://go-acme.github.io/lego/dns/"  target="_top">https://go-acme.github.io/lego/dns/

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.dnsResolver
Desc:
Set the resolver to use for performing recursive DNS queries. Supported:
host:port. The default is to use the system resolvers, or Google’s DNS
resolvers if the system’s cannot be determined.

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.domain
Desc: Domain to fetch certificate for (defaults to the entry name).

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.email
Desc:
Email address for account creation and correspondence from the CA.
It is recommended to use the same email for all certs to avoid account
creation limits.

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.environmentFile
Desc:
Path to an EnvironmentFile for the cert’s service containing any required and
optional environment variables for your selected dnsProvider.
To find out what values you need to set, consult the documentation at
<a class="link" href="https://go-acme.github.io/lego/dns/"  target="_top">https://go-acme.github.io/lego/dns/

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.extraDomainNames
Desc: A list of extra domain names, which are included in the one certificate to be issued.

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.extraLegoFlags
Desc: Additional global flags to pass to all lego commands.

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.extraLegoRenewFlags
Desc: Additional flags to pass to lego renew.

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.extraLegoRunFlags
Desc: Additional flags to pass to lego run.

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.group
Desc: Group running the ACME client.

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.inheritDefaults
Desc: Whether to inherit values set in <code class="literal">security.acme.defaults

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.keyType
Desc:
Key type to use for private keys.
For an up to date list of supported values check the --key-type option
at <a class="link" href="https://go-acme.github.io/lego/usage/cli/options/"  target="_top">https://go-acme.github.io/lego/usage/cli/options/

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.listenHTTP
Desc:
Interface and port to listen on to solve HTTP challenges
in the form [INTERFACE]:PORT.
If you use a port other than 80, you must proxy port 80 to this port.

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.ocspMustStaple
Desc:
Turns on the OCSP Must-Staple TLS extension.
Make sure you know what you’re doing! See:

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.postRun
Desc:
Commands to run after new certificates go live. Note that
these commands run as the root user.

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.reloadServices
Desc: The list of systemd services to call <code class="literal">systemctl try-reload-or-restart

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.renewInterval
Desc:
Systemd calendar expression when to check for renewal. See
<a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.time.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">systemd.time

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.s3Bucket
Desc: S3 bucket name to use for HTTP-01 based challenges. Challenges will be written to the S3 bucket.

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.server
Desc:
ACME Directory Resource URI.
Defaults to Let’s Encrypt’s production endpoint.
For testing Let’s Encrypt’s <a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/staging-environment/"  target="_top">staging endpoint

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.validMinDays
Desc: Minimum remaining validity before renewal in days.

Name: security.acme.certs._name_.webroot
Desc:
Where the webroot of the HTTP vhost is located.
<code class="filename">.well-known/acme-challenge/

Name: security.acme.defaults
Desc:
Default values inheritable by all configured certs. You can
use this to define options shared by all your certs. These defaults
can also be ignored on a per-cert basis using the
<code class="option">security.acme.certs.${cert}.inheritDefaults

Name: security.acme.defaults.enableDebugLogs
Desc: Whether to enable debug logging for this certificate.

Name: security.acme.defaults.credentialFiles
Desc:
Environment variables suffixed by “_FILE” to set for the cert’s service
for your selected dnsProvider.
To find out what values you need to set, consult the documentation at
<a class="link" href="https://go-acme.github.io/lego/dns/"  target="_top">https://go-acme.github.io/lego/dns/

Name: security.acme.defaults.dnsPropagationCheck
Desc:
Toggles lego DNS propagation check, which is used alongside DNS-01
challenge to ensure the DNS entries required are available.

Name: security.acme.defaults.dnsProvider
Desc:
DNS Challenge provider. For a list of supported providers, see the “code”
field of the DNS providers listed at <a class="link" href="https://go-acme.github.io/lego/dns/"  target="_top">https://go-acme.github.io/lego/dns/

Name: security.acme.defaults.dnsResolver
Desc:
Set the resolver to use for performing recursive DNS queries. Supported:
host:port. The default is to use the system resolvers, or Google’s DNS
resolvers if the system’s cannot be determined.

Name: security.acme.defaults.email
Desc:
Email address for account creation and correspondence from the CA.
It is recommended to use the same email for all certs to avoid account
creation limits.

Name: security.acme.defaults.environmentFile
Desc:
Path to an EnvironmentFile for the cert’s service containing any required and
optional environment variables for your selected dnsProvider.
To find out what values you need to set, consult the documentation at
<a class="link" href="https://go-acme.github.io/lego/dns/"  target="_top">https://go-acme.github.io/lego/dns/

Name: security.acme.defaults.extraLegoFlags
Desc: Additional global flags to pass to all lego commands.

Name: security.acme.defaults.extraLegoRenewFlags
Desc: Additional flags to pass to lego renew.

Name: security.acme.defaults.extraLegoRunFlags
Desc: Additional flags to pass to lego run.

Name: security.acme.defaults.group
Desc: Group running the ACME client.

Name: security.acme.defaults.keyType
Desc:
Key type to use for private keys.
For an up to date list of supported values check the --key-type option
at <a class="link" href="https://go-acme.github.io/lego/usage/cli/options/"  target="_top">https://go-acme.github.io/lego/usage/cli/options/

Name: security.acme.defaults.ocspMustStaple
Desc:
Turns on the OCSP Must-Staple TLS extension.
Make sure you know what you’re doing! See:

Name: security.acme.defaults.postRun
Desc:
Commands to run after new certificates go live. Note that
these commands run as the root user.

Name: security.acme.defaults.reloadServices
Desc: The list of systemd services to call <code class="literal">systemctl try-reload-or-restart

Name: security.acme.defaults.renewInterval
Desc:
Systemd calendar expression when to check for renewal. See
<a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.time.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">systemd.time

Name: security.acme.defaults.server
Desc:
ACME Directory Resource URI.
Defaults to Let’s Encrypt’s production endpoint.
For testing Let’s Encrypt’s <a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/staging-environment/"  target="_top">staging endpoint

Name: security.acme.defaults.validMinDays
Desc: Minimum remaining validity before renewal in days.

Name: security.acme.defaults.webroot
Desc:
Where the webroot of the HTTP vhost is located.
<code class="filename">.well-known/acme-challenge/

Name: security.acme.maxConcurrentRenewals
Desc:
Maximum number of concurrent certificate generation or renewal jobs. All other
jobs will queue and wait running jobs to finish. Reduces the system load of
certificate generation.

Name: security.acme.preliminarySelfsigned
Desc:
Whether a preliminary self-signed certificate should be generated before
doing ACME requests. This can be useful when certificates are required in
a webserver, but ACME needs the webserver to make its requests.

Name: security.acme.useRoot
Desc:
Whether to use the root user when generating certs. This is not recommended
for security + compatibility reasons. If a service requires root owned certificates
consider following the guide on “Using ACME with services demanding root
owned certificates” in the NixOS manual, and only using this as a fallback
or for testing.

Name: security.allowSimultaneousMultithreading
Desc:
Whether to allow SMT/hyperthreading.  Disabling SMT means that only
physical CPU cores will be usable at runtime, potentially at
significant performance cost.

Name: security.allowUserNamespaces
Desc: Whether to allow creation of user namespaces.

Name: security.apparmor.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the AppArmor Mandatory Access Control system.

Name: security.apparmor.enableCache
Desc:
Whether to enable caching of AppArmor policies
in <code class="literal">/var/cache/apparmor/

Name: security.apparmor.packages
Desc: List of packages to be added to AppArmor’s include path

Name: security.apparmor.includes
Desc:
List of paths to be added to AppArmor’s searched paths
when resolving <code class="literal">include
Type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n”

Name: security.apparmor.killUnconfinedConfinables
Desc:
Whether to enable killing of processes which have an AppArmor profile enabled
(in <a class='xref' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-security.apparmor.policies'><code class="option">security.apparmor.policies

Name: security.apparmor.policies
Desc: AppArmor policies.

Name: security.apparmor.policies._name_.enable
Desc: Whether to enable loading of the profile into the kernel.

Name: security.apparmor.policies._name_.enforce
Desc: Whether to enable enforcing of the policy or only complain in the logs.

Name: security.apparmor.policies._name_.profile
Desc: The policy of the profile.

Name: security.audit.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Linux audit system. The special <code class="literal">lock

Name: security.audit.backlogLimit
Desc:
The maximum number of outstanding audit buffers allowed; exceeding this is
considered a failure and handled in a manner specified by failureMode.

Name: security.audit.failureMode
Desc: How to handle critical errors in the auditing system

Name: security.audit.rateLimit
Desc:
The maximum messages per second permitted before triggering a failure as
specified by failureMode. Setting it to zero disables the limit.

Name: security.audit.rules
Desc: The ordered audit rules, with each string appearing as one line of the audit.rules file.

Name: security.auditd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Linux Audit daemon.

Name: security.chromiumSuidSandbox.enable
Desc:
Whether to install the Chromium SUID sandbox which is an executable that
Chromium may use in order to achieve sandboxing.

Name: security.dhparams.enable
Desc: Whether to generate new DH params and clean up old DH params.

Name: security.dhparams.defaultBitSize
Desc:
This allows to override the default bit size for all of the
Diffie-Hellman parameters set in
<code class="option">security.dhparams.params

Name: security.dhparams.params
Desc: Diffie-Hellman parameters to generate.
Type: attribute set of ((submodule) or signed integer convertible to it)

Name: security.dhparams.params._name_.bits
Desc:
The bit size for the prime that is used during a Diffie-Hellman
key exchange.

Name: security.dhparams.params._name_.path
Desc:
The resulting path of the generated Diffie-Hellman parameters
file for other services to reference. This could be either a
store path or a file inside the directory specified by
<code class="option">security.dhparams.path

Name: security.dhparams.path
Desc:
Path to the directory in which Diffie-Hellman parameters will be
stored. This only is relevant if
<code class="option">security.dhparams.stateful

Name: security.dhparams.stateful
Desc:
Whether generation of Diffie-Hellman parameters should be stateful or
not. If this is enabled, PEM-encoded files for Diffie-Hellman
parameters are placed in the directory specified by
<code class="option">security.dhparams.path

Name: security.doas.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the <span class="command"><strong>doas

Name: security.doas.extraConfig
Desc: Extra configuration text appended to <code class="filename">doas.conf

Name: security.doas.extraRules
Desc:
Define specific rules to be set in the
<code class="filename">/etc/doas.conf

Name: security.doas.extraRules._.args
Desc:
Arguments that must be provided to the command. When set to
<code class="literal">[]

Name: security.doas.extraRules._.cmd
Desc:
The command the user is allowed to run. When set to
<code class="literal">null

Name: security.doas.extraRules._.groups
Desc: The groups / GIDs this rule should apply for.

Name: security.doas.extraRules._.keepEnv
Desc: If <code class="literal">true

Name: security.doas.extraRules._.noLog
Desc: If <code class="literal">true

Name: security.doas.extraRules._.noPass
Desc: If <code class="literal">true

Name: security.doas.extraRules._.persist
Desc: If <code class="literal">true

Name: security.doas.extraRules._.runAs
Desc:
Which user or group the specified command is allowed to run as.
When set to <code class="literal">null

Name: security.doas.extraRules._.setEnv
Desc:
Keep or set the specified variables. Variables may also be
removed with a leading ‘-’ or set using
<code class="literal">variable=value

Name: security.doas.extraRules._.users
Desc: The usernames / UIDs this rule should apply for.

Name: security.doas.wheelNeedsPassword
Desc: Whether users of the <code class="literal">wheel

Name: security.duosec.acceptEnvFactor
Desc:
Look for factor selection or passcode in the
<code class="literal">$DUO_PASSCODE

Name: security.duosec.allowTcpForwarding
Desc:
By default, when SSH forwarding, enabling Duo Security will
disable TCP forwarding. By enabling this, you potentially
undermine some of the SSH based login security. Note this is
not needed if you use PAM.

Name: security.duosec.autopush
Desc: If <code class="literal">true

Name: security.duosec.failmode
Desc:
On service or configuration errors that prevent Duo
authentication, fail “safe” (allow access) or “secure” (deny
access). The default is “safe”.

Name: security.duosec.fallbackLocalIP
Desc:
Duo Unix reports the IP address of the authorizing user, for
the purposes of authorization and whitelisting. If Duo Unix
cannot detect the IP address of the client, setting
<code class="literal">fallbackLocalIP = yes

Name: security.duosec.groups
Desc:
If specified, Duo authentication is required only for users
whose primary group or supplementary group list matches one
of the space-separated pattern lists. Refer to
<a class="link" href="https://duo.com/docs/duounix"  target="_top">https://duo.com/docs/duounix

Name: security.duosec.host
Desc: Duo API hostname.

Name: security.duosec.integrationKey
Desc: Integration key.

Name: security.duosec.motd
Desc: Print the contents of <code class="literal">/etc/motd

Name: security.duosec.pam.enable
Desc: If enabled, protect logins with Duo Security using PAM support.

Name: security.duosec.prompts
Desc:
If a user fails to authenticate with a second factor, Duo
Unix will prompt the user to authenticate again. This option
sets the maximum number of prompts that Duo Unix will
display before denying access. Must be 1, 2, or 3. Default
is 3.

Name: security.duosec.pushinfo
Desc:
Include information such as the command to be executed in
the Duo Push message.

Name: security.duosec.secretKeyFile
Desc: A file containing your secret key. The security of your Duo application is tied to the security of your secret key.

Name: security.duosec.ssh.enable
Desc: If enabled, protect SSH logins with Duo Security.

Name: security.forcePageTableIsolation
Desc:
Whether to force-enable the Page Table Isolation (PTI) Linux kernel
feature even on CPU models that claim to be safe from Meltdown.

Name: security.googleOsLogin.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Google OS Login.

Name: security.ipa.enable
Desc: Whether to enable FreeIPA domain integration.

Name: security.ipa.basedn
Desc: Base DN to use when performing LDAP operations.

Name: security.ipa.cacheCredentials
Desc: Whether to cache credentials.

Name: security.ipa.certificate
Desc: IPA server CA certificate.

Name: security.ipa.chromiumSupport
Desc: Whether to whitelist the FreeIPA domain in Chromium.

Name: security.ipa.domain
Desc: Domain of the IPA server.

Name: security.ipa.dyndns.enable
Desc: Whether to enable FreeIPA automatic hostname updates.

Name: security.ipa.dyndns.interface
Desc: Network interface to perform hostname updates through.

Name: security.ipa.ifpAllowedUids
Desc: A list of users allowed to access the ifp dbus interface.

Name: security.ipa.ipaHostname
Desc: Fully-qualified hostname used to identify this host in the IPA domain.

Name: security.ipa.offlinePasswords
Desc: Whether to store offline passwords when the server is down.

Name: security.ipa.realm
Desc: Kerberos realm.

Name: security.ipa.server
Desc: IPA Server hostname.

Name: security.isolate.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable Sandbox for securely executing untrusted programs
.

Name: security.isolate.package
Desc: The isolate-unwrapped package to use.

Name: security.isolate.boxRoot
Desc:
All sandboxes are created under this directory.
To avoid symlink attacks, this directory and all its ancestors
must be writeable only by root.

Name: security.isolate.cgRoot
Desc:
Control group which subgroups are placed under.
Either an explicit path to a subdirectory in cgroupfs, or “auto:file” to read
the path from “file”, where it is put by <code class="literal">isolate-cg-helper

Name: security.isolate.extraConfig
Desc: Extra configuration to append to the configuration file.

Name: security.isolate.firstGid
Desc: Start of block of GIDs reserved for sandboxes.
Type: integer or floating point number between 1000 and 65533 (both inclusive)

Name: security.isolate.firstUid
Desc: Start of block of UIDs reserved for sandboxes.
Type: integer or floating point number between 1000 and 65533 (both inclusive)

Name: security.isolate.lockRoot
Desc: Directory where lock files are created.

Name: security.isolate.numBoxes
Desc:
Number of UIDs and GIDs to reserve, starting from
<code class="option">firstUid
Type: integer or floating point number between 1000 and 65533 (both inclusive)

Name: security.isolate.restrictedInit
Desc: If true, only root can create sandboxes.

Name: security.krb5.enable
Desc: Enable and configure Kerberos utilities

Name: security.krb5.package
Desc: The krb5 package to use.

Name: security.krb5.settings
Desc: Structured contents of the <code class="filename">krb5.conf
Type: attribute set of attribute set of ((list of attribute set of ((list of (signed integer or string or boolean)) or signed integer or string or boolean)) or attribute set of ((list of (signed integer or string or boolean)) or signed integer or string or boolean) or (list of (signed integer or string or boolean)) or signed integer or string or boolean)

Name: security.krb5.settings.include
Desc: Files to include in the Kerberos configuration.
Type: (list of path) or path convertible to it

Name: security.krb5.settings.includedir
Desc: Directories containing files to include in the Kerberos configuration.
Type: (list of path) or path convertible to it

Name: security.krb5.settings.module
Desc: Modules to obtain Kerberos configuration from.
Type: (list of path) or path convertible to it

Name: security.lockKernelModules
Desc:
Disable kernel module loading once the system is fully initialised.
Module loading is disabled until the next reboot. Problems caused
by delayed module loading can be fixed by adding the module(s) in
question to <code class="option">boot.kernelModules

Name: security.loginDefs.package
Desc: The shadow package to use.

Name: security.loginDefs.chfnRestrict
Desc: Use chfn SUID to allow non-root users to change their account GECOS information.

Name: security.loginDefs.settings
Desc:
Config options for the /etc/login.defs file, that defines
the site-specific configuration for the shadow password suite.
See login.defs(5) man page for available options.
Type: attribute set of (atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: security.loginDefs.settings.DEFAULT_HOME
Desc: Indicate if login is allowed if we can’t cd to the home directory.

Name: security.loginDefs.settings.ENCRYPT_METHOD
Desc: This defines the system default encryption algorithm for encrypting passwords.

Name: security.loginDefs.settings.GID_MAX
Desc: Range of group IDs used for the creation of regular groups by useradd, groupadd, or newusers.

Name: security.loginDefs.settings.GID_MIN
Desc: Range of group IDs used for the creation of regular groups by useradd, groupadd, or newusers.

Name: security.loginDefs.settings.SYS_GID_MAX
Desc: Range of group IDs used for the creation of system groups by useradd, groupadd, or newusers

Name: security.loginDefs.settings.SYS_GID_MIN
Desc: Range of group IDs used for the creation of system groups by useradd, groupadd, or newusers

Name: security.loginDefs.settings.SYS_UID_MAX
Desc: Range of user IDs used for the creation of system users by useradd or newusers.

Name: security.loginDefs.settings.SYS_UID_MIN
Desc: Range of user IDs used for the creation of system users by useradd or newusers.

Name: security.loginDefs.settings.TTYGROUP
Desc:
The terminal permissions: the login tty will be owned by the TTYGROUP group,
and the permissions will be set to TTYPERM

Name: security.loginDefs.settings.TTYPERM
Desc:
The terminal permissions: the login tty will be owned by the TTYGROUP group,
and the permissions will be set to TTYPERM

Name: security.loginDefs.settings.UID_MAX
Desc: Range of user IDs used for the creation of regular users by useradd or newusers.

Name: security.loginDefs.settings.UID_MIN
Desc: Range of user IDs used for the creation of regular users by useradd or newusers.

Name: security.loginDefs.settings.UMASK
Desc: The file mode creation mask is initialized to this value.

Name: security.pam.enableEcryptfs
Desc: Whether to enable eCryptfs PAM module (mounting ecryptfs home directory on login).

Name: security.pam.enableFscrypt
Desc: Whether to enable fscrypt, to automatically unlock directories with the user’s login password.

Name: security.pam.enableOTPW
Desc: Whether to enable the OTPW (one-time password) PAM module.

Name: security.pam.package
Desc: The pam package to use.

Name: security.pam.dp9ik.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the dp9ik pam module provided by tlsclient.

Name: security.pam.dp9ik.authserver
Desc:
This controls the hostname for the 9front authentication server
that users will be authenticated against.

Name: security.pam.dp9ik.control
Desc: This option sets the pam “control” used for this module.

Name: security.pam.krb5.enable
Desc: Enables Kerberos PAM modules (<code class="literal">pam-krb5

Name: security.pam.loginLimits
Desc:
Define resource limits that should apply to users or groups.
Each item in the list should be an attribute set with a
<code class="varname">domain

Name: security.pam.loginLimits._.domain
Desc: Username, groupname, or wildcard this limit applies to

Name: security.pam.loginLimits._.item
Desc: Item this limit applies to

Name: security.pam.loginLimits._.type
Desc: Type of this limit

Name: security.pam.loginLimits._.value
Desc: Value of this limit

Name: security.pam.makeHomeDir.skelDirectory
Desc:
Path to skeleton directory whose contents are copied to home
directories newly created by <code class="literal">pam_mkhomedir

Name: security.pam.makeHomeDir.umask
Desc:
The user file mode creation mask to use on home directories
newly created by <code class="literal">pam_mkhomedir

Name: security.pam.mount.enable
Desc: Enable PAM mount system to mount filesystems on user login.

Name: security.pam.mount.additionalSearchPaths
Desc:
Additional programs to include in the search path of pam_mount.
Useful for example if you want to use some FUSE filesystems like bindfs.

Name: security.pam.mount.createMountPoints
Desc: Create mountpoints for volumes if they do not exist.

Name: security.pam.mount.cryptMountOptions
Desc:
Global mount options that apply to every crypt volume.
You can define volume-specific options in the volume definitions.

Name: security.pam.mount.debugLevel
Desc:
Sets the Debug-Level. 0 disables debugging, 1 enables pam_mount tracing,
and 2 additionally enables tracing in mount.crypt. The default is 0.
For more information, visit <a class="link" href="https://pam-mount.sourceforge.net/pam_mount.conf.5.html"  target="_top">https://pam-mount.sourceforge.net/pam_mount.conf.5.html

Name: security.pam.mount.extraVolumes
Desc:
List of volume definitions for pam_mount.
For more information, visit <a class="link" href="https://pam-mount.sourceforge.net/pam_mount.conf.5.html"  target="_top">https://pam-mount.sourceforge.net/pam_mount.conf.5.html

Name: security.pam.mount.fuseMountOptions
Desc:
Global mount options that apply to every FUSE volume.
You can define volume-specific options in the volume definitions.

Name: security.pam.mount.logoutHup
Desc: Kill remaining processes after logout by sending a SIGHUP.

Name: security.pam.mount.logoutKill
Desc: Kill remaining processes after logout by sending a SIGKILL.

Name: security.pam.mount.logoutTerm
Desc: Kill remaining processes after logout by sending a SIGTERM.

Name: security.pam.mount.logoutWait
Desc:
Amount of microseconds to wait until killing remaining processes after
final logout.
For more information, visit <a class="link" href="https://pam-mount.sourceforge.net/pam_mount.conf.5.html"  target="_top">https://pam-mount.sourceforge.net/pam_mount.conf.5.html

Name: security.pam.mount.removeCreatedMountPoints
Desc:
Remove mountpoints created by pam_mount after logout. This
only affects mountpoints that have been created by pam_mount
in the same session.

Name: security.pam.oath.enable
Desc: Enable the OATH (one-time password) PAM module.

Name: security.pam.oath.digits
Desc:
Specify the lib.length of the one-time password in number of
digits.

Name: security.pam.oath.usersFile
Desc:
Set the path to file where the user’s credentials are
stored. This file must not be world readable!

Name: security.pam.oath.window
Desc:
Specify the number of one-time passwords to check in order
to accommodate for situations where the system and the
client are slightly out of sync (iteration for HOTP or time
steps for TOTP).

Name: security.pam.p11.enable
Desc: Enables P11 PAM (<code class="literal">pam_p11

Name: security.pam.p11.control
Desc:
This option sets pam “control”.
If you want to have multi factor authentication, use “required”.
If you want to use the PKCS#11 device instead of the regular password,
use “sufficient”.

Name: security.pam.rssh.enable
Desc: Whether to enable authenticating using a signature performed by the ssh-agent.

Name: security.pam.rssh.settings
Desc:
Options to pass to the pam_rssh module. Refer to
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/z4yx/pam_rssh/blob/main/README.md#optional-arguments"  target="_top">https://github.com/z4yx/pam_rssh/blob/main/README.md#optional-arguments
Type: attribute set of (null or boolean or string or signed integer or path in the Nix store)

Name: security.pam.rssh.settings.auth_key_file
Desc: Path to file with trusted public keys in OpenSSH’s <code class="literal">authorized_keys

Name: security.pam.services
Desc:
This option defines the PAM services.  A service typically
corresponds to a program that uses PAM,
e.g. <span class="command"><strong>login

Name: security.pam.services._name_.enableAppArmor
Desc:
Enable support for attaching AppArmor profiles at the
user/group level, e.g., as part of a role based access
control scheme.

Name: security.pam.services._name_.enableGnomeKeyring
Desc:
If enabled, pam_gnome_keyring will attempt to automatically unlock the
user’s default Gnome keyring upon login. If the user login password does
not match their keyring password, Gnome Keyring will prompt separately
after login.

Name: security.pam.services._name_.allowNullPassword
Desc:
Whether to allow logging into accounts that have no password
set (i.e., have an empty password field in
<code class="filename">/etc/passwd

Name: security.pam.services._name_.duoSecurity.enable
Desc:
If set, use the Duo Security pam module
<code class="literal">pam_duo

Name: security.pam.services._name_.failDelay.enable
Desc: If enabled, this will replace the <code class="literal">FAIL_DELAY

Name: security.pam.services._name_.failDelay.delay
Desc: The delay time (in microseconds) on failure.

Name: security.pam.services._name_.forwardXAuth
Desc:
Whether X authentication keys should be passed from the
calling user to the target user (e.g. for
<span class="command"><strong>su

Name: security.pam.services._name_.fprintAuth
Desc:
If set, fingerprint reader will be used (if exists and
your fingerprints are enrolled).

Name: security.pam.services._name_.gnupg.enable
Desc:
If enabled, pam_gnupg will attempt to automatically unlock the
user’s GPG keys with the login password via
<span class="command"><strong>gpg-agent

Name: security.pam.services._name_.gnupg.noAutostart
Desc: Don’t start <span class="command"><strong>gpg-agent

Name: security.pam.services._name_.gnupg.storeOnly
Desc:
Don’t send the password immediately after login, but store for PAM
<code class="literal">session

Name: security.pam.services._name_.googleAuthenticator.enable
Desc:
If set, users with enabled Google Authenticator (created
<code class="filename">~/.google_authenticator

Name: security.pam.services._name_.googleOsLoginAccountVerification
Desc:
If set, will use the Google OS Login PAM modules
(<code class="literal">pam_oslogin_login

Name: security.pam.services._name_.googleOsLoginAuthentication
Desc: If set, will use the <code class="literal">pam_oslogin_login

Name: security.pam.services._name_.kwallet.enable
Desc:
If enabled, pam_wallet will attempt to automatically unlock the
user’s default KDE wallet upon login. If the user has no wallet named
“kdewallet”, or the login password does not match their wallet
password, KDE will prompt separately after login.

Name: security.pam.services._name_.kwallet.package
Desc: The kwallet-pam package to use.

Name: security.pam.services._name_.kwallet.forceRun
Desc: The <code class="literal">force_run

Name: security.pam.services._name_.limits
Desc:
Attribute set describing resource limits.  Defaults to the
value of <code class="option">security.pam.loginLimits

Name: security.pam.services._name_.limits._.domain
Desc: Username, groupname, or wildcard this limit applies to

Name: security.pam.services._name_.limits._.item
Desc: Item this limit applies to

Name: security.pam.services._name_.limits._.type
Desc: Type of this limit

Name: security.pam.services._name_.limits._.value
Desc: Value of this limit

Name: security.pam.services._name_.logFailures
Desc: Whether to log authentication failures in <code class="filename">/var/log/faillog

Name: security.pam.services._name_.makeHomeDir
Desc:
Whether to try to create home directories for users
with <code class="literal">$HOME

Name: security.pam.services._name_.mysqlAuth
Desc: If set, the <code class="literal">pam_mysql

Name: security.pam.services._name_.name
Desc: Name of the PAM service.

Name: security.pam.services._name_.nodelay
Desc: Whether the delay after typing a wrong password should be disabled.

Name: security.pam.services._name_.oathAuth
Desc: If set, the OATH Toolkit will be used.

Name: security.pam.services._name_.otpwAuth
Desc:
If set, the OTPW system will be used (if
<code class="filename">~/.otpw

Name: security.pam.services._name_.p11Auth
Desc:
If set, keys listed in
<code class="filename">~/.ssh/authorized_keys

Name: services.agorakit.nginx.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

The host name or IP address on which to bind Airsonic.

specific IP or 0.0.0.0 to listen on all interfaces.

Name: services.amazon-cloudwatch-agent.enable

Amazon CloudWatch Agent configuration. See

Desc:
Amazon CloudWatch Agent mode. Indicates whether the agent is running in EC2 (“ec2”), on-premises (“onPremise”),
or if it should guess based on metadata endpoints like IMDS or the ECS task metadata endpoint (“auto”).

Rules to write in ‘nixRules.rules’. See:

Types to write in ‘nixTypes.types’. See:

Type: attribute set of (signed integer or boolean or string)

Name: services.anki-sync-server.enable
Desc: Whether to enable anki-sync-server.

IP address anki-sync-server listens to.

Name: services.anki-sync-server.openFirewall
Desc: Whether to open the firewall for the specified port.

Password accepted by anki-sync-server for the associated username.
<span class="strong"><strong>WARNING

File containing the password accepted by anki-sync-server for
the associated username.  Make sure to make readable only by
root.

Name: services.anki-sync-server.users._.username

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Anuko Time Tracker.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.package
Desc: The anuko-time-tracker package to use.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.dataDir
Desc: Default data folder for Anuko Time Tracker.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.database.createLocally
Desc: Create the database and database user locally.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.database.host
Desc: Database host.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.database.name
Desc: Database name.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.database.passwordFile
Desc: Database user password file.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.database.user
Desc: Database username.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.hostname
Desc: The hostname to serve Anuko Time Tracker on.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx
Desc: With this option, you can customize the Nginx virtualHost settings.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.acmeFallbackHost
Desc:
Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful
if you want multiple hosts to be able to verify the same domain name.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.acmeRoot
Desc: Directory for the ACME challenge, which is <span class="strong"><strong>public

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,
configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.listen._.addr
Desc: Listen address.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.listen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.listen._.port
Desc:
Port number to listen on.
If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.listen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.listen._.ssl
Desc: Enable SSL.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.locations
Desc: Declarative location config

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.locations._name_.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.locations._name_.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.locations._name_.fastcgiParams
Desc:
FastCGI parameters to override.  Unlike in the Nginx
configuration file, overriding only some default parameters
won’t unset the default values for other parameters.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds index directive.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc:
Adds proxy_pass directive and sets recommended proxy headers if
recommendedProxySettings is enabled.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.locations._name_.proxyWebsockets
Desc: Whether to support proxying websocket connections with HTTP/1.1.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.locations._name_.recommendedProxySettings
Desc: Enable recommended proxy settings.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.locations._name_.return
Desc: Adds a return directive, for e.g. redirections.
Type: null or string or signed integer

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.locations._name_.root
Desc: Root directory for requests.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.locations._name_.tryFiles
Desc: Adds try_files directive.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.onlySSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.quic
Desc:
Whether to enable the QUIC transport protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.redirectCode
Desc: HTTP status used by <code class="literal">globalRedirect

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.rejectSSL
Desc:
Whether to listen for and reject all HTTPS connections to this vhost. Useful in
<a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.default'>default

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.reuseport
Desc:
Create an individual listening socket .
It is required to specify only once on one of the hosts.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.root
Desc: The path of the web root directory.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.serverAliases
Desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.serverName
Desc: Name of this virtual host. Defaults to attribute name in virtualHosts.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.sslCertificate
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.sslCertificateKey
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate key.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.sslTrustedCertificate
Desc: Path to root SSL certificate for stapling and client certificates.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.nginx.useACMEHost
Desc:
A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.poolConfig
Desc: Options for Anuko Time Tracker’s PHP-FPM pool.
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.defaultCurrency
Desc:
Defines a default currency symbol for new groups.
Use €, £, a more specific dollar like US$, CAD, etc.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.defaultLanguage
Desc:
Defines Anuko Time Tracker default language. It is used on Time Tracker login page.
After login, a language set for user group is used.
Empty string means the language is defined by user browser.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.email.mode
Desc: Mail sending mode. Can be ‘mail’ or ‘smtp’.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.email.sender
Desc: Default sender for mail.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.email.smtpAuth
Desc: MTA requires authentication.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.email.smtpDebug
Desc: Debug mail sending.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.email.smtpHost
Desc: MTA hostname.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.email.smtpPasswordFile
Desc: Path to file containing the MTA authentication password.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.email.smtpPort
Desc: MTA port.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.email.smtpUser
Desc: MTA authentication username.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.emailRequired
Desc: Defines whether an email is required for new registrations.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.exportDecimalDuration
Desc:
Defines whether time duration values are decimal in CSV and XML data
exports (1.25 vs 1:15).

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.forumLink
Desc: Forum link from the main menu.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.helpLink
Desc: Help link from the main menu.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.multiorgMode
Desc:
Defines whether users see the Register option in the menu of Time Tracker that allows them
to self-register and create new organizations (top groups).

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.reportFooter
Desc: Defines whether to use a footer on reports.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.settings.weekendStartDay
Desc:
This option defines which days are highlighted with weekend color.
6 means Saturday. For Saudi Arabia, etc. set it to 4 for Thursday and Friday to be
weekend days.

Name: services.anuko-time-tracker.user
Desc: User under which Anuko Time Tracker runs.

Name: services.apache-kafka.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Apache Kafka event streaming broker.

Name: services.apache-kafka.package
Desc: The apacheKafka package to use.

Name: services.apache-kafka.clusterId
Desc: KRaft mode ClusterId used for formatting log directories. Can be generated with <code class="literal">kafka-storage.sh random-uuid

Desc: Kafka log4j property configuration file path

Name: services.apache-kafka.configFiles.serverProperties
Desc:
Kafka server.properties configuration file path.
Defaults to the rendered <code class="literal">settings

Name: services.apache-kafka.formatLogDirs
Desc:
Whether to format log dirs in KRaft mode if all log dirs are
unformatted, ie. they contain no meta.properties.

Name: services.apache-kafka.formatLogDirsIgnoreFormatted
Desc:
Whether to ignore already formatted log dirs when formatting log dirs,
instead of failing. Useful when replacing or adding disks.

Name: services.apache-kafka.jre
Desc: The JRE with which to run Kafka

Name: services.apache-kafka.jvmOptions
Desc: Extra command line options for the JVM running Kafka.

Name: services.apache-kafka.log4jProperties
Desc: Kafka log4j property configuration.

Name: services.apache-kafka.settings
Desc: <a class="link" href="https://kafka.apache.org/documentation.html#brokerconfigs"  target="_top">Kafka broker configuration
Type: lazy attribute set of (null or boolean or signed integer or string or list of (boolean or signed integer or string))

Name: services.apache-kafka.settings._broker.id_
Desc: Broker ID. -1 or null to auto-allocate in zookeeper mode.

Name: services.apache-kafka.settings.listeners
Desc:
Kafka Listener List.
See <a class="link" href="https://kafka.apache.org/documentation/#brokerconfigs_listeners"  target="_top">listeners

Name: services.apache-kafka.settings._log.dirs_
Desc: Log file directories.

Name: services.apcupsd.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable the APC UPS daemon. apcupsd monitors your UPS and
permits orderly shutdown of your computer in the event of a power
failure. User manual: http://www.apcupsd.com/manual/manual.html.
Note that apcupsd runs as root (to allow shutdown of computer).
You can check the status of your UPS with the “apcaccess” command.

Name: services.apcupsd.configText
Desc:
Contents of the runtime configuration file, apcupsd.conf. The default
settings makes apcupsd autodetect USB UPSes, limit network access to
localhost and shutdown the system when the battery level is below 50
percent, or when the UPS has calculated that it has 5 minutes or less
of remaining power-on time. See man apcupsd.conf for details.

Name: services.apcupsd.hooks
Desc:
Each attribute in this option names an apcupsd event and the string
value it contains will be executed in a shell, in response to that
event (prior to the default action). See “man apccontrol” for the
list of events and what they represent.
Type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n”

Name: services.arbtt.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Arbtt statistics capture service.

Name: services.arbtt.package
Desc: The arbtt package to use.

Name: services.arbtt.logFile
Desc: The log file for captured samples.

Name: services.arbtt.sampleRate
Desc: The sampling interval in seconds.

Name: services.archisteamfarm.enable
Desc:
If enabled, starts the ArchisSteamFarm service.
For configuring the SteamGuard token you will need to use the web-ui, which is enabled by default over on 127.0.0.1:1242.
You cannot configure ASF in any way outside of nix, since all the config files get wiped on restart and replaced with the programnatically set ones by nix.

Name: services.archisteamfarm.package
Desc:
The ArchiSteamFarm package to use. ::: {.warning}
Should always be the latest version, for security reasons,
since this module uses very new features and to not get out of sync with the Steam API.
:::

Name: services.archisteamfarm.bots
Desc: Bots name and configuration.

Name: services.archisteamfarm.bots._name_.enabled
Desc: Whether to enable the bot on startup.

Name: services.archisteamfarm.bots._name_.passwordFile
Desc: Path to a file containing the password. The file must be readable by the <code class="literal">archisteamfarm

Name: services.archisteamfarm.bots._name_.settings
Desc: Additional settings that are documented <a class="link" href="https://github.com/JustArchiNET/ArchiSteamFarm/wiki/Configuration#bot-config"  target="_top">here

Name: services.archisteamfarm.bots._name_.username
Desc: Name of the user to log in. Default is attribute name.

Name: services.archisteamfarm.dataDir
Desc:
The ASF home directory used to store all data.
If left as the default value this directory will automatically be created before the ASF server starts, otherwise the sysadmin is responsible for ensuring the directory exists with appropriate ownership and permissions.

Name: services.archisteamfarm.ipcPasswordFile
Desc: Path to a file containing the password. The file must be readable by the <code class="literal">archisteamfarm

Name: services.archisteamfarm.ipcSettings
Desc:
Settings to write to IPC.config.
All options can be found <a class="link" href="https://github.com/JustArchiNET/ArchiSteamFarm/wiki/IPC#custom-configuration"  target="_top">here

Name: services.archisteamfarm.settings
Desc: The ASF.json file, all the options are documented <a class="link" href="https://github.com/JustArchiNET/ArchiSteamFarm/wiki/Configuration#global-config"  target="_top">here

Name: services.archisteamfarm.web-ui
Desc: The Web-UI hosted on 127.0.0.1:1242.

Name: services.archisteamfarm.web-ui.enable
Desc: Whether to start the web-ui. This is the preferred way of configuring things such as the steam guard token.

Name: services.archisteamfarm.web-ui.package
services.aria2.enable
Desc: Whether or not to enable the headless Aria2 daemon service.

Name: services.aria2.downloadDirPermission

A file containing the RPC secret authorization token.
Read https://aria2.github.io/manual/en/html/aria2c.html#rpc-auth to know how this option value is used.

Name: services.aria2.serviceUMask

Name: services.aria2.settings.dir

Type: list of attribute set of 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.aria2.settings.rpc-listen-port
Desc: Specify a port number for JSON-RPC/XML-RPC server to listen to. Possible Values: 1024-65535
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.aria2.settings.save-session

Name: services.armagetronad.servers

The content of /etc/asusd/asusd.ron.
