Name: services.avahi.allowInterfaces
Desc: List of network interfaces that should be used by the <span class="command"><strong>avahi-daemon

Name: services.avahi.allowPointToPoint
Desc:
Whether to use POINTTOPOINT interfaces. Might make mDNS unreliable due to usually large
latencies with such links and opens a potential security hole by allowing mDNS access from Internet
connections.

Name: services.avahi.browseDomains
Desc: List of non-local DNS domains to be browsed.

Name: services.avahi.cacheEntriesMax
Desc:
Number of resource records to be cached per interface. Use 0 to
disable caching. Avahi daemon defaults to 4096 if not set.

Name: services.avahi.denyInterfaces
Desc:
List of network interfaces that should be ignored by the
<span class="command"><strong>avahi-daemon

Name: services.avahi.domainName
Desc: Domain name for all advertisements.

Name: services.avahi.extraConfig
Desc: Extra config to append to avahi-daemon.conf.

Name: services.avahi.extraServiceFiles
Desc:
Specify custom service definitions which are placed in the avahi service directory.
See the <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">avahi.service

Name: services.avahi.hostName
Desc:
Host name advertised on the LAN. If not set, avahi will use the value
of <code class="option">config.networking.hostName

Name: services.avahi.ipv4
Desc: Whether to use IPv4.

Name: services.avahi.ipv6
Desc: Whether to use IPv6.

Name: services.avahi.nssmdns4
Desc:
Whether to enable the mDNS NSS (Name Service Switch) plug-in for IPv4.
Enabling it allows applications to resolve names in the <code class="literal">.local

Name: services.avahi.nssmdns6
Desc:
Whether to enable the mDNS NSS (Name Service Switch) plug-in for IPv6.
Enabling it allows applications to resolve names in the <code class="literal">.local

Name: services.avahi.openFirewall
Desc:
Whether to open the firewall for UDP port 5353.
Disabling this setting also disables discovering of network devices.

Name: services.avahi.publish.enable
Desc: Whether to allow publishing in general.

Name: services.avahi.publish.addresses
Desc: Whether to register mDNS address records for all local IP addresses.

Name: services.avahi.publish.domain
Desc: Whether to announce the locally used domain name for browsing by other hosts.

Name: services.avahi.publish.hinfo
Desc:
Whether to register a mDNS HINFO record which contains information about the
local operating system and CPU.

Name: services.avahi.publish.userServices
Desc: Whether to publish user services. Will set <code class="literal">addresses=true

Name: services.avahi.publish.workstation
Desc: Whether to register a service of type “_workstation._tcp” on the local LAN.

Name: services.avahi.reflector
Desc: Reflect incoming mDNS requests to all allowed network interfaces.

Name: services.avahi.wideArea
Desc: Whether to enable wide-area service discovery.

Name: services.awstats.enable
Desc: Whether to enable awstats, a real-time logfile analyzer.

Name: services.awstats.configs
Desc: Attribute set of domains to collect stats for.

Name: services.awstats.configs._name_.domain
Desc: The domain name to collect stats for.

Name: services.awstats.configs._name_.extraConfig
Desc: Extra configuration to be appended to awstats.${name}.conf.

Name: services.awstats.configs._name_.hostAliases
Desc: List of aliases the site has.

Name: services.awstats.configs._name_.logFile
Desc: The log file to be scanned.

Name: services.awstats.configs._name_.logFormat
Desc: The log format being used.

Name: services.awstats.configs._name_.type
Desc: The type of log being collected.

Name: services.awstats.configs._name_.webService.enable
Desc: Whether to enable awstats web service.

Name: services.awstats.configs._name_.webService.hostname
Desc: The hostname the web service appears under.

Name: services.awstats.configs._name_.webService.urlPrefix
Desc: The URL prefix under which the awstats pages appear.

Name: services.awstats.dataDir
Desc: The directory where awstats data will be stored.

Name: services.awstats.updateAt
Desc:
Specification of the time at which awstats will get updated.
(in the format described by <a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.time.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">systemd.time

Name: services.ayatana-indicators.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable Ayatana Indicators, a continuation of Canonical’s Application Indicators
.

Name: services.ayatana-indicators.packages
Desc:
List of packages containing Ayatana Indicator services
that should be brought up by a SystemD “ayatana-indicators” user target.

Name: services.babeld.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the babeld network routing daemon.

Name: services.babeld.extraConfig
Desc:
Options that will be copied to babeld.conf.
See <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">babeld

Name: services.babeld.interfaceDefaults
Desc:
A set describing default parameters for babeld interfaces.
See <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">babeld
Type: null or (attribute set of unspecified value)

Name: services.babeld.interfaces
Desc:
A set describing babeld interfaces.
See <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">babeld
Type: attribute set of attribute set of unspecified value

Name: services.bacula-dir.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Bacula Director Daemon.

Name: services.bacula-dir.extraConfig
Desc: Extra configuration for Bacula Director Daemon.

Name: services.bacula-dir.extraDirectorConfig
Desc: Extra configuration to be passed in Director directive.

Name: services.bacula-dir.extraMessagesConfig
Desc: Extra configuration to be passed in Messages directive.

Name: services.bacula-dir.name
Desc:
The director name used by the system administrator. This directive is
required.

Name: services.bacula-dir.password
Desc: Specifies the password that must be supplied for a Director.

Name: services.bacula-dir.port
Desc:
Specify the port (a positive integer) on which the Director daemon
will listen for Bacula Console connections. This same port number
must be specified in the Director resource of the Console
configuration file. The default is 9101, so normally this directive
need not be specified. This directive should not be used if you
specify DirAddresses (N.B plural) directive.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.bacula-dir.tls
Desc:
TLS Options for the Director.
Important notice: The backup won’t be encrypted.

Name: services.bacula-dir.tls.enable
Desc:
Specifies if TLS should be enabled.
If this set to <code class="literal">false

Name: services.bacula-dir.tls.allowedCN
Desc:
Common name attribute of allowed peer certificates.
This directive is valid for a server and in a client context.
If this directive is specified, the peer certificate will be verified against this list.
In the case this directive is configured on a server side, the allowed
CN list will not be checked if <a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.bacula-dir.tls.verifyPeer'>services.bacula-dir.tls.verifyPeer

Name: services.bacula-dir.tls.caCertificateFile
Desc:
The path specifying a PEM encoded TLS CA certificate(s).
Multiple certificates are permitted in the file.
One of TLS CA Certificate File or TLS CA Certificate Dir are required in a server context, unless
<a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.bacula-dir.tls.verifyPeer'>services.bacula-dir.tls.verifyPeer

Name: services.bacula-dir.tls.certificate
Desc:
The full path to the PEM encoded TLS certificate.
It will be used as either a client or server certificate,
depending on the connection direction.
This directive is required in a server context, but it may
not be specified in a client context if <a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.bacula-dir.tls.verifyPeer'>services.bacula-dir.tls.verifyPeer

Name: services.bacula-dir.tls.key
Desc:
The path of a PEM encoded TLS private key.
It must correspond to the TLS certificate.

Name: services.bacula-dir.tls.require
Desc:
Require TLS or TLS-PSK encryption.
This directive is ignored unless one of <a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.bacula-dir.tls.enable'>services.bacula-dir.tls.enable

Name: services.bacula-dir.tls.verifyPeer
Desc:
Verify peer certificate.
Instructs server to request and verify the client’s X.509 certificate.
Any client certificate signed by a known-CA will be accepted.
Additionally, the client’s X509 certificate Common Name must meet the value of the Address directive.
If <a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.bacula-dir.tls.allowedCN'>services.bacula-dir.tls.allowedCN

Name: services.bacula-fd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Bacula File Daemon.

Name: services.bacula-fd.director
Desc: This option defines director resources in Bacula File Daemon.

Name: services.bacula-fd.director._name_.monitor
Desc: If Monitor is set to <code class="literal">no

Name: services.bacula-fd.director._name_.password
Desc:
Specifies the password that must be supplied for the default Bacula
Console to be authorized. The same password must appear in the
Director resource of the Console configuration file. For added
security, the password is never passed across the network but instead
a challenge response hash code created with the password. This
directive is required. If you have either /dev/random or bc on your
machine, Bacula will generate a random password during the
configuration process, otherwise it will be left blank and you must
manually supply it.

Name: services.bacula-fd.director._name_.tls
Desc: TLS Options for the Director in this Configuration.

Name: services.bacula-fd.director._name_.tls.enable
Desc:

If this set to <code class="literal">false

depending on the connection direction.
This directive is required in a server context, but it may

Name: services.bacula-fd.extraClientConfig
Desc: Extra configuration to be passed in Client directive.

Name: services.bacula-fd.extraMessagesConfig
Desc: Extra configuration to be passed in Messages directive.

Name: services.bacula-fd.name
Desc:
The client name that must be used by the Director when connecting.
Generally, it is a good idea to use a name related to the machine so
that error messages can be easily identified if you have multiple
Clients. This directive is required.

Name: services.bacula-fd.port
Desc:
This specifies the port number on which the Client listens for
Director connections. It must agree with the FDPort specified in
the Client resource of the Director’s configuration file.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.bacula-fd.tls
Desc:
TLS Options for the File Daemon.

Name: services.bacula-sd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Bacula Storage Daemon.

Name: services.bacula-sd.autochanger
Desc: This option defines Autochanger resources in Bacula Storage Daemon.

Name: services.bacula-sd.autochanger._name_.changerCommand
Desc:
The name-string specifies an external program to be called that will
automatically change volumes as required by Bacula. Normally, this
directive will be specified only in the AutoChanger resource, which
is then used for all devices. However, you may also specify the
different Changer Command in each Device resource. Most frequently,
you will specify the Bacula supplied mtx-changer script as follows:

Name: services.bacula-sd.autochanger._name_.changerDevice
Desc:
The specified name-string must be the generic SCSI device name of the
autochanger that corresponds to the normal read/write Archive Device
specified in the Device resource. This generic SCSI device name
should be specified if you have an autochanger or if you have a
standard tape drive and want to use the Alert Command (see below).
For example, on Linux systems, for an Archive Device name of
<code class="literal">/dev/nst0

Name: services.bacula-sd.autochanger._name_.devices
Desc: <span class="emphasis"><em>Type:

Name: services.bacula-sd.autochanger._name_.extraAutochangerConfig
Desc: Extra configuration to be passed in Autochanger directive.

Name: services.bacula-sd.device
Desc: This option defines Device resources in Bacula Storage Daemon.

Name: services.bacula-sd.device._name_.archiveDevice
Desc:
The specified name-string gives the system file name of the storage
device managed by this storage daemon. This will usually be the
device file name of a removable storage device (tape drive), for
example <code class="literal">/dev/nst0

Name: services.bacula-sd.device._name_.extraDeviceConfig
Desc: Extra configuration to be passed in Device directive.

Name: services.bacula-sd.device._name_.mediaType
Desc:
The specified name-string names the type of media supported by this
device, for example, <code class="literal">DLT7000

Name: services.bacula-sd.director
Desc: This option defines Director resources in Bacula Storage Daemon.

Name: services.bacula-sd.director._name_.monitor

Name: services.bamf.enable
Desc: Whether to enable bamf.

Name: services.bazarr.enable
Desc: Whether to enable bazarr, a subtitle manager for Sonarr and Radarr.

Name: services.bazarr.package
Desc: The bazarr package to use.

Name: services.bazarr.group
Desc: Group under which bazarr runs.

Name: services.bazarr.listenPort
Desc: Port on which the bazarr web interface should listen
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.bazarr.openFirewall
Desc: Open ports in the firewall for the bazarr web interface.

Name: services.bazarr.user
Desc: User account under which bazarr runs.

Name: services.bcg.enable
Desc: Whether to enable BigClown gateway.

Name: services.bcg.package
Desc: The bcg package to use.

Name: services.bcg.automaticRemoveKitFromNames
Desc: Automatically remove kits.

Name: services.bcg.automaticRenameGenericNodes
Desc: Automatically rename generic nodes.

Name: services.bcg.automaticRenameKitNodes
Desc: Automatically rename kit’s nodes.

Name: services.bcg.automaticRenameNodes
Desc: Automatically rename all nodes.

Name: services.bcg.baseTopicPrefix
Desc: Topic prefix added to all MQTT messages.

Name: services.bcg.device
Desc: Device name to configure gateway to use.

Name: services.bcg.environmentFiles
Desc:
File to load as environment file. Environment variables from this file
will be interpolated into the config file using envsubst with this
syntax: <code class="literal">$ENVIRONMENT

Name: services.bcg.mqtt.cafile
Desc: Certificate Authority file for MQTT server access.

Name: services.bcg.mqtt.certfile
Desc: Certificate file for MQTT server access.

Name: services.bcg.mqtt.host
Desc: Host where MQTT server is running.

Name: services.bcg.mqtt.keyfile
Desc: Key file for MQTT server access.

Name: services.bcg.mqtt.password
Desc: MQTT server access password.

Name: services.bcg.mqtt.port
Desc: Port of MQTT server.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.bcg.mqtt.username
Desc: MQTT server access username.

Name: services.bcg.name
Desc: Name for the device.

Name: services.bcg.qosNodeMessages
Desc: Set the guarantee of MQTT message delivery.

Name: services.bcg.rename
Desc: Rename nodes to different name.

Name: services.bcg.retainNodeMessages
Desc: Specify that node messages should be retaied in MQTT broker.

Name: services.bcg.verbose
Desc: Verbosity level.

Name: services.beanstalkd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Beanstalk work queue.

Name: services.beanstalkd.listen.address
Desc: IP address to listen on.

Name: services.beanstalkd.listen.port
Desc: TCP port that will be used to accept client connections.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.beanstalkd.openFirewall
Desc: Whether to open ports in the firewall for the server.

Name: services.bee.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Ethereum Swarm Bee.

Name: services.bee.package
Desc: The bee package to use.

Name: services.bee.daemonNiceLevel
Desc:
Daemon process priority for bee.
0 is the default Unix process priority, 19 is the lowest.

Name: services.bee.group
Desc: Group the bee binary should execute under.

Name: services.bee.settings
Desc:
Ethereum Swarm Bee configuration. Refer to
<a class="link" href="https://gateway.ethswarm.org/bzz/docs.swarm.eth/docs/installation/configuration/"  target="_top">https://gateway.ethswarm.org/bzz/docs.swarm.eth/docs/installation/configuration/

Name: services.bee.user
Desc: User the bee binary should execute under.

Name: services.beesd.filesystems
Desc: BTRFS filesystems to run block-level deduplication on.

Name: services.beesd.filesystems._name_.extraOptions
Desc: Extra command-line options passed to the daemon. See upstream bees documentation.

Name: services.beesd.filesystems._name_.hashTableSizeMB
Desc: Hash table size in MB; must be a multiple of 16.

Name: services.beesd.filesystems._name_.spec
Desc:
Description of how to identify the filesystem to be duplicated by this
instance of bees. Note that deduplication crosses subvolumes; one must
not configure multiple instances for subvolumes of the same filesystem
(or block devices which are part of the same filesystem), but only for
completely independent btrfs filesystems.

Desc: Whether to enable the Biboumi XMPP gateway to IRC.

Desc:
Path to a configuration file to be merged with the settings.
Beware not to surround “=” with spaces when setting biboumi’s options in this file.
Useful to merge a file which is better kept out of the Nix store
because it contains sensible data like
<a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.biboumi.settings.password'>password

Desc: Whether to enable opening of the identd port in the firewall.

Name: services.biboumi.settings.admin
Desc:
The bare JID of the gateway administrator. This JID will have more
privileges than other standard users, for example some administration
ad-hoc commands will only be available to that JID.

Name: services.biboumi.settings.ca_file
Desc:
Specifies which file should be used as the list of trusted CA
when negotiating a TLS session.

Name: services.biboumi.settings.db_name
Desc: The name of the database to use.

Name: services.biboumi.settings.hostname
Desc:
The hostname served by the XMPP gateway.
This domain must be configured in the XMPP server
as an external component.

Name: services.biboumi.settings.identd_port
Desc: The TCP port on which to listen for identd queries.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.biboumi.settings.log_level
Desc:
Indicate what type of log messages to write in the logs.
0 is debug, 1 is info, 2 is warning, 3 is error.

Name: services.biboumi.settings.password
Desc:
The password used to authenticate the XMPP component to your XMPP server.
This password must be configured in the XMPP server,
associated with the external component on
<a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.biboumi.settings.hostname'>hostname

Name: services.biboumi.settings.persistent_by_default
Desc:
Whether all rooms will be persistent by default:
the value of the “persistent” option in the global configuration of each
user will be “true”, but the value of each individual room will still
default to false. This means that a user just needs to change the global
“persistent” configuration option to false in order to override this.

Name: services.biboumi.settings.policy_directory
Desc:
A directory that should contain the policy files,
used to customize Botan’s behaviour
when negotiating the TLS connections with the IRC servers.

Name: services.biboumi.settings.port
Desc: The TCP port to use to connect to the local XMPP component.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.biboumi.settings.realname_customization
Desc:
Whether the users will be able to use
the ad-hoc commands that lets them configure
their realname and username.

Name: services.biboumi.settings.realname_from_jid
Desc:
Whether the realname and username of each biboumi
user will be extracted from their JID.
Otherwise they will be set to the nick
they used to connect to the IRC server.

Name: services.biboumi.settings.xmpp_server_ip
Desc:
The IP address to connect to the XMPP server on.
The connection to the XMPP server is unencrypted,
so the biboumi instance and the server should
normally be on the same host.

Name: services.bitcoind._name_.prune
Desc:
Reduce storage requirements by enabling pruning (deleting) of old
blocks. This allows the pruneblockchain RPC to be called to delete
specific blocks, and enables automatic pruning of old blocks if a
target size in MiB is provided. This mode is incompatible with -txindex
and -rescan. Warning: Reverting this setting requires re-downloading
the entire blockchain. (“disable” = disable pruning blocks, “manual”
= allow manual pruning via RPC, >=550 = automatically prune block files
to stay under the specified target size in MiB).
Type: null or ((unsigned integer, meaning >=0) or (one of “disable”, “manual”) convertible to it)

The following authentication modes are available:
Open – Accept connections from anyone, use NickServ for user authentication.
Closed – Require authorization (using the PASS command during login) before allowing the user to connect at all.
Registered – Only allow registered users to use this server; this disables the register- and the account command until the user identifies himself.

<a class="link" href="https://0xerr0r.github.io/blocky/configuration/"  target="_top">https://0xerr0r.github.io/blocky/configuration/

Name: services.bloop.extraOptions
Desc:
Specifies additional command line argument to pass to bloop
java process.

Name: services.bloop.install
Desc: Whether to install a user service for the Bloop server.

Name: services.blueman.enable
Desc: Whether to enable blueman, a bluetooth manager.

Name: services.bluemap.enable
Desc: Whether to enable bluemap.

Name: services.bluemap.enableNginx
Desc: Enable configuring a virtualHost for serving the bluemap webapp

Name: services.bluemap.enableRender
Desc: Enable rendering

Name: services.bluemap.addons
Desc: A set of jar addons to be loaded.
Type: attribute set of path in the Nix store

Name: services.bluemap.coreSettings
Desc: Settings for the core.conf file, <a class="link" href="https://github.com/BlueMap-Minecraft/BlueMap/blob/master/BlueMapCommon/src/main/resources/de/bluecolored/bluemap/config/core.conf"  target="_top">see upstream docs

Name: services.bluemap.coreSettings.data
Desc: Folder for where bluemap stores its data

Name: services.bluemap.coreSettings.metrics
Desc: Whether to enable Sending usage metrics containing the version of bluemap in use.

Name: services.bluemap.defaultWorld
Desc:
The world used by the default map ruleset.
If you configure your own maps you do not need to set this.

Name: services.bluemap.eula
Desc:
By changing this option to true you confirm that you own a copy of minecraft Java Edition,
and that you agree to minecrafts EULA.

Name: services.bluemap.host
Desc: Domain on which nginx will serve the bluemap webapp

Name: services.bluemap.maps
Desc: Settings for files in <code class="literal">maps/

Name: services.bluemap.maps._name_.world
Desc: Path to world folder containing the dimension to render

Name: services.bluemap.onCalendar
Desc:
How often to trigger rendering the map,
in the format of a systemd timer onCalendar configuration.
See <a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.timer.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">systemd.timer

Name: services.bluemap.packs
Desc:
A set of resourcepacks, datapacks, and mods to extract resources from,
loaded in alphabetical order.
Type: attribute set of path in the Nix store

Name: services.bluemap.storage
Desc:
Where the rendered map will be stored.
Unless you are doing something advanced you should probably leave this alone and configure webRoot instead.
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/BlueMap-Minecraft/BlueMap/tree/master/BlueMapCommon/src/main/resources/de/bluecolored/bluemap/config/storages"  target="_top">See upstream docs

Name: services.bluemap.storage._name_.storage-type
Desc: Type of storage config

Name: services.bluemap.webRoot
Desc: The directory for saving and serving the webapp and the maps

Name: services.bluemap.webappSettings
Desc: Settings for the webapp.conf file, see <a class="link" href="https://github.com/BlueMap-Minecraft/BlueMap/blob/master/BlueMapCommon/src/main/resources/de/bluecolored/bluemap/config/webapp.conf"  target="_top">upstream docs

Name: services.bluemap.webserverSettings
Desc:
Settings for the webserver.conf file, usually not required.
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/BlueMap-Minecraft/BlueMap/blob/master/BlueMapCommon/src/main/resources/de/bluecolored/bluemap/config/webserver.conf"  target="_top">See upstream docs

Name: services.bluemap.webserverSettings.enabled
Desc:
Enable bluemap’s built-in webserver.
Disabled by default in nixos for use of nginx directly.

Name: services.boinc.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable the BOINC distributed computing client. If this
option is set to true, the boinc_client daemon will be run as a
background service. The boinccmd command can be used to control the
daemon.

Name: services.boinc.package
Desc: The boinc package to use.

Name: services.boinc.allowRemoteGuiRpc
Desc:
If set to true, any remote host can connect to and control this BOINC
client (subject to password authentication). If instead set to false,
only the hosts listed in <code class="varname">dataDir

Name: services.boinc.dataDir
Desc: The directory in which to store BOINC’s configuration and data files.

Name: services.boinc.extraEnvPackages
Desc:
Additional packages to make available in the environment in which
BOINC will run. Common choices are:

Name: services.bookstack.enable
Desc: Whether to enable BookStack.

Name: services.bookstack.appKeyFile
Desc:
A file containing the Laravel APP_KEY - a 32 character long,
base64 encoded key used for encryption where needed. Can be
generated with <code class="literal">head -c 32 /dev/urandom | base64

Name: services.bookstack.appURL
Desc:
The root URL that you want to host BookStack on. All URLs in BookStack will be generated using this value.
If you change this in the future you may need to run a command to update stored URLs in the database. Command example: <code class="literal">php artisan bookstack:update-url https://old.example.com https://new.example.com

Name: services.bookstack.config
Desc:
BookStack configuration options to set in the
<code class="filename">.env
Type: attribute set of (null or boolean or signed integer or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive) or path or string or (submodule))

Name: services.bookstack.dataDir
Desc: BookStack data directory

Name: services.bookstack.database.createLocally
Desc: Create the database and database user locally.

Name: services.bookstack.database.host
Desc: Database host address.

Name: services.bookstack.database.name
Desc: Database name.

Name: services.bookstack.database.passwordFile
Desc:
A file containing the password corresponding to
<code class="option">database.user

Name: services.bookstack.database.port
Desc: Database host port.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.bookstack.database.user
Desc: Database username.

Name: services.bookstack.group
Desc: Group bookstack runs as.

Name: services.bookstack.hostname
Desc: The hostname to serve BookStack on.

Name: services.bookstack.mail.driver
Desc: Mail driver to use.

Name: services.bookstack.mail.encryption
Desc: SMTP encryption mechanism to use.

Name: services.bookstack.mail.from
Desc: Mail “from” email.

Name: services.bookstack.mail.fromName
Desc: Mail “from” name.

Name: services.bookstack.mail.host
Desc: Mail host address.

Name: services.bookstack.mail.passwordFile
Desc:
A file containing the password corresponding to
<code class="option">mail.user

Name: services.bookstack.mail.port
Desc: Mail host port.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.bookstack.mail.user
Desc: Mail username.

Name: services.bookstack.maxUploadSize
Desc: The maximum size for uploads (e.g. images).

Name: services.bookstack.nginx
Desc: With this option, you can customize the nginx virtualHost settings.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.acmeFallbackHost
Desc:
Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful
if you want multiple hosts to be able to verify the same domain name.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.acmeRoot
Desc: Directory for the ACME challenge, which is <span class="strong"><strong>public

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,
configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.listen._.addr
Desc: Listen address.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.listen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.listen._.port
Desc:
Port number to listen on.
If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.listen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.listen._.ssl
Desc: Enable SSL.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.locations
Desc: Declarative location config

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.locations._name_.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.locations._name_.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.locations._name_.fastcgiParams
Desc:
FastCGI parameters to override.  Unlike in the Nginx
configuration file, overriding only some default parameters
won’t unset the default values for other parameters.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds index directive.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc:
Adds proxy_pass directive and sets recommended proxy headers if
recommendedProxySettings is enabled.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.locations._name_.proxyWebsockets
Desc: Whether to support proxying websocket connections with HTTP/1.1.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.locations._name_.recommendedProxySettings
Desc: Enable recommended proxy settings.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.locations._name_.return
Desc: Adds a return directive, for e.g. redirections.
Type: null or string or signed integer

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.locations._name_.root
Desc: Root directory for requests.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.locations._name_.tryFiles
Desc: Adds try_files directive.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.onlySSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.quic
Desc:
Whether to enable the QUIC transport protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.redirectCode
Desc: HTTP status used by <code class="literal">globalRedirect

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.rejectSSL
Desc:
Whether to listen for and reject all HTTPS connections to this vhost. Useful in
<a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.default'>default

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.reuseport
Desc:
Create an individual listening socket .
It is required to specify only once on one of the hosts.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.root
Desc: The path of the web root directory.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.serverAliases
Desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.serverName
Desc: Name of this virtual host. Defaults to attribute name in virtualHosts.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.sslCertificate
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.sslCertificateKey
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate key.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.sslTrustedCertificate
Desc: Path to root SSL certificate for stapling and client certificates.

Name: services.bookstack.nginx.useACMEHost
Desc:
A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

Name: services.bookstack.poolConfig
Desc: Options for the bookstack PHP pool. See the documentation on <code class="literal">php-fpm.conf
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

Name: services.bookstack.user
Desc: User bookstack runs as.

Name: services.borgbackup.package
Desc: The borgbackup package to use.

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs
Desc:
Deduplicating backups using BorgBackup.
Adding a job will cause a borg-job-NAME wrapper to be added
to your system path, so that you can perform maintenance easily.
See also the chapter about BorgBackup in the NixOS manual.

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.appendFailedSuffix
Desc: Append a <code class="literal">.failed

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.archiveBaseName
Desc:
How to name the created archives. A timestamp, whose format is
determined by <code class="option">dateFormat
Type: null or string matching the pattern [^/{}]+

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.compression
Desc:
Compression method to use. Refer to
<span class="command"><strong>borg help compression

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.dateFormat
Desc: Arguments passed to <span class="command"><strong>date

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.doInit
Desc: Run <span class="command"><strong>borg init

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.dumpCommand
Desc:
Backup the stdout of this program instead of filesystem paths.
Mutually exclusive with <code class="option">paths

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.encryption.mode
Desc:
Encryption mode to use. Setting a mode
other than <code class="literal">"none"

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.encryption.passCommand
Desc:
A command which prints the passphrase to stdout.
Mutually exclusive with <code class="option">passphrase

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.encryption.passphrase
Desc:
The passphrase the backups are encrypted with.
Mutually exclusive with <code class="option">passCommand

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.environment
Desc:
Environment variables passed to the backup script.
You can for example specify which SSH key to use.

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.exclude
Desc:
Exclude paths matching any of the given patterns. See
<span class="command"><strong>borg help patterns

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.extraArgs
Desc: Additional arguments for all <span class="command"><strong>borg
Type: string or (list of string) convertible to it

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.extraCompactArgs
Desc: Additional arguments for <span class="command"><strong>borg compact
Type: string or (list of string) convertible to it

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.extraCreateArgs
Desc: Additional arguments for <span class="command"><strong>borg create
Type: string or (list of string) convertible to it

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.extraInitArgs
Desc: Additional arguments for <span class="command"><strong>borg init
Type: string or (list of string) convertible to it

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.extraPruneArgs
Desc: Additional arguments for <span class="command"><strong>borg prune
Type: string or (list of string) convertible to it

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.failOnWarnings
Desc:
Fail the whole backup job if any borg command returns a warning
(exit code 1), for example because a file changed during backup.

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.group
Desc:
The group borg is run as. User or group needs read permission
for the specified <code class="option">paths

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.inhibitsSleep
Desc: Prevents the system from sleeping while backing up.

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.paths
Desc:
Path(s) to back up.
Mutually exclusive with <code class="option">dumpCommand
Type: null or ((list of string) or string convertible to it)

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.patterns
Desc:
Include/exclude paths matching the given patterns. The first
matching patterns is used, so if an include pattern (prefix <code class="literal">+

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.persistentTimer
Desc: Set the <code class="literal">Persistent

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.postCreate
Desc: Shell commands to run after <span class="command"><strong>borg create

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.postHook
Desc:
Shell commands to run just before exit. They are executed
even if a previous command exits with a non-zero exit code.
The latter is available as <code class="literal">$exitStatus

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.postInit
Desc: Shell commands to run after <span class="command"><strong>borg init

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.postPrune
Desc: Shell commands to run after <span class="command"><strong>borg prune

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.preHook
Desc:
Shell commands to run before the backup.
This can for example be used to mount file systems.

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.privateTmp
Desc: Set the <code class="literal">PrivateTmp

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.prune.keep
Desc:
Prune a repository by deleting all archives not matching any of the
specified retention options. See <span class="command"><strong>borg help prune
Type: attribute set of (signed integer or string matching the pattern [[:digit:]]+[Hdwmy])

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.prune.prefix
services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.readWritePaths
Desc:
By default, borg cannot write anywhere on the system but
<code class="literal">$HOME/.config/borg

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.removableDevice
Desc: Whether the repo (which must be local) is a removable device.

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.repo
Desc: Remote or local repository to back up to.

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.startAt
Desc:
When or how often the backup should run.
Must be in the format described in
<a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.time.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">systemd.time

Name: services.borgbackup.jobs._name_.user
Desc: The user <span class="command"><strong>borg

Name: services.borgbackup.repos
Desc:
Serve BorgBackup repositories to given public SSH keys,
restricting their access to the repository only.
See also the chapter about BorgBackup in the NixOS manual.
Also, clients do not need to specify the absolute path when accessing the repository,
i.e. <code class="literal">user@machine:.

Name: services.borgbackup.repos._name_.allowSubRepos
Desc:
Allow clients to create repositories in subdirectories of the
specified <code class="option">path

Name: services.borgbackup.repos._name_.authorizedKeys
Desc:
Public SSH keys that are given full write access to this repository.
You should use a different SSH key for each repository you write to, because
the specified keys are restricted to running <span class="command"><strong>borg serve

Name: services.borgbackup.repos._name_.authorizedKeysAppendOnly
Desc:
Public SSH keys that can only be used to append new data (archives) to the repository.
Note that archives can still be marked as deleted and are subsequently removed from disk
upon accessing the repo with full write access, e.g. when pruning.

Name: services.borgbackup.repos._name_.group
Desc: The group <span class="command"><strong>borg serve

Name: services.borgbackup.repos._name_.path
Desc:
Where to store the backups. Note that the directory
is created automatically, with correct permissions.

Name: services.borgbackup.repos._name_.quota
Desc:
Storage quota for the repository. This quota is ensured for all
sub-repositories if <code class="option">allowSubRepos
Type: null or string matching the pattern [[:digit:].]+[KMGTP]?

Name: services.borgbackup.repos._name_.user
Desc: The user <span class="command"><strong>borg serve

Name: services.borgmatic.enable
Desc: Whether to enable borgmatic.

Name: services.borgmatic.enableConfigCheck
Desc: Whether to enable checking all configurations during build time.

Name: services.borgmatic.configurations
Desc: Set of borgmatic configurations, see https://torsion.org/borgmatic/docs/reference/configuration/

Name: services.borgmatic.configurations._name_.repositories
Desc:
A required list of local or remote repositories with paths and
optional labels (which can be used with the --repository flag to
select a repository). Tildes are expanded. Multiple repositories are
backed up to in sequence. Borg placeholders can be used. See the
output of “borg help placeholders” for details. See ssh_command for
SSH options like identity file or port. If systemd service is used,
then add local repository paths in the systemd service file to the
ReadWritePaths list.

Name: services.borgmatic.configurations._name_.repositories._.label
Desc: Label to the repository

Name: services.borgmatic.configurations._name_.repositories._.path
Desc: Path to the repository

Name: services.borgmatic.configurations._name_.source_directories
Desc:
List of source directories and files to backup. Globs and tildes are
expanded. Do not backslash spaces in path names.

Name: services.borgmatic.settings
Desc: See https://torsion.org/borgmatic/docs/reference/configuration/

Name: services.borgmatic.settings.repositories
Desc:
A required list of local or remote repositories with paths and
optional labels (which can be used with the --repository flag to
select a repository). Tildes are expanded. Multiple repositories are
backed up to in sequence. Borg placeholders can be used. See the
output of “borg help placeholders” for details. See ssh_command for
SSH options like identity file or port. If systemd service is used,
then add local repository paths in the systemd service file to the
ReadWritePaths list.

Name: services.borgmatic.settings.repositories._.label
Desc: Label to the repository

Name: services.borgmatic.settings.repositories._.path
Desc: Path to the repository

Name: services.borgmatic.settings.source_directories
Desc:
List of source directories and files to backup. Globs and tildes are
expanded. Do not backslash spaces in path names.

Name: services.bosun.enable
Desc: Whether to enable bosun.

Name: services.bosun.package
Desc: The bosun package to use.

Name: services.bosun.checkFrequency
Desc: Bosun’s check frequency

Name: services.bosun.extraConfig
Desc:
Extra configuration options for Bosun. You should describe your
desired templates, alerts, macros, etc through this configuration
option.

Name: services.bosun.group
Desc: Group account under which bosun runs.

Name: services.bosun.influxHost
Desc: Host and port of the influxdb database.

Name: services.bosun.ledisDir
Desc: Path to bosun’s ledis data dir

Name: services.bosun.listenAddress
Desc: The host address and port that bosun’s web interface will listen on.

Name: services.bosun.opentsdbHost
Desc:
Host and port of the OpenTSDB database that stores bosun data.
To disable opentsdb you can pass null as parameter.

Name: services.bosun.stateFile
Desc: Path to bosun’s state file.

Name: services.bosun.user
Desc: User account under which bosun runs.

Name: services.botamusique.enable
Desc: Whether to enable botamusique, a bot to play audio streams on mumble.

Name: services.botamusique.package
Desc: The botamusique package to use.

Name: services.botamusique.settings
Desc: Your <code class="filename">configuration.ini
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: services.botamusique.settings.bot.comment
Desc: Comment displayed for the bot.
Default: "Hi, I'm here to play radio, local music or youtube/soundcloud music. Have fun!"

Name: services.botamusique.settings.bot.username
Desc: Name the bot should appear with.

Name: services.botamusique.settings.server.host
Desc: Hostname of the mumble server to connect to.

Name: services.botamusique.settings.server.port
Desc: Port of the mumble server to connect to.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.bpftune.enable
Desc: Whether to enable bpftune BPF driven auto-tuning.

Name: services.bpftune.package
Desc: The bpftune package to use.

Name: services.brltty.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the BRLTTY daemon.

Name: services.btrbk.extraPackages
Desc: Extra packages for btrbk, like compression utilities for <code class="literal">stream_compress

Name: services.btrbk.instances
Desc: Set of btrbk instances. The instance named <code class="literal">btrbk

Name: services.btrbk.instances._name_.onCalendar
Desc:
How often this btrbk instance is started. See systemd.time(7) for more information about the format.
Setting it to null disables the timer, thus this instance can only be started manually.

Name: services.btrbk.instances._name_.settings
Desc: configuration options for btrbk. Nested attrsets translate to subsections.
Type: attribute set of (string or instances of this type recursively)

Name: services.btrbk.instances._name_.settings.stream_compress
Desc:
Compress the btrfs send stream before transferring it from/to remote locations using a
compression command.

Name: services.btrbk.ioSchedulingClass
Desc: IO scheduling class for btrbk (see ionice(1) for a quick description). Applies to local instances, and remote ones connecting by ssh if set to idle.

Name: services.btrbk.niceness
Desc: Niceness for local instances of btrbk. Also applies to remote ones connecting via ssh when positive.

Name: services.btrbk.sshAccess
Desc: SSH keys that should be able to make or push snapshots on this system remotely with btrbk

Name: services.btrbk.sshAccess._.key
Desc: SSH public key allowed to login as user <code class="literal">btrbk

Name: services.btrbk.sshAccess._.roles
Desc: What actions can be performed with this SSH key. See ssh_filter_btrbk(1) for details

Name: services.btrfs.autoScrub.enable
Desc: Whether to enable regular btrfs scrub.

Name: services.btrfs.autoScrub.fileSystems
Desc: List of paths to btrfs filesystems to regularly call <span class="command"><strong>btrfs scrub

Name: services.btrfs.autoScrub.interval
Desc:
Systemd calendar expression for when to scrub btrfs filesystems.

your worker admins about your choice.

Desc: Extra configuration to add to the global section for manager daemons.

Desc: Whether to enable Ceph MON daemon.

Name: services.ceph.mon.package
Desc: The ceph package to use.

Name: services.ceph.mon.daemons
Desc:
A list of monitor daemons that should have a service created. The names correspond

Name: services.ceph.mon.extraConfig

Desc: Whether to enable Ceph OSD daemon.

Desc: The ceph package to use.

A list of OSD daemons that should have a service created. The names correspond

Desc: The ceph package to use.

Name: services.ceph.rgw.daemons
Desc:
A list of rados gateway daemons that should have a service created. The names correspond
to the id part in ceph i.e. [ “name1” ] would result in client.name1, radosgw daemons
aren’t daemons to cluster in the sense that OSD, MGR or MON daemons are. They are simply
daemons, from ceph, that uses the cluster as a backend.

Metadata file for root certificate presence.
The content of the file is a json dictionary (k,v): each key k is
a SHA-1 digest of a root certificate while value v is a list of key

Whether to enable Network Time Security authentication.

Enable tracking of the RTC offset to the system clock and automatic trimming.

Allow chronyd to make a rapid measurement of the system clock error

The threshold of system clock error (in seconds) above which the

Name: services.cjdns.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable the cjdns network encryption
and routing engine. A file at /etc/cjdns.keys will
be created if it does not exist to contain a random
secret key that your IPv6 address will be derived from.

Name: services.cjdns.ETHInterface.beacon
Desc:
Auto-connect to other cjdns nodes on the same network.
Options:
0: Disabled.
1: Accept beacons, this will cause cjdns to accept incoming
beacon messages and try connecting to the sender.
2: Accept and send beacons, this will cause cjdns to broadcast
messages on the local network which contain a randomly
generated per-session password, other nodes which have this
set to 1 or 2 will hear the beacon messages and connect
automatically.

Name: services.cjdns.ETHInterface.bind
Desc:
Bind to this device for native ethernet operation.
<code class="literal">all

Name: services.cjdns.ETHInterface.connectTo
Desc:
Credentials for connecting look similar to UDP credientials
except they begin with the mac address.

Name: services.cjdns.ETHInterface.connectTo._name_.hostname
Desc: Optional hostname to add to /etc/hosts; prevents reverse lookup failures.

Name: services.cjdns.ETHInterface.connectTo._name_.login
Desc: (optional) name your peer has for you

Name: services.cjdns.ETHInterface.connectTo._name_.password
Desc: Authorized password to the opposite end of the tunnel.

Name: services.cjdns.ETHInterface.connectTo._name_.peerName
Desc: (optional) human-readable name for peer

Name: services.cjdns.ETHInterface.connectTo._name_.publicKey
Desc: Public key at the opposite end of the tunnel.

Name: services.cjdns.UDPInterface.connectTo._name_.password
Desc: Authorized password to the opposite end of the tunnel.

Name: services.cjdns.UDPInterface.connectTo._name_.peerName
Desc: (optional) human-readable name for peer

Name: services.cjdns.UDPInterface.connectTo._name_.publicKey
Desc: Public key at the opposite end of the tunnel.

Desc:

the machine according to this metadata.

Specification (in the format described by systemd.time(7)) of the time

Whether to periodically update the DOK resource file. If enabled, a
systemd timer will run the update task as specified by the interval option.

Desc:
Specification (in the format described by systemd.time(7)) of the
time at which the DOK update will occur.

Whether to periodically update the list of LoTW users. If enabled, a
systemd timer will run the update task as specified by the interval

Desc:
Specification (in the format described by systemd.time(7)) of the
time at which the LoTW user update will occur.

Whether to periodically update the SOTA database. If enabled, a
systemd timer will run the update task as specified by the interval option.

Desc:
Specification (in the format described by systemd.time(7)) of the time
at which the SOTA update will occur.

Whether to periodically update the WWFF database. If enabled, a
systemd timer will run the update task as specified by the interval
option.

Name: services.cloudlog.update-wwff.interval
Desc:
Specification (in the format described by systemd.time(7)) of the time
at which the WWFF update will occur.

Whether to periodically upload logs to Clublog. If enabled, a systemd

Desc:
Specification (in the format described by systemd.time(7)) of the time
at which the Clublog upload will occur.

Name: services.cloudlog.upload-lotw.enable
Desc:
Whether to periodically upload logs to LoTW. If enabled, a systemd

Name: services.cloudlog.upload-lotw.interval
Desc:
Specification (in the format described by systemd.time(7)) of the

Whether to periodically upload logs to QRZ. If enabled, a systemd

Specification (in the format described by systemd.time(7)) of the

Name: services.cockroachdb.locality
Desc:
An ordered, comma-separated list of key-value pairs that describe the
topography of the machine. Topography might include country,
datacenter or rack designations. Data is automatically replicated to
maximize diversities of each tier. The order of tiers is used to
determine the priority of the diversity, so the more inclusive
localities like country should come before less inclusive localities
like datacenter.  The tiers and order must be the same on all nodes.
Including more tiers is better than including fewer. For example:

Alternative listening port for UDP and TCP listeners;
default (or zero) value means “listening port plus one”.
This is needed for RFC 5780 support
(STUN extension specs, NAT behavior discovery). The TURN Server
supports RFC 5780 only if it is started with more than one
listening IP address of the same family (IPv4 or IPv6).
RFC 5780 is supported only by UDP protocol, other protocols
are listening to that endpoint only for “symmetry”.

Name: services.coturn.alt-tls-listening-port
Desc: Alternative listening port for TLS and DTLS protocols.

Name: services.coturn.cert
Desc: Certificate file in PEM format.

Name: services.coturn.cli-ip
Desc: Local system IP address to be used for CLI server endpoint.

Name: services.coturn.cli-password
Desc:
CLI access password.
For the security reasons, it is recommended to use the encrypted
for of the password (see the -P command in the turnadmin utility).

Name: services.coturn.cli-port
Desc: CLI server port.

Name: services.coturn.dh-file
Desc: Use custom DH TLS key, stored in PEM format in the file.

Name: services.coturn.extraConfig
Desc: Additional configuration options

Name: services.coturn.listening-ips
Desc:
Listener IP addresses of relay server.
If no IP(s) specified in the config file or in the command line options,
then all IPv4 and IPv6 system IPs will be used for listening.

Name: services.coturn.listening-port
Desc:
TURN listener port for UDP and TCP.
Note: actually, TLS and DTLS sessions can connect to the
“plain” TCP and UDP port(s), too - if allowed by configuration.

Name: services.coturn.lt-cred-mech
Desc: Use long-term credential mechanism.

Name: services.coturn.max-port
Desc: Upper bound of UDP relay endpoints

Name: services.coturn.min-port
Desc: Lower bound of UDP relay endpoints

Name: services.coturn.no-auth
Desc:
This option is opposite to lt-cred-mech.
(TURN Server with no-auth option allows anonymous access).
If neither option is defined, and no users are defined,
then no-auth is default. If at least one user is defined,
in this file or in command line or in usersdb file, then
lt-cred-mech is default.

Name: services.coturn.no-cli
Desc: Turn OFF the CLI support.

Name: services.coturn.no-dtls
Desc: Disable DTLS client listener

Name: services.coturn.no-tcp
Desc: Disable TCP client listener

Name: services.coturn.no-tcp-relay
Desc: Disable TCP relay endpoints

Name: services.coturn.no-tls
Desc: Disable TLS client listener

Name: services.coturn.no-udp
Desc: Disable UDP client listener

Name: services.coturn.no-udp-relay
Desc: Disable UDP relay endpoints

Name: services.coturn.pkey
Desc: Private key file in PEM format.

Name: services.coturn.realm
Desc:
The default realm to be used for the users when no explicit
origin/realm relationship was found in the database, or if the TURN
server is not using any database (just the commands-line settings
and the userdb file). Must be used with long-term credentials
mechanism or with TURN REST API.

Name: services.coturn.relay-ips
Desc:
Relay address (the local IP address that will be used to relay the
packets to the peer).
Multiple relay addresses may be used.
The same IP(s) can be used as both listening IP(s) and relay IP(s).

Name: services.coturn.secure-stun
Desc:
Require authentication of the STUN Binding request.
By default, the clients are allowed anonymous access to the STUN Binding functionality.

Name: services.coturn.static-auth-secret
Desc:
‘Static’ authentication secret value (a string) for TURN REST API only.
If not set, then the turn server
will try to use the ‘dynamic’ value in turn_secret table
in user database (if present). The database-stored  value can be changed on-the-fly
by a separate program, so this is why that other mode is ‘dynamic’.

Name: services.coturn.static-auth-secret-file
Desc: Path to the file containing the static authentication secret.

Name: services.coturn.tls-listening-port
Desc:
TURN listener port for TLS.
Note: actually, “plain” TCP and UDP sessions can connect to the TLS and
DTLS port(s), too - if allowed by configuration. The TURN server
“automatically” recognizes the type of traffic. Actually, two listening
endpoints (the “plain” one and the “tls” one) are equivalent in terms of
functionality; but we keep both endpoints to satisfy the RFC 5766 specs.
For secure TCP connections, we currently support SSL version 3 and
TLS version 1.0, 1.1 and 1.2.
For secure UDP connections, we support DTLS version 1.

Name: services.coturn.use-auth-secret
Desc:
TURN REST API flag.
Flag that sets a special authorization option that is based upon authentication secret.
This feature can be used with the long-term authentication mechanism, only.
This feature purpose is to support “TURN Server REST API”, see
“TURN REST API” link in the project’s page
https://github.com/coturn/coturn/

Name: services.couchdb.enable

Name: services.couchdb.package

Name: services.couchdb.adminUser

Couchdb (i.e. fauxton) account with permission for all dbs and

Name: services.couchdb.port
Desc: Defined the port number to listen.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.couchdb.uriFile
Desc:
This file contains the full URI that can be used to access this
instance of CouchDB. It is used to help discover the port CouchDB is
running on (if it was set to 0 (e.g. automatically assigned any free

Name: services.couchdb.user
Desc: User account under which couchdb runs.

Name: services.couchdb.viewIndexDir
Desc:
Specifies location of CouchDB view index files. This location should
be writable and readable for the user that runs the CouchDB service
(couchdb by default).

A list of Cron jobs to be appended to the system-wide

The crossfire-server package to use. ::: {.note}
This will also be used for map/arch data, if you don’t change <code class="option">dataDir

Text to append to the corresponding configuration files. Note that the

Where to load readonly data from – maps, archetypes, treasure tables,

Disable telemetry. This setting is only effective if the ‘Disable server telemetry’

Name: services.cyrus-imap.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Cyrus IMAP, an email, contacts and calendar server.

Name: services.cyrus-imap.cyrusSettings
Desc: Cyrus configuration settings. See <a class="link" href="https://www.cyrusimap.org/imap/reference/manpages/configs/cyrus.conf.html"  target="_top">cyrus.conf(5)
Type: attribute set of attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or list of string)

Name: services.cyrus-imap.cyrusSettings.DAEMON
Desc: This section lists long running daemons to start before any SERVICES are spawned. master(8) will ensure that these processes are running, restarting any process which dies or forks. All listed processes will be shutdown when master(8) is exiting.

Name: services.cyrus-imap.cyrusSettings.EVENTS
Desc: This section lists processes that should be run at specific intervals, similar to cron jobs. This section is typically used to perform scheduled cleanup/maintenance.

Name: services.cyrus-imap.cyrusSettings.SERVICES
Desc: This section is the heart of the cyrus.conf file. It lists the processes that should be spawned to handle client connections made on certain Internet/UNIX sockets.

Name: services.cyrus-imap.cyrusSettings.START
Desc:
This section lists the processes to run before any SERVICES are spawned.
This section is typically used to initialize databases.
Master itself will not startup until all tasks in START have completed, so put no blocking commands here.

Name: services.cyrus-imap.debug
Desc: Whether to enable debugging messages for the Cyrus master process.

Name: services.cyrus-imap.group
Desc: Cyrus IMAP group name. If this is not set, a group named <code class="literal">cyrus

Name: services.cyrus-imap.imapdConfigFile
Desc: Path to the configuration file used for cyrus-imap.

Name: services.cyrus-imap.imapdSettings
Desc: IMAP configuration settings. See <a class="link" href="https://www.cyrusimap.org/imap/reference/manpages/configs/imapd.conf.html"  target="_top">imapd.conf(5)
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)

Name: services.cyrus-imap.imapdSettings.configdirectory

Name: services.cyrus-imap.imapdSettings.idlesocket

Name: services.cyrus-imap.imapdSettings.lmtpsocket

Name: services.cyrus-imap.imapdSettings.notifysocket

Name: services.cyrus-imap.listenQueue
Desc:
Socket listen queue backlog size. See listen(2) for more information about a backlog.
Default is 32, which may be increased if you have a very high connection rate.

Name: services.cyrus-imap.sslCACert
Desc: File path which containing one or more CA certificates to use.

Name: services.cyrus-imap.sslServerCert
Desc: File containing the global certificate used for all services (IMAP, POP3, LMTP, Sieve)

Name: services.cyrus-imap.sslServerKey

Name: services.cyrus-imap.tmpDBDir

Location where DB files are stored.
Databases in this directory are recreated upon startup, so ideally they should live in ephemeral storage for best performance.

Name: services.cyrus-imap.user
Desc: Cyrus IMAP user name. If this is not set, a user named <code class="literal">cyrus

Type: attribute set of (null or boolean or signed integer or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive) or path or string or (submodule))
