Name: services.davis.nginx
Desc: With this option, you can customize the nginx virtualHost settings.

Name: services.davis.nginx.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.davis.nginx.acmeFallbackHost
Desc:
Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful
if you want multiple hosts to be able to verify the same domain name.

Name: services.davis.nginx.acmeRoot
Desc: Directory for the ACME challenge, which is <span class="strong"><strong>public

Name: services.davis.nginx.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.davis.nginx.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.davis.nginx.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.davis.nginx.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.davis.nginx.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Name: services.davis.nginx.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.davis.nginx.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,
configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.davis.nginx.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.davis.nginx.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.davis.nginx.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.davis.nginx.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.davis.nginx.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.davis.nginx.listen._.addr
Desc: Listen address.

Name: services.davis.nginx.listen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.davis.nginx.listen._.port
Desc:
Port number to listen on.
If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.davis.nginx.listen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.davis.nginx.listen._.ssl
Desc: Enable SSL.

Name: services.davis.nginx.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.davis.nginx.locations
Desc: Declarative location config

Name: services.davis.nginx.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests.

Name: services.davis.nginx.locations._name_.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.davis.nginx.locations._name_.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.davis.nginx.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.davis.nginx.locations._name_.fastcgiParams
Desc:
FastCGI parameters to override.  Unlike in the Nginx
configuration file, overriding only some default parameters
won’t unset the default values for other parameters.

Name: services.davis.nginx.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds index directive.

Name: services.davis.nginx.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.davis.nginx.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc:
Adds proxy_pass directive and sets recommended proxy headers if
recommendedProxySettings is enabled.

Name: services.davis.nginx.locations._name_.proxyWebsockets
Desc: Whether to support proxying websocket connections with HTTP/1.1.

Name: services.davis.nginx.locations._name_.recommendedProxySettings
Desc: Enable recommended proxy settings.

Name: services.davis.nginx.locations._name_.return
Desc: Adds a return directive, for e.g. redirections.
Type: null or string or signed integer

Name: services.davis.nginx.locations._name_.root
Desc: Root directory for requests.

Name: services.davis.nginx.locations._name_.tryFiles
Desc: Adds try_files directive.

Name: services.davis.nginx.onlySSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.davis.nginx.quic
Desc:
Whether to enable the QUIC transport protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.davis.nginx.redirectCode
Desc: HTTP status used by <code class="literal">globalRedirect

Name: services.davis.nginx.rejectSSL
Desc:
Whether to listen for and reject all HTTPS connections to this vhost. Useful in
<a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.default'>default

Name: services.davis.nginx.reuseport
Desc:
Create an individual listening socket .
It is required to specify only once on one of the hosts.

Name: services.davis.nginx.root
Desc: The path of the web root directory.

Name: services.davis.nginx.serverAliases
Desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

Name: services.davis.nginx.serverName
Desc: Name of this virtual host. Defaults to attribute name in virtualHosts.

Name: services.davis.nginx.sslCertificate
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate.

Name: services.davis.nginx.sslCertificateKey
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate key.

Name: services.davis.nginx.sslTrustedCertificate
Desc: Path to root SSL certificate for stapling and client certificates.

Name: services.davis.nginx.useACMEHost
Desc:
A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

Name: services.davis.poolConfig
Desc:
Options for the davis PHP pool. See the documentation on <literal>php-fpm.conf</literal>
for details on configuration directives.
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

Name: services.davis.user
Desc: User davis runs as.

Name: services.davmail.enable
Desc: Whether to enable davmail, an MS Exchange gateway.

Name: services.davmail.config
Desc:
Davmail configuration. Refer to
<a class="link" href="http://davmail.sourceforge.net/serversetup.html"  target="_top">http://davmail.sourceforge.net/serversetup.html
Type: davmail config type (str, int, bool or attribute set thereof)

Name: services.davmail.url
Desc: Outlook Web Access URL to access the exchange server, i.e. the base webmail URL.

Name: services.db-rest.enable
Desc: Whether to enable db-rest service.

Name: services.db-rest.package
Desc: The db-rest package to use.

Name: services.db-rest.group
Desc: Group under which db-rest runs.

Name: services.db-rest.host
Desc: The host address the db-rest server should listen on.

Name: services.db-rest.port
Desc: The port the db-rest server should listen on.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.db-rest.redis.enable
Desc: Enable caching with redis for db-rest.

Name: services.db-rest.redis.createLocally
Desc: Configure a local redis server for db-rest.

Name: services.db-rest.redis.host
Desc: Redis host.

Name: services.db-rest.redis.passwordFile
Desc: Path to a file containing the redis password.

Name: services.db-rest.redis.port
Desc: Redis port.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.db-rest.redis.useSSL
Desc: Use SSL if using a redis network connection.

Name: services.db-rest.redis.user
Desc: Optional username used for authentication with redis.

Name: services.db-rest.user
Desc: User account under which db-rest runs.

Name: services.dbus.packages
Desc:
Packages whose D-Bus configuration files should be included in
the configuration of the D-Bus system-wide or session-wide
message bus.  Specifically, files in the following directories
will be included into their respective DBus configuration paths:
<code class="filename">«pkg»/etc/dbus-1/system.d

Name: services.dbus.apparmor
Desc: AppArmor mode for dbus.

Name: services.dbus.implementation
Desc:
The implementation to use for the message bus defined by the D-Bus specification.
Can be either the classic dbus daemon or dbus-broker, which aims to provide high
performance and reliability, while keeping compatibility to the D-Bus
reference implementation.

Name: services.ddccontrol.enable
Desc: Whether to enable ddccontrol for controlling displays.

Name: services.ddclient.enable
Desc: Whether to synchronise your machine’s IP address with a dynamic DNS provider (e.g. dyndns.org).

Name: services.ddclient.package
Desc: The ddclient executable package run by the service.

Name: services.ddclient.configFile
Desc:
Path to configuration file.
When set this overrides the generated configuration from module options.

Name: services.ddclient.domains
Desc: Domain name(s) to synchronize.

Name: services.ddclient.extraConfig
Desc: Extra configuration. Contents will be added verbatim to the configuration file.

Name: services.ddclient.interval
Desc:
The interval at which to run the check and update.
See <span class="command"><strong>man 7 systemd.time

Name: services.ddclient.passwordFile
Desc: A file containing the password or a TSIG key in named format when using the nsupdate protocol.

Name: services.ddclient.protocol
Desc: Protocol to use with dynamic DNS provider (see https://ddclient.net/protocols.html ).

Name: services.ddclient.quiet
Desc: Print no messages for unnecessary updates.

Name: services.ddclient.script
Desc: script as required by some providers.

Name: services.ddclient.server
Desc: Server address.

Name: services.ddclient.ssl
Desc: Whether to use SSL/TLS to connect to dynamic DNS provider.

Name: services.ddclient.use
Desc: Method to determine the IP address to send to the dynamic DNS provider.

Name: services.ddclient.username
Desc: User name.

Name: services.ddclient.usev4
Desc: Method to determine the IPv4 address to send to the dynamic DNS provider. Only used if <code class="literal">use

Name: services.ddclient.usev6
Desc: Method to determine the IPv6 address to send to the dynamic DNS provider. Only used if <code class="literal">use

Name: services.ddclient.verbose
Desc: Print verbose information.

Name: services.ddclient.zone
Desc: zone as required by some providers.

Name: services.ddns-updater.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Container to update DNS records periodically with WebUI for many DNS providers.

Name: services.ddns-updater.package
Desc: The ddns-updater package to use.

Name: services.ddns-updater.environment
Desc: Environment variables to be set for the ddns-updater service. DATADIR is ignored to enable using systemd DynamicUser. For full list see https://github.com/qdm12/ddns-updater

Name: services.deconz.enable
Desc: Whether to enable deCONZ, a Zigbee gateway for use with ConBee/RaspBee hardware (https://phoscon.de/).

Name: services.deconz.package
Desc: Which deCONZ package to use.

Name: services.deconz.allowRebootSystem
Desc: Whether to enable rebooting the system.

Name: services.deconz.allowRestartService
Desc: Whether to enable killing/restarting processes.

Name: services.deconz.allowSetSystemTime
Desc: Whether to enable setting the system time.

Name: services.deconz.device
Desc:
Force deCONZ to use a specific USB device (e.g. /dev/ttyACM0). By
default it does a search.

Name: services.deconz.extraArgs
Desc:
Extra command line arguments for deCONZ, see
https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/wiki/deCONZ-command-line-parameters.

Name: services.deconz.httpPort
Desc: TCP port for the web server.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.deconz.listenAddress
Desc:
Pin deCONZ to the network interface specified through the provided IP
address. This applies for the webserver as well as the websocket
notifications.

Name: services.deconz.openFirewall
Desc: Whether to enable opening up the service ports in the firewall.

Name: services.deconz.wsPort
Desc: TCP port for the WebSocket.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.deepin.app-services.enable
Desc: Whether to enable service collection of DDE applications, including dconfig-center.

Name: services.deepin.dde-api.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable the DDE API, which provides some dbus interfaces that is used for screen zone detecting,
thumbnail generating, and sound playing in Deepin Desktop Environment
.

Name: services.deepin.dde-daemon.enable
Desc: Whether to enable daemon for handling the deepin session settings.

Name: services.deepin.deepin-anything.enable
Desc: Whether to enable deepin anything file search tool.

Name: services.deliantra-server.enable
Desc: If enabled, the Deliantra game server will be started at boot.

Name: services.deliantra-server.package
Desc:
The deliantra-server package to use. ::: {.note}
This will also be used for map/arch data, if you don’t change <code class="option">dataDir

Name: services.deliantra-server.configFiles
Desc:
Contents of the server configuration files. These will be appended to
the example configurations the server comes with and overwrite any
default settings defined therein.

Name: services.deliantra-server.dataDir
Desc:
Where to store readonly data (maps, archetypes, sprites, etc).
Note that if you plan to use the live map editor (rather than editing
the maps offline and then nixos-rebuilding), THIS MUST BE WRITEABLE –
copy the deliantra-data someplace writeable (say,
/var/lib/deliantra/data) and update this option accordingly.

Name: services.deliantra-server.openFirewall
Desc: Whether to open ports in the firewall for the server.

Name: services.deliantra-server.stateDir
Desc: Where to store runtime data (save files, persistent items, etc).

Name: services.deluge.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Deluge daemon.

Name: services.deluge.package
Desc: The deluge-2_x package to use.

Name: services.deluge.authFile
Desc:
The file managing the authentication for deluge, the format of this
file is straightforward, each line contains a
username:password:level tuple in plaintext. It only has an effect
when <code class="option">services.deluge.declarative

Name: services.deluge.config
Desc:
Deluge core configuration for the core.conf file. Only has an effect
when <code class="option">services.deluge.declarative

Name: services.deluge.dataDir
Desc: The directory where deluge will create files.

Name: services.deluge.declarative
Desc:
Whether to use a declarative deluge configuration.
Only if set to <code class="literal">true

Name: services.deluge.extraPackages
Desc:
Extra packages available at runtime to enable Deluge’s plugins. For example,
extraction utilities are required for the built-in “Extractor” plugin.
This always contains unzip, gnutar, xz and bzip2.

Name: services.deluge.group
Desc: Group under which deluge runs.

Name: services.deluge.openFilesLimit
Desc: Number of files to allow deluged to open.

Name: services.deluge.openFirewall
Desc:
Whether to open the firewall for the ports in
<code class="option">services.deluge.config.listen_ports

Name: services.deluge.user
Desc: User account under which deluge runs.

Name: services.deluge.web.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Deluge Web daemon.

Name: services.deluge.web.openFirewall
Desc: Open ports in the firewall for deluge web daemon

Name: services.deluge.web.port
Desc: Deluge web UI port.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.dendrite.enable
Desc: Whether to enable matrix.org dendrite.

Name: services.dendrite.environmentFile
Desc: Environment file as defined in <a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.exec.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">systemd.exec

Name: services.dendrite.httpPort
Desc: The port to listen for HTTP requests on.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.dendrite.httpsPort
Desc: The port to listen for HTTPS requests on.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.dendrite.loadCredential
Desc:
This can be used to pass secrets to the systemd service without adding them to
the nix store.
To use the example setting, see the example of
<code class="option">services.dendrite.settings.global.private_key

Name: services.dendrite.openRegistration
Desc: Allow open registration without secondary verification (reCAPTCHA).

Name: services.dendrite.settings
Desc:
Configuration for dendrite, see:
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/matrix-org/dendrite/blob/main/dendrite-sample.yaml"  target="_top">https://github.com/matrix-org/dendrite/blob/main/dendrite-sample.yaml

Name: services.dendrite.settings.app_service_api.database.connection_string
Desc: Database for the Appservice API.

Name: services.dendrite.settings.client_api.registration_disabled
Desc:
Whether to disable user registration to the server
without the shared secret.

Name: services.dendrite.settings.federation_api.database.connection_string
Desc: Database for the Federation API.

Name: services.dendrite.settings.global.private_key
Desc:
The path to the signing private key file, used to sign
requests and events.
Type: path or string matching the pattern ^\$CREDENTIALS_DIRECTORY/.+

Name: services.dendrite.settings.global.server_name
Desc:
The domain name of the server, with optional explicit port.
This is used by remote servers to connect to this server.
This is also the last part of your UserID.

Name: services.dendrite.settings.global.trusted_third_party_id_servers
Desc:
Lists of domains that the server will trust as identity
servers to verify third party identifiers such as phone
numbers and email addresses

Name: services.dendrite.settings.key_server.database.connection_string
Desc: Database for the Key Server (for end-to-end encryption).

Name: services.dendrite.settings.media_api.base_path
Desc: Storage path for uploaded media.

Name: services.dendrite.settings.media_api.database.connection_string
Desc: Database for the Media API.

Name: services.dendrite.settings.mscs.database.connection_string
Desc: Database for exerimental MSC’s.

Name: services.dendrite.settings.relay_api.database.connection_string
Desc: Database for the Relay Server.

Name: services.dendrite.settings.room_server.database.connection_string
Desc: Database for the Room Server.

Name: services.dendrite.settings.sync_api.database.connection_string
Desc: Database for the Sync API.

Name: services.dendrite.settings.sync_api.search.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Dendrite’s full-text search engine.

Name: services.dendrite.settings.sync_api.search.index_path
Desc: The path the search index will be created in.

Name: services.dendrite.settings.sync_api.search.language
Desc:
The language most likely to be used on the server - used when indexing, to
ensure the returned results match expectations. A full list of possible languages
can be found at https://github.com/blevesearch/bleve/tree/master/analysis/lang

Name: services.dendrite.settings.user_api.account_database.connection_string
Desc: Database for the User API, accounts.

Name: services.dendrite.settings.user_api.device_database.connection_string
Desc: Database for the User API, devices.

Name: services.dendrite.tlsCert
Desc: The path to the TLS certificate.

Name: services.dendrite.tlsKey
Desc: The path to the TLS key.

Name: services.dependency-track.enable
Desc: Whether to enable dependency-track.

Name: services.dependency-track.package
Desc: The dependency-track package to use.

Name: services.dependency-track.database.createLocally
Desc:
Whether a database should be automatically created on the
local host. Set this to false if you plan on provisioning a
local database yourself.

Name: services.dependency-track.database.databaseName
Desc:
Database name to use when connecting to an external or
manually provisioned database; has no effect when a local
database is automatically provisioned.

Name: services.dependency-track.database.passwordFile
Desc: The path to a file containing the database password.

Name: services.dependency-track.database.type
Desc: <code class="literal">h2

Name: services.dependency-track.database.username
Desc:
Username to use when connecting to an external or manually
provisioned database; has no effect when a local database is
automatically provisioned.

Name: services.dependency-track.frontend.baseUrl
Desc: The base URL of the API server.

Name: services.dependency-track.javaArgs
Desc: Java options passed to JVM

Name: services.dependency-track.ldap.bindPasswordFile
Desc: The path to a file containing the LDAP bind password.

Name: services.dependency-track.logLevel
Desc: Log level for dependency-track

Name: services.dependency-track.nginx.enable
Desc: Whether to set up an nginx virtual host.

Name: services.dependency-track.nginx.domain
Desc: The domain name under which to set up the virtual host.

Name: services.dependency-track.oidc.enable
Desc: Whether to enable oidc support.

Name: services.dependency-track.oidc.clientId
Desc: Defines the client ID for OpenID Connect.

Name: services.dependency-track.oidc.flow
Desc:
Specifies the OpenID Connect flow to use.
Values other than “implicit” will result in the Code+PKCE flow to be used.
Usage of the implicit flow is strongly discouraged, but may be necessary when
the IdP of choice does not support the Code+PKCE flow.
See also:

Name: services.dependency-track.oidc.issuer
Desc:
Defines the issuer URL to be used for OpenID Connect.
See alpine.oidc.issuer property of the API server.

Name: services.dependency-track.oidc.loginButtonText
Desc:
Defines the scopes to request for OpenID Connect.
See also: https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-basic-1_0.html#Scopes

Name: services.dependency-track.oidc.scope
Desc:
Defines the scopes to request for OpenID Connect.
See also: https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-basic-1_0.html#Scopes

Name: services.dependency-track.oidc.teamSynchronization
Desc:
This option will ensure that team memberships for OpenID Connect users are dynamic and
synchronized with membership of OpenID Connect groups or assigned roles. When a team is
mapped to an OpenID Connect group, all local OpenID Connect users will automatically be
assigned to the team if they are a member of the group the team is mapped to. If the user
is later removed from the OpenID Connect group, they will also be removed from the team. This
option provides the ability to dynamically control user permissions via the identity provider.
Note that team synchronization is only performed during user provisioning and after successful
authentication.

Name: services.dependency-track.oidc.teams.claim
Desc:
Defines the name of the claim that contains group memberships or role assignments in the provider’s userinfo endpoint.
The claim must be an array of strings. Most public identity providers do not support group or role management.
When using a customizable / on-demand hosted identity provider, name, content, and inclusion in the userinfo endpoint
will most likely need to be configured.

Name: services.dependency-track.oidc.teams.default
Desc:
Defines one or more team names that auto-provisioned OIDC users shall be added to.
Multiple team names may be provided as comma-separated list.

Name: services.dependency-track.oidc.userProvisioning
Desc:
Specifies if mapped OpenID Connect accounts are automatically created upon successful
authentication. When a user logs in with a valid access token but an account has
not been previously provisioned, an authentication failure will be returned.
This allows admins to control specifically which OpenID Connect users can access the
system and which users cannot. When this value is set to true, a local OpenID Connect
user will be created and mapped to the OpenID Connect account automatically. This
automatic provisioning only affects authentication, not authorization.

Name: services.dependency-track.oidc.usernameClaim
Desc:
Defines the name of the claim that contains the username in the provider’s userinfo endpoint.
Common claims are “name”, “username”, “preferred_username” or “nickname”.
See also: https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#UserInfoResponse

Name: services.dependency-track.port
Desc: On which port dependency-track should listen for new HTTP connections.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.dependency-track.settings
Desc: See https://docs.dependencytrack.org/getting-started/configuration/#default-configuration for possible options
Type: attribute set of (string, package, bool, int or float)

Name: services.dependency-track.settings._alpine.data.directory_
Desc:
Defines the path to the data directory. This directory will hold logs, keys,
and any database or index files along with application-specific files or
directories.

Name: services.dependency-track.settings._alpine.database.driver_
Desc: Specifies the JDBC driver class to use.

Name: services.dependency-track.settings._alpine.database.mode_
Desc:
Defines the database mode of operation. Valid choices are:
‘server’, ‘embedded’, and ‘external’.
In server mode, the database will listen for connections from remote hosts.
In embedded mode, the system will be more secure and slightly faster.
External mode should be used when utilizing an external database server
(i.e. mysql, postgresql, etc).

Name: services.dependency-track.settings._alpine.database.url_
Desc: Specifies the JDBC URL to use when connecting to the database.

Name: services.dependency-track.settings._alpine.database.username_
Desc: Specifies the username to use when authenticating to the database.

Name: services.dependency-track.settings._alpine.ldap.enabled_
Desc:
Defines if LDAP will be used for user authentication. If enabled,
alpine.ldap.* properties should be set accordingly.

Name: services.dependency-track.settings._alpine.oidc.client.id_
Desc:
Defines the client ID to be used for OpenID Connect.
The client ID should be the same as the one configured for the frontend,
and will only be used to validate ID tokens.

Name: services.dependency-track.settings._alpine.oidc.enabled_
Desc:
Defines if OpenID Connect will be used for user authentication.
If enabled, alpine.oidc.* properties should be set accordingly.

Name: services.dependency-track.settings._alpine.oidc.issuer_
Desc:
Defines the issuer URL to be used for OpenID Connect.
This issuer MUST support provider configuration via the /.well-known/openid-configuration endpoint.
See also:

Name: services.dependency-track.settings._alpine.oidc.team.synchronization_
Desc:
This option will ensure that team memberships for OpenID Connect users are dynamic and
synchronized with membership of OpenID Connect groups or assigned roles. When a team is
mapped to an OpenID Connect group, all local OpenID Connect users will automatically be
assigned to the team if they are a member of the group the team is mapped to. If the user
is later removed from the OpenID Connect group, they will also be removed from the team. This
option provides the ability to dynamically control user permissions via the identity provider.
Note that team synchronization is only performed during user provisioning and after successful
authentication.

Name: services.dependency-track.settings._alpine.oidc.teams.claim_
Desc:
Defines the name of the claim that contains group memberships or role assignments in the provider’s userinfo endpoint.
The claim must be an array of strings. Most public identity providers do not support group or role management.
When using a customizable / on-demand hosted identity provider, name, content, and inclusion in the userinfo endpoint
will most likely need to be configured.

Name: services.dependency-track.settings._alpine.oidc.teams.default_
Desc:
Defines one or more team names that auto-provisioned OIDC users shall be added to.
Multiple team names may be provided as comma-separated list.

Name: services.dependency-track.settings._alpine.oidc.user.provisioning_
Desc:
Specifies if mapped OpenID Connect accounts are automatically created upon successful
authentication. When a user logs in with a valid access token but an account has
not been previously provisioned, an authentication failure will be returned.
This allows admins to control specifically which OpenID Connect users can access the
system and which users cannot. When this value is set to true, a local OpenID Connect
user will be created and mapped to the OpenID Connect account automatically. This
automatic provisioning only affects authentication, not authorization.

Name: services.dependency-track.settings._alpine.oidc.username.claim_
Desc:
Defines the name of the claim that contains the username in the provider’s userinfo endpoint.
Common claims are “name”, “username”, “preferred_username” or “nickname”.
See also: https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#UserInfoResponse

Name: services.desktopManager.lomiri.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable the Lomiri graphical shell (formerly known as Unity8)
.

Name: services.desktopManager.plasma6.enable
Desc: Enable the Plasma 6 (KDE 6) desktop environment.

Name: services.desktopManager.plasma6.enableQt5Integration
Desc: Enable Qt 5 integration (theming, etc). Disable for a pure Qt 6 system.

Name: services.desktopManager.plasma6.notoPackage
Desc: The Noto fonts - used for UI by default package to use.

Name: services.devmon.enable
Desc: Whether to enable devmon, an automatic device mounting daemon.

Name: services.devpi-server.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Devpi Server.

Name: services.devpi-server.package
Desc: The devpi-server package to use.

Name: services.devpi-server.host
Desc: domain/ip address to listen on

Name: services.devpi-server.openFirewall
Desc: Whether to enable opening the default ports in the firewall for Devpi Server.

Name: services.diod.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the diod 9P file server.

Name: services.diod.allsquash
Desc:
Remap all users to “nobody”. The attaching user need not be present in the
password file.

Name: services.diod.authRequired
Desc: Allow clients to connect without authentication, i.e. without a valid MUNGE credential.

Name: services.diod.exportall
Desc:
Export all file systems listed in /proc/mounts. If new file systems are mounted
after diod has started, they will become immediately mountable. If there is a
duplicate entry for a file system in the exports list, any options listed in
the exports entry will apply.

Name: services.diod.exportopts
Desc:
Establish a default set of export options. These are overridden, not appended
to, by opts attributes in an “exports” entry.

Name: services.diod.exports
Desc:
List the file systems that clients will be allowed to mount. All paths should
be fully qualified. The exports table can include two types of element:
a string element (as above),
or an alternate table element form { path=“/path”, opts=“ro” }.
In the alternate form, the (optional) opts attribute is a comma-separated list
of export options. The two table element forms can be mixed in the exports
table. Note that although diod will not traverse file system boundaries for a
given mount due to inode uniqueness constraints, subdirectories of a file
system can be separately exported.

Name: services.diod.extraConfig
Desc: Extra configuration options for diod.conf.

Name: services.diod.listen
Desc:
[ “IP:PORT” [,“IP:PORT”,…] ]
List the interfaces and ports that diod should listen on.

Name: services.diod.logdest
Desc:
Set the destination for logging.
The value has the form of “syslog:facility:level” or “filename”.

Name: services.diod.nwthreads
Desc:
Sets the (fixed) number of worker threads created to handle 9P
requests for a unique aname.

Name: services.diod.squashuser
Desc: Change the squash user. The squash user must be present in the password file.

Name: services.diod.statfsPassthru
Desc:
This option configures statfs to return the host file system’s type
rather than V9FS_MAGIC.

Name: services.diod.userdb
Desc:
This option disables password/group lookups. It allows any uid to attach and
assumes gid=uid, and supplementary groups contain only the primary gid.

Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for

Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Desc:

Name: services.dolibarr.nginx.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.dolibarr.nginx.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.dolibarr.nginx.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,
configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.dolibarr.nginx.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.dolibarr.nginx.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.dolibarr.nginx.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.dolibarr.nginx.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.dolibarr.nginx.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.dolibarr.nginx.listen._.addr
Desc: Listen address.

Name: services.dolibarr.nginx.listen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.dolibarr.nginx.listen._.port
Desc:
Port number to listen on.
If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.dolibarr.nginx.listen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.dolibarr.nginx.listen._.ssl
Desc: Enable SSL.

Name: services.dolibarr.nginx.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

If non-null, delete incremental sets of all backups sets that are

exim_group, exim_path, or spool_directory.

Name: services.exim.group
Desc: Group to use when no root privileges are required.

Name: services.exim.queueRunnerInterval
Desc: How often to spawn a new queue runner.

Name: services.exim.spoolDir
Desc: Location of the spool directory of exim.

Name: services.exim.user
Desc:
User to use when no root privileges are required.
In particular, this applies when receiving messages and when doing
remote deliveries.  (Local deliveries run as various non-root users,
typically as the owner of a local mailbox.) Specifying this value
as root is not supported.

Name: services.expressvpn.enable
Desc: Enable the ExpressVPN daemon.

Name: services.factorio.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Factorio.

Name: services.factorio.package
Desc: The factorio-headless package to use.

Name: services.factorio.admins
Desc: List of player names which will be admin.

Name: services.factorio.allowedPlayers
Desc:
If non-empty, only these player names are allowed to connect. The game
will not be able to save any changes made in-game with the /whitelist
console command, though they will still take effect until the server
is restarted.

Name: services.factorio.autosave-interval
Desc: Autosave interval in minutes.

Name: services.factorio.bind
Desc: The address to which the service should bind.

Name: services.factorio.configFile
Desc: The server’s configuration file.

Name: services.factorio.description
Desc: Description of the game that will appear in the listing.

Name: services.factorio.extraSettings
Desc: Extra game configuration that will go into server-settings.json

Name: services.factorio.extraSettingsFile
Desc:
File, which is dynamically applied to server-settings.json before
startup.

Name: services.factorio.game-name
Desc: Name of the game as it will appear in the game listing.

Name: services.factorio.game-password
Desc: Game password.

Name: services.factorio.lan
Desc: Game will be broadcast on LAN.

Name: services.factorio.loadLatestSave
Desc:
Load the latest savegame on startup. This overrides saveName, in that the latest
save will always be used even if a saved game of the given name exists. It still
controls the ‘canonical’ name of the savegame.

Name: services.factorio.mods
Desc: Mods the server should install and activate.

Name: services.factorio.mods-dat
Desc:
Mods settings can be changed by specifying a dat file, in the <a class="link" href="https://wiki.factorio.com/Mod_settings_file_format"  target="_top">mod
settings file
format

Name: services.factorio.nonBlockingSaving
Desc:
Highly experimental feature, enable only at your own risk of losing your saves.
On UNIX systems, server will fork itself to create an autosave.
Autosaving on connected Windows clients will be disabled regardless of autosave_only_on_server option.

Name: services.factorio.openFirewall
Desc: Whether to automatically open the specified UDP port in the firewall.

Name: services.factorio.password
Desc: Your factorio.com login credentials. Required for games with visibility public.

Name: services.factorio.port
Desc: The port to which the service should bind.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.factorio.public
Desc: Game will be published on the official Factorio matching server.

Name: services.factorio.requireUserVerification
Desc: When set to true, the server will only allow clients that have a valid factorio.com account.

Name: services.factorio.saveName
Desc: The name of the savegame that will be used by the server.

Name: services.factorio.stateDirName
Desc: Name of the directory under /var/lib holding the server’s data.

Name: services.factorio.token
Desc: Authentication token. May be used instead of ‘password’ above.

Name: services.factorio.username
Desc: Your factorio.com login credentials. Required for games with visibility public.

Name: services.fail2ban.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the fail2ban service.

Name: services.fail2ban.package
Desc: The fail2ban package to use.

Name: services.fail2ban.packageFirewall
Desc: The firewall package used by fail2ban service. Defaults to the package for your firewall (iptables or nftables).

Name: services.fail2ban.banaction
Desc:
Default banning action (e.g. iptables, iptables-new, iptables-multiport,
iptables-ipset-proto6-allports, shorewall, etc). It is used to
define action_* variables. Can be overridden globally or per
section within jail.local file

Name: services.fail2ban.banaction-allports
Desc:
Default banning action (e.g. iptables, iptables-new, iptables-multiport,
shorewall, etc) for “allports” jails. It is used to define action_* variables. Can be overridden
globally or per section within jail.local file

Name: services.fail2ban.bantime
Desc: Number of seconds that a host is banned.

Name: services.fail2ban.bantime-increment.enable
Desc:
“bantime.increment” allows to use database for searching of previously banned ip’s to increase
a default ban time using special formula, default it is banTime * 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32 …

Name: services.fail2ban.bantime-increment.factor
Desc:
“bantime.factor” is a coefficient to calculate exponent growing of the formula or common multiplier,
default value of factor is 1 and with default value of formula, the ban time grows by 1, 2, 4, 8, 16 …

Name: services.fail2ban.bantime-increment.formula
Desc:
“bantime.formula” used by default to calculate next value of ban time, default value below,
the same ban time growing will be reached by multipliers 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32 …

Name: services.fail2ban.bantime-increment.maxtime
Desc: “bantime.maxtime” is the max number of seconds using the ban time can reach (don’t grows further)

Name: services.fail2ban.bantime-increment.multipliers
Desc:
“bantime.multipliers” used to calculate next value of ban time instead of formula, corresponding
previously ban count and given “bantime.factor” (for multipliers default is 1);
following example grows ban time by 1, 2, 4, 8, 16 … and if last ban count greater as multipliers count,
always used last multiplier (64 in example), for factor ‘1’ and original ban time 600 - 10.6 hours

Name: services.fail2ban.bantime-increment.overalljails
Desc:
“bantime.overalljails” (if true) specifies the search of IP in the database will be executed
cross over all jails, if false (default), only current jail of the ban IP will be searched.

Name: services.fail2ban.bantime-increment.rndtime
Desc:
“bantime.rndtime” is the max number of seconds using for mixing with random time
to prevent “clever” botnets calculate exact time IP can be unbanned again

Name: services.fail2ban.daemonSettings
Desc:
The contents of Fail2ban’s main configuration file.
It’s generally not necessary to change it.
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: services.fail2ban.extraPackages
Desc:
Extra packages to be made available to the fail2ban service. The example contains
the packages needed by the <code class="literal">iptables-ipset-proto6

Name: services.fail2ban.ignoreIP
Desc:
“ignoreIP” can be a list of IP addresses, CIDR masks or DNS hosts. Fail2ban will not ban a host which
matches an address in this list. Several addresses can be defined using space (and/or comma) separator.

Name: services.fail2ban.jails
Desc:
The configuration of each Fail2ban “jail”.  A jail
consists of an action (such as blocking a port using
<span class="command"><strong>iptables
Type: attribute set of (strings concatenated with “\n” or (submodule))

Name: services.fail2ban.maxretry
Desc: Number of failures before a host gets banned.

Name: services.fakeroute.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the fakeroute service.

Name: services.fakeroute.route
Desc:
Fake route that will appear after the real
one to any host running a traceroute.

Name: services.fanout.enable
Desc: Whether to enable fanout.

Name: services.fanout.bufferSize
Desc: Size of /dev/fanout buffer in bytes

Name: services.fanout.fanoutDevices
Desc: Number of /dev/fanout devices

Name: services.fastnetmon-advanced.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the fastnetmon-advanced DDoS Protection daemon.

Name: services.fastnetmon-advanced.hostgroups
Desc: Hostgroups to declaratively load into FastNetMon Advanced

Name: services.fastnetmon-advanced.settings
Desc: Extra configuration options to declaratively load into FastNetMon Advanced.

Name: services.fastnetmon-advanced.traffic_db.settings
Desc: Additional settings for /etc/fastnetmon/traffic_db.conf

Name: services.fcgiwrap.instances
Desc: Configuration for fcgiwrap instances.

Name: services.fcgiwrap.instances._name_.process.group
Desc: Group as which this instance of fcgiwrap will be run.

Name: services.fcgiwrap.instances._name_.process.prefork
Desc: Number of processes to prefork.

Name: services.fcgiwrap.instances._name_.process.user
Desc:
User as which this instance of fcgiwrap will be run.
Set to <code class="literal">null

Name: services.fcgiwrap.instances._name_.socket.address
Desc:
Socket address.
In case of a UNIX socket, this should be its filesystem path.

Name: services.fcgiwrap.instances._name_.socket.group
Desc: Group to be set as owner of the UNIX socket.

Name: services.fcgiwrap.instances._name_.socket.mode
Desc:
Mode to be set on the UNIX socket.
Defaults to private to the socket’s owner.

Name: services.fcgiwrap.instances._name_.socket.type
Desc: Socket type: ‘unix’, ‘tcp’ or ‘tcp6’.

Name: services.fcgiwrap.instances._name_.socket.user
Desc: User to be set as owner of the UNIX socket.

Name: services.fcron.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the <span class="command"><strong>fcron

Name: services.fcron.allow
Desc:
Users allowed to use fcrontab and fcrondyn (one name per
line, <code class="literal">all

Name: services.fcron.deny
Desc: Users forbidden from using fcron.

Name: services.fcron.maxSerialJobs
Desc: Maximum number of serial jobs which can run simultaneously.

Name: services.fcron.queuelen
Desc: Number of jobs the serial queue and the lavg queue can contain.

Name: services.fcron.systab
Desc: The “system” crontab contents.

Name: services.fedimintd
Desc: Specification of one or more fedimintd instances.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.enable
Desc: Whether to enable fedimintd.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.package
Desc: The fedimint package to use.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.api.bind
Desc: Address to bind on for API connections relied by the reverse proxy/tls terminator.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.api.openFirewall
Desc: Opens port in firewall for fedimintd’s api port

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.api.port
Desc: Port to bind on for API connections relied by the reverse proxy/tls terminator.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.api.url
Desc: Public URL of the API address of the reverse proxy/tls terminator. Usually starting with <code class="literal">wss://

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.bitcoin.network
Desc: Bitcoin network to participate in.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.bitcoin.rpc.kind
Desc: Kind of a bitcoin node.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.bitcoin.rpc.secretFile
Desc: If set the URL specified in <code class="literal">bitcoin.rpc.url

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.bitcoin.rpc.url
Desc: Bitcoin node (bitcoind/electrum/esplora) address to connect to

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.consensus.finalityDelay
Desc: Consensus peg-in finality delay.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.dataDir
Desc:
Path to the data dir fedimintd will use to store its data.
Note that due to using the DynamicUser feature of systemd, this value should not be changed
and is set to be read only.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.environment
Desc: Extra Environment variables to pass to the fedimintd.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.enable
Desc: Whether to configure nginx for fedimintd

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config
Desc: Overrides to the nginx vhost section for api

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.acmeFallbackHost
Desc:
Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful
if you want multiple hosts to be able to verify the same domain name.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.acmeRoot
Desc: Directory for the ACME challenge, which is <span class="strong"><strong>public

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,
configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.listen._.addr
Desc: Listen address.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.listen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.listen._.port
Desc:
Port number to listen on.
If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.listen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.listen._.ssl
Desc: Enable SSL.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.locations
Desc: Declarative location config

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.locations._name_.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.locations._name_.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.locations._name_.fastcgiParams
Desc:
FastCGI parameters to override.  Unlike in the Nginx
configuration file, overriding only some default parameters
won’t unset the default values for other parameters.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds index directive.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc:
Adds proxy_pass directive and sets recommended proxy headers if
recommendedProxySettings is enabled.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.locations._name_.proxyWebsockets
Desc: Whether to support proxying websocket connections with HTTP/1.1.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.locations._name_.recommendedProxySettings
Desc: Enable recommended proxy settings.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.locations._name_.return
Desc: Adds a return directive, for e.g. redirections.
Type: null or string or signed integer

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.locations._name_.root
Desc: Root directory for requests.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.locations._name_.tryFiles
Desc: Adds try_files directive.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.onlySSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.quic
Desc:
Whether to enable the QUIC transport protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.redirectCode
Desc: HTTP status used by <code class="literal">globalRedirect

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.rejectSSL
Desc:
Whether to listen for and reject all HTTPS connections to this vhost. Useful in
<a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.default'>default

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.reuseport
Desc:
Create an individual listening socket .
It is required to specify only once on one of the hosts.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.root
Desc: The path of the web root directory.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.serverAliases
Desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.serverName
Desc: Name of this virtual host. Defaults to attribute name in virtualHosts.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.sslCertificate
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.sslCertificateKey
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate key.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.sslTrustedCertificate
Desc: Path to root SSL certificate for stapling and client certificates.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.config.useACMEHost
Desc:
A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.fqdn
Desc: Public domain of the API address of the reverse proxy/tls terminator.

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.nginx.path
Desc: Path to host the API on and forward to the daemon’s api port

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.p2p.bind
Desc: Address to bind on for p2p connections from peers

Desc: Opens port in firewall for fedimintd’s p2p port

Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.fedimintd._name_.p2p.url
Desc: Public address for p2p connections from peers

A file containing the password corresponding to

Name: services.filesender.database.port

Name: services.filesender.settings

Configuration options used by FileSender.

Name: services.filesender.settings.admin
Desc:
UIDs (as per the configured saml_uid_attribute) of FileSender administrators.
Accounts with these UIDs can access the Admin page through the web UI.

Name: services.filesender.settings.admin_email
Desc:
Email address of FileSender administrator(s).
Emails regarding disk full etc. are sent here.

Name: services.filesender.settings.log_facilities
Desc: Defines where FileSender logging is sent. You can sent logging to a file, to syslog or to the default PHP log facility (as configured through your webserver’s PHP module). The directive takes an array of one or more logging targets. Logging can be sent to multiple targets simultaneously. Each logging target is a list containing the name of the logging target and a number of attributes which vary per log target. See below for the exact definiation of each log target.

Name: services.filesender.settings.site_url
Desc: Site URL. Used in emails, to build URLs for logging in, logging out, build URL for upload endpoint for web workers, to include scripts etc.

Name: services.filesender.settings.storage_filesystem_path

Desc: User under which filesender runs.

Name: services.firebird.enable

Location containing data/ and system/ directories.
data/ stores the databases, system/ stores the password database security2.fdb.

Desc: The firefly-iii package to use.

Name: services.firefly-iii.dataDir
Desc: The place where firefly-iii stores its state.

Group under which firefly-iii runs. It is best to set this to the group
of whatever webserver is being used as the frontend.

Options for the Firefly III PHP pool. See the documentation on <literal>php-fpm.conf</literal>
for details on configuration directives.

Name: services.firefly-iii.settings
Desc:
Options for firefly-iii configuration. Refer to
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/firefly-iii/firefly-iii/blob/main/.env.example"  target="_top">https://github.com/firefly-iii/firefly-iii/blob/main/.env.example
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

Name: services.firefly-iii.settings.APP_ENV
Desc:
The app environment. It is recommended to keep this at “local”.
Possible values are “local”, “production” and “testing”

Name: services.firefly-iii.settings.APP_KEY_FILE
Desc:
The path to your appkey. The file should contain a 32 character
random app key. This may be set using <code class="literal">echo "base64:$(head -c 32 /dev/urandom | base64)" > /path/to/key-file

Name: services.firefly-iii.settings.APP_URL
Desc:
The APP_URL used by firefly-iii internally. Please make sure this
URL matches the external URL of your Firefly III installation. It
is used to validate specific requests and to generate URLs in
emails.

Name: services.firefly-iii.settings.DB_CONNECTION
Desc:
The type of database you wish to use. Can be one of “sqlite”,
“mysql” or “pgsql”.

Name: services.firefly-iii.settings.DB_HOST
Desc:
The machine which hosts your database. This is left at the
default value for “mysql” because we use the “DB_SOCKET” option
to connect to a unix socket instead. “pgsql” requires that the
unix socket location be specified here instead of at “DB_SOCKET”.
This option does not affect “sqlite”.

Name: services.firefly-iii.settings.DB_PORT
Desc:
The port your database is listening at. sqlite does not require
this value to be filled.

Name: services.firefly-iii.user
Desc: User account under which firefly-iii runs.

Name: services.firefly-iii.virtualHost
Desc:
The hostname at which you wish firefly-iii to be served. If you have
enabled nginx using <code class="literal">services.firefly-iii.enableNginx

Name: services.firefly-iii-data-importer.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Firefly III Data Importer.

Name: services.firefly-iii-data-importer.enableNginx
services.firefly-iii-data-importer.package
Desc:
The firefly-iii-data-importer package served by php-fpm and the webserver of choice.
This option can be used to point the webserver to the correct root. It
may also be used to set the package to a different version, say a
development version.

Name: services.firefly-iii-data-importer.dataDir
Desc: The place where firefly-iii data importer stores its state.

Name: services.firefly-iii-data-importer.group
Desc:
Group under which firefly-iii-data-importer runs. It is best to set this to the group
of whatever webserver is being used as the frontend.

Name: services.firefly-iii-data-importer.poolConfig
Desc:
Options for the Firefly III Data Importer PHP pool. See the documentation on <literal>php-fpm.conf</literal>
for details on configuration directives.
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

Name: services.firefly-iii-data-importer.settings
Desc:
Options for firefly-iii data importer configuration. Refer to
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/firefly-iii/data-importer/blob/main/.env.example"  target="_top">https://github.com/firefly-iii/data-importer/blob/main/.env.example
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

Name: services.firefly-iii-data-importer.user
Desc: User account under which firefly-iii-data-importer runs.

Name: services.firefly-iii-data-importer.virtualHost
Desc:
The hostname at which you wish firefly-iii-data-importer to be served. If you have
enabled nginx using <code class="literal">services.firefly-iii-data-importer.enableNginx

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.enable

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.database.createLocally

Whether to create database and user on the local machine if they do not exist.

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.database.host
Desc: Database host name. <code class="literal">localhost

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.database.name
Desc:
Database to use for storage. Will be created automatically if it does not exist
and <code class="literal">config.services.firefox-syncserver.database.createLocally

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.database.user
Desc: Username for database connections.

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.logLevel
Desc: Log level to run with. This can be a simple log level like <code class="literal">error

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.secrets
Desc:
A file containing the various secrets. Should be in the format expected by systemd’s
<code class="literal">EnvironmentFile

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.settings
Desc:
Settings for the sync server. These take priority over values computed
from NixOS options.

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.settings.port
Desc: Port to bind to.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.settings.tokenserver.enabled
Desc: Whether to enable the token service as well.

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.singleNode.enable

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.singleNode.enableTLS

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.singleNode.capacity
Desc:
How many sync accounts are allowed on this server. Setting this value

effectively deny service to accounts not yet registered here.

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.singleNode.hostname
Desc: Host name to use for this service.

Name: services.firefox-syncserver.singleNode.url
Desc:
URL of the host. If you are not using the automatic webserver proxy setup you will have
to change this setting or your sync server may not be functional.

Name: services.fireqos.enable
Desc: Whether to enable FireQOS.

Name: services.fireqos.config
Desc: The FireQOS configuration.

Name: services.flannel.enable

Desc: The flannel package to use.

Name: services.flannel.backend
Desc: Type of backend to use and specific configurations for that backend.

Name: services.flannel.etcd.endpoints

Desc:
Interface to use (IP or name) for inter-host communication.

Name: services.flannel.kubeconfig
Desc:
Path to kubeconfig to use for storing flannel config using the
Kubernetes API

Name: services.flannel.network
Desc: IPv4 network in CIDR format to use for the entire flannel network.

Name: services.flannel.nodeName
Desc: Needed when running with Kubernetes as backend as this cannot be auto-detected";

Name: services.flannel.publicIp
Desc:
IP accessible by other nodes for inter-host communication.

Name: services.flannel.storageBackend
Desc: Determines where flannel stores its configuration at runtime

Name: services.flannel.subnetLen
Desc:
The size of the subnet allocated to each host. Defaults to 24 (i.e. /24)
unless the Network was configured to be smaller than a /24 in which case

Name: services.flannel.subnetMax
Desc:
The end of IP range which the subnet allocation should start with.
Defaults to the last subnet of Network.

Name: services.flannel.subnetMin
Desc:
The beginning of IP range which the subnet allocation should start with.
Defaults to the first subnet of Network.

Desc: The port on which FlareSolverr will listen for incoming HTTP traffic.

Name: services.flarum.adminEmail

Desc: Username for first web application administrator

Desc: Change <code class="literal">domain

Name: services.flarum.createDatabaseLocally

Desc: System user to run Flarum

Desc: The flatpak package to use.

Desc: The flexget package to use.

Name: services.flexget.homeDir
Desc: Where files live.

Name: services.flexget.interval
Desc: When to perform a <span class="command"><strong>flexget

Name: services.flexget.systemScheduler
Desc: When true, execute the runs via the flexget-runner.timer. If false, you have to specify the settings yourself in the YML file.

Desc: The user under which to run flexget.

Name: services.flood.enable
Desc: Whether to enable flood.

Desc: The flood package to use.

Name: services.flood.extraArgs
Desc: Extra arguments passed to <code class="literal">flood

Desc: Whether to open the firewall for the port in <code class="option">services.flood.port

Name: services.fluentd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable fluentd, a data/log collector.

A list of plugin paths to pass into fluentd. It will make plugins defined in ruby files

Name: services.fluidd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Fluidd, a Klipper web interface for managing your 3d printer.

Name: services.fluidd.package
Desc: The fluidd package to use.

Name: services.fluidd.hostName
Desc: Hostname to serve fluidd on

Name: services.fluidd.nginx
Desc: Extra configuration for the nginx virtual host of fluidd.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.acmeFallbackHost
Desc:
Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful
if you want multiple hosts to be able to verify the same domain name.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.acmeRoot
Desc: Directory for the ACME challenge, which is <span class="strong"><strong>public

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,
configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.listen._.addr
Desc: Listen address.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.listen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.listen._.port
Desc:
Port number to listen on.
If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.listen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.listen._.ssl
Desc: Enable SSL.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.locations
Desc: Declarative location config

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.locations._name_.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.locations._name_.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.locations._name_.fastcgiParams
Desc:
FastCGI parameters to override.  Unlike in the Nginx
configuration file, overriding only some default parameters
won’t unset the default values for other parameters.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds index directive.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc:
Adds proxy_pass directive and sets recommended proxy headers if
recommendedProxySettings is enabled.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.locations._name_.proxyWebsockets
Desc: Whether to support proxying websocket connections with HTTP/1.1.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.locations._name_.recommendedProxySettings
Desc: Enable recommended proxy settings.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.locations._name_.return
Desc: Adds a return directive, for e.g. redirections.
Type: null or string or signed integer

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.locations._name_.root
Desc: Root directory for requests.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.locations._name_.tryFiles
Desc: Adds try_files directive.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.onlySSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.quic
Desc:
Whether to enable the QUIC transport protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.redirectCode
Desc: HTTP status used by <code class="literal">globalRedirect

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.rejectSSL
Desc:
Whether to listen for and reject all HTTPS connections to this vhost. Useful in
<a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.default'>default

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.reuseport
Desc:
Create an individual listening socket .
It is required to specify only once on one of the hosts.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.root
Desc: The path of the web root directory.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.serverAliases
Desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.serverName
Desc: Name of this virtual host. Defaults to attribute name in virtualHosts.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.sslCertificate
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.sslCertificateKey
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate key.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.sslTrustedCertificate
Desc: Path to root SSL certificate for stapling and client certificates.

Name: services.fluidd.nginx.useACMEHost
Desc:
A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

Name: services.foldingathome.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Folding@home client.

Name: services.foldingathome.package
Desc: The fahclient package to use.

Name: services.foldingathome.daemonNiceLevel
Desc:
Daemon process priority for FAHClient.
0 is the default Unix process priority, 19 is the lowest.

Name: services.foldingathome.extraArgs
Desc:
Extra startup options for the FAHClient. Run
<code class="literal">fah-client --help

Name: services.foldingathome.team
Desc:
The team ID associated with the reported computation results. This
will be used in the ranking statistics.

Name: services.foldingathome.user
Desc:
The user associated with the reported computation results. This will
be used in the ranking statistics.

Name: services.forgejo.enable

Desc: Base directory for custom templates and other options.

Name: services.forgejo.database.createDatabase
Desc: Whether to create a local database automatically.

Name: services.forgejo.database.host
Desc: Database host address.

Name: services.forgejo.database.name
Desc: Database name.

Name: services.forgejo.database.passwordFile
Desc:
A file containing the password corresponding to
<code class="option">services.forgejo.database.user

Desc: Path to the sqlite3 database file.

Name: services.forgejo.database.port
Desc: Database host port.

Name: services.forgejo.database.socket
Desc: Path to the unix socket file to use for authentication.

Name: services.forgejo.database.type

Name: services.forgejo.database.user
Desc: Database user.

Name: services.forgejo.dump.enable
Desc: Whether to enable periodic dumps via the <a class="link" href="https://forgejo.org/docs/latest/admin/command-line/#dump"  target="_top">built-in <span class="command"><strong>dump

Name: services.forgejo.dump.backupDir
Desc: Path to the directory where the dump archives will be stored.

Name: services.forgejo.dump.file
Desc: Filename to be used for the dump. If <code class="literal">null

Name: services.forgejo.dump.interval
Desc: Run a Forgejo dump at this interval. Runs by default at 04:31 every day.

Name: services.forgejo.dump.type
Desc: Archive format used to store the dump file.

Name: services.forgejo.group
Desc: Group under which Forgejo runs.

Name: services.forgejo.lfs.contentDir
Desc: Where to store LFS files.

Name: services.forgejo.repositoryRoot
Desc: Path to the git repositories.

Name: services.forgejo.secrets
Desc: This is a small wrapper over systemd’s <code class="literal">LoadCredential
Type: attribute set of attribute set of path

Name: services.forgejo.settings
Desc: Free-form settings written directly to the <code class="literal">app.ini
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: services.forgejo.settings.log.LEVEL
Desc: General log level.

Name: services.forgejo.settings.log.ROOT_PATH
Desc: Root path for log files.

Name: services.forgejo.settings.server.DISABLE_SSH
Desc: Disable external SSH feature.

Name: services.forgejo.settings.server.DOMAIN
Desc: Domain name of your server.

Name: services.forgejo.settings.server.HTTP_ADDR
Desc: Listen address. Must be a path when using a unix socket.

Name: services.forgejo.settings.server.HTTP_PORT
Desc: Listen port. Ignored when using a unix socket.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.forgejo.settings.server.PROTOCOL
Desc: Listen protocol. <code class="literal">+unix

Name: services.forgejo.settings.server.ROOT_URL
Desc: Full public URL of Forgejo server.

Name: services.forgejo.settings.server.SSH_PORT
Desc:
SSH port displayed in clone URL.
The option is required to configure a service when the external visible port
differs from the local listening port i.e. if port forwarding is used.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.forgejo.settings.server.STATIC_ROOT_PATH
