Name: services.forgejo.settings.session.COOKIE_SECURE
Desc:
Marks session cookies as “secure” as a hint for browsers to only send
them via HTTPS. This option is recommend, if Forgejo is being served over HTTPS.

Name: services.forgejo.stateDir
Desc: Forgejo data directory.

Name: services.forgejo.useWizard
Desc:
Whether to use the built-in installation wizard instead of
declaratively managing the <code class="filename">app.ini

Name: services.forgejo.user
Desc: User account under which Forgejo runs.

Name: services.foundationdb.enable
Desc: Whether to enable FoundationDB Server.

Name: services.foundationdb.package
Desc:
The FoundationDB package to use for this server. This must be specified by the user
in order to ensure migrations and upgrades are controlled appropriately.

Name: services.foundationdb.backupProcesses
Desc: Number of backup_agent processes to run for snapshots.

Name: services.foundationdb.class
Desc: Process class

Name: services.foundationdb.dataDir
Desc: Data directory. All cluster data will be put under here.

Name: services.foundationdb.extraReadWritePaths
Desc:
An extra set of filesystem paths that FoundationDB can read to
and write from. By default, FoundationDB runs under a heavily
namespaced systemd environment without write access to most of
the filesystem outside of its data and log directories. By
adding paths to this list, the set of writeable paths will be
expanded. This is useful for allowing e.g. backups to local files,
which must be performed on behalf of the foundationdb service.

Name: services.foundationdb.group
Desc: Group account under which FoundationDB runs.

Name: services.foundationdb.listenAddress
Desc: Publicly visible IP address of the process. Port is determined by process ID

Name: services.foundationdb.listenPortStart
Desc:
Starting port number for database listening sockets. Every FDB process binds to a
subsequent port, to this number reflects the start of the overall range. e.g. having
8 server processes will use all ports between 4500 and 4507.

Name: services.foundationdb.locality
Desc: FoundationDB locality settings.

Name: services.foundationdb.locality.dataHall
Desc:
Data hall identifier key. All processes physically located in a
data hall should share the id. If you are depending on data
hall based replication this must be set on all processes.

Name: services.foundationdb.locality.datacenterId
Desc:
Data center identifier key. All processes physically located in a
data center should share the id. If you are depending on data
center based replication this must be set on all processes.

Name: services.foundationdb.locality.machineId
Desc:
Machine identifier key. All processes on a machine should share a
unique id. By default, processes on a machine determine a unique id to share.
This does not generally need to be set.

Name: services.foundationdb.locality.zoneId
Desc:
Zone identifier key. Processes that share a zone id are
considered non-unique for the purposes of data replication.
If unset, defaults to machine id.

Name: services.foundationdb.logDir
Desc: Log directory.

Name: services.foundationdb.logSize
Desc:
Roll over to a new log file after the current log file
reaches the specified size.

Name: services.foundationdb.maxLogSize
Desc:
Delete the oldest log file when the total size of all log
files exceeds the specified size. If set to 0, old log files
will not be deleted.

Name: services.foundationdb.memory
Desc:
Maximum memory used by the process. The default value is
<code class="literal">8GiB

Name: services.foundationdb.openFirewall
Desc:
Open the firewall ports corresponding to FoundationDB processes and coordinators
using <code class="option">config.networking.firewall.*

Name: services.foundationdb.pidfile
Desc: Path to pidfile for fdbmonitor.

Name: services.foundationdb.publicAddress
Desc: Publicly visible IP address of the process. Port is determined by process ID

Name: services.foundationdb.restartDelay
Desc: Number of seconds to wait before restarting servers.

Name: services.foundationdb.serverProcesses
Desc: Number of fdbserver processes to run.

Name: services.foundationdb.storageMemory
Desc:
Maximum memory used for data storage. The default value is
<code class="literal">1GiB

Name: services.foundationdb.tls
Desc: FoundationDB Transport Security Layer (TLS) settings.

Name: services.foundationdb.tls.allowedPeers
Desc:
“Peer verification string”. This may be used to adjust which TLS
client certificates a server will accept, as a form of user
authorization; for example, it may only accept TLS clients who
offer a certificate abiding by some locality or organization name.

Name: services.foundationdb.tls.certificate
Desc:
Path to the TLS certificate file. This certificate will
be offered to, and may be verified by, clients.

Name: services.foundationdb.tls.key
Desc: Private key file for the certificate.

Name: services.foundationdb.traceFormat
Desc: Trace logging format.

Name: services.foundationdb.user
Desc: User account under which FoundationDB runs.

Name: services.fprintd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable fprintd daemon and PAM module for fingerprint readers handling.

Name: services.fprintd.package
Desc: fprintd package to use.
Default: if config.services.fprintd.tod.enable then pkgs.fprintd-tod else pkgs.fprintd

Name: services.fprintd.tod.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Touch OEM Drivers library support.

Name: services.fprintd.tod.driver
Desc: Touch OEM Drivers (TOD) package to use.

Name: services.fractalart.enable
Desc: Enable FractalArt for generating colorful wallpapers on login

Name: services.fractalart.height
Desc: Screen height

Name: services.fractalart.width
Desc: Screen width

Name: services.freeciv.enable
Desc: Whether to enable freeciv.

Name: services.freeciv.openFirewall

Name: services.fwupd.extraTrustedKeys
Desc: Installing a public key allows firmware signed with a matching private key to be recognized as trusted, which may require less authentication to install than for untrusted files. By default trusted firmware can be upgraded (but not downgraded) without the user or administrator password. Only very few keys are installed by default.

Whether Galene should listen in http or in https. If left as the default

Path to the server’s private key. The file is copied at runtime to
Galene’s data directory where it needs to reside.

Name: services.galene.recordingsDir
Desc: Recordings directory.

Name: services.galene.stateDir
Desc:
The directory where Galene stores its internal state. If left as the default
value this directory will automatically be created before the Galene server
starts, otherwise the sysadmin is responsible for ensuring the directory
exists with appropriate ownership and permissions.

Name: services.galene.staticDir
Desc: Web server directory.

Name: services.galene.turnAddress

Desc: User account under which galene runs.

Name: services.gancio.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Gancio, a shared agenda for local communities.

Name: services.gancio.package
Desc: The gancio package to use.

Name: services.gancio.nginx
Desc: Extra configuration for the nginx virtual host of gancio.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.gancio.nginx.acmeFallbackHost
Desc:
Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful
if you want multiple hosts to be able to verify the same domain name.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.acmeRoot
Desc: Directory for the ACME challenge, which is <span class="strong"><strong>public

Name: services.gancio.nginx.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.gancio.nginx.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.gancio.nginx.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.gancio.nginx.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,
configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.gancio.nginx.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.gancio.nginx.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.gancio.nginx.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.gancio.nginx.listen._.addr
Desc: Listen address.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.listen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.listen._.port
Desc:
Port number to listen on.
If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.gancio.nginx.listen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.listen._.ssl
Desc: Enable SSL.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.gancio.nginx.locations
Desc: Declarative location config

Name: services.gancio.nginx.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.locations._name_.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.locations._name_.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.gancio.nginx.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.locations._name_.fastcgiParams
Desc:
FastCGI parameters to override.  Unlike in the Nginx
configuration file, overriding only some default parameters
won’t unset the default values for other parameters.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds index directive.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.gancio.nginx.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc:
Adds proxy_pass directive and sets recommended proxy headers if
recommendedProxySettings is enabled.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.locations._name_.proxyWebsockets
Desc: Whether to support proxying websocket connections with HTTP/1.1.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.locations._name_.recommendedProxySettings
Desc: Enable recommended proxy settings.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.locations._name_.return
Desc: Adds a return directive, for e.g. redirections.
Type: null or string or signed integer

Name: services.gancio.nginx.locations._name_.root
Desc: Root directory for requests.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.locations._name_.tryFiles
Desc: Adds try_files directive.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.onlySSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.gancio.nginx.quic
Desc:
Whether to enable the QUIC transport protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.gancio.nginx.redirectCode
Desc: HTTP status used by <code class="literal">globalRedirect

Name: services.gancio.nginx.rejectSSL
Desc:
Whether to listen for and reject all HTTPS connections to this vhost. Useful in
<a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.default'>default

Name: services.gancio.nginx.reuseport
Desc:
Create an individual listening socket .
It is required to specify only once on one of the hosts.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.root
Desc: The path of the web root directory.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.serverAliases
Desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.serverName
Desc: Name of this virtual host. Defaults to attribute name in virtualHosts.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.sslCertificate
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.sslCertificateKey
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate key.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.sslTrustedCertificate
Desc: Path to root SSL certificate for stapling and client certificates.

Name: services.gancio.nginx.useACMEHost
Desc:
A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

Name: services.gancio.plugins
Desc: Paths of gancio plugins to activate (linked under $WorkingDirectory/plugins/).

Name: services.gancio.settings
Desc: Configuration for Gancio, see <a class="link" href="https://gancio.org/install/config"  target="_top">https://gancio.org/install/config

Name: services.gancio.settings.baseurl
Desc: The full URL under which the server is reachable.

Name: services.gancio.settings.db.database
Desc: Name of the PostgreSQL database

Name: services.gancio.settings.db.dialect
Desc: The database dialect to use

Name: services.gancio.settings.db.host
Desc: Connection string for the PostgreSQL database

Name: services.gancio.settings.db.storage
Desc: Location for the SQLite database.

Name: services.gancio.settings.hostname
Desc: The domain name under which the server is reachable.

Name: services.gancio.settings.log_level
Desc: Gancio log level.

Name: services.gancio.settings.log_path
Desc: Directory Gancio logs into

Name: services.gancio.settings.server.socket
Desc: The unix socket for the gancio server to listen on.

Name: services.gancio.user
Desc: The user (and PostgreSQL database name) used to run the gancio server

Name: services.gancio.userLocale

Name: services.gpsd.readonly
Desc:
Whether to enable the broken-device-safety, otherwise
known as read-only mode.  Some popular bluetooth and USB
receivers lock up or become totally inaccessible when
probed or reconfigured.  This switch prevents gpsd from
writing to a receiver.  This means that gpsd cannot
configure the receiver for optimal performance, but it
also means that gpsd cannot break the receiver.  A better
solution would be for Bluetooth to not be so fragile.  A
platform independent method to identify
serial-over-Bluetooth devices would also be nice.

Name: services.grafana.settings.security.cookie_secure
Desc: Set to <code class="literal">true

Name: services.grafana.settings.security.csrf_additional_headers
Desc:
List of allowed headers to be set by the user.
Suggested to use for if authentication lives behind reverse proxies.

Name: services.grafana.settings.security.csrf_trusted_origins
Desc:
List of additional allowed URLs to pass by the CSRF check.
Suggested when authentication comes from an IdP.

Name: services.grafana.settings.security.data_source_proxy_whitelist
Desc:
Define a whitelist of allowed IP addresses or domains, with ports,
to be used in data source URLs with the Grafana data source proxy.
Format: <code class="literal">ip_or_domain:port

Name: services.grafana.settings.security.disable_brute_force_login_protection
Desc: Set to <code class="literal">true

Name: services.grafana.settings.security.disable_gravatar
Desc: Set to <code class="literal">true

Name: services.grafana.settings.security.disable_initial_admin_creation
Desc: Disable creation of admin user on first start of Grafana.

Name: services.grafana.settings.security.secret_key
Desc:
Secret key used for signing. Please note that the contents of this option
will end up in a world-readable Nix store. Use the file provider
pointing at a reasonably secured file in the local filesystem
to work around that. Look at the documentation for details:
<a class="link" href="https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/setup-grafana/configure-grafana/#file-provider"  target="_top">https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/setup-grafana/configure-grafana/#file-provider

Name: services.grafana.settings.security.strict_transport_security
Desc: Set to <code class="literal">true

Name: services.grafana.settings.security.strict_transport_security_max_age_seconds
Desc:
Sets how long a browser should cache HSTS in seconds.
Only applied if <code class="literal">strict_transport_security

Name: services.grafana.settings.security.strict_transport_security_preload
Desc: Set to <code class="literal">true

Name: services.grafana.settings.security.strict_transport_security_subdomains
Desc: Set to <code class="literal">true

Name: services.grafana.settings.security.x_content_type_options
Desc: Set to <code class="literal">false

Name: services.grafana.settings.security.x_xss_protection
Desc: Set to <code class="literal">false

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.enable_gzip
Desc: Set this option to <code class="literal">true

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.cdn_url
Desc:
Specify a full HTTP URL address to the root of your Grafana CDN assets.
Grafana will add edition and version paths.

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.cert_file
Desc: Path to the certificate file (if <code class="literal">protocol

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.cert_key
Desc: Path to the certificate key file (if <code class="literal">protocol

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.domain
Desc: The public facing domain name used to access grafana from a browser.

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.enforce_domain
Desc:
Redirect to correct domain if the host header does not match the domain.
Prevents DNS rebinding attacks.

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.http_addr
Desc: Listening address.

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.http_port
Desc: Listening port.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.protocol
Desc: Which protocol to listen.

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.read_timeout
Desc:
Sets the maximum time using a duration format (5s/5m/5ms)
before timing out read of an incoming request and closing idle connections.
0 means there is no timeout for reading the request.

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.root_url
Desc:
This is the full URL used to access Grafana from a web browser.
This is important if you use Google or GitHub OAuth authentication (for the callback URL to be correct).

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.router_logging
Desc: Set to <code class="literal">true

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.serve_from_sub_path
Desc: Serve Grafana from subpath specified in the <code class="literal">root_url

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.socket
Desc: Path where the socket should be created when <code class="literal">protocol=socket

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.socket_gid
Desc: GID where the socket should be set when <code class="literal">protocol=socket

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.socket_mode
Desc: Mode where the socket should be set when <code class="literal">protocol=socket

Name: services.grafana.settings.server.static_root_path
Desc: Root path for static assets.

Name: services.grafana.settings.smtp.enabled
Desc: Whether to enable SMTP.

Name: services.grafana.settings.smtp.cert_file
Desc: File path to a cert file.

Name: services.grafana.settings.smtp.ehlo_identity
Desc: Name to be used as client identity for EHLO in SMTP dialog.

Name: services.grafana.settings.smtp.from_address
Desc: Address used when sending out emails.

Name: services.grafana.settings.smtp.from_name
Desc: Name to be used as client identity for EHLO in SMTP dialog.

Name: services.grafana.settings.smtp.host
Desc: Host to connect to.

Name: services.grafana.settings.smtp.key_file
Desc: File path to a key file.

Name: services.grafana.settings.smtp.password
Desc:
Password used for authentication. Please note that the contents of this option
will end up in a world-readable Nix store. Use the file provider
pointing at a reasonably secured file in the local filesystem
to work around that. Look at the documentation for details:
<a class="link" href="https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/setup-grafana/configure-grafana/#file-provider"  target="_top">https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/setup-grafana/configure-grafana/#file-provider

Name: services.grafana.settings.smtp.skip_verify
Desc: Verify SSL for SMTP server.

Name: services.grafana.settings.smtp.startTLS_policy
Desc: StartTLS policy when connecting to server.

Name: services.grafana.settings.smtp.user
Desc: User used for authentication.

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.allow_org_create
Desc: Set to <code class="literal">false

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.allow_sign_up
Desc:
Set to false to prohibit users from being able to sign up / create user accounts.
The admin user can still create users.

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.auto_assign_org
Desc: Set to <code class="literal">true

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.auto_assign_org_id
Desc:
Set this value to automatically add new users to the provided org.
This requires <code class="literal">auto_assign_org

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.auto_assign_org_role
Desc: The role new users will be assigned for the main organization (if the <code class="literal">auto_assign_org

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.default_language
Desc: This setting configures the default UI language, which must be a supported IETF language tag, such as <code class="literal">en-US

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.default_theme
Desc: Sets the default UI theme. <code class="literal">system

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.editors_can_admin
Desc: Editors can administrate dashboards, folders and teams they create.

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.hidden_users
Desc:
This is a comma-separated list of usernames.
Users specified here are hidden in the Grafana UI.
They are still visible to Grafana administrators and to themselves.

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.home_page
Desc:
Path to a custom home page.
Users are only redirected to this if the default home dashboard is used.
It should match a frontend route and contain a leading slash.

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.login_hint
Desc: Text used as placeholder text on login page for login/username input.

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.password_hint
Desc: Text used as placeholder text on login page for password input.

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.user_invite_max_lifetime_duration
Desc:
The duration in time a user invitation remains valid before expiring.
This setting should be expressed as a duration.
Examples: <code class="literal">6h

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.verify_email_enabled
Desc: Require email validation before sign up completes.

Name: services.grafana.settings.users.viewers_can_edit
Desc:
Viewers can access and use Explore and perform temporary edits on panels in dashboards they have access to.
They cannot save their changes.

Desc: Directory used to store Graylog server state.

Name: services.graylog.elasticsearchHosts
Desc: List of valid URIs of the http ports of your elastic nodes. If one or more of your elasticsearch hosts require authentication, include the credentials in each node URI that requires authentication

Desc: Any other configuration options you might want to add

Name: services.graylog.isMaster
Desc: Whether this is the master instance of your Graylog cluster

Desc: The directory which will be used to store the message journal. The directory must be exclusively used by Graylog and must not contain any other files than the ones created by Graylog itself

Name: services.graylog.passwordSecret
Desc:
You MUST set a secret to secure/pepper the stored user passwords here. Use at least 64 characters.
Generate one by using for example: pwgen -N 1 -s 96

Name: services.graylog.plugins
Desc: Extra graylog plugins

Name: services.graylog.rootPasswordSha2
Desc:
You MUST specify a hash password for the root user (which you only need to initially set up the
system and in case you lose connectivity to your authentication backend)
This password cannot be changed using the API or via the web interface. If you need to change it,
modify it here.
Create one by using for example: echo -n yourpassword | shasum -a 256
and use the resulting hash value as string for the option

Whether to restart greetd when it terminates (e.g. on failure).
This is usually desirable so a user can always log in, but should be disabled when using ‘settings.initial_session’ (autologin),
because every greetd restart will trigger the autologin again.

Each prefix consists of either an IPv4 or IPv6 address,

Each prefix consists of either an IPv4 or IPv6 address,
and the associated prefix length, delimited by a slash.

client - i.e., subnets of 100.64.0.0/10 and fd7a:115c:a1e0::/48.

Desc: Whether to enable hickory-dns.

Name: services.hickory-dns.package
Desc:
The hickory-dns package to use. ::: {.note}
The package must provide <code class="literal">meta.mainProgram

Log DEBUG, INFO, WARN and ERROR messages.
This option is mutually exclusive with the <code class="literal">debug

Name: services.hickory-dns.quiet

Log ERROR level messages only.

Name: services.hickory-dns.settings

Settings for hickory-dns. The options enumerated here are not exhaustive.
Refer to upstream documentation for all available options:

Name: services.hickory-dns.settings.directory

The directory in which hickory-dns should look for .zone files,
whenever zones aren’t specified by absolute path.

Name: services.hickory-dns.settings.listen_addrs_ipv4
Desc: List of ipv4 addresses on which to listen for DNS queries.

Name: services.hickory-dns.settings.listen_addrs_ipv6

Name: services.hickory-dns.settings.listen_port
Desc: Port to listen on (applies to all listen addresses).
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.hickory-dns.settings.zones
Desc: List of zones to serve.
Type: list of ((submodule) or string convertible to it)

Name: services.hickory-dns.settings.zones._.file
Desc:
Path to the .zone file.
If not fully-qualified, this path will be interpreted relative to the <code class="literal">directory

Name: services.hickory-dns.settings.zones._.zone
Desc: Zone name, like “example.com”, “localhost”, or “0.0.127.in-addr.arpa”.

Name: services.hickory-dns.settings.zones._.zone_type
Desc: One of:

Path the service has access to. If left as the default value this

Name: services.hologram-server.roleAttr

Name: services.home-assistant.enable

Name: services.home-assistant.extraPackages

Name: services.home-assistant.lovelaceConfig

Password for admin account.

Additional command-line arguments to pass to

Name: services.hostapd.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable hostapd, a user space daemon for access point and
authentication servers. It implements IEEE 802.11 access point management,
IEEE 802.1X/WPA/WPA2/EAP Authenticators, RADIUS client, EAP server, and RADIUS
authentication server
.

Name: services.hostapd.package
Desc: The hostapd package to use.

Name: services.hostapd.radios
Desc:
This option allows you to define APs for one or multiple physical radios.
At least one radio must be specified.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.band
Desc:
Specifies the frequency band to use, possible values are 2g for 2.4 GHz,
5g for 5 GHz, 6g for 6 GHz and 60g for 60 GHz.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.channel
Desc:
The channel to operate on. Use 0 to enable ACS (Automatic Channel Selection).
Beware that not every device supports ACS in which case <span class="command"><strong>hostapd

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.countryCode
Desc:
Country code (ISO/IEC 3166-1). Used to set regulatory domain.
Set as needed to indicate country in which device is operating.
This can limit available channels and transmit power.
These two octets are used as the first two octets of the Country String
(dot11CountryString).

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.driver
Desc: The driver <span class="command"><strong>hostapd

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.dynamicConfigScripts
Desc:
All of these scripts will be executed in lexicographical order before hostapd
is started, right after the global segment was generated and may dynamically
append global options the generated configuration file.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks
Desc:
This defines a BSS, colloquially known as a WiFi network.
You have to specify at least one.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.apIsolate
Desc:
Isolate traffic between stations (clients) and prevent them from
communicating with each other.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.authentication.enableRecommendedPairwiseCiphers
Desc:
Additionally enable the recommended set of pairwise ciphers.
This enables newer secure ciphers, additionally to those defined in <code class="option">pairwiseCiphers

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.authentication.mode
Desc: Selects the authentication mode for this AP.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.authentication.pairwiseCiphers
Desc:
Set of accepted cipher suites (encryption algorithms) for pairwise keys (unicast packets).
By default this allows just CCMP, which is the only commonly supported secure option.
Use <code class="option">enableRecommendedPairwiseCiphers

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.authentication.saeAddToMacAllow
Desc:
If set, all sae password entries that have a non-wildcard MAC associated to
them will additionally be used to populate the MAC allow list. This is
additional to any entries set via <code class="option">macAllow

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.authentication.saePasswords
Desc: Sets allowed passwords for WPA3-SAE.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.authentication.saePasswords._.id
Desc:
If this attribute is given with non-zero length, it will set the password identifier
for this entry. It can then only be used with that identifier.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.authentication.saePasswords._.mac
Desc: If this attribute is not included, or if is set to the wildcard address (<code class="literal">ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.authentication.saePasswords._.password
Desc:
The password for this entry. SAE technically imposes no restrictions on
password length or character set. But due to limitations of <span class="command"><strong>hostapd

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.authentication.saePasswords._.pk
Desc:
If this attribute is given, SAE-PK will be enabled for this connection.
This prevents evil-twin attacks, but a public key is required additionally to connect.
(Essentially adds pubkey authentication such that the client can verify identity of the AP)

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.authentication.saePasswords._.vlanid
Desc: If this attribute is given, all clients using this entry will get tagged with the given VLAN ID.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.authentication.saePasswordsFile
Desc: Sets the password for WPA3-SAE. Follows the same rules as <code class="option">saePasswords

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.authentication.wpaPassword
Desc:
Sets the password for WPA-PSK that will be converted to the pre-shared key.
The password length must be in the range [8, 63] characters. While some devices
may allow arbitrary characters (such as UTF-8) to be used, but the standard specifies
that each character in the passphrase must be an ASCII character in the range [0x20, 0x7e]
(IEEE Std. 802.11i-2004, Annex H.4.1). Use emojis at your own risk.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.authentication.wpaPasswordFile
Desc: Sets the password for WPA-PSK. Follows the same rules as <code class="option">wpaPassword

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.authentication.wpaPskFile
Desc: Sets the password(s) for WPA-PSK. Similar to <code class="option">wpaPasswordFile

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.bssid
Desc:
Specifies the BSSID for this BSS. Usually determined automatically,
but for now you have to manually specify them when using multiple BSS.
Try assigning related addresses from the locally administered MAC address ranges,
by reusing the hardware address but replacing the second nibble with 2, 6, A or E.
(e.g. if real address is <code class="literal">XX:XX:XX:XX:XX

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.dynamicConfigScripts
Desc:
All of these scripts will be executed in lexicographical order before hostapd
is started, right after the bss segment was generated and may dynamically
append bss options to the generated configuration file.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.group
Desc: Members of this group can access the control socket for this interface.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.ignoreBroadcastSsid
Desc:
Send empty SSID in beacons and ignore probe request frames that do not
specify full SSID, i.e., require stations to know SSID. Note that this does
not increase security, since your clients will then broadcast the SSID instead,
which can increase congestion.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.logLevel
Desc:
Levels (minimum value for logged events):
0 = verbose debugging
1 = debugging
2 = informational messages
3 = notification
4 = warning

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.macAcl
Desc: Station MAC address -based authentication. The following modes are available:

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.macAllow
Desc: Specifies the MAC addresses to allow if <code class="option">macAcl

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.macAllowFile
Desc: Specifies a file containing the MAC addresses to allow if <code class="option">macAcl

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.macDeny
Desc: Specifies the MAC addresses to deny if <code class="option">macAcl

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.macDenyFile
Desc: Specifies a file containing the MAC addresses to deny if <code class="option">macAcl

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.settings
Desc:
Extra configuration options to put at the end of this BSS’s defintion in the
hostapd.conf for the associated interface. To find out which options are global
and which are per-bss you have to read hostapd’s source code, which is non-trivial
and not documented otherwise.
Type: attribute set of (atom (bool, int or string) or a list of them for duplicate keys)

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.ssid
Desc: SSID to be used in IEEE 802.11 management frames.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.networks._name_.utf8Ssid
Desc: Whether the SSID is to be interpreted using UTF-8 encoding.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.noScan
Desc:
Disables scan for overlapping BSSs in HT40+/- mode.
Caution: turning this on will likely violate regulatory requirements!

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.settings
Desc:
Extra configuration options to put at the end of global initialization, before defining BSSs.
To find out which options are global and which are per-bss you have to read hostapd’s source code,
which is non-trivial and not documented otherwise.
Type: attribute set of (atom (bool, int or string) or a list of them for duplicate keys)

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi4.enable
Desc:
Enables support for IEEE 802.11n (WiFi 4, HT).
This is enabled by default, since the vase majority of devices
are expected to support this.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi4.capabilities
Desc:
HT (High Throughput) capabilities given as a list of flags.
Please refer to the hostapd documentation for allowed values and
only set values supported by your physical adapter.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi4.require
Desc: Require stations (clients) to support WiFi 4 (HT) and disassociate them if they don’t.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi5.enable
Desc: Enables support for IEEE 802.11ac (WiFi 5, VHT)

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi5.capabilities
Desc:
VHT (Very High Throughput) capabilities given as a list of flags.
Please refer to the hostapd documentation for allowed values and
only set values supported by your physical adapter.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi5.operatingChannelWidth
Desc: Determines the operating channel width for VHT.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi5.require
Desc: Require stations (clients) to support WiFi 5 (VHT) and disassociate them if they don’t.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi6.enable
Desc: Enables support for IEEE 802.11ax (WiFi 6, HE)

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi6.multiUserBeamformer
Desc: HE multi user beamformee support

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi6.operatingChannelWidth
Desc: Determines the operating channel width for HE.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi6.require
Desc: Require stations (clients) to support WiFi 6 (HE) and disassociate them if they don’t.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi6.singleUserBeamformee
Desc: HE single user beamformee support

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi6.singleUserBeamformer
Desc: HE single user beamformer support

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi7.enable
Desc:
Enables support for IEEE 802.11be (WiFi 7, EHT). This is currently experimental
and requires you to manually enable CONFIG_IEEE80211BE when building hostapd.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi7.multiUserBeamformer
Desc: EHT multi user beamformee support

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi7.operatingChannelWidth
Desc: Determines the operating channel width for EHT.

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi7.singleUserBeamformee
Desc: EHT single user beamformee support

Name: services.hostapd.radios._name_.wifi7.singleUserBeamformer
Desc: EHT single user beamformer support

Name: services.hound.enable
Desc: Whether to enable hound.

Name: services.hound.package
Desc: The hound package to use.

Name: services.hound.group
Desc: Group the hound daemon should execute under.

Name: services.hound.home
Desc:
The path to use as hound’s $HOME.
If the default user “hound” is configured then this is the home of the “hound” user.

Name: services.hound.listen
Desc: Listen on this [IP]:port

Name: services.htpdate.enable

Desc: Additional command line arguments to pass to htpdate.

Name: services.httpd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Apache HTTP Server.

Name: services.httpd.enableMellon
Desc: Whether to enable the mod_auth_mellon module.

Name: services.httpd.enablePHP
Desc: Whether to enable the PHP module.

Name: services.httpd.enablePerl
Desc: Whether to enable the Perl module (mod_perl).

Name: services.httpd.package
Desc: The apacheHttpd package to use.

Name: services.httpd.adminAddr
Desc: E-mail address of the server administrator.

Name: services.httpd.configFile
Desc:
Override the configuration file used by Apache. By default,
NixOS generates one automatically.

Name: services.httpd.extraConfig
Desc:
Configuration lines appended to the generated Apache
configuration file. Note that this mechanism will not work
when <code class="option">configFile

Name: services.httpd.extraModules
Desc:
Additional Apache modules to be used. These can be
specified as a string in the case of modules distributed
with Apache, or as an attribute set specifying the
<code class="varname">name

Name: services.httpd.group
Desc: Group under which httpd children processes run.

Name: services.httpd.logDir
Desc: Directory for Apache’s log files. It is created automatically.

Name: services.httpd.logFormat
Desc:
Log format for log files. Possible values are: combined, common, referer, agent, none.
See <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/logs.html"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/logs.html

Name: services.httpd.logPerVirtualHost
Desc:
If enabled, each virtual host gets its own
<code class="filename">access.log

Name: services.httpd.maxClients
Desc: Maximum number of httpd processes (prefork)

Name: services.httpd.maxRequestsPerChild
Desc: Maximum number of httpd requests answered per httpd child (prefork), 0 means unlimited.

Name: services.httpd.mpm
Desc:
Multi-processing module to be used by Apache. Available
modules are <code class="literal">prefork

Name: services.httpd.phpOptions
Desc: Options appended to the PHP configuration file <code class="filename">php.ini

Name: services.httpd.phpPackage
Desc: The php package to use.

Name: services.httpd.sslCiphers
Desc: Cipher Suite available for negotiation in SSL proxy handshake.

Name: services.httpd.sslProtocols
Desc: Allowed SSL/TLS protocol versions.

Name: services.httpd.user
Desc: User account under which httpd children processes run.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts
Desc:
Specification of the virtual hosts served by Apache. Each
element should be an attribute set specifying the
configuration of the virtual host.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.enableUserDir
Desc: Whether to enable serving <code class="filename">~/public_html

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.acmeRoot
Desc:
Directory for the acme challenge which is PUBLIC, don’t put certs or keys in here.
Set to null to inherit from config.security.acme.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.adminAddr
Desc: E-mail address of the server administrator.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.documentRoot
Desc:
The path of Apache’s document root directory.  If left undefined,
an empty directory in the Nix store will be used as root.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.extraConfig
Desc:
These lines go to httpd.conf verbatim. They will go after
directories and directory aliases defined by default.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that permanently redirects (301)
all plain HTTP traffic to HTTPS. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected permanently to
the given URL.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.hostName
Desc: Canonical hostname for the server.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTP 2. HTTP/2 is supported in all multi-processing modules that come with httpd. <span class="emphasis"><em>However, if you use the prefork mpm, there will
be severe restrictions.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.listen
Desc: Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.listen._.ip
Desc: IP to listen on. 0.0.0.0 for IPv4 only, * for all.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.listen._.port
Desc: Port to listen on
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.listen._.ssl
Desc: Whether to enable SSL (https) support.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.locations
Desc: Declarative location config. See <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/core.html#location"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/core.html#location

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests. See <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_alias.html#alias"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_alias.html#alias

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds DirectoryIndex directive. See <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_dir.html#directoryindex"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_dir.html#directoryindex

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc: Sets up a simple reverse proxy as described by <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/howto/reverse_proxy.html#simple"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/howto/reverse_proxy.html#simple

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.logFormat
Desc: Log format for Apache’s log files. Possible values are: combined, common, referer, agent.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.onlySSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.robotsEntries
Desc: Specification of pages to be ignored by web crawlers. See <a class="link" href="http://www.robotstxt.org/"  target="_top">http://www.robotstxt.org/

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.servedDirs
Desc: This option provides a simple way to serve static directories.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.servedFiles
Desc: This option provides a simple way to serve individual, static files.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.serverAliases
Desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.sslServerCert
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.sslServerChain
Desc: Path to server SSL chain file.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.sslServerKey
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate key.

Name: services.httpd.virtualHosts._name_.useACMEHost
Desc:
A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

Name: services.https-dns-proxy.enable
Desc: Whether to enable https-dns-proxy daemon.

Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

https_dns_proxy will by default use IPv6 and fail if it is not available.
To play it safe, we choose IPv4.

Name: services.https-dns-proxy.provider.ips
Desc: The custom provider IPs

Name: services.https-dns-proxy.provider.kind
Desc:
The upstream provider to use or custom in case you do not trust any of

Name: services.https-dns-proxy.provider.url

Desc: Directory that holds Hydra garbage collector roots.

Desc: The base URL for the Hydra webserver instance. Used for links in emails.

Desc: Path to a file containing the logo of your Hydra instance.

Name: services.hydra.minimumDiskFreeEvaluator
Desc: Threshold of minimum disk space (GiB) to determine if the evaluator should run or not.

Name: services.hydra.notificationSender
Desc: Sender email address used for email notifications.

Desc: TCP port the web server should listen to.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Desc: Piece of HTML that is included on all pages.

Name: services.hydra.useSubstitutes
Desc:
Whether to use binary caches for downloading store paths. Note that
binary substitutions trigger (a potentially large number of) additional
HTTP requests that slow down the queue monitor thread significantly.
Also, this Hydra instance will serve those downloaded store paths to
its users with its own signature attached as if it had built them
itself, so don’t enable this feature unless your active binary caches
are absolute trustworthy.

Attribute set of default values for
modem config files <code class="filename">etc/config.*

Purge old files from the spooling area with
<code class="filename">faxcron

Whether to enable purging old files from the spooling area with

Set the job
age threshold (in minutes) that controls how long

Attribute set of lines for the global

Desc:
Description of installed modems.
At least on modem must be defined

Name: services.hylafax.modems._name_.config
Desc:
Attribute set of values for the given modem.
Values can be either strings or integers
(which will be added to the config file verbatimly)
or lists thereof
(which will be translated to multiple
lines with the same configuration key).
Boolean values are translated to “Yes” or “No”.
The default contains some reasonable
configuration to yield an operational system.
Type: attribute set of ((list of ((string or signed integer convertible to it) or boolean convertible to it)) or ((string or signed integer convertible to it) or boolean convertible to it) convertible to it)

Name: services.hylafax.modems._name_.name

Name of modem device,
will be searched for in <code class="filename">/dev

Name of modem configuration file,
will be searched for in <code class="filename">config

Whether to enable the Jenkins Job Builder (JJB) service. It

User token in Jenkins used to reload config.
WARNING: This token will be world readable in the Nix store. To keep

Desc: File containing the API token for the <code class="option">accessUser

Name: services.jenkins.jobBuilder.accessUser

Specifies the bind address on which the jenkins HTTP interface listens.

A set of plugins to activate. Note that this will completely

Desc:
Specifies a urlPrefix to use with jenkins.
If the example /jenkins is given, the jenkins server will be

Desc: User the jenkins server should execute under.

If true the system will be configured to work as a jenkins slave.
If the system is also configured to work as a jenkins master then this has no effect.

If the default slave agent user “jenkins” is configured then this is

Desc:
The path to use as JENKINS_HOME. If the default user “jenkins” is configured then

Desc: SHA-256 of the desired administration password. Leave blank/unset for no password.

Desc: Jirefeau configuration. Refer to <a class="link" href="https://gitlab.com/mojo42/Jirafeau/-/blob/4.4.0/lib/config.original.php"  target="_top">https://gitlab.com/mojo42/Jirafeau/-/blob/4.4.0/lib/config.original.php

Desc: URL of instance. Must have trailing slash.

Timeout for reading client request bodies and headers. Refer to
<a class="link" href="http://nginx.org/en/docs/http/ngx_http_core_module.html#client_body_timeout"  target="_top">http://nginx.org/en/docs/http/ngx_http_core_module.html#client_body_timeout

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig
Desc: Extra configuration for the nginx virtual host of Jirafeau.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.acmeFallbackHost
Desc:
Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful
if you want multiple hosts to be able to verify the same domain name.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.acmeRoot
Desc: Directory for the ACME challenge, which is <span class="strong"><strong>public

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,
configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.listen._.addr
Desc: Listen address.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.listen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.listen._.port
Desc:
Port number to listen on.
If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.listen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.listen._.ssl
Desc: Enable SSL.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.locations
Desc: Declarative location config

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.locations._name_.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.locations._name_.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.locations._name_.fastcgiParams
Desc:
FastCGI parameters to override.  Unlike in the Nginx
configuration file, overriding only some default parameters
won’t unset the default values for other parameters.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds index directive.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc:
Adds proxy_pass directive and sets recommended proxy headers if
recommendedProxySettings is enabled.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.locations._name_.proxyWebsockets
Desc: Whether to support proxying websocket connections with HTTP/1.1.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.locations._name_.recommendedProxySettings
Desc: Enable recommended proxy settings.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.locations._name_.return
Desc: Adds a return directive, for e.g. redirections.
Type: null or string or signed integer

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.locations._name_.root
Desc: Root directory for requests.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.locations._name_.tryFiles
Desc: Adds try_files directive.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.onlySSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.quic
Desc:
Whether to enable the QUIC transport protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.redirectCode
Desc: HTTP status used by <code class="literal">globalRedirect

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.rejectSSL
Desc:
Whether to listen for and reject all HTTPS connections to this vhost. Useful in
<a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.default'>default

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.reuseport
Desc:
Create an individual listening socket .
It is required to specify only once on one of the hosts.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.root
Desc: The path of the web root directory.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.serverAliases
Desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.serverName
Desc: Name of this virtual host. Defaults to attribute name in virtualHosts.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.sslCertificate
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.sslCertificateKey
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate key.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.sslTrustedCertificate
Desc: Path to root SSL certificate for stapling and client certificates.

Name: services.jirafeau.nginxConfig.useACMEHost
Desc:
A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

Name: services.jirafeau.poolConfig
Desc: Options for Jirafeau PHP pool. See documentation on <code class="literal">php-fpm.conf
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

Desc: Videobridge configuration.

Addresses of public STUN services to use to automatically find
the public and local addresses of this Jitsi-Videobridge instance

Desc: Local address to assume when running behind NAT.

Name: services.jitsi-videobridge.xmppConfigs._name_.hostName

Videobridges use the same XMPP account and need to be distinguished by the

Name: services.jitsi-videobridge.xmppConfigs._name_.userName

Name: services.jitterentropy-rngd.enable

Name: services.jmusicbot.stateDir
Desc:
The directory where config.txt and serversettings.json is saved.
If left as the default value this directory will automatically be created before JMusicBot starts, otherwise the sysadmin is responsible for ensuring the directory exists with appropriate ownership and permissions.
Untouched by the value of this option config.txt needs to be placed manually into this directory.

Name: services.jotta-cli.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Jottacloud Command-line Tool.

Name: services.jotta-cli.package
Desc: The jotta-cli package to use.

Name: services.journalbeat.extraConfig
Desc: Any other configuration options you want to add

Name: services.journalbeat.name
Desc: Name of the beat

Name: services.journalbeat.stateDir
Desc: Directory below <code class="literal">/var/lib/

Name: services.journalbeat.tags
Desc: Tags to place on the shipped log messages

Name: services.journald.console
Desc: If non-empty, write log messages to the specified TTY device.

Name: services.journald.extraConfig
Desc: Extra config options for systemd-journald. See <a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/journald.conf.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">journald.conf

Name: services.journald.forwardToSyslog
Desc: Whether to forward log messages to syslog.

Name: services.journald.gateway.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the HTTP gateway to the journal.

Name: services.journald.gateway.cert
Desc: The path to a file or <code class="literal">AF_UNIX

Name: services.journald.gateway.key
Desc: Specify the path to a file or <code class="literal">AF_UNIX

Name: services.journald.gateway.merge
Desc:
Serve entries interleaved from all available journals, including other
machines.

Name: services.journald.gateway.port
Desc: The port to listen to.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.journald.gateway.system
Desc: Serve entries from system services and the kernel.

Name: services.journald.gateway.trust
Desc: Specify the path to a file or <code class="literal">AF_UNIX

Name: services.journald.gateway.user
Desc: Serve entries from services for the current user.

Name: services.journald.rateLimitBurst
Desc:
Configures the rate limiting burst limit (number of messages per
interval) that is applied to all messages generated on the system.
This rate limiting is applied per-service, so that two services
which log do not interfere with each other’s limit.

Name: services.journald.rateLimitInterval
Desc:
Configures the rate limiting interval that is applied to all
messages generated on the system. This rate limiting is applied
per-service, so that two services which log do not interfere with
each other’s limit. The value may be specified in the following
units: s, min, h, ms, us. To turn off any kind of rate limiting,
set either value to 0.

Name: services.journald.remote.enable
Desc: Whether to enable receiving systemd journals from the network.

Name: services.journald.remote.listen
Desc: Which protocol to listen to.

Name: services.journald.remote.output
Desc: The location of the output journal.

Name: services.journald.remote.port
Desc: The port to listen to.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.journald.remote.settings
Desc:
Configuration in the journal-remote configuration file. See
<a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/journal-remote.conf.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">journal-remote.conf
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string) or a list of them for duplicate keys)

Name: services.journald.remote.settings.Remote.Seal
Desc:
Periodically sign the data in the journal using Forward Secure
Sealing.

Name: services.journald.remote.settings.Remote.ServerCertificateFile
Desc: A path to a SSL certificate file in PEM format.

Name: services.journald.remote.settings.Remote.ServerKeyFile
Desc: A path to a SSL secret key file in PEM format.

Name: services.journald.remote.settings.Remote.SplitMode
Desc:
With “host”, a separate output file is used, based on the
hostname of the other endpoint of a connection. With “none”, only
one output journal file is used.

Name: services.journald.remote.settings.Remote.TrustedCertificateFile
Desc: A path to a SSL CA certificate file in PEM format, or <code class="literal">all

Name: services.journald.storage
Desc:
Controls where to store journal data. See
<a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/journald.conf.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">journald.conf

Name: services.journald.upload.enable
Desc: Whether to enable uploading the systemd journal to a remote server.

Name: services.journald.upload.settings
Desc: Configuration for journal-upload. See <a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/journal-upload.conf.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">journal-upload.conf
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string) or a list of them for duplicate keys)

Name: services.journald.upload.settings.Upload.NetworkTimeoutSec
Desc:
When network connectivity to the server is lost, this option
configures the time to wait for the connectivity to get restored.

Name: services.journald.upload.settings.Upload.ServerCertificateFile
Desc: SSL CA certificate in PEM format.

Name: services.journald.upload.settings.Upload.ServerKeyFile
Desc: SSL key in PEM format.

Name: services.journald.upload.settings.Upload.TrustedCertificateFile
Desc: SSL CA certificate.

Name: services.journald.upload.settings.Upload.URL
Desc: The URL to upload the journal entries to.

Name: services.journaldriver.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable journaldriver to forward journald logs to
Stackdriver Logging.

Name: services.journaldriver.applicationCredentials
Desc:
Path to the service account private key (in JSON-format) used
to forward log entries to Stackdriver Logging on non-GCP
instances.

Name: services.journaldriver.googleCloudProject
Desc:
Configures the name of the Google Cloud project to which to
forward journald logs.

Name: services.journaldriver.logLevel
Desc: Log level at which journaldriver logs its own output.

Name: services.journaldriver.logName
Desc:
Configures the name of the target log in Stackdriver Logging.
This option can be set to, for example, the hostname of a
machine to improve the user experience in the logging
overview.

Name: services.journaldriver.logStream
Desc:
Configures the name of the Stackdriver Logging log stream into
which to write journald entries.

Name: services.journalwatch.enable
Desc: If enabled, periodically check the journal with journalwatch and report the results by mail.

Name: services.journalwatch.package
Desc: The journalwatch package to use.

Name: services.journalwatch.accuracy
Desc: The time window around the interval in which the journalwatch run will be scheduled.

Name: services.journalwatch.extraConfig
Desc:
Extra lines to be added verbatim to the journalwatch/config configuration file.
You can add any commandline argument to the config, without the ‘–’.
See <code class="literal">journalwatch --help

Name: services.journalwatch.filterBlocks
Desc:
filterBlocks can be defined to blacklist journal messages which are not errors.
Each block matches on a log entry field, and the filters in that block then are matched
against all messages with a matching log entry field.

Name: services.journalwatch.filterBlocks._.filters
Desc: The filters to apply on all messages which satisfy <code class="option">match

Name: services.journalwatch.filterBlocks._.match
Desc: Syntax: <code class="literal">field = value

Name: services.journalwatch.interval
Desc: How often to run journalwatch.

Name: services.journalwatch.mailBinary
Desc: Sendmail-compatible binary to be used to send the messages.

Name: services.journalwatch.mailFrom
Desc: Mail address to send journalwatch reports from.

Name: services.journalwatch.mailTo
Desc: Mail address to send journalwatch reports to.

Name: services.journalwatch.priority
Desc:
Lowest priority of message to be considered.
A value between 7 (“debug”), and 0 (“emerg”). Defaults to 6 (“info”).
If you don’t care about anything with “info” priority, you can reduce
this to e.g. 5 (“notice”) to considerably reduce the amount of
messages without needing many <code class="option">filterBlocks

Which command the service runs. Note that not all jupyter packages

Desc:
Name of the group used to run the jupyter service.
Use this if you want to create a group of users that are able to view the notebook directory’s content.

Desc: IP address Jupyter will be listening on.

Desc: Language of the environment. Typically the name of the binary.

Desc: Path to 32x32 logo png.

Name: services.jupyter.kernels._name_.logo64
Desc: Path to 64x64 logo png.

Name: services.jupyter.notebookConfig

Name: services.jupyter.password
Desc:
Password to use with notebook.
Can be generated using:
In [1]: from notebook.auth import passwd
In [2]: passwd(‘test’)
Out[2]: ‘sha1:1b961dc713fb:88483270a63e57d18d43cf337e629539de1436ba’
NOTE: you need to keep the single quote inside the nix string.
Or you can use a python oneliner:
“open(‘/path/secret_file’, ‘r’, encoding=‘utf8’).read().strip()”
It will be interpreted at the end of the notebookConfig.

Name: services.jupyter.port
Desc: Port number Jupyter will be listening on.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.jupyter.user
Desc:
Name of the user used to run the jupyter service.
For security reason, jupyter should really not be run as root.
If not set (jupyter), the service will create a jupyter user with appropriate settings.

Desc: Name that will be shown to the user.

Desc: Port number Jupyterhub will be listening on
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.jupyterhub.spawner

Name: services.k3s.enable
Desc: Whether to enable k3s.

Name: services.k3s.package
Desc: The k3s package to use.

Name: services.k3s.charts
Desc: Packaged Helm charts that are linked to <code class="filename">/var/lib/rancher/k3s/server/static/charts

Name: services.k3s.clusterInit

Name: services.k3s.configPath
Desc: File path containing the k3s YAML config. This is useful when the config is generated (for example on boot).

Name: services.k3s.containerdConfigTemplate
Desc:
Config template for containerd, to be placed at
<code class="literal">/var/lib/rancher/k3s/agent/etc/containerd/config.toml.tmpl

Name: services.k3s.disableAgent
Desc: Only run the server. This option only makes sense for a server.

Name: services.k3s.extraFlags

Desc:
Extra configuration to add to the kube-proxy’s configuration file. The subset of the kube-proxy’s

<a class="link" href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/config-api/kube-proxy-config.v1alpha1/"  target="_top">KubeProxyConfiguration

Name: services.k3s.extraKubeletConfig

Extra configuration to add to the kubelet’s configuration file. The subset of the kubelet’s

<a class="link" href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/config-api/kubelet-config.v1beta1/"  target="_top">KubeletConfiguration

Name: services.k3s.gracefulNodeShutdown.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable graceful node shutdowns where the kubelet attempts to detect

<a class="link" href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/cluster-administration/node-shutdown/#graceful-node-shutdown"  target="_top">documentation

Name: services.k3s.gracefulNodeShutdown.shutdownGracePeriod
Desc:
Specifies the total duration that the node should delay the shutdown by. This is the total
grace period for pod termination for both regular and critical pods.

Name: services.k3s.gracefulNodeShutdown.shutdownGracePeriodCriticalPods
Desc:
Specifies the duration used to terminate critical pods during a node shutdown. This should be
less than <code class="literal">shutdownGracePeriod

Name: services.k3s.images
Desc:
List of derivations that provide container images.
All images are linked to <code class="filename">/var/lib/rancher/k3s/agent/images

Name: services.k3s.manifests
Desc: Auto-deploying manifests that are linked to <code class="filename">/var/lib/rancher/k3s/server/manifests

will generate multiple documents separated by <code class="literal">---
Type: null or (attribute set) or list of (attribute set)

Name: services.k3s.manifests._name_.source

Name: services.k3s.manifests._name_.target

Name: services.k3s.token
Desc: The k3s token to use when connecting to a server.

Name: services.k3s.tokenFile

Name: services.kanata.enable
Desc: Whether to enable kanata, a tool to improve keyboard comfort and usability with advanced customization.

Name: services.kanata.package
Desc:
The kanata package to use. ::: {.note}
If <code class="option">danger-enable-cmd

Name: services.kanata.keyboards

Name: services.kanata.keyboards._name_.config
Desc: Configuration other than <code class="literal">defcfg

Default: "A config file generated by values from other kanata module options."

Name: services.kanata.keyboards._name_.devices
Desc: Paths to keyboard devices.

Name: services.kanata.keyboards._name_.extraArgs

Name: services.kanata.keyboards._name_.extraDefCfg
Desc: Configuration of <code class="literal">defcfg

Name: services.kanata.keyboards._name_.port
Desc: Port to run the TCP server on. <code class="literal">null

Name: services.kanboard.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Kanboard.

Name: services.kanboard.package
Desc: The kanboard package to use.

Desc: Default data folder for Kanboard.

Name: services.kanboard.domain
Desc: FQDN for the Kanboard instance.

Name: services.kanboard.group
Desc: Group under which Kanboard runs.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx
Desc:
With this option, you can customize an NGINX virtual host which already
has sensible defaults for Kanboard. Set to <code class="literal">{ }

Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.

Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful

Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
