Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,
configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.listen._.addr
Desc: Listen address.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.listen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.listen._.port
Desc:
Port number to listen on.
If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.listen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.listen._.ssl
Desc: Enable SSL.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.locations
Desc: Declarative location config

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.locations._name_.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.locations._name_.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.locations._name_.fastcgiParams
Desc:
FastCGI parameters to override.  Unlike in the Nginx
configuration file, overriding only some default parameters
won’t unset the default values for other parameters.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds index directive.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc:
Adds proxy_pass directive and sets recommended proxy headers if
recommendedProxySettings is enabled.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.locations._name_.proxyWebsockets
Desc: Whether to support proxying websocket connections with HTTP/1.1.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.locations._name_.recommendedProxySettings
Desc: Enable recommended proxy settings.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.locations._name_.return
Desc: Adds a return directive, for e.g. redirections.
Type: null or string or signed integer

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.locations._name_.root
Desc: Root directory for requests.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.locations._name_.tryFiles
Desc: Adds try_files directive.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.onlySSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.quic
Desc:
Whether to enable the QUIC transport protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.redirectCode
Desc: HTTP status used by <code class="literal">globalRedirect

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.rejectSSL
Desc:
Whether to listen for and reject all HTTPS connections to this vhost. Useful in
<a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.default'>default

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.reuseport
Desc:
Create an individual listening socket .
It is required to specify only once on one of the hosts.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.root
Desc: The path of the web root directory.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.serverAliases
Desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.serverName
Desc: Name of this virtual host. Defaults to attribute name in virtualHosts.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.sslCertificate
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.sslCertificateKey
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate key.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.sslTrustedCertificate
Desc: Path to root SSL certificate for stapling and client certificates.

Name: services.kanboard.nginx.useACMEHost
Desc:
A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

Name: services.kanboard.phpfpm.settings
Desc: Options for kanboard’s PHPFPM pool.
Type: attribute set of (signed integer or string or boolean)

Name: services.kanboard.settings
Desc: Customize the default settings, refer to <a class="link" href="https://github.com/kanboard/kanboard/blob/main/config.default.php"  target="_top">https://github.com/kanboard/kanboard/blob/main/config.default.php
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

Name: services.kanboard.user
Desc: User under which Kanboard runs.

Name: services.kanidm.enableClient
Desc: Whether to enable the Kanidm client.

Name: services.kanidm.enablePam
Desc: Whether to enable the Kanidm PAM and NSS integration.

Name: services.kanidm.enableServer
Desc: Whether to enable the Kanidm server.

Name: services.kanidm.package
Desc: The kanidm package to use. If not set will receive a specific version based on stateVersion. Set to <code class="literal">pkgs.kanidm

Name: services.kanidm.clientSettings
Desc:
Configure Kanidm clients, needed for the PAM daemon. See
<a class="link" href="https://kanidm.github.io/kanidm/stable/client_tools.html#kanidm-configuration"  target="_top">the documentation

Name: services.kanidm.clientSettings.uri
Desc: Address of the Kanidm server.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.enable
Desc: Whether to enable provisioning of groups, users and oauth2 resource servers.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.acceptInvalidCerts
Desc:
Whether to allow invalid certificates when provisioning the target instance.
By default this is only allowed when the instanceUrl is localhost. This is
dangerous when used with an external URL.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.adminPasswordFile
Desc: Path to a file containing the admin password for kanidm. Do NOT use a file from the nix store here!

Name: services.kanidm.provision.autoRemove
Desc:
Determines whether deleting an entity in this provisioning config should automatically
cause them to be removed from kanidm, too. This works because the provisioning tool tracks
all entities it has ever created. If this is set to false, you need to explicitly specify
<code class="literal">present = false

Name: services.kanidm.provision.groups
Desc: Provisioning of kanidm groups

Name: services.kanidm.provision.groups._name_.members
Desc: List of kanidm entities (persons, groups, …) which are part of this group.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.groups._name_.present
Desc: Whether to ensure that this group is present or absent.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.idmAdminPasswordFile
Desc:
Path to a file containing the idm admin password for kanidm. Do NOT use a file from the nix store here!
If this is not given but provisioning is enabled, the idm_admin password will be reset on each restart.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.instanceUrl
Desc: The instance url to which the provisioning tool should connect.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.persons
Desc: Provisioning of kanidm persons

Name: services.kanidm.provision.persons._name_.displayName
Desc: Display name

Name: services.kanidm.provision.persons._name_.groups
Desc: List of groups this person should belong to.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.persons._name_.legalName
Desc: Full legal name

Name: services.kanidm.provision.persons._name_.mailAddresses
Desc: Mail addresses. First given address is considered the primary address.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.persons._name_.present
Desc: Whether to ensure that this person is present or absent.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2
Desc: Provisioning of oauth2 resource servers

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.enableLegacyCrypto
Desc: Enable legacy crypto on this client. Allows JWT signing algorthms like RS256.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.enableLocalhostRedirects
Desc: Allow localhost redirects. Only for public clients.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.allowInsecureClientDisablePkce
Desc:
Disable PKCE on this oauth2 resource server to work around insecure clients
that may not support it. You should request the client to enable PKCE!
Only for non-public clients.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.basicSecretFile
Desc:
The basic secret to use for this service. If null, the random secret generated
by kanidm will not be touched. Do NOT use a path from the nix store here!

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.claimMaps
Desc:
Adds additional claims (and values) based on which kanidm groups an authenticating party belongs to.
See <a class="link" href="https://kanidm.github.io/kanidm/master/integrations/oauth2.html#custom-claim-maps"  target="_top">Claim Maps

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.claimMaps._name_.joinType
Desc:
Determines how multiple values are joined to create the claim value.
See <a class="link" href="https://kanidm.github.io/kanidm/master/integrations/oauth2.html#custom-claim-maps"  target="_top">Claim Maps

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.claimMaps._name_.valuesByGroup
Desc: Maps kanidm groups to values for the claim.
Type: attribute set of list of string

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.displayName
Desc: Display name

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.originLanding
Desc: When redirecting from the Kanidm Apps Listing page, some linked applications may need to land on a specific page to trigger oauth2/oidc interactions.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.originUrl
Desc: The redirect URL of the service. These need to exactly match the OAuth2 redirect target
Type: string matching the pattern .*://.*$ or non-empty (list of string matching the pattern .*://.*$)

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.preferShortUsername
Desc: Use ‘name’ instead of ‘spn’ in the preferred_username claim

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.present
Desc: Whether to ensure that this oauth2 resource server is present or absent.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.public
Desc: Whether this is a public client (enforces PKCE, doesn’t use a basic secret)

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.removeOrphanedClaimMaps
Desc: Whether claim maps not specified here but present in kanidm should be removed from kanidm.

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.scopeMaps
Desc:
Maps kanidm groups to returned oauth scopes.
See <a class="link" href="https://kanidm.github.io/kanidm/stable/integrations/oauth2.html#scope-relationships"  target="_top">Scope Relations
Type: attribute set of list of string

Name: services.kanidm.provision.systems.oauth2._name_.supplementaryScopeMaps
Desc:
Maps kanidm groups to additionally returned oauth scopes.
See <a class="link" href="https://kanidm.github.io/kanidm/stable/integrations/oauth2.html#scope-relationships"  target="_top">Scope Relations
Type: attribute set of list of string

Name: services.kanidm.serverSettings
Desc:
Settings for Kanidm, see
<a class="link" href="https://kanidm.github.io/kanidm/stable/server_configuration.html"  target="_top">the documentation

Name: services.kanidm.serverSettings.bindaddress
Desc: Address/port combination the webserver binds to.

Name: services.kanidm.serverSettings.db_path
Desc: Path to Kanidm database.

Name: services.kanidm.serverSettings.domain
Desc: The <code class="literal">domain

Name: services.kanidm.serverSettings.ldapbindaddress
Desc: Address and port the LDAP server is bound to. Setting this to <code class="literal">null

Name: services.kanidm.serverSettings.log_level
Desc: Log level of the server.

Name: services.kanidm.serverSettings.online_backup.path
Desc: Path to the output directory for backups.

Name: services.kanidm.serverSettings.online_backup.schedule
Desc: The schedule for backups in cron format.

Name: services.kanidm.serverSettings.online_backup.versions
Desc: Number of backups to keep.

Name: services.kanidm.serverSettings.origin
Desc: The origin of your Kanidm instance. Must have https as protocol.

Name: services.kanidm.serverSettings.role
Desc: The role of this server. This affects the replication relationship and thereby available features.

Name: services.kanidm.serverSettings.tls_chain
Desc: TLS chain in pem format.

Name: services.kanidm.serverSettings.tls_key
Desc: TLS key in pem format.

Name: services.kanidm.unixSettings
Desc:
Configure Kanidm unix daemon.
See <a class="link" href="https://kanidm.github.io/kanidm/stable/integrations/pam_and_nsswitch.html#the-unix-daemon"  target="_top">the documentation

Name: services.kanidm.unixSettings.hsm_pin_path
Desc: Path to a HSM pin.

Name: services.kanidm.unixSettings.pam_allowed_login_groups
Desc: Kanidm groups that are allowed to login using PAM.

Name: services.kapacitor.enable
Desc: Whether to enable kapacitor.

Name: services.kapacitor.alerta.enable
Desc: Whether to enable kapacitor alerta integration.

Name: services.kapacitor.alerta.environment
Desc: Default Alerta environment

Name: services.kapacitor.alerta.origin
Desc: Default origin of alert

Name: services.kapacitor.alerta.token
Desc: Default Alerta authentication token

Name: services.kapacitor.alerta.url
Desc: The URL to the Alerta REST API

Name: services.kapacitor.bind
Desc: Address to bind to. The default is to bind to all addresses

Name: services.kapacitor.dataDir
Desc: Location where Kapacitor stores its state

Name: services.kapacitor.defaultDatabase.enable
Desc: Whether to enable kapacitor.defaultDatabase.

Name: services.kapacitor.defaultDatabase.password
Desc: The password to connect to the remote InfluxDB server

Name: services.kapacitor.defaultDatabase.url
Desc: The URL to an InfluxDB server that serves as the default database

Name: services.kapacitor.defaultDatabase.username
Desc: The username to connect to the remote InfluxDB server

Name: services.kapacitor.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go into kapacitord.conf verbatim.

Name: services.kapacitor.group
Desc: Group under which Kapacitor runs

Name: services.kapacitor.loadDirectory
Desc: Directory where to load services from, such as tasks, templates and handlers (or null to disable service loading on startup)

Name: services.kapacitor.port
Desc: Port of Kapacitor
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.kapacitor.taskSnapshotInterval
Desc: Specifies how often to snapshot the task state  (in InfluxDB time units)

Name: services.kapacitor.user
Desc: User account under which Kapacitor runs

Name: services.karma.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Karma dashboard service.

Name: services.karma.package
Desc: The karma package to use.

Name: services.karma.configFile
Desc: A YAML config file which can be used to configure karma instead of the nix-generated file.
Default: "A configuration file generated from the provided nix attributes settings option."

Name: services.karma.environment
Desc: Additional environment variables to provide to karma.

Name: services.karma.extraOptions
Desc: Extra command line options.

Name: services.karma.openFirewall
Desc: Whether to open ports in the firewall needed for karma to function.

Name: services.karma.settings
Desc: Karma dashboard configuration as nix attributes.

Name: services.karma.settings.listen.address
Desc: Hostname or IP to listen on.

Name: services.karma.settings.listen.port
Desc: HTTP port to listen on.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.kasmweb.enable
Desc: Whether to enable kasmweb.

Name: services.kasmweb.datastorePath
Desc: The directory used to store all data for kasmweb.

Name: services.kasmweb.defaultAdminPassword
Desc: default admin password to use.

Name: services.kasmweb.defaultGuacToken
Desc: default guac token to use.

Name: services.kasmweb.defaultManagerToken
Desc: default manager token to use.

Name: services.kasmweb.defaultRegistrationToken
Desc: default registration token to use.

Name: services.kasmweb.defaultUserPassword
Desc: default user password to use.

Name: services.kasmweb.listenAddress
Desc: The address on which kasmweb should listen.

Name: services.kasmweb.listenPort
Desc: The port on which kasmweb should listen.

Name: services.kasmweb.networkSubnet
Desc: The network subnet to use for the containers.

Name: services.kasmweb.postgres.password
Desc: password to use for the postgres database.

Name: services.kasmweb.postgres.user
Desc: Username to use for the postgres database.

Name: services.kasmweb.redisPassword
Desc: password to use for the redis cache.

Name: services.kasmweb.sslCertificate
Desc: The SSL certificate to be used for kasmweb.

Name: services.kasmweb.sslCertificateKey
Desc:
The SSL certificate’s key to be used for kasmweb. Make sure to specify
this as a string and not a literal path, so that it is not accidentally
included in your nixstore.

Name: services.kavita.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Kavita reading server.

Name: services.kavita.package
Desc: The kavita package to use.

Name: services.kavita.dataDir
Desc: The directory where Kavita stores its state.

Name: services.kavita.settings
Desc: Kavita configuration options, as configured in <code class="filename">appsettings.json

Name: services.kavita.settings.IpAddresses
Desc: IP Addresses to bind to. The default is to bind to all IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

Name: services.kavita.settings.Port
Desc: Port to bind to.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.kavita.tokenKeyFile
Desc:
A file containing the TokenKey, a secret with at 512+ bits.
It can be generated with <code class="literal">head -c 64 /dev/urandom | base64 --wrap=0

Name: services.kavita.user
Desc: User account under which Kavita runs.

Name: services.kbfs.enable
Desc: Whether to mount the Keybase filesystem.

Name: services.kbfs.enableRedirector
Desc:
Whether to enable the Keybase root redirector service, allowing
any user to access KBFS files via <code class="literal">/keybase

Name: services.kbfs.extraFlags
Desc: Additional flags to pass to the Keybase filesystem on launch.

Name: services.kbfs.mountPoint
Desc: Mountpoint for the Keybase filesystem.

Name: services.kea.ctrl-agent
Desc: Kea Control Agent configuration

Name: services.kea.ctrl-agent.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Kea Control Agent.

Name: services.kea.ctrl-agent.configFile
Desc: Kea Control Agent configuration as a path, see <a class="link" href="https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/agent.html"  target="_top">https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/agent.html

Name: services.kea.ctrl-agent.extraArgs
Desc: List of additional arguments to pass to the daemon.

Name: services.kea.ctrl-agent.settings
Desc: Kea Control Agent configuration as an attribute set, see <a class="link" href="https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/agent.html"  target="_top">https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/agent.html

Name: services.kea.dhcp-ddns
Desc: Kea DHCP-DDNS configuration

Name: services.kea.dhcp-ddns.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Kea DDNS server.

Name: services.kea.dhcp-ddns.configFile
Desc: Kea DHCP-DDNS configuration as a path, see <a class="link" href="https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/ddns.html"  target="_top">https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/ddns.html

Name: services.kea.dhcp-ddns.extraArgs
Desc: List of additional arguments to pass to the daemon.

Name: services.kea.dhcp-ddns.settings
Desc: Kea DHCP-DDNS configuration as an attribute set, see <a class="link" href="https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/ddns.html"  target="_top">https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/ddns.html

Name: services.kea.dhcp4
Desc: DHCP4 Server configuration

Name: services.kea.dhcp4.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Kea DHCP4 server.

Name: services.kea.dhcp4.configFile
Desc: Kea DHCP4 configuration as a path, see <a class="link" href="https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/dhcp4-srv.html"  target="_top">https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/dhcp4-srv.html

Name: services.kea.dhcp4.extraArgs
Desc: List of additional arguments to pass to the daemon.

Name: services.kea.dhcp4.settings
Desc: Kea DHCP4 configuration as an attribute set, see <a class="link" href="https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/dhcp4-srv.html"  target="_top">https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/dhcp4-srv.html

Name: services.kea.dhcp6
Desc: DHCP6 Server configuration

Name: services.kea.dhcp6.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Kea DHCP6 server.

Name: services.kea.dhcp6.configFile
Desc: Kea DHCP6 configuration as a path, see <a class="link" href="https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/dhcp6-srv.html"  target="_top">https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/dhcp6-srv.html

Name: services.kea.dhcp6.extraArgs
Desc: List of additional arguments to pass to the daemon.

Name: services.kea.dhcp6.settings
Desc: Kea DHCP6 configuration as an attribute set, see <a class="link" href="https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/dhcp6-srv.html"  target="_top">https://kea.readthedocs.io/en/kea-2.6.1/arm/dhcp6-srv.html

Name: services.keepalived.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Keepalived.

Name: services.keepalived.enableScriptSecurity
Desc: Don’t run scripts configured to be run as root if any part of the path is writable by a non-root user.

Name: services.keepalived.extraConfig
Desc: Extra lines to be added verbatim to the configuration file.

Name: services.keepalived.extraGlobalDefs
Desc:
Extra lines to be added verbatim to the ‘global_defs’ block of the
configuration file

Name: services.keepalived.openFirewall
Desc: Whether to automatically allow VRRP and AH packets in the firewall.

Name: services.keepalived.secretFile
Desc:
Environment variables from this file will be interpolated into the
final config file using envsubst with this syntax: <code class="literal">$ENVIRONMENT

Name: services.keepalived.snmp.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the builtin AgentX subagent.

Name: services.keepalived.snmp.enableChecker
Desc: Enable SNMP handling of checker element of KEEPALIVED MIB.

Name: services.keepalived.snmp.enableKeepalived
Desc: Enable SNMP handling of vrrp element of KEEPALIVED MIB.

Name: services.keepalived.snmp.enableRfc
Desc: Enable SNMP handling of RFC2787 and RFC6527 VRRP MIBs.

Name: services.keepalived.snmp.enableRfcV2
Desc: Enable SNMP handling of RFC2787 VRRP MIB.

Name: services.keepalived.snmp.enableRfcV3
Desc: Enable SNMP handling of RFC6527 VRRP MIB.

Name: services.keepalived.snmp.enableTraps
Desc: Enable SNMP traps.

Name: services.keepalived.snmp.socket
Desc:
Socket to use for connecting to SNMP master agent. If this value is
set to null, keepalived’s default will be used, which is
unix:/var/agentx/master, unless using a network namespace, when the
default is udp:localhost:705.

Name: services.keepalived.vrrpInstances
Desc: Declarative vhost config

Name: services.keepalived.vrrpInstances._name_.extraConfig
Desc: Extra lines to be added verbatim to the vrrp_instance section.

Name: services.keepalived.vrrpInstances._name_.interface
Desc: Interface for inside_network, bound by vrrp.

Name: services.keepalived.vrrpInstances._name_.noPreempt
Desc:
VRRP will normally preempt a lower priority machine when a higher
priority machine comes online. “nopreempt” allows the lower priority
machine to maintain the master role, even when a higher priority machine
comes back online. NOTE: For this to work, the initial state of this
entry must be BACKUP.

Name: services.keepalived.vrrpInstances._name_.priority
Desc:
For electing MASTER, highest priority wins. To be MASTER, make 50 more
than other machines.

Name: services.keepalived.vrrpInstances._name_.state
Desc:
Initial state. As soon as the other machine(s) come up, an election will
be held and the machine with the highest “priority” will become MASTER.
So the entry here doesn’t matter a whole lot.

Name: services.keepalived.vrrpInstances._name_.trackInterfaces
Desc: List of network interfaces to monitor for health tracking.

Name: services.keepalived.vrrpInstances._name_.trackScripts
Desc: List of script names to invoke for health tracking.

Name: services.keepalived.vrrpInstances._name_.unicastPeers
Desc:
Do not send VRRP adverts over VRRP multicast group. Instead it sends
adverts to the following list of ip addresses using unicast design
fashion. It can be cool to use VRRP FSM and features in a networking
environment where multicast is not supported! IP Addresses specified can
IPv4 as well as IPv6.

Name: services.keepalived.vrrpInstances._name_.unicastSrcIp
Desc:
Default IP for binding vrrpd is the primary IP on interface. If you

Name of the vmac interface to use. keepalived will come up with a name

Name: services.keepalived.vrrpInstances._name_.vmacXmitBase

Name: services.keepalived.vrrpScripts._name_.weight

Desc:

Keep an old app running and swap the ports when the new one is booted
.

Name: services.keter.globalKeterConfig.ip-from-header
Desc: You want that ip-from-header in the nginx setup case. It allows nginx setting the original ip address rather then it being localhost (due to reverse proxying)

Name: services.keter.globalKeterConfig.listeners
Desc:
You want that ip-from-header in
the nginx setup case.
It allows nginx setting the original ip address rather
then it being localhost (due to reverse proxying).
However if you configure keter to accept connections
directly you may want to set this to false.

Name: services.keter.globalKeterConfig.listeners._.host
Desc: host

Name: services.keter.globalKeterConfig.listeners._.port

Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Desc:
emits keter logs and it’s applications to stderr.
which allows journald to capture them.
Set to true to let keter put the logs in files
(useful on non systemd systems, this is the old approach
where keter handled log management)

Use kmscon as the virtual console instead of gettys.
kmscon is a kms/dri-based userspace virtual terminal implementation.
It supports a richer feature set than the standard linux console VT,
including full unicode support, and when the video card supports drm
should be much faster.

Username of the account that will be automatically logged in at the console.

A list of files containing additional configuration

checks at build time.

The number of instances to start.  They will be called kresd@{1,2,…}.service.
Knot Resolver uses no threads, so this is the way to scale.
You can dynamically start/stop them at will, so this is just system default.

Addresses and ports on which kresd should provide DNS over HTTPS/2 (see RFC 8484).

Name: services.libinput.enable
Desc: Whether to enable libinput.

Name: services.libinput.mouse.accelPointsFallback
Desc:
Sets the points of the fallback acceleration function. The value must be a list of
floating point non-negative numbers. This only applies to the custom profile.
Type: null or (list of (signed integer or floating point number))

Name: services.libinput.mouse.accelPointsMotion
Desc:
Sets the points of the (pointer) motion acceleration function. The value must be a
list of floating point non-negative numbers. This only applies to the custom profile.
Type: null or (list of (signed integer or floating point number))

Name: services.libinput.mouse.accelPointsScroll
Desc:
Sets the points of the scroll acceleration function. The value must be a list of
floating point non-negative numbers. This only applies to the custom profile.
Type: null or (list of (signed integer or floating point number))

Name: services.libinput.mouse.accelProfile
Desc:
Sets the pointer acceleration profile to the given profile.
Permitted values are <code class="literal">adaptive

Name: services.libinput.mouse.accelSpeed
Desc:
Cursor acceleration (how fast speed increases from minSpeed to maxSpeed).
This only applies to the flat or adaptive profile.

Name: services.libinput.mouse.accelStepFallback
Desc:
Sets the step between the points of the fallback acceleration function. When a step of
0.0 is provided, libinput’s Fallback acceleration function is used. This only applies
to the custom profile.
Type: null or signed integer or floating point number

Name: services.libinput.mouse.accelStepMotion
Desc:
Sets the step between the points of the (pointer) motion acceleration function. When a
step of 0.0 is provided, libinput’s Fallback acceleration function is used. This only
applies to the custom profile.
Type: null or signed integer or floating point number

Name: services.libinput.mouse.accelStepScroll
Desc:
Sets the step between the points of the scroll acceleration function. When a step of
0.0 is provided, libinput’s Fallback acceleration function is used. This only applies
to the custom profile.
Type: null or signed integer or floating point number

Name: services.libinput.mouse.additionalOptions
Desc:
Additional options for libinput mouse driver. See
<span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">libinput

Name: services.libinput.mouse.buttonMapping
Desc:
Sets the logical button mapping for this device, see XSetPointerMapping(3). The string  must
be  a  space-separated  list  of  button mappings in the order of the logical buttons on the
device, starting with button 1.  The default mapping is “1 2 3 … 32”. A mapping of 0 deac‐
tivates the button. Multiple buttons can have the same mapping.  Invalid mapping strings are
discarded and the default mapping is used for all buttons.  Buttons  not  specified  in  the
user’s mapping use the default mapping. See section BUTTON MAPPING for more details.

Name: services.libinput.mouse.calibrationMatrix
Desc:
A string of 9 space-separated floating point numbers. Sets the calibration matrix to the
3x3 matrix where the first row is (abc), the second row is (def) and the third row is (ghi).

Name: services.libinput.mouse.clickMethod
Desc: Enables a click method. Permitted values are <code class="literal">none

Name: services.libinput.mouse.dev
Desc: Path for mouse device.  Set to <code class="literal">null

Name: services.libinput.mouse.disableWhileTyping
Desc: Disable input method while typing.

Name: services.libinput.mouse.horizontalScrolling
Desc:
Enables or disables horizontal scrolling. When disabled, this driver will discard any
horizontal scroll events from libinput. This does not disable horizontal scroll events
from libinput; it merely discards the horizontal axis from any scroll events.

Name: services.libinput.mouse.leftHanded
Desc: Enables left-handed button orientation, i.e. swapping left and right buttons.

Name: services.libinput.mouse.middleEmulation
Desc:
Enables middle button emulation. When enabled, pressing the left and right buttons
simultaneously produces a middle mouse button click.

Name: services.libinput.mouse.naturalScrolling
Desc: Enables or disables natural scrolling behavior.

Name: services.libinput.mouse.scrollButton
Desc:
Designates a button as scroll button. If the ScrollMethod is button and the button is logically
held down, x/y axis movement is converted into scroll events.

Name: services.libinput.mouse.scrollMethod
Desc: Specify the scrolling method: <code class="literal">twofinger

Name: services.libinput.mouse.sendEventsMode
Desc: Sets the send events mode to <code class="literal">disabled

Name: services.libinput.mouse.tapping
Desc: Enables or disables tap-to-click behavior.

Name: services.libinput.mouse.tappingButtonMap
Desc: Set the button mapping for 1/2/3-finger taps to left/right/middle or left/middle/right, respectively.

Name: services.libinput.mouse.tappingDragLock
Desc:
Enables or disables drag lock during tapping behavior. When enabled, a finger up during tap-
and-drag will not immediately release the button. If the finger is set down again within the
timeout, the dragging process continues.

Name: services.libinput.mouse.transformationMatrix
Desc:
A string of 9 space-separated floating point numbers. Sets the transformation matrix to
the 3x3 matrix where the first row is (abc), the second row is (def) and the third row is (ghi).

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.accelPointsFallback
Desc:
Sets the points of the fallback acceleration function. The value must be a list of
floating point non-negative numbers. This only applies to the custom profile.
Type: null or (list of (signed integer or floating point number))

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.accelPointsMotion
Desc:
Sets the points of the (pointer) motion acceleration function. The value must be a
list of floating point non-negative numbers. This only applies to the custom profile.
Type: null or (list of (signed integer or floating point number))

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.accelPointsScroll
Desc:
Sets the points of the scroll acceleration function. The value must be a list of
floating point non-negative numbers. This only applies to the custom profile.
Type: null or (list of (signed integer or floating point number))

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.accelProfile
Desc:
Sets the pointer acceleration profile to the given profile.
Permitted values are <code class="literal">adaptive

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.accelSpeed
Desc:
Cursor acceleration (how fast speed increases from minSpeed to maxSpeed).
This only applies to the flat or adaptive profile.

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.accelStepFallback
Desc:
Sets the step between the points of the fallback acceleration function. When a step of
0.0 is provided, libinput’s Fallback acceleration function is used. This only applies
to the custom profile.
Type: null or signed integer or floating point number

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.accelStepMotion
Desc:
Sets the step between the points of the (pointer) motion acceleration function. When a
step of 0.0 is provided, libinput’s Fallback acceleration function is used. This only
applies to the custom profile.
Type: null or signed integer or floating point number

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.accelStepScroll
Desc:
Sets the step between the points of the scroll acceleration function. When a step of
0.0 is provided, libinput’s Fallback acceleration function is used. This only applies
to the custom profile.
Type: null or signed integer or floating point number

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.additionalOptions
Desc:
Additional options for libinput touchpad driver. See
<span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">libinput

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.buttonMapping
Desc:
Sets the logical button mapping for this device, see XSetPointerMapping(3). The string  must
be  a  space-separated  list  of  button mappings in the order of the logical buttons on the
device, starting with button 1.  The default mapping is “1 2 3 … 32”. A mapping of 0 deac‐
tivates the button. Multiple buttons can have the same mapping.  Invalid mapping strings are
discarded and the default mapping is used for all buttons.  Buttons  not  specified  in  the
user’s mapping use the default mapping. See section BUTTON MAPPING for more details.

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.calibrationMatrix
Desc:
A string of 9 space-separated floating point numbers. Sets the calibration matrix to the
3x3 matrix where the first row is (abc), the second row is (def) and the third row is (ghi).

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.clickMethod
Desc: Enables a click method. Permitted values are <code class="literal">none

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.dev
Desc: Path for touchpad device.  Set to <code class="literal">null

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.disableWhileTyping
Desc: Disable input method while typing.

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.horizontalScrolling
Desc:
Enables or disables horizontal scrolling. When disabled, this driver will discard any
horizontal scroll events from libinput. This does not disable horizontal scroll events
from libinput; it merely discards the horizontal axis from any scroll events.

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.leftHanded
Desc: Enables left-handed button orientation, i.e. swapping left and right buttons.

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.middleEmulation
Desc:
Enables middle button emulation. When enabled, pressing the left and right buttons
simultaneously produces a middle mouse button click.

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.naturalScrolling
Desc: Enables or disables natural scrolling behavior.

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.scrollButton
Desc:
Designates a button as scroll button. If the ScrollMethod is button and the button is logically
held down, x/y axis movement is converted into scroll events.

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.scrollMethod
Desc: Specify the scrolling method: <code class="literal">twofinger

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.sendEventsMode
Desc: Sets the send events mode to <code class="literal">disabled

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.tapping
Desc: Enables or disables tap-to-click behavior.

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.tappingButtonMap
Desc: Set the button mapping for 1/2/3-finger taps to left/right/middle or left/middle/right, respectively.

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.tappingDragLock
Desc:
Enables or disables drag lock during tapping behavior. When enabled, a finger up during tap-
and-drag will not immediately release the button. If the finger is set down again within the
timeout, the dragging process continues.

Name: services.libinput.touchpad.transformationMatrix
Desc:
A string of 9 space-separated floating point numbers. Sets the transformation matrix to
the 3x3 matrix where the first row is (abc), the second row is (def) and the third row is (ghi).

Name: services.librenms.enable
Desc: Whether to enable LibreNMS network monitoring system.

Name: services.librenms.enableLocalBilling
Desc:
Enable billing Cron-Jobs on the local instance. Enabled by default, but you may disable it
on some nodes within a distributed poller setup. See <a class="link" href="https://docs.librenms.org/Extensions/Distributed-Poller/#discovery"  target="_top">the docs

Name: services.librenms.enableOneMinutePolling
Desc: Enables the <a class="link" href="https://docs.librenms.org/Support/1-Minute-Polling/"  target="_top">1-Minute Polling

Name: services.librenms.dataDir
Desc: Path of the LibreNMS state directory.

Name: services.librenms.database.createLocally
Desc: Whether to create a local database automatically.

Name: services.librenms.database.database
Desc: Name of the database on the MySQL/MariaDB server.

Name: services.librenms.database.host
Desc:
Hostname or IP of the MySQL/MariaDB server.
Ignored if ‘socket’ is defined.

Name: services.librenms.database.passwordFile
Desc:
A file containing the password for the user of the MySQL/MariaDB server.
Must be readable for the LibreNMS user.
Ignored if ‘socket’ is defined, mandatory otherwise.

Name: services.librenms.database.port
Desc:
Port of the MySQL/MariaDB server.
Ignored if ‘socket’ is defined.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.librenms.database.socket
Desc:
A unix socket to mysql, accessible by the librenms user.
Useful when mysql is on the localhost.

Name: services.librenms.database.username
Desc:
Name of the user on the MySQL/MariaDB server.
Ignored if ‘socket’ is defined.

Name: services.librenms.distributedPoller.enable
Desc: Configure this LibreNMS instance as a <a class="link" href="https://docs.librenms.org/Extensions/Distributed-Poller/"  target="_top">distributed poller

Name: services.librenms.distributedPoller.distributedBilling
Desc: Enable distributed billing on this poller.

Name: services.librenms.distributedPoller.group
Desc: Group(s) of this poller.

Name: services.librenms.distributedPoller.memcachedHost
Desc: Hostname or IP of the <code class="literal">memcached

Name: services.librenms.distributedPoller.memcachedPort
Desc: Port of the <code class="literal">memcached
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.librenms.distributedPoller.name
Desc: Custom name of this poller.

Name: services.librenms.distributedPoller.rrdcachedHost
Desc: Hostname or IP of the <code class="literal">rrdcached

Name: services.librenms.distributedPoller.rrdcachedPort
Desc: Port of the <code class="literal">memcached
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.librenms.environmentFile
Desc:
File containing env-vars to be substituted into the final config. Useful for secrets.
Does not apply to settings defined in <code class="literal">extraConfig

Name: services.librenms.extraConfig
Desc: Additional config for LibreNMS that will be appended to the <code class="literal">config.php

Name: services.librenms.group
Desc: Name of the LibreNMS group.

Name: services.librenms.hostname
Desc: The hostname to serve LibreNMS on.

Name: services.librenms.logDir
Desc: Path of the LibreNMS logging directory.

Name: services.librenms.nginx
Desc: With this option, you can customize the nginx virtualHost settings.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.librenms.nginx.acmeFallbackHost
Desc:
Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful
if you want multiple hosts to be able to verify the same domain name.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.acmeRoot
Desc: Directory for the ACME challenge, which is <span class="strong"><strong>public

Name: services.librenms.nginx.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.librenms.nginx.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.librenms.nginx.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.librenms.nginx.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,
configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.librenms.nginx.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.librenms.nginx.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.librenms.nginx.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.librenms.nginx.listen._.addr
Desc: Listen address.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.listen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.listen._.port
Desc:
Port number to listen on.
If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.librenms.nginx.listen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.listen._.ssl
Desc: Enable SSL.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.librenms.nginx.locations
Desc: Declarative location config

Name: services.librenms.nginx.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.locations._name_.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.locations._name_.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.librenms.nginx.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.locations._name_.fastcgiParams
Desc:
FastCGI parameters to override.  Unlike in the Nginx
configuration file, overriding only some default parameters
won’t unset the default values for other parameters.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds index directive.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.librenms.nginx.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc:
Adds proxy_pass directive and sets recommended proxy headers if
recommendedProxySettings is enabled.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.locations._name_.proxyWebsockets
Desc: Whether to support proxying websocket connections with HTTP/1.1.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.locations._name_.recommendedProxySettings
Desc: Enable recommended proxy settings.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.locations._name_.return
Desc: Adds a return directive, for e.g. redirections.
Type: null or string or signed integer

Name: services.librenms.nginx.locations._name_.root
Desc: Root directory for requests.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.locations._name_.tryFiles
Desc: Adds try_files directive.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.onlySSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.librenms.nginx.quic
Desc:
Whether to enable the QUIC transport protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.librenms.nginx.redirectCode
Desc: HTTP status used by <code class="literal">globalRedirect

Name: services.librenms.nginx.rejectSSL
Desc:
Whether to listen for and reject all HTTPS connections to this vhost. Useful in
<a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.default'>default

Name: services.librenms.nginx.reuseport
Desc:
Create an individual listening socket .
It is required to specify only once on one of the hosts.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.root
Desc: The path of the web root directory.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.serverAliases
Desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.serverName
Desc: Name of this virtual host. Defaults to attribute name in virtualHosts.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.sslCertificate
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.sslCertificateKey
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate key.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.sslTrustedCertificate
Desc: Path to root SSL certificate for stapling and client certificates.

Name: services.librenms.nginx.useACMEHost
Desc:
A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

Name: services.librenms.pollerThreads
Desc: Amount of threads of the cron-poller.

Name: services.librenms.poolConfig
Desc: Options for the LibreNMS PHP pool. See the documentation on <code class="literal">php-fpm.conf
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

Name: services.librenms.settings
Desc:
Attrset of the LibreNMS configuration.
See https://docs.librenms.org/Support/Configuration/ for reference.
All possible options are listed <a class="link" href="https://github.com/librenms/librenms/blob/master/misc/config_definitions.json"  target="_top">here

Name: services.librenms.useDistributedPollers
Desc: Enables <a class="link" href="https://docs.librenms.org/Extensions/Distributed-Poller/"  target="_top">distributed pollers

Name: services.librenms.user
Desc: Name of the LibreNMS user.

Name: services.libreswan.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Libreswan IPsec service.

Name: services.libreswan.configSetup
Desc: Options to go in the ‘config setup’ section of the Libreswan IPsec configuration

Name: services.libreswan.connections
Desc: A set of connections to define for the Libreswan IPsec service
Type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n”

Name: services.libreswan.disableRedirects
Desc:
Whether to disable send and accept redirects for all network interfaces.
See the Libreswan <a class="link" href="https://libreswan.org/wiki/FAQ#Why_is_it_recommended_to_disable_send_redirects_in_.2Fproc.2Fsys.2Fnet_.3F"  target="_top">
FAQ

Name: services.libreswan.policies
Desc: A set of policies to apply to the IPsec connections.
Type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n”

Name: services.lidarr.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Lidarr, a Usenet/BitTorrent music downloader.

Name: services.lidarr.package

Name: services.lidarr.dataDir
Desc: The directory where Lidarr stores its data files.

Name: services.lidarr.group

Name: services.lidarr.openFirewall

Name: services.lidarr.user
Desc: User account under which Lidarr runs.

Name: services.lifecycled.enable
Desc: Whether to enable lifecycled, a daemon for responding to AWS AutoScaling Lifecycle Hooks.

Name: services.lifecycled.awsRegion
Desc: The region used for accessing AWS services.

Name: services.lifecycled.cloudwatchGroup
Desc: Write logs to a specific Cloudwatch Logs group.

Name: services.lifecycled.cloudwatchStream
Desc: Write logs to a specific Cloudwatch Logs stream. Defaults to the instance ID.

Name: services.lifecycled.debug
Desc: Enable debugging information.

Name: services.lifecycled.handler
Desc: The script to invoke to handle events.

Name: services.lifecycled.instanceId
Desc: The instance ID to listen for events for.

Name: services.lifecycled.json
Desc: Enable JSON logging.

Name: services.lifecycled.noSpot
Desc: Disable the spot termination listener.

Name: services.lifecycled.queueCleaner.enable
Desc: Whether to enable lifecycled-queue-cleaner.

Name: services.lifecycled.queueCleaner.frequency
Desc: How often to trigger the queue cleaner.

Name: services.lifecycled.queueCleaner.parallel
Desc: The number of parallel deletes to run.

Name: services.lifecycled.snsTopic
Desc: The SNS topic that receives events.

Name: services.lighthouse.package
Desc: The lighthouse package to use.

Name: services.lighthouse.beacon

Desc: Whether to enable Lightouse Beacon node.

Name: services.lighthouse.beacon.address

Name: services.lighthouse.beacon.dataDir

Name: services.lighthouse.beacon.disableDepositContractSync
Desc:
Explicitly disables syncing of deposit logs from the execution node.
This overrides any previous option that depends on it.
Useful if you intend to run a non-validating beacon node.

Name: services.lighthouse.beacon.execution.address

Name: services.lighthouse.beacon.execution.jwtPath

Name: services.lighthouse.beacon.execution.port

Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.lighthouse.beacon.extraArgs

Name: services.lighthouse.beacon.http.enable

Name: services.lighthouse.beacon.http.address

Name: services.lighthouse.beacon.http.port

Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.lighthouse.beacon.metrics.port

Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.lighthouse.beacon.openFirewall
Desc: Open the port in the firewall

Name: services.lighthouse.beacon.port
Desc: Port number the Beacon node will be listening on.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.lighthouse.extraArgs
Desc: Additional arguments passed to every lighthouse command.

Name: services.lighthouse.network
Desc: The network to connect to. Mainnet is the default ethereum network.

Name: services.lighthouse.validator
Desc: Validator node

Name: services.lighthouse.validator.enable
Desc: Enable Lightouse Validator node.

Name: services.lighthouse.validator.beaconNodes

Name: services.lighthouse.validator.dataDir
Desc: Directory where data will be stored. Each chain will be stored under it’s own specific subdirectory.

Name: services.lighthouse.validator.extraArgs
Desc: Additional arguments passed to the lighthouse validator command.

Name: services.lighthouse.validator.metrics.enable

Name: services.lighthouse.validator.metrics.address

Name: services.lighthouse.validator.metrics.port

Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.lighttpd.enable
Desc: Enable the lighttpd web server.

Name: services.lighttpd.enableModules
Desc:
List of lighttpd modules to enable. Sub-services take care of
enabling modules as needed, so this option is mainly for when you
want to add custom stuff to
<code class="option">services.lighttpd.extraConfig

Name: services.lighttpd.enableUpstreamMimeTypes
Desc:
Whether to include the list of mime types bundled with lighttpd
(upstream). If you disable this, no mime types will be added by
NixOS and you will have to add your own mime types in
<code class="option">services.lighttpd.extraConfig

Name: services.lighttpd.package
Desc: The lighttpd package to use.

Name: services.lighttpd.cgit.enable
Desc:
If true, enable cgit (fast web interface for git repositories) as a
sub-service in lighttpd.

Name: services.lighttpd.cgit.configText
Desc:
Verbatim contents of the cgit runtime configuration file. Documentation
(with cgitrc example file) is available in “man cgitrc”. Or online:
http://git.zx2c4.com/cgit/tree/cgitrc.5.txt

Name: services.lighttpd.cgit.subdir
Desc:
The subdirectory in which to serve cgit. The web application will be
accessible at http://yourserver/${subdir}

Name: services.lighttpd.collectd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable collectd subservice accessible at http://yourserver/collectd.

Name: services.lighttpd.collectd.collectionCgi
Desc:
Path to collection.cgi script from (collectd sources)/contrib/collection.cgi
This option allows to use a customized version

Name: services.lighttpd.configText
Desc:
Overridable config file contents to use for lighttpd. By default, use
the contents automatically generated by NixOS.

Name: services.lighttpd.document-root
Desc: Document-root of the web server. Must be readable by the “lighttpd” user.

Name: services.lighttpd.extraConfig
Desc:
These configuration lines will be appended to the generated lighttpd
config file. Note that this mechanism does not work when the manual
<code class="option">configText

Name: services.lighttpd.gitweb.enable
Desc: If true, enable gitweb in lighttpd. Access it at http://yourserver/gitweb

Name: services.lighttpd.mod_status
Desc:
Show server status overview at /server-status, statistics at
/server-statistics and list of loaded modules at /server-config.

Name: services.lighttpd.mod_userdir
Desc:
If true, requests in the form /~user/page.html are rewritten to take
the file public_html/page.html from the home directory of the user.

Name: services.lighttpd.port
Desc: TCP port number for lighttpd to bind to.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.limesurvey.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Limesurvey web application.

Name: services.limesurvey.package
Desc: The limesurvey package to use.

Name: services.limesurvey.config
Desc:
LimeSurvey configuration. Refer to
<a class="link" href="https://manual.limesurvey.org/Optional_settings"  target="_top">https://manual.limesurvey.org/Optional_settings
Type: limesurvey config type (str, int, bool or attribute set thereof)

Name: services.limesurvey.database.createLocally
Desc:
Create the database and database user locally.
This currently only applies if database type “mysql” is selected.

Name: services.limesurvey.database.dbEngine
Desc: Database storage engine to use.

Name: services.limesurvey.database.host
Desc: Database host address.

Name: services.limesurvey.database.name
Desc: Database name.

Name: services.limesurvey.database.passwordFile
Desc:
A file containing the password corresponding to
<code class="option">database.user

Name: services.limesurvey.database.port
Desc: Database host port.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.limesurvey.database.socket
Desc: Path to the unix socket file to use for authentication.

Name: services.limesurvey.database.type
Desc: Database engine to use.

Name: services.limesurvey.database.user

Name: services.limesurvey.encryptionKeyFile
Desc: 32-byte key used to encrypt variables in the database.

Name: services.limesurvey.encryptionNonceFile
Desc: 24-byte used to encrypt variables in the database.

Name: services.limesurvey.poolConfig
Desc: Options for the LimeSurvey PHP pool. See the documentation on <code class="literal">php-fpm.conf
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost
Desc: Apache configuration can be done by adapting <code class="literal">services.httpd.virtualHosts.<name>

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.enableUserDir
Desc: Whether to enable serving <code class="filename">~/public_html

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.acmeRoot
Desc:
Directory for the acme challenge which is PUBLIC, don’t put certs or keys in here.
Set to null to inherit from config.security.acme.

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.adminAddr
Desc: E-mail address of the server administrator.

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.documentRoot
Desc:
The path of Apache’s document root directory.  If left undefined,
an empty directory in the Nix store will be used as root.

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.extraConfig
Desc:
These lines go to httpd.conf verbatim. They will go after
directories and directory aliases defined by default.

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that permanently redirects (301)
all plain HTTP traffic to HTTPS. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected permanently to
the given URL.

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.hostName
Desc: Canonical hostname for the server.

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTP 2. HTTP/2 is supported in all multi-processing modules that come with httpd. <span class="emphasis"><em>However, if you use the prefork mpm, there will
be severe restrictions.

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.listen
Desc: Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.listen._.ip
Desc: IP to listen on. 0.0.0.0 for IPv4 only, * for all.

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.listen._.port
Desc: Port to listen on
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.listen._.ssl

Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set

Whether to enable the QUIC transport protocol.

<a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.default'>default

Desc:
Create an individual listening socket .

Name: services.matomo.nginx.serverAliases
Desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

Desc: Name of this virtual host. Defaults to attribute name in virtualHosts.

Name: services.matomo.nginx.sslTrustedCertificate

Desc:
A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.

<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

Name: services.matomo.periodicArchiveProcessing
Desc: Enable periodic archive processing, which generates aggregated reports from the visits.

Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.matrix-conduit.settings.global.trusted_servers

Desc:
Path to the directory with database, registration, and other data for the bridge service.
This path is relative to <code class="literal">/var/lib

Name: services.mautrix-meta.instances._name_.environmentFile
Desc:
File containing environment variables to substitute when copying the configuration
out of Nix store to the <code class="literal">services.mautrix-meta.dataDir

Name: services.mautrix-meta.instances._name_.registerToSynapse
Desc: Whether to add registration file to <code class="literal">services.matrix-synapse.settings.app_service_config_files

Name: services.mautrix-meta.instances._name_.registrationFile
Desc: Path to the yaml registration file of the appservice.

Name: services.mautrix-meta.instances._name_.registrationServiceUnit
Desc: The registration service that generates the registration file.

Name: services.mautrix-meta.instances._name_.serviceDependencies
Desc: List of Systemd services to require and wait for when starting the application service.

Name: services.mautrix-meta.instances._name_.serviceUnit
Desc:
The systemd unit (a service or a target) for other services to depend on if they
need to be started after matrix-synapse.

Name: services.mautrix-meta.instances._name_.settings
Desc: <code class="filename">config.yaml

in which secret tokens can be specified securely by defining values for e.g.

File containing environment variables to be passed to the mautrix-whatsapp service,

Name: services.mbpfan.settings.general.low_temp
Desc: If temperature is below this, fans will run at minimum speed.

Name: services.mbpfan.settings.general.max_temp
Desc: If temperature is above this, fans will run at maximum speed.

Name: services.mbpfan.settings.general.polling_interval
Desc: The polling interval.

Name: services.mbpfan.verbose
Desc: If true, sets the log level to verbose.

Name: services.mchprs.enable
Desc: Whether to enable MCHPRS, a Minecraft server.

Name: services.mchprs.package
Desc: The mchprs package to use.

Name: services.mchprs.dataDir
Desc: Directory to store MCHPRS database and other state/data files.

Desc: Whether to use a declarative configuration for MCHPRS.

Name: services.mchprs.declarativeWhitelist
Desc:
Whether to use a declarative whitelist.
The options <code class="option">services.mchprs.whitelist.list

Name: services.mchprs.maxRuntime
Desc:
Automatically restart the server after
<code class="option">services.mchprs.maxRuntime

Name: services.mchprs.openFirewall
Desc:
Whether to open ports in the firewall for the server.
Only has effect when
<code class="option">services.mchprs.declarativeSettings

Name: services.mchprs.settings
Desc: Configuration for MCHPRS via <code class="literal">Config.toml

Name: services.mchprs.settings.address
Desc:
Address for the server.
Please use enclosing square brackets when using ipv6.
Only has effect when
<code class="option">services.mchprs.declarativeSettings

Name: services.mchprs.settings.auto_redpiler
Desc:
Use redpiler automatically.
Only has effect when
<code class="option">services.mchprs.declarativeSettings

Name: services.mchprs.settings.block_in_hitbox
Desc:
Allow placing blocks inside of players
(hitbox logic is simplified).
Only has effect when
<code class="option">services.mchprs.declarativeSettings

Name: services.mchprs.settings.bungeecord
Desc:
Enable compatibility with
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/SpigotMC/BungeeCord"  target="_top">BungeeCord

Name: services.mchprs.settings.chat_format
Desc: How to format chat message interpolating <code class="literal">username

Name: services.mchprs.settings.max_players
Desc:
Maximum number of simultaneous players.
Only has effect when
<code class="option">services.mchprs.declarativeSettings

Name: services.mchprs.settings.motd
Desc:
Message of the day.
Only has effect when
<code class="option">services.mchprs.declarativeSettings

Name: services.mchprs.settings.port
Desc:
Port for the server.
Only has effect when
<code class="option">services.mchprs.declarativeSettings
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.mchprs.settings.schemati
Desc:
Mimic the verification and directory layout used by the
Open Redstone Engineers
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/OpenRedstoneEngineers/Schemati"  target="_top">Schemati plugin

Name: services.mchprs.settings.view_distance
Desc:
Maximal distance (in chunks) between players and loaded chunks.
Only has effect when
<code class="option">services.mchprs.declarativeSettings

Name: services.mchprs.whitelist.enable
Desc: Whether or not the whitelist (in <code class="literal">whitelist.json

Name: services.mchprs.whitelist.list

<code class="option">services.mchprs.declarativeWhitelist

Desc: Settings which are written into <code class="literal">mediagoblin.ini

Desc:
Whether to enable user self registration. This is generally not recommend due to spammers.
See <a class="link" href="https://docs.mediagoblin.org/en/stable/siteadmin/production-deployments.html#should-i-keep-open-registration-enabled"  target="_top">upstream FAQ

Name: services.mediagoblin.settings.mediagoblin.email_debug_mode
Desc:
Disable email debug mode to start sending outgoing mails.
This requires configuring SMTP settings,

Desc: Whether the indexation must take place recursively or not.

Desc:
If false (the default), this is up to the user to declare the firewall rules.
If true, this opens port 1900 (tcp and udp) and the port specified by
<code class="option">sercvices.mediatomb.port

Name: services.mediatomb.pcDirectoryHide
Desc: Whether to list the top-level directory or not (from upnp client standpoint).

Desc: The network port to listen on.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.mediatomb.ps3Support
Desc:
Whether to enable ps3 specific tweaks.
WARNING: incompatible with DSM 320 support.

Desc: Whether to enable Telegent TG100 specific tweaks.

Desc: Whether to enable transcoding.

Name: services.mediatomb.user
Desc: User account under which the service runs.

Name: services.mediatomb.uuid
Desc: A unique (on your network) to identify the server by.

Desc: Database name.

Desc:
A file containing the password corresponding to

Desc: Database host port.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.mediawiki.database.socket
Desc: Path to the unix socket file to use for authentication.

Name: services.mediawiki.database.tablePrefix
Desc:
If you only have access to a single database and wish to install more than
one version of MediaWiki, or have other applications that also use the
database, you can give the table names a unique prefix to stop any naming
conflicts or confusion.
See <a class="link" href="https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:$wgDBprefix"  target="_top">https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:$wgDBprefix

Name: services.mediawiki.database.type
Desc: Database engine to use. MySQL/MariaDB is the database of choice by MediaWiki developers.

Desc: Database user.

Name: services.mediawiki.extraConfig
Desc:
Any additional text to be appended to MediaWiki’s
LocalSettings.php configuration file. For configuration
settings, see <a class="link" href="https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:Configuration_settings"  target="_top">https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:Configuration_settings

Name: services.mediawiki.finalPackage
Desc: The final package used by the module. This is the package that will have extensions and skins installed.

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost
Desc: Apache configuration can be done by adapting <code class="option">services.httpd.virtualHosts

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.enableUserDir
Desc: Whether to enable serving <code class="filename">~/public_html

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.acmeRoot
Desc:
Directory for the acme challenge which is PUBLIC, don’t put certs or keys in here.
Set to null to inherit from config.security.acme.

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.adminAddr
Desc: E-mail address of the server administrator.

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.documentRoot
Desc:
The path of Apache’s document root directory.  If left undefined,
an empty directory in the Nix store will be used as root.

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.extraConfig
Desc:
These lines go to httpd.conf verbatim. They will go after
directories and directory aliases defined by default.

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that permanently redirects (301)
all plain HTTP traffic to HTTPS. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected permanently to
the given URL.

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.hostName
Desc: Canonical hostname for the server.

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTP 2. HTTP/2 is supported in all multi-processing modules that come with httpd. <span class="emphasis"><em>However, if you use the prefork mpm, there will
be severe restrictions.

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.listen
Desc: Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.listen._.ip
Desc: IP to listen on. 0.0.0.0 for IPv4 only, * for all.

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.listen._.port
Desc: Port to listen on
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.listen._.ssl
Desc: Whether to enable SSL (https) support.

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.locations
Desc: Declarative location config. See <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/core.html#location"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/core.html#location

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests. See <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_alias.html#alias"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_alias.html#alias

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds DirectoryIndex directive. See <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_dir.html#directoryindex"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_dir.html#directoryindex

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc: Sets up a simple reverse proxy as described by <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/howto/reverse_proxy.html#simple"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/howto/reverse_proxy.html#simple

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.logFormat
Desc: Log format for Apache’s log files. Possible values are: combined, common, referer, agent.

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.onlySSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.robotsEntries
Desc: Specification of pages to be ignored by web crawlers. See <a class="link" href="http://www.robotstxt.org/"  target="_top">http://www.robotstxt.org/

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.serverAliases

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.sslServerCert

Name: services.mediawiki.httpd.virtualHost.sslServerKey

A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

The hostname to use for the nginx virtual host.

Name: services.mediawiki.passwordFile

Name: services.mediawiki.passwordSender
Desc: Contact address for password reset.

Name: services.mediawiki.poolConfig
Desc: Options for the MediaWiki PHP pool. See the documentation on <code class="literal">php-fpm.conf
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

Name: services.mediawiki.skins
Desc: Attribute set of paths whose content is copied to the <code class="filename">skins

Name: services.mediawiki.uploadsDir

This directory is used for uploads of pictures. The directory passed here is automatically

Name: services.meilisearch.enable
Desc: Whether to enable MeiliSearch - a RESTful search API.

Name: services.meilisearch.package
Desc: The meilisearch package to use. Use this if you require specific features to be enabled. The default package has no features.

Name: services.meilisearch.environment
Desc: Defines the running environment of MeiliSearch.

Name: services.meilisearch.listenAddress
Desc: MeiliSearch listen address.

Name: services.meilisearch.listenPort
Desc: MeiliSearch port to listen on.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.meilisearch.logLevel
Desc:
Defines how much detail should be present in MeiliSearch’s logs.
MeiliSearch currently supports four log levels, listed in order of increasing verbosity:

Name: services.meilisearch.masterKeyEnvironmentFile
Desc:
Path to file which contains the master key.
By doing so, all routes will be protected and will require a key to be accessed.
If no master key is provided, all routes can be accessed without requiring any key.
The format is the following:
MEILI_MASTER_KEY=my_secret_key

Name: services.meilisearch.maxIndexSize
Desc:
Sets the maximum size of the index.
Value must be given in bytes or explicitly stating a base unit.
For example, the default value can be written as 107374182400, ‘107.7Gb’, or ‘107374 Mb’.
Default is 100 GiB

Name: services.meilisearch.noAnalytics
Desc:
Deactivates analytics.
Analytics allow MeiliSearch to know how many users are using MeiliSearch,
which versions and which platforms are used.
This process is entirely anonymous.

Name: services.meilisearch.payloadSizeLimit
Desc:
Sets the maximum size of accepted JSON payloads.
Value must be given in bytes or explicitly stating a base unit.
For example, the default value can be written as 107374182400, ‘107.7Gb’, or ‘107374 Mb’.
Default is ~ 100 MB

Name: services.memcached.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Memcached.

Name: services.memcached.enableUnixSocket
Desc: Whether to enable Unix Domain Socket at /run/memcached/memcached.sock instead of listening on an IP address and port. The <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.memcached.listen

Name: services.memcached.maxConnections

Name: services.memcached.maxMemory

See <a class="link" href="https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/metricbeat/current/configuration-general-options.html#_name"  target="_top">https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/metricbeat/current/configuration-general-options.html#_name

HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

anyone in this room can use the bot - secure your room!
This should be a room alias or room ID - not a matrix.to URL.
Note: <code class="literal">mjolnir

Desc:
Whether to enable ignoring the accessToken. If true, accessToken is ignored and the username/password below will be
used instead. The access token of the bot will be stored in the dataPath
.

The port where the daemon will listen to client connections for

Desc: With this option, you can customize the nginx virtualHost settings.
