Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.monica.nginx.acmeFallbackHost
Desc:
Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful
if you want multiple hosts to be able to verify the same domain name.

Name: services.monica.nginx.acmeRoot
Desc: Directory for the ACME challenge, which is <span class="strong"><strong>public

Name: services.monica.nginx.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.monica.nginx.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.monica.nginx.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.monica.nginx.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.monica.nginx.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Name: services.monica.nginx.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.monica.nginx.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,
configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.monica.nginx.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.monica.nginx.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.monica.nginx.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.monica.nginx.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.monica.nginx.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.monica.nginx.listen._.addr
Desc: Listen address.

Name: services.monica.nginx.listen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.monica.nginx.listen._.port
Desc:
Port number to listen on.
If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.monica.nginx.listen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.monica.nginx.listen._.ssl
Desc: Enable SSL.

Name: services.monica.nginx.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set

Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.

Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful

IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.mtprotoproxy.enable
Desc: Whether to enable mtprotoproxy.

Name: services.mtprotoproxy.adTag
Desc: Tag for advertising that can be obtained from @MTProxybot.

Name: services.mtprotoproxy.extraConfig
Desc: Extra configuration options for mtprotoproxy.

Name: services.mtprotoproxy.port
Desc: TCP port to accept mtproto connections on.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.mtprotoproxy.secureOnly
Desc: Don’t allow users to connect in non-secure mode (without random padding).

Name: services.mtprotoproxy.users
Desc: Allowed users and their secrets. A secret is a 32 characters long hex string.

Name: services.mtr-exporter.enable
Desc: Whether to enable a Prometheus exporter for MTR.

Name: services.mtr-exporter.package
Desc: The mtr-exporter package to use.

Name: services.mtr-exporter.address
Desc: Listen address for MTR exporter.

Name: services.mtr-exporter.extraFlags
Desc: Extra command line options to pass to MTR exporter.

Name: services.mtr-exporter.jobs
Desc: List of MTR jobs. Will be added to /etc/mtr-exporter.conf

Name: services.mtr-exporter.jobs._.address
Desc: Target address for MTR client.

Name: services.mtr-exporter.jobs._.flags
Desc: Additional flags to pass to MTR.

Name: services.mtr-exporter.jobs._.name
Desc: Name of ICMP pinging job.

Name: services.mtr-exporter.jobs._.schedule
Desc: Schedule of MTR checks. Also accepts Cron format.

Name: services.mtr-exporter.mtrPackage
Desc: The mtr package to use.

Name: services.mtr-exporter.port
Desc: Listen port for MTR exporter.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.mullvad-vpn.enable
Desc:
This option enables Mullvad VPN daemon.
This sets <code class="option">networking.firewall.checkReversePath

Name: services.mullvad-vpn.enableExcludeWrapper
Desc:
This option activates the wrapper that allows the use of mullvad-exclude.
Might have minor security impact, so consider disabling if you do not use the feature.

Name: services.mullvad-vpn.package
Desc: The mullvad package to use. <code class="literal">pkgs.mullvad

Name: services.multipath.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the device mapper multipath (DM-MP) daemon.

Name: services.multipath.package
Desc: The multipath-tools package to use.

Name: services.multipath.blacklist
Desc:
This section defines which devices should be excluded from the
multipath topology discovery.

Name: services.multipath.blacklist_exceptions
Desc:
This section defines which devices should be included in the
multipath topology discovery, despite being listed in the
blacklist section.

Name: services.multipath.defaults
Desc:
This section defines default values for attributes which are used
whenever no values are given in the appropriate device or multipath
sections.

Name: services.multipath.devices
Desc:
This option allows you to define arrays for use in multipath
groups.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.alias_prefix
Desc: The user_friendly_names prefix to use for this device type, instead of the default mpath

Name: services.multipath.devices._.all_tg_pt
Desc: Set the ‘all targets ports’ flag when registering keys with mpathpersist

Name: services.multipath.devices._.deferred_remove
Desc:
If set to “yes”, multipathd will do a deferred remove instead of a
regular remove when the last path device has been deleted. This means
that if the multipath device is still in use, it will be freed when
the last user closes it. If path is added to the multipath device
before the last user closes it, the deferred remove will be canceled.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.delay_wait_checks
Desc: This option is deprecated, and mapped to san_path_err_recovery_time

Name: services.multipath.devices._.delay_watch_checks
Desc: This option is deprecated, and mapped to san_path_err_forget_rate

Name: services.multipath.devices._.detect_checker
Desc:
If set to “yes”, multipath will try to detect if the device supports
SCSI-3 ALUA. If so, the device will automatically use the tur checker.
If set to “no”, the checker will be selected as usual.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.detect_prio
Desc:
If set to “yes”, multipath will try to detect if the device supports
SCSI-3 ALUA. If so, the device will automatically use the sysfs
prioritizer if the required sysf attributes access_state and
preferred_path are supported, or the alua prioritizer if not. If set
to “no”, the prioritizer will be selected as usual.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.dev_loss_tmo
Desc:
Specify the number of seconds the SCSI layer will wait after a problem has
been detected on a FC remote port before removing it from the system. This
can be set to “infinity” which sets it to the max value of 2147483647
seconds, or 68 years. It will be automatically adjusted to the overall
retry interval no_path_retry * polling_interval
if a number of retries is given with no_path_retry and the
overall retry interval is longer than the specified dev_loss_tmo value.
The Linux kernel will cap this value to 600 if fast_io_fail_tmo
is not set.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.failback
Desc: Tell multipathd how to manage path group failback. Quote integers as strings

Name: services.multipath.devices._.fast_io_fail_tmo
Desc:
Specify the number of seconds the SCSI layer will wait after a problem has been
detected on a FC remote port before failing I/O to devices on that remote port.
This should be smaller than dev_loss_tmo. Setting this to “off” will disable
the timeout. Quote integers as strings.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.features
Desc: Specify any device-mapper features to be used

Name: services.multipath.devices._.flush_on_last_del
Desc:
If set to “yes” multipathd will disable queueing when the last path to a
device has been deleted.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.getuid_callout
Desc:
(Superseded by uid_attribute) The default program and args to callout
to obtain a unique path identifier. Should be specified with an absolute path.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.ghost_delay
Desc: Sets the number of seconds that multipath will wait after creating a device with only ghost paths before marking it ready for use in systemd

Name: services.multipath.devices._.hardware_handler
Desc: The hardware handler to use for this device type

Name: services.multipath.devices._.marginal_path_double_failed_time
Desc: One of the four parameters of supporting path check based on accounting IO error such as intermittent error

Name: services.multipath.devices._.marginal_path_err_rate_threshold
Desc: The error rate threshold as a permillage (1/1000)

Name: services.multipath.devices._.marginal_path_err_recheck_gap_time
Desc: One of the four parameters of supporting path check based on accounting IO error such as intermittent error

Name: services.multipath.devices._.marginal_path_err_sample_time
Desc: One of the four parameters of supporting path check based on accounting IO error such as intermittent error

Name: services.multipath.devices._.max_sectors_kb
Desc: Sets the max_sectors_kb device parameter on all path devices and the multipath device to the specified value

Name: services.multipath.devices._.no_path_retry
Desc: Specify what to do when all paths are down. Quote integers as strings

Name: services.multipath.devices._.path_checker
Desc: The default method used to determine the paths state

Name: services.multipath.devices._.path_grouping_policy
Desc: The default path grouping policy to apply to unspecified multipaths

Name: services.multipath.devices._.path_selector
Desc: The default path selector algorithm to use; they are offered by the kernel multipath target

Name: services.multipath.devices._.prio
Desc: The name of the path priority routine

Name: services.multipath.devices._.prio_args
Desc: Arguments to pass to to the prio function

Name: services.multipath.devices._.product
Desc: Regular expression to match the product name

Name: services.multipath.devices._.product_blacklist
Desc: Products with the given vendor matching this string are blacklisted

Name: services.multipath.devices._.revision
Desc: Regular expression to match the product revision

Name: services.multipath.devices._.rr_min_io
Desc:
Number of I/O requests to route to a path before switching to the next in the
same path group. This is only for Block I/O (BIO) based multipath and
only apply to round-robin path_selector.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.rr_min_io_rq
Desc:
Number of I/O requests to route to a path before switching to the next in the
same path group. This is only for Request based multipath and
only apply to round-robin path_selector.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.rr_weight
Desc:
If set to priorities the multipath configurator will assign path weights
as “path prio * rr_min_io”.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.san_path_err_forget_rate
Desc:
If set to a value greater than 0, multipathd will check whether the path
failures has exceeded the san_path_err_threshold within this many checks
i.e san_path_err_forget_rate. If so we will not reinstante the path till
san_path_err_recovery_time.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.san_path_err_recovery_time
Desc:
If set to a value greater than 0, multipathd will make sure that when
path failures has exceeded the san_path_err_threshold within
san_path_err_forget_rate then the path will be placed in failed state
for san_path_err_recovery_time duration. Once san_path_err_recovery_time
has timeout we will reinstante the failed path. san_path_err_recovery_time
value should be in secs.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.san_path_err_threshold
Desc:
If set to a value greater than 0, multipathd will watch paths and check
how many times a path has been failed due to errors.If the number of
failures on a particular path is greater then the san_path_err_threshold,
then the path will not reinstate till san_path_err_recovery_time. These
path failures should occur within a san_path_err_forget_rate checks, if
not we will consider the path is good enough to reinstantate.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.skip_kpartx
Desc: If set to yes, kpartx will not automatically create partitions on the device

Name: services.multipath.devices._.uid_attribute
Desc: The udev attribute providing a unique path identifier (WWID)

Name: services.multipath.devices._.user_friendly_names
Desc:
If set to “yes”, using the bindings file /etc/multipath/bindings
to assign a persistent and unique alias to the multipath, in the
form of mpath. If set to “no” use the WWID as the alias. In either
case this be will be overridden by any specific aliases in the
multipaths section.

Name: services.multipath.devices._.vendor
Desc: Regular expression to match the vendor name

Name: services.multipath.devices._.vpd_vendor
Desc: The vendor specific vpd page information, using the vpd page abbreviation

Name: services.multipath.extraConfig
Desc: Lines to append to default multipath.conf

Name: services.multipath.extraConfigFile
Desc: Append an additional file’s contents to /etc/multipath.conf

Name: services.multipath.overrides
Desc:
This section defines values for attributes that should override the
device-specific settings for all devices.

Name: services.multipath.pathGroups
Desc:
This option allows you to define multipath groups as described
in http://christophe.varoqui.free.fr/usage.html.

Name: services.multipath.pathGroups._.alias
Desc: The name of the multipath device

Name: services.multipath.pathGroups._.array
Desc: The DNS name of the storage array

Name: services.multipath.pathGroups._.fsType
Desc: Type of the filesystem

Name: services.multipath.pathGroups._.options
Desc: Options used to mount the file system

Name: services.multipath.pathGroups._.wwid
Desc: The identifier for the multipath device

Name: services.munge.enable
Desc: Whether to enable munge service.

Name: services.munge.password
Desc: The path to a daemon’s secret key.

Name: services.munin-cron.enable
Desc:
Enable munin-cron. Takes care of all heavy lifting to collect data from
nodes and draws graphs to html. Runs munin-update, munin-limits,
munin-graphs and munin-html in that order.

Name: services.munin-cron.extraCSS
Desc:
Custom styling for the HTML that munin-cron generates. This will be
appended to the CSS files used by munin-cron and will thus take
precedence over the builtin styles.

Name: services.munin-cron.extraGlobalConfig
Desc: <code class="filename">munin.conf

Name: services.munin-cron.hosts
Desc:
Definitions of hosts of nodes to collect data from. Needs at least one
host for cron to succeed. See
<a class="link" href="https://guide.munin-monitoring.org/en/latest/reference/munin.conf.html"  target="_top">https://guide.munin-monitoring.org/en/latest/reference/munin.conf.html

Name: services.munin-node.enable
Desc:
Enable Munin Node agent. Munin node listens on 0.0.0.0 and
by default accepts connections only from 127.0.0.1 for security reasons.

Name: services.munin-node.disabledPlugins
Desc:
Munin plugins to disable, even if
<code class="literal">munin-node-configure --suggest

Name: services.munin-node.extraAutoPlugins
Desc:
Additional Munin plugins to autoconfigure, using
<code class="literal">munin-node-configure --suggest

Name: services.munin-node.extraConfig
Desc: <code class="filename">munin-node.conf

Name: services.munin-node.extraPluginConfig
Desc: <code class="filename">plugin-conf.d

Name: services.munin-node.extraPlugins
Desc:
Additional Munin plugins to activate. Keys are the name of the plugin
symlink, values are the path to the underlying plugin script. You
can use the same plugin script multiple times (e.g. for wildcard
plugins).

Name: services.murmur.enable
Desc: If enabled, start the Murmur Mumble server.

Name: services.murmur.package
Desc: The murmur package to use.

Name: services.murmur.allowHtml
Desc:
Allow HTML in client messages, comments, and channel
descriptions.

Name: services.murmur.autobanAttempts
Desc:
Number of attempts a client is allowed to make in
<code class="literal">autobanTimeframe

Name: services.murmur.autobanTime
Desc: The amount of time an IP ban lasts (in seconds).

Name: services.murmur.autobanTimeframe
Desc:
Timeframe in which a client can connect without being banned
for repeated attempts (in seconds).

Name: services.murmur.bandwidth
Desc:
Maximum bandwidth (in bits per second) that clients may send
speech at.

Name: services.murmur.bonjour
Desc:
Enable Bonjour auto-discovery, which allows clients over
your LAN to automatically discover Murmur servers.

Name: services.murmur.clientCertRequired
Desc: Require clients to authenticate via certificates.

Name: services.murmur.dbus
Desc: Enable D-Bus remote control. Set to the bus you want Murmur to connect to.

Name: services.murmur.environmentFile
Desc: Environment file as defined in <a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.exec.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">systemd.exec

Name: services.murmur.extraConfig
Desc: Extra configuration to put into murmur.ini.

Name: services.murmur.group
Desc:
The name of an existing group to use to run the service.
If not specified, the default group will be created.

Name: services.murmur.hostName
Desc: Host to bind to. Defaults binding on all addresses.

Name: services.murmur.imgMsgLength
Desc: Max length of image messages. Set 0 for no limit.

Name: services.murmur.logDays
Desc:
How long to store RPC logs for in the database. Set 0 to
keep logs forever, or -1 to disable DB logging.

Name: services.murmur.logFile
Desc: Path to the log file for Murmur daemon. Empty means log to journald.

Name: services.murmur.openFirewall
Desc: Open ports in the firewall for the Murmur Mumble server.

Name: services.murmur.password
Desc: Required password to join server, if specified.

Name: services.murmur.port
Desc: Ports to bind to (UDP and TCP).
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.murmur.registerHostname
Desc:
DNS hostname where your server can be reached. This is only
needed if you want your server to be accessed by its
hostname and not IP - but the name <span class="emphasis"><em>must

Name: services.murmur.registerName
Desc:
Public server registration name, and also the name of the
Root channel. Even if you don’t publicly register your
server, you probably still want to set this.

Name: services.murmur.registerPassword
Desc:
Public server registry password, used authenticate your
server to the registry to prevent impersonation; required for
subsequent registry updates.

Name: services.murmur.registerUrl
Desc: URL website for your server.

Name: services.murmur.sendVersion
Desc: Send Murmur version in UDP response.

Name: services.murmur.sslCa
Desc: Path to your SSL CA certificate.

Name: services.murmur.sslCert
Desc: Path to your SSL certificate.

Name: services.murmur.sslKey
Desc: Path to your SSL key.

Name: services.murmur.stateDir
Desc: Directory to store data for the server.

Name: services.murmur.textMsgLength
Desc: Max length of text messages. Set 0 for no limit.

Name: services.murmur.user
Desc:
The name of an existing user to use to run the service.
If not specified, the default user will be created.

Name: services.murmur.users
Desc: Maximum number of concurrent clients allowed.

Name: services.murmur.welcometext
Desc: Welcome message for connected clients.

Name: services.music-assistant.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Music Assistant.

Name: services.music-assistant.package
Desc: The music-assistant package to use.

Name: services.music-assistant.extraOptions
Desc: List of extra options to pass to the music-assistant executable.

Name: services.music-assistant.providers
Desc: List of provider names for which dependencies will be installed.

Name: services.mx-puppet-discord.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable mx-puppet-discord is a discord puppeting bridge for matrix.
It handles bridging private and group DMs, as well as Guilds (servers)
.

Name: services.mx-puppet-discord.serviceDependencies
Desc: List of Systemd services to require and wait for when starting the application service.

Name: services.mx-puppet-discord.settings
Desc: <code class="filename">config.yaml

Name: services.mycelium.enable
Desc: Whether to enable mycelium network.

Name: services.mycelium.package
Desc: The mycelium package to use

Name: services.mycelium.addHostedPublicNodes
Desc: Adds the hosted peers from https://github.com/threefoldtech/mycelium#hosted-public-nodes.

Name: services.mycelium.extraArgs
Desc: Extra command-line arguments to pass to mycelium.

Name: services.mycelium.keyFile
Desc:
Optional path to a file containing the mycelium key material.
If unset, the default location (<code class="literal">/var/lib/mycelium/key.bin

Name: services.mycelium.openFirewall
Desc: Open the firewall for mycelium

Name: services.mycelium.peers
Desc: List of peers to connect to, in the formats:

Name: services.mympd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable MyMPD server.

Name: services.mympd.package
Desc: The mympd package to use.

Name: services.mympd.extraGroups
Desc: Additional groups for the systemd service.

Name: services.mympd.openFirewall
Desc: Open ports needed for the functionality of the program.

Name: services.mympd.settings
Desc:
Manages the configuration files declaratively. For all the configuration
options, see <a class="link" href="https://jcorporation.github.io/myMPD/configuration/configuration-files"  target="_top">https://jcorporation.github.io/myMPD/configuration/configuration-files
Type: attribute set of (null or string or boolean or signed integer)

Name: services.mympd.settings.http_port
Desc: The HTTP port where mympd’s web interface will be available.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.mympd.settings.ssl
Desc: Whether to enable listening on the SSL port.

Name: services.mysql.enable
Desc: Whether to enable MySQL server.

Name: services.mysql.package
Desc: Which MySQL derivation to use. MariaDB packages are supported too.

Name: services.mysql.configFile
Desc:
Override the configuration file used by MySQL. By default,
NixOS generates one automatically from <code class="option">services.mysql.settings

Name: services.mysql.dataDir
Desc: The data directory for MySQL.

Name: services.mysql.ensureDatabases
Desc:
Ensures that the specified databases exist.
This option will never delete existing databases, especially not when the value of this
option is changed. This means that databases created once through this option or
otherwise have to be removed manually.

Name: services.mysql.ensureUsers
Desc:
Ensures that the specified users exist and have at least the ensured permissions.
The MySQL users will be identified using Unix socket authentication. This authenticates the Unix user with the
same name only, and that without the need for a password.
This option will never delete existing users or remove permissions, especially not when the value of this
option is changed. This means that users created and permissions assigned once through this option or
otherwise have to be removed manually.

Name: services.mysql.ensureUsers._.ensurePermissions
Desc:
Permissions to ensure for the user, specified as attribute set.
The attribute names specify the database and tables to grant the permissions for,
separated by a dot. You may use wildcards here.
The attribute values specfiy the permissions to grant.
You may specify one or multiple comma-separated SQL privileges here.

Name: services.mysql.ensureUsers._.name
Desc: Name of the user to ensure.

Name: services.mysql.group
Desc: Group account under which MySQL runs.

Name: services.mysql.initialDatabases
Desc:
List of database names and their initial schemas that should be used to create databases on the first startup
of MySQL. The schema attribute is optional: If not specified, an empty database is created.

Name: services.mysql.initialDatabases._.name
Desc: The name of the database to create.

Name: services.mysql.initialDatabases._.schema
Desc:
The initial schema of the database; if null (the default),
an empty database is created.

Name: services.mysql.initialScript
Desc: A file containing SQL statements to be executed on the first startup. Can be used for granting certain permissions on the database.

Name: services.mysql.replication.masterHost
Desc: Hostname of the MySQL master server.

Name: services.mysql.replication.masterPassword
Desc: Password of the MySQL replication user.

Name: services.mysql.replication.masterPort
Desc: Port number on which the MySQL master server runs.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.mysql.replication.masterUser
Desc: Username of the MySQL replication user.

Name: services.mysql.replication.role
Desc: Role of the MySQL server instance.

Name: services.mysql.replication.serverId
Desc: Id of the MySQL server instance. This number must be unique for each instance.

Name: services.mysql.replication.slaveHost
Desc: Hostname of the MySQL slave server.

Name: services.mysql.settings
Desc:
MySQL configuration. Refer to
<a class="link" href="https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/server-system-variables.html"  target="_top">https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/server-system-variables.html
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string) or a list of them for duplicate keys)

Name: services.mysql.user
Desc: User account under which MySQL runs.

Name: services.mysqlBackup.enable
Desc: Whether to enable MySQL backups.

Name: services.mysqlBackup.calendar
Desc: Configured when to run the backup service systemd unit (DayOfWeek Year-Month-Day Hour:Minute:Second).

Name: services.mysqlBackup.databases
Desc: List of database names to dump.

Name: services.mysqlBackup.gzipOptions
Desc: Command line options to use when invoking <code class="literal">gzip

Name: services.mysqlBackup.location
Desc: Location to put the gzipped MySQL database dumps.

Name: services.mysqlBackup.singleTransaction
Desc: Whether to create database dump in a single transaction

Name: services.mysqlBackup.user
Desc: User to be used to perform backup.

Name: services.n8n.enable
Desc: Whether to enable n8n server.

Name: services.n8n.openFirewall
Desc: Open ports in the firewall for the n8n web interface.

Name: services.n8n.settings
Desc: Configuration for n8n, see <a class="link" href="https://docs.n8n.io/hosting/environment-variables/configuration-methods/"  target="_top">https://docs.n8n.io/hosting/environment-variables/configuration-methods/

Name: services.n8n.webhookUrl
Desc:
WEBHOOK_URL for n8n, in case we’re running behind a reverse proxy.
This cannot be set through configuration and must reside in an environment variable.

Name: services.nagios.enable
Desc: Whether to enable <a class="link" href="https://www.nagios.org/"  target="_top">Nagios

Name: services.nagios.enableWebInterface
Desc:
Whether to enable the Nagios web interface.  You should also
enable Apache (<code class="option">services.httpd.enable

Name: services.nagios.cgiConfigFile
Desc:
Derivation for the configuration file of Nagios CGI scripts
that can be used in web servers for running the Nagios web interface.

Name: services.nagios.extraConfig
Desc: Configuration to add to /etc/nagios.cfg

Name: services.nagios.mainConfigFile
Desc: If non-null, overrides the main configuration file of Nagios.

Name: services.nagios.objectDefs
Desc:
A list of Nagios object configuration files that must define
the hosts, host groups, services and contacts for the
network that you want Nagios to monitor.

Name: services.nagios.plugins
Desc: Packages to be added to the Nagios <code class="envar">PATH

Name: services.nagios.validateConfig
Desc: if true, the syntax of the nagios configuration file is checked at build time

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost
Desc: Apache configuration can be done by adapting <code class="option">services.httpd.virtualHosts

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.enableUserDir
Desc: Whether to enable serving <code class="filename">~/public_html

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.acmeRoot
Desc:
Directory for the acme challenge which is PUBLIC, don’t put certs or keys in here.
Set to null to inherit from config.security.acme.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.adminAddr
Desc: E-mail address of the server administrator.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.documentRoot
Desc:
The path of Apache’s document root directory.  If left undefined,
an empty directory in the Nix store will be used as root.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.extraConfig
Desc:
These lines go to httpd.conf verbatim. They will go after
directories and directory aliases defined by default.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that permanently redirects (301)
all plain HTTP traffic to HTTPS. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected permanently to
the given URL.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.hostName
Desc: Canonical hostname for the server.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTP 2. HTTP/2 is supported in all multi-processing modules that come with httpd. <span class="emphasis"><em>However, if you use the prefork mpm, there will
be severe restrictions.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.listen
Desc: Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.listen._.ip
Desc: IP to listen on. 0.0.0.0 for IPv4 only, * for all.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.listen._.port
Desc: Port to listen on
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.listen._.ssl
Desc: Whether to enable SSL (https) support.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.locations
Desc: Declarative location config. See <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/core.html#location"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/core.html#location

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests. See <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_alias.html#alias"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_alias.html#alias

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds DirectoryIndex directive. See <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_dir.html#directoryindex"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_dir.html#directoryindex

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc: Sets up a simple reverse proxy as described by <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/howto/reverse_proxy.html#simple"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/howto/reverse_proxy.html#simple

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.logFormat
Desc: Log format for Apache’s log files. Possible values are: combined, common, referer, agent.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.onlySSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.robotsEntries
Desc: Specification of pages to be ignored by web crawlers. See <a class="link" href="http://www.robotstxt.org/"  target="_top">http://www.robotstxt.org/

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.servedDirs
Desc: This option provides a simple way to serve static directories.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.servedFiles
Desc: This option provides a simple way to serve individual, static files.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.serverAliases
Desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.sslServerCert
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.sslServerChain
Desc: Path to server SSL chain file.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.sslServerKey
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate key.

Name: services.nagios.virtualHost.useACMEHost
Desc:
A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

Name: services.namecoind.enable
Desc: Whether to enable namecoind, Namecoin client.

Name: services.namecoind.extraNodes
Desc: List of additional peer IP addresses to connect to.

Name: services.namecoind.generate
Desc: Whether to generate (mine) Namecoins.

Name: services.namecoind.rpc.address
Desc: IP address the RPC server will bind to.

Name: services.namecoind.rpc.allowFrom
Desc:
List of IP address ranges allowed to use the RPC API.
Wiledcards (*) can be user to specify a range.

Name: services.namecoind.rpc.certificate
Desc: Certificate file for securing RPC connections.

Name: services.namecoind.rpc.key
Desc: Key file for securing RPC connections.

Name: services.namecoind.rpc.password
Desc: Password for RPC connections.

Name: services.namecoind.rpc.port
Desc: Port the RPC server will bind to.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.namecoind.rpc.user
Desc: User name for RPC connections.

Name: services.namecoind.trustedNodes
Desc:
List of the only peer IP addresses to connect to. If specified
no other connection will be made.

Name: services.namecoind.wallet
Desc:
Wallet file. The ownership of the file has to be
namecoin:namecoin, and the permissions must be 0640.

Name: services.nar-serve.enable
Desc: Whether to enable serving NAR file contents via HTTP.

Name: services.nar-serve.package
Desc: The nar-serve package to use.

Name: services.nar-serve.cacheURL
Desc: Binary cache URL to connect to.

Name: services.nar-serve.domain
Desc:
When set, enables the feature of serving <nar-hash>.<domain>
on top of <domain>/nix/store/<nar-hash>-<pname>.

Name: services.nar-serve.port
Desc: Port number where nar-serve will listen on.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nats.enable
Desc: Whether to enable NATS messaging system.

Name: services.nats.dataDir
Desc:
The NATS data directory. Only used if JetStream is enabled, for
storing stream metadata and messages.

Name: services.nats.group
Desc: Group under which NATS runs.

Name: services.nats.jetstream
Desc: Whether to enable JetStream.

Name: services.nats.port
Desc: Port on which to listen.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nats.serverName
Desc: Name of the NATS server, must be unique if clustered.

Name: services.nats.settings
Desc:
Declarative NATS configuration. See the
<a class="link" href="https://docs.nats.io/nats-server/configuration"  target="_top">
NATS documentation

Name: services.nats.user
Desc: User account under which NATS runs.

Name: services.navidrome.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Navidrome music server.

Name: services.navidrome.package
Desc: The navidrome package to use.

Name: services.navidrome.group
Desc: Group under which Navidrome runs.

Name: services.navidrome.openFirewall
Desc: Whether to open the TCP port in the firewall

Name: services.navidrome.settings
Desc: Configuration for Navidrome, see <a class="link" href="https://www.navidrome.org/docs/usage/configuration-options/"  target="_top">https://www.navidrome.org/docs/usage/configuration-options/

Name: services.navidrome.settings.Address
Desc: Address to run Navidrome on.

Name: services.navidrome.settings.Port
Desc: Port to run Navidrome on.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.navidrome.user
Desc: User under which Navidrome runs.

Name: services.nbd.server.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Network Block Device (nbd) server.

Name: services.nbd.server.exports
Desc: Files or block devices to make available over the network.

Name: services.nbd.server.exports._name_.allowAddresses
Desc: IPs and subnets that are authorized to connect for this device. If not specified, the server will allow all connections.

Name: services.nbd.server.exports._name_.extraOptions
Desc:
Extra options for this export. See
<span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">nbd-server
Type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string)

Name: services.nbd.server.exports._name_.path
Desc: File or block device to export.

Name: services.nbd.server.extraOptions
Desc:
Extra options for the server. See
<span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">nbd-server
Type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string)

Name: services.nbd.server.listenAddress
Desc: Address to listen on. If not specified, the server will listen on all interfaces.

Name: services.nbd.server.listenPort
Desc: Port to listen on. The port is NOT automatically opened in the firewall.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.ncdns.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable ncdns, a Go daemon to bridge Namecoin to DNS.
To resolve .bit domains set <code class="literal">services.namecoind.enable = true;

Name: services.ncdns.address
Desc:
The IP address the ncdns resolver will bind to.  Leave this unchanged
if you do not wish to directly expose the resolver.

Name: services.ncdns.dnssec.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable DNSSEC support in ncdns. This will generate KSK and ZSK keypairs
(unless provided via the options
<code class="option">services.ncdns.dnssec.publicKey

Name: services.ncdns.dnssec.keys.private
Desc: Path to the file containing the KSK private key.

Name: services.ncdns.dnssec.keys.public
Desc:
Path to the file containing the KSK public key.
The key can be generated using the <code class="literal">dnssec-keygen

Name: services.ncdns.dnssec.keys.zonePrivate
Desc: Path to the file containing the ZSK private key.

Name: services.ncdns.dnssec.keys.zonePublic
Desc:
Path to the file containing the ZSK public key.
The key can be generated using the <code class="literal">dnssec-keygen

Name: services.ncdns.identity.address
Desc:
The IP address the hostname specified in
<code class="option">services.ncdns.identity.hostname

Name: services.ncdns.identity.hostmaster
Desc:
An email address for the SOA record at the bit zone.
If you are only using ncdns locally you can ignore this.

Name: services.ncdns.identity.hostname
Desc:
The hostname of this ncdns instance, which defaults to the machine
hostname. If specified, ncdns lists the hostname as an NS record at
the zone apex:

Name: services.ncdns.port
Desc: The port the ncdns resolver will bind to.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.ncdns.settings
Desc:
ncdns settings. Use this option to configure ncds
settings not exposed in a NixOS option or to bypass one.
See the example ncdns.conf file at <a class="link" href="https://github.com/namecoin/ncdns/blob/master/_doc/ncdns.conf.example"  target="_top">https://github.com/namecoin/ncdns/blob/master/_doc/ncdns.conf.example
Type:
ncdns.conf configuration type. The format consists of an
attribute set of settings. Each setting can be either `null`,
a value or an attribute set. The allowed values are integers,
strings, booleans or paths.

Name: services.ndppd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable daemon that proxies NDP (Neighbor Discovery Protocol) messages between interfaces.

Name: services.ndppd.configFile
Desc: Path to configuration file.

Name: services.ndppd.interface
Desc:
Interface which is on link-level with router.
(Legacy option, use services.ndppd.proxies.<interface>.rules.<network> instead)

Name: services.ndppd.network
Desc:
Network that we proxy.
(Legacy option, use services.ndppd.proxies.<interface>.rules.<network> instead)

Name: services.ndppd.proxies
Desc:
This sets up a listener, that will listen for any Neighbor Solicitation
messages, and respond to them according to a set of rules.

Name: services.ndppd.proxies._name_.interface
Desc:
Listen for any Neighbor Solicitation messages on this interface,
and respond to them according to a set of rules.
Defaults to the name of the attrset.

Name: services.ndppd.proxies._name_.router
Desc: Turns on or off the router flag for Neighbor Advertisement Messages.

Name: services.ndppd.proxies._name_.rules
Desc:
This is a rule that the target address is to match against. If no netmask
is provided, /128 is assumed. You may have several rule sections, and the
addresses may or may not overlap.

Name: services.ndppd.proxies._name_.rules._name_.interface
Desc: Interface to use when method is iface.

Name: services.ndppd.proxies._name_.rules._name_.method
Desc:
static: Immediately answer any Neighbor Solicitation Messages
(if they match the IP rule).
iface: Forward the Neighbor Solicitation Message through the specified
interface and only respond if a matching Neighbor Advertisement
Message is received.
auto: Same as iface, but instead of manually specifying the outgoing
interface, check for a matching route in /proc/net/ipv6_route.

Name: services.ndppd.proxies._name_.rules._name_.network
Desc:
This is the target address is to match against. If no netmask
is provided, /128 is assumed. The addresses of several rules
may or may not overlap.
Defaults to the name of the attrset.

Name: services.ndppd.proxies._name_.timeout
Desc:
Controls how long to wait for a Neighbor Advertisement Message before
invalidating the entry, in milliseconds.

Name: services.ndppd.proxies._name_.ttl
Desc:
Controls how long a valid or invalid entry remains in the cache, in
milliseconds.

Name: services.ndppd.routeTTL
Desc:
This tells ‘ndppd’ how often to reload the route file /proc/net/ipv6_route,
in milliseconds.

Name: services.neard.enable
Desc: Whether to enable neard, an NFC daemon.

Name: services.neard.settings
Desc: Neard INI-style configuration file as a Nix attribute set.
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: services.neard.settings.General.ConstantPoll
Desc:
Enable constant polling. Constant polling will automatically trigger a new
polling loop whenever a tag or a device is no longer in the RF field.

Name: services.neard.settings.General.DefaultPowered
Desc: Automatically turn an adapter on when being discovered.

Name: services.neard.settings.General.ResetOnError
Desc: Power cycle the adapter when getting a driver error from the kernel.

Name: services.nebula.networks
Desc: Nebula network definitions.

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.enable
Desc: Enable or disable this network.

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.package
Desc: The nebula package to use.

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.ca
Desc: Path to the certificate authority certificate.

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.cert
Desc: Path to the host certificate.

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.firewall.inbound
Desc: Firewall rules for inbound traffic.

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.firewall.outbound
Desc: Firewall rules for outbound traffic.

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.isLighthouse
Desc: Whether this node is a lighthouse.

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.isRelay
Desc: Whether this node is a relay.

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.key
Desc: Path or reference to the host key.

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.lighthouses
Desc:
List of IPs of lighthouse hosts this node should report to and query from. This should be empty on lighthouse
nodes. The IPs should be the lighthouse’s Nebula IPs, not their external IPs.

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.listen.host
Desc: IP address to listen on.

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.listen.port
Desc: Port number to listen on.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.relays
Desc: List of IPs of relays that this node should allow traffic from.

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.settings
Desc:
Nebula configuration. Refer to
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/slackhq/nebula/blob/master/examples/config.yml"  target="_top">https://github.com/slackhq/nebula/blob/master/examples/config.yml

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.staticHostMap
Desc:
The static host map defines a set of hosts with fixed IP addresses on the internet (or any network).
A host can have multiple fixed IP addresses defined here, and nebula will try each when establishing a tunnel.
Type: attribute set of list of string

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.tun.device
Desc: Name of the tun device. Defaults to nebula.${networkName}.

Name: services.nebula.networks._name_.tun.disable
Desc: When tun is disabled, a lighthouse can be started without a local tun interface (and therefore without root).

Name: services.neo4j.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Neo4j Community Edition.

Name: services.neo4j.package
Desc: The neo4j package to use.

Name: services.neo4j.bolt.enable
Desc:
Enable the BOLT connector for Neo4j. Setting this option to
<code class="literal">false

Name: services.neo4j.bolt.listenAddress
Desc:
Neo4j listen address for BOLT traffic. The listen address is
expressed in the format <code class="literal"><ip-address>:<port-number>

Name: services.neo4j.bolt.sslPolicy
Desc: Neo4j SSL policy for BOLT traffic.

Name: services.neo4j.bolt.tlsLevel
Desc: SSL/TSL requirement level for BOLT traffic.

Name: services.neo4j.constrainLoadCsv
Desc:
Sets the root directory for file URLs used with the Cypher
<code class="literal">LOAD CSV

Name: services.neo4j.defaultListenAddress
Desc:
Default network interface to listen for incoming connections. To
listen for connections on all interfaces, use “0.0.0.0”.

Name: services.neo4j.directories.certificates
Desc:
Directory for storing certificates to be used by Neo4j for
TLS connections.

Name: services.neo4j.directories.data
Desc:
Path of the data directory. You must not configure more than one
Neo4j installation to use the same data directory.

Name: services.neo4j.directories.home
Desc:
Path of the Neo4j home directory. Other default directories are
subdirectories of this path. This directory will be created if
non-existent, and its ownership will be <span class="command"><strong>chown

Name: services.neo4j.directories.imports
Desc:
The root directory for file URLs used with the Cypher
<code class="literal">LOAD CSV

Name: services.neo4j.directories.plugins
Desc:
Path of the database plugin directory. Compiled Java JAR files that
contain database procedures will be loaded if they are placed in
this directory.

Name: services.neo4j.extraServerConfig
Desc:
Extra configuration for Neo4j Community server. Refer to the
<a class="link" href="https://neo4j.com/docs/operations-manual/current/reference/configuration-settings/"  target="_top">complete reference

Name: services.neo4j.http.enable
Desc:
Enable the HTTP connector for Neo4j. Setting this option to
<code class="literal">false

Name: services.neo4j.http.listenAddress
Desc:
Neo4j listen address for HTTP traffic. The listen address is
expressed in the format <code class="literal"><ip-address>:<port-number>

Name: services.neo4j.https.enable
Desc:
Enable the HTTPS connector for Neo4j. Setting this option to
<code class="literal">false

Name: services.neo4j.https.listenAddress
Desc:
Neo4j listen address for HTTPS traffic. The listen address is
expressed in the format <code class="literal"><ip-address>:<port-number>

Name: services.neo4j.https.sslPolicy
Desc: Neo4j SSL policy for HTTPS traffic.

Name: services.neo4j.readOnly
Desc: Only allow read operations from this Neo4j instance.

Name: services.neo4j.shell.enable
Desc:
Enable a remote shell server which Neo4j Shell clients can log in to.
Only applicable to <span class="command"><strong>neo4j-shell

Name: services.neo4j.ssl.policies
Desc:
Defines the SSL policies for use with Neo4j connectors. Each attribute
of this set defines a policy, with the attribute name defining the name
of the policy and its namespace. Refer to the operations manual section
on Neo4j’s
<a class="link" href="https://neo4j.com/docs/operations-manual/current/security/ssl-framework/"  target="_top">SSL Framework

Name: services.neo4j.ssl.policies._name_.allowKeyGeneration
Desc:
Allows the generation of a private key and associated self-signed
certificate. Only performed when both objects cannot be found for
this policy. It is recommended to turn this off again after keys
have been generated.

Name: services.neo4j.ssl.policies._name_.baseDirectory
Desc:
The mandatory base directory for cryptographic objects of this
policy. This path is only automatically generated when this
option as well as <code class="option">directories.certificates

Name: services.neo4j.ssl.policies._name_.ciphers
Desc:
Restrict the allowed ciphers of this policy to those defined
here. The default ciphers are those of the JVM platform.

Name: services.neo4j.ssl.policies._name_.clientAuth
Desc: The client authentication stance for this policy.

Name: services.neo4j.ssl.policies._name_.privateKey
Desc:
The name of private PKCS #8 key file for this policy to be found
in the <code class="option">baseDirectory

Name: services.neo4j.ssl.policies._name_.publicCertificate
Desc:
The name of public X.509 certificate (chain) file in PEM format
for this policy to be found in the <code class="option">baseDirectory

Name: services.neo4j.ssl.policies._name_.revokedDir
Desc:
Path to directory of CRLs (Certificate Revocation Lists) in
PEM format. Must be an absolute path. The existence of this
directory is mandatory and will need to be created manually when:
setting this option to something other than its default; setting
either this policy’s <code class="option">baseDirectory

Name: services.neo4j.ssl.policies._name_.tlsVersions
Desc:
Restrict the TLS protocol versions of this policy to those
defined here.

Name: services.neo4j.ssl.policies._name_.trustAll
Desc:
Makes this policy trust all remote parties. Enabling this is not
recommended and the policy’s trusted directory will be ignored.
Use of this mode is discouraged. It would offer encryption but
no security.

Name: services.neo4j.ssl.policies._name_.trustedDir
Desc:
Path to directory of X.509 certificates in PEM format for
trusted parties. Must be an absolute path. The existence of this
directory is mandatory and will need to be created manually when:
setting this option to something other than its default; setting
either this policy’s <code class="option">baseDirectory

Name: services.neo4j.workerCount
Desc:
Number of Neo4j worker threads, where the default of
<code class="literal">0

Name: services.netatalk.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Netatalk AFP fileserver.

Name: services.netatalk.extmap
Desc:
File name extension mappings.
See <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">extmap.conf

Name: services.netatalk.port
Desc: TCP port to be used for AFP.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.netatalk.settings
Desc:
Configuration for Netatalk. See
<span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">afp.conf
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: services.netbird.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Netbird daemon.

Name: services.netbird.package
Desc: The netbird package to use.

Name: services.netbird.server.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Netbird Server stack, comprising the dashboard, management API and signal service.

Name: services.netbird.server.enableNginx
Desc: Whether to enable Nginx reverse-proxy for the netbird server services.

Name: services.netbird.server.coturn.enable
Desc: Whether to enable a Coturn server for Netbird, will also open the firewall on the configured range.

Name: services.netbird.server.coturn.domain
Desc: The domain under which the coturn server runs.

Name: services.netbird.server.coturn.openPorts
Desc: The list of ports used by coturn for listening to open in the firewall.
Type: list of 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.netbird.server.coturn.password
Desc:
The password of the user used by netbird to connect to the coturn server.
Be advised this will be world readable in the nix store.

Name: services.netbird.server.coturn.passwordFile
Desc: The path to a file containing the password of the user used by netbird to connect to the coturn server.

Name: services.netbird.server.coturn.useAcmeCertificates
Desc: Whether to use ACME certificates corresponding to the given domain for the server.

Name: services.netbird.server.coturn.user
Desc: The username used by netbird to connect to the coturn server.

Name: services.netbird.server.dashboard.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the static netbird dashboard frontend.

Name: services.netbird.server.dashboard.enableNginx
Desc: Whether to enable Nginx reverse-proxy to serve the dashboard.

Name: services.netbird.server.dashboard.package
Desc: The netbird-dashboard package to use.

Name: services.netbird.server.dashboard.domain
Desc: The domain under which the dashboard runs.

Name: services.netbird.server.dashboard.finalDrv
Desc: The derivation containing the final templated dashboard.

Name: services.netbird.server.dashboard.managementServer
Desc: The address of the management server, used for the API endpoints.

Name: services.netbird.server.dashboard.settings
Desc:
An attribute set that will be used to substitute variables when building the dashboard.
Any values set here will be templated into the frontend and be public for anyone that can reach your website.
The exact values sadly aren’t documented anywhere.
A starting point when searching for valid values is this <a class="link" href="https://github.com/netbirdio/dashboard/blob/main/docker/init_react_envs.sh"  target="_top">script

Name: services.netbird.server.domain
Desc: The domain under which the netbird server runs.

Name: services.netbird.server.management.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Netbird Management Service.

Name: services.netbird.server.management.enableNginx
Desc: Whether to enable Nginx reverse-proxy for the netbird management service.

Name: services.netbird.server.management.package
Desc: The netbird package to use.

Name: services.netbird.server.management.disableAnonymousMetrics
Desc: Disables push of anonymous usage metrics to NetBird.

Name: services.netbird.server.management.disableSingleAccountMode
Desc:
If set to true, disables single account mode.
The <code class="literal">singleAccountModeDomain

Name: services.netbird.server.management.dnsDomain
Desc: Domain used for peer resolution.

Name: services.netbird.server.management.domain
Desc: The domain under which the management API runs.

Name: services.netbird.server.management.extraOptions
Desc: Additional options given to netbird-mgmt as commandline arguments.

Name: services.netbird.server.management.logLevel
Desc: Log level of the netbird services.

Name: services.netbird.server.management.metricsPort
Desc: Internal port of the metrics server.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.netbird.server.management.oidcConfigEndpoint
Desc: The oidc discovery endpoint.

Name: services.netbird.server.management.port
Desc: Internal port of the management server.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.netbird.server.management.settings
Desc:
Configuration of the netbird management server.
Options containing secret data should be set to an attribute set containing the attribute _secret

Name: services.netbird.server.management.singleAccountModeDomain
Desc:
Enables single account mode.
This means that all the users will be under the same account grouped by the specified domain.
If the installation has more than one account, the property is ineffective.

Name: services.netbird.server.management.turnDomain
Desc: The domain of the TURN server to use.

Name: services.netbird.server.management.turnPort
Desc: The port of the TURN server to use.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.netbird.server.signal.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Netbird’s Signal Service.

Name: services.netbird.server.signal.enableNginx
Desc: Whether to enable Nginx reverse-proxy for the netbird signal service.

Name: services.netbird.server.signal.package
Desc: The netbird package to use.

Name: services.netbird.server.signal.domain

Name: services.netbox.settings.ALLOWED_HOSTS
Desc:
A list of valid fully-qualified domain names (FQDNs) and/or IP
addresses that can be used to reach the NetBox service.

Name: services.netclient.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Netclient Daemon.

Name: services.netclient.package
Desc: The netclient package to use.

Name: services.netdata.enable
Desc: Whether to enable netdata.

Name: services.netdata.enableAnalyticsReporting
Desc:
Enable reporting of anonymous usage statistics to Netdata Inc. via either
Google Analytics (in versions prior to 1.29.4), or Netdata Inc.'s
self-hosted PostHog (in versions 1.29.4 and later).
See: <a class="link" href="https://learn.netdata.cloud/docs/agent/anonymous-statistics"  target="_top">https://learn.netdata.cloud/docs/agent/anonymous-statistics

Name: services.netdata.package
Desc: The netdata package to use.

Name: services.netdata.claimTokenFile
Desc:
If set, automatically registers the agent using the given claim token
file.

Name: services.netdata.config
Desc: netdata.conf configuration as nix attributes. cannot be combined with configText.

Name: services.netdata.configDir
Desc:
Complete netdata config directory except netdata.conf.
The default configuration is merged with changes
defined in this option.
Each top-level attribute denotes a path in the configuration
directory as in environment.etc.
Its value is the absolute path and must be readable by netdata.
Cannot be combined with configText.

Name: services.netdata.configText
Desc: Verbatim netdata.conf, cannot be combined with config.

Name: services.netdata.deadlineBeforeStopSec
Desc:
In order to detect when netdata is misbehaving, we run a concurrent task pinging netdata (wait-for-netdata-up)
in the systemd unit.

Name: services.netdata.extraPluginPaths
Desc:
Extra paths to add to the netdata global “plugins directory”
option.  Useful for when you want to include your own
collection scripts.

Name: services.netdata.group
Desc: Group under which netdata runs.

Name: services.netdata.python.enable
Desc: Whether to enable python-based plugins

Name: services.netdata.python.extraPackages
Desc:
Extra python packages available at runtime
to enable additional python plugins.
Type: function that evaluates to a(n) list of package

Name: services.netdata.python.recommendedPythonPackages
Desc:
Whether to enable a set of recommended Python plugins
by installing extra Python packages.

Name: services.netdata.user
Desc: User account under which netdata runs.

Name: services.networkaudiod.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Networkaudiod (NAA).

Name: services.networkd-dispatcher.enable

Whether to enable Networkd-dispatcher service for systemd-networkd connection status

Declarative configuration of networkd-dispatcher rules. See
<a class="link" href="https://gitlab.com/craftyguy/networkd-dispatcher"  target="_top">upstream instructions

Name: services.networkd-dispatcher.rules._name_.onState

List of names of the systemd-networkd operational states which
should trigger the script. See <a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/networkctl.html"  target="_top">https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/networkctl.html

Name: services.networkd-dispatcher.rules._name_.script
Desc: Shell commands executed on specified operational states.

Name: services.nextcloud.enable

Name: services.nextcloud.enableImagemagick
Desc:
Whether to enable the ImageMagick module for PHP.
This is used by the theming app and for generating previews of certain images (e.g. SVG and HEIF).
You may want to disable it for increased security. In that case, previews will still be available
for some images (e.g. JPEG and PNG).
See <a class="link" href="https://github.com/nextcloud/server/issues/13099"  target="_top">https://github.com/nextcloud/server/issues/13099

Name: services.nextcloud.package
Desc: Which package to use for the Nextcloud instance.

Name: services.nextcloud.appstoreEnable
Desc:
Allow the installation and updating of apps from the Nextcloud appstore.
Enabled by default unless there are packages in <a class='xref' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nextcloud.extraApps'><code class="option">services.nextcloud.extraApps

Name: services.nextcloud.autoUpdateApps.enable
Desc: Run a regular auto-update of all apps installed from the Nextcloud app store.

Name: services.nextcloud.autoUpdateApps.startAt
Desc: When to run the update. See <code class="literal">systemd.services.<name>.startAt

Name: services.nextcloud.caching.apcu

Name: services.nextcloud.caching.memcached
Desc:
Whether to load the Memcached module into PHP.
You still need to enable Memcached in your config.php.
See https://docs.nextcloud.com/server/14/admin_manual/configuration_server/caching_configuration.html

Name: services.nextcloud.caching.redis
Desc:
Whether to load the Redis module into PHP.
You still need to enable Redis in your config.php.
See https://docs.nextcloud.com/server/14/admin_manual/configuration_server/caching_configuration.html

Name: services.nextcloud.cli.memoryLimit

Name: services.nextcloud.config.adminpassFile
Desc:
The full path to a file that contains the admin’s password. Must be
readable by user <code class="literal">nextcloud

Name: services.nextcloud.config.adminuser
Desc:
Username for the admin account. The username is only set during the
initial setup of Nextcloud! Since the username also acts as unique
ID internally, it cannot be changed later!

Name: services.nextcloud.config.dbhost
Desc:
Database host (+port) or socket path.
If <a class='xref' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nextcloud.database.createLocally'><code class="option">services.nextcloud.database.createLocally

Name: services.nextcloud.config.dbname
Desc: Database name.

Name: services.nextcloud.config.dbpassFile
Desc: The full path to a file that contains the database password.

Name: services.nextcloud.config.dbtableprefix
Desc: Table prefix in Nextcloud’s database.

Name: services.nextcloud.config.dbtype
Desc: Database type.

Name: services.nextcloud.config.dbuser
Desc: Database user.

Name: services.nextcloud.config.objectstore.s3.enable
Desc: Whether to enable S3 object storage as primary storage.

Name: services.nextcloud.config.objectstore.s3.autocreate
Desc: Create the objectstore if it does not exist.

Name: services.nextcloud.config.objectstore.s3.bucket
Desc: The name of the S3 bucket.

Name: services.nextcloud.config.objectstore.s3.hostname
Desc: Required for some non-Amazon implementations.

Name: services.nextcloud.config.objectstore.s3.key
Desc: The access key for the S3 bucket.

Name: services.nextcloud.config.objectstore.s3.port
Desc: Required for some non-Amazon implementations.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nextcloud.config.objectstore.s3.region
Desc: Required for some non-Amazon implementations.

Name: services.nextcloud.config.objectstore.s3.secretFile
Desc:
The full path to a file that contains the access secret. Must be
readable by user <code class="literal">nextcloud

Name: services.nextcloud.config.objectstore.s3.sseCKeyFile
Desc:
If provided this is the full path to a file that contains the key
to enable <a class="link" href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/ServerSideEncryptionCustomerKeys.html"  target="_top">server-side encryption with customer-provided keys

Name: services.nextcloud.config.objectstore.s3.usePathStyle
Desc: Required for some non-Amazon S3 implementations.

Name: services.nextcloud.config.objectstore.s3.useSsl
Desc: Use SSL for objectstore access.

Name: services.nextcloud.configureRedis
Desc: Whether to configure Nextcloud to use the recommended Redis settings for small instances.

Desc: Whether to create the database and database user locally.

Name: services.nextcloud.datadir
Desc: Nextcloud’s data storage path.  Will be <a class='xref' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nextcloud.home'><code class="option">services.nextcloud.home

Name: services.nextcloud.extraApps
Desc:
Extra apps to install. Should be an attrSet of appid to packages generated by fetchNextcloudApp.
The appid must be identical to the “id” value in the apps appinfo/info.xml.
Using this will disable the appstore to prevent Nextcloud from updating these apps (see <a class='xref' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nextcloud.appstoreEnable'><code class="option">services.nextcloud.appstoreEnable

Name: services.nextcloud.extraAppsEnable
Desc: Automatically enable the apps in <a class='xref' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nextcloud.extraApps'><code class="option">services.nextcloud.extraApps

Name: services.nextcloud.fastcgiTimeout
Desc: FastCGI timeout for database connection in seconds.

Desc: Storage path of nextcloud.

Desc: FQDN for the nextcloud instance.

Desc: Use HTTPS for generated links.

Desc:
The upload limit for files. This changes the relevant options
in php.ini and nginx if enabled.

Name: services.nextcloud.nginx.hstsMaxAge
Desc: Value for the <code class="literal">max-age

Name: services.nextcloud.nginx.recommendedHttpHeaders
Desc: Enable additional recommended HTTP response headers

Name: services.nextcloud.notify_push.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Notify push.

Desc: Which package to use for notify_push

Name: services.nextcloud.notify_push.bendDomainToLocalhost
Desc: Whether to add an entry to <code class="literal">/etc/hosts
