Desc:
Database host (+port) or socket path.
If <a class='xref' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nextcloud.database.createLocally'><code class="option">services.nextcloud.database.createLocally

Name: services.nextcloud.notify_push.dbname
Desc: Database name.

Name: services.nextcloud.notify_push.dbpassFile
Desc: The full path to a file that contains the database password.

Name: services.nextcloud.notify_push.dbtableprefix
Desc: Table prefix in Nextcloud’s database.

Name: services.nextcloud.notify_push.dbtype
Desc: Database type.

Name: services.nextcloud.notify_push.dbuser
Desc: Database user.

Name: services.nextcloud.notify_push.logLevel
Desc: Log level

Name: services.nextcloud.notify_push.socketPath
Desc: Socket path to use for notify_push

Name: services.nextcloud.occ
Desc: The nextcloud-occ program preconfigured to target this Nextcloud instance.

Name: services.nextcloud.phpExtraExtensions
Desc:
Additional PHP extensions to use for Nextcloud.
By default, only extensions necessary for a vanilla Nextcloud installation are enabled,
but you may choose from the list of available extensions and add further ones.
This is sometimes necessary to be able to install a certain Nextcloud app that has additional requirements.
Type: function that evaluates to a(n) list of package

Name: services.nextcloud.phpOptions
Desc: Options for PHP’s php.ini file for nextcloud.
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer)

Name: services.nextcloud.phpPackage
Desc: The php package to use.

Name: services.nextcloud.poolConfig
Desc: Options for Nextcloud’s PHP pool. See the documentation on <code class="literal">php-fpm.conf

Name: services.nextcloud.poolSettings
Desc: Options for nextcloud’s PHP pool. See the documentation on <code class="literal">php-fpm.conf
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)

Name: services.nextcloud.secretFile
Desc:
Secret options which will be appended to Nextcloud’s config.php file (written as JSON, in the same
form as the <a class='xref' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nextcloud.settings'><code class="option">services.nextcloud.settings

Name: services.nextcloud.settings
Desc: Extra options which should be appended to Nextcloud’s config.php file.

Name: services.nextcloud.settings.default_phone_region
Desc: An <a class="link" href="https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html"  target="_top">ISO 3166-1

Name: services.nextcloud.settings.log_type
Desc:
Logging backend to use.
systemd requires the php-systemd package to be added to services.nextcloud.phpExtraExtensions.
See the <a class="link" href="https://docs.nextcloud.com/server/latest/admin_manual/configuration_server/logging_configuration.html"  target="_top">nextcloud documentation

Name: services.nextcloud.settings.loglevel
Desc: Log level value between 0 (DEBUG) and 4 (FATAL).

Name: services.nextcloud.settings.overwriteprotocol
Desc:
Force Nextcloud to always use HTTP or HTTPS i.e. for link generation.
Nextcloud uses the currently used protocol by default, but when
behind a reverse-proxy, it may use <code class="literal">http

Name: services.nextcloud.settings._profile.enabled_
Desc: Makes user-profiles globally available under <code class="literal">nextcloud.tld/u/user.name

Name: services.nextcloud.settings.skeletondirectory
Desc:
The directory where the skeleton files are located. These files will be
copied to the data directory of new users. Leave empty to not copy any
skeleton files.

Name: services.nextcloud.settings.trusted_domains
Desc:
Trusted domains, from which the nextcloud installation will be
accessible. You don’t need to add
<code class="literal">services.nextcloud.hostname

Name: services.nextcloud.settings.trusted_proxies
Desc:
Trusted proxies, to provide if the nextcloud installation is being
proxied to secure against e.g. spoofing.

Name: services.nextcloud.webfinger
Desc:
Enable this option if you plan on using the webfinger plugin.
The appropriate nginx rewrite rules will be added to your configuration.

Name: services.nextcloud-whiteboard-server.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Nextcloud backend server for the Whiteboard app.

Name: services.nextcloud-whiteboard-server.secrets
Desc:
A list of files containing the various secrets. Should be in the
format expected by systemd’s <code class="literal">EnvironmentFile

Name: services.nextcloud-whiteboard-server.settings
Desc:
Settings to configure backend server. Especially the Nextcloud host
url has to be set. The required environment variable <code class="literal">JWT_SECRET_KEY

Name: services.nextdns.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the NextDNS DNS/53 to DoH Proxy service.

Name: services.nextdns.arguments
Desc: Additional arguments to be passed to nextdns run.

Name: services.nextjs-ollama-llm-ui.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable Simple Ollama web UI service; an easy to use web frontend for a Ollama backend service.
Run state-of-the-art AI large language models (LLM) similar to ChatGPT locally with privacy
on your personal computer.
This service is stateless and doesn’t store any data on the server; all data is kept
locally in your web browser.
See https://github.com/jakobhoeg/nextjs-ollama-llm-ui.

Name: services.nextjs-ollama-llm-ui.package
Desc: The nextjs-ollama-llm-ui package to use.

Name: services.nextjs-ollama-llm-ui.hostname
Desc:
The hostname under which the Ollama UI interface should be accessible.
By default it uses localhost/127.0.0.1 to be accessible only from the local machine.
Change to “0.0.0.0” to make it directly accessible from the local network.

Name: services.nextjs-ollama-llm-ui.ollamaUrl
Desc:
The address (including host and port) under which we can access the Ollama backend server.
!Note that if the the UI service is running under a domain “https://ui.example.org”,
the Ollama backend service must allow “CORS” requests from this domain, e.g. by adding
“services.ollama.environment.OLLAMA_ORIGINS = [ … “https://ui.example.org” ];”!

Name: services.nextjs-ollama-llm-ui.port
Desc: The port under which the Ollama UI interface should be accessible.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nexus.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Sonatype Nexus3 OSS service.

Name: services.nexus.package
Desc: The nexus package to use.

Name: services.nexus.group
Desc: Group which runs Nexus3.

Name: services.nexus.home
Desc: Home directory of the Nexus3 instance.

Name: services.nexus.jdkPackage
Desc: The openjdk8 package to use.

Name: services.nexus.jvmOpts
Desc: Options for the JVM written to <code class="literal">nexus.jvmopts

Name: services.nexus.listenAddress
Desc: Address to listen on.

Name: services.nexus.listenPort
Desc: Port to listen on.

Name: services.nexus.user
Desc: User which runs Nexus3.

Name: services.nezha-agent.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Agent of Nezha Monitoring.

Name: services.nezha-agent.package
Desc: The nezha-agent package to use.

Name: services.nezha-agent.debug
Desc: Whether to enable verbose log.

Name: services.nezha-agent.disableCommandExecute
Desc: Disable executing the command from dashboard.

Name: services.nezha-agent.disableNat
Desc: Disable NAT penetration.

Name: services.nezha-agent.disableSendQuery
Desc: Disable sending TCP/ICMP/HTTP requests.

Name: services.nezha-agent.extraFlags
Desc: Extra command-line flags passed to nezha-agent.

Name: services.nezha-agent.gpu
Desc: Enable GPU monitoring.

Name: services.nezha-agent.passwordFile
Desc: Path to the file contained the password from dashboard.

Name: services.nezha-agent.reportDelay
Desc:
The interval between system status reportings.
The value must be an integer from 1 to 4

Name: services.nezha-agent.server
Desc: Address to the dashboard

Name: services.nezha-agent.skipConnection
Desc: Do not monitor the number of connections.

Name: services.nezha-agent.skipProcess
Desc: Do not monitor the number of processes.

Name: services.nezha-agent.temperature
Desc: Enable temperature monitoring.

Name: services.nezha-agent.tls
Desc: Enable SSL/TLS encryption.

Name: services.nezha-agent.useIPv6CountryCode
Desc: Use ipv6 countrycode to report location.

Name: services.nfs.extraConfig
Desc: Extra nfs-utils configuration.

Name: services.nfs.idmapd.settings
Desc:
libnfsidmap configuration. Refer to
<a class="link" href="https://linux.die.net/man/5/idmapd.conf"  target="_top">https://linux.die.net/man/5/idmapd.conf
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: services.nfs.server.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the kernel’s NFS server.

Name: services.nfs.server.createMountPoints
Desc: Whether to create the mount points in the exports file at startup time.

Name: services.nfs.server.exports
Desc:
Contents of the /etc/exports file.  See
<span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">exports

Name: services.nfs.server.extraNfsdConfig
Desc: Extra configuration options for the [nfsd] section of /etc/nfs.conf.

Name: services.nfs.server.hostName
Desc:
Hostname or address on which NFS requests will be accepted.
Default is all.  See the <code class="option">-H

Name: services.nfs.server.lockdPort
Desc:
Use a fixed port for the NFS lock manager kernel module
(<code class="literal">lockd/nlockmgr

Name: services.nfs.server.mountdPort
Desc: Use fixed port for rpc.mountd, useful if server is behind firewall.

Name: services.nfs.server.nproc
Desc: Number of NFS server threads.  Defaults to the recommended value of 8.

Name: services.nfs.server.statdPort
Desc: Use a fixed port for <span class="command"><strong>rpc.statd

Name: services.nfs.settings
Desc:
General configuration for NFS daemons and tools.
See nfs.conf(5) and related man pages for details.
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: services.nghttpx.enable
Desc: Whether to enable nghttpx.

Name: services.nghttpx.backend-address-family
Desc:
Specify address family of backend connections. If “auto” is
given, both IPv4 and IPv6 are considered. If “IPv4” is given,
only IPv4 address is considered. If “IPv6” is given, only IPv6
address is considered.

Name: services.nghttpx.backends
Desc: A list of backend specifications.

Name: services.nghttpx.backends._.params
Desc: Parameters to configure a backend.

Name: services.nghttpx.backends._.params.affinity
Desc:
If “ip” is given, client IP based session affinity is
enabled. If “none” is given, session affinity is disabled.

Name: services.nghttpx.backends._.params.dns
Desc:
Name resolution of a backends host name is done at start up,
or configuration reload. If “dns” is true, name resolution
takes place dynamically.

Name: services.nghttpx.backends._.params.fall
Desc:
If nghttpx cannot connect to the backend N times in a row, the
backend is assumed to be offline and is excluded from load
balancing. If N is 0 the backend is never excluded from load
balancing.

Name: services.nghttpx.backends._.params.proto
Desc:
This option configures the protocol the backend server expects
to use.

Name: services.nghttpx.backends._.params.redirect-if-not-tls
Desc:
If true, a backend match requires the frontend connection be
TLS encrypted. If it is not, nghttpx responds to the request
with a 308 status code and https URI the client should use
instead in the Location header.

Name: services.nghttpx.backends._.params.rise
Desc:
If the backend is excluded from load balancing, nghttpx will
periodically attempt to make a connection to the backend. If
the connection is successful N times in a row the backend is
re-included in load balancing. If N is 0 a backend is never
reconsidered for load balancing once it falls.

Name: services.nghttpx.backends._.params.sni
Desc:
Override the TLS SNI field value. This value (in nghttpx)
defaults to the host value of the backend configuration.

Name: services.nghttpx.backends._.params.tls
Desc:
This option determines whether nghttpx will negotiate its
connection with a backend server using TLS or not. The burden
is on the backend server to provide the TLS certificate!

Name: services.nghttpx.backends._.patterns
Desc: List of nghttpx backend patterns.

Name: services.nghttpx.backends._.server
Desc:
Backend server location specified as either a host:port pair
or a unix domain docket.

Name: services.nghttpx.backlog
Desc: Listen backlog size.

Name: services.nghttpx.extraConfig
Desc:
Extra configuration options to be appended to the generated
configuration file.

Name: services.nghttpx.frontends
Desc: A list of frontend listener specifications.

Name: services.nghttpx.frontends._.params
Desc: Parameters to configure a backend.

Name: services.nghttpx.frontends._.params.api
Desc:
Enable API access for this frontend. This enables you to
dynamically modify nghttpx at run-time therefore this feature
is disabled by default and should be turned on with care.

Name: services.nghttpx.frontends._.params.healthmon
Desc:
Make this frontend a health monitor endpoint. Any request
received on this frontend is responded to with a 200 OK.

Name: services.nghttpx.frontends._.params.proxyproto
Desc: Accept PROXY protocol version 1 on frontend connection.

Name: services.nghttpx.frontends._.params.sni-fwd
Desc:
When performing a match to select a backend server, SNI host
name received from the client is used instead of the request
host. See --backend option about the pattern match.

Name: services.nghttpx.frontends._.params.tls
Desc:
Enable or disable TLS. If true (enabled) the key and
certificate must be configured for nghttpx.

Name: services.nghttpx.frontends._.server
Desc:
Frontend server interface binding specification as either a
host:port pair or a unix domain docket.

Name: services.nghttpx.rlimit-nofile
Desc:
Set maximum number of open files (RLIMIT_NOFILE) to <N>. If 0
is given, nghttpx does not set the limit.

Name: services.nghttpx.single-process
Desc:
Run this program in a single process mode for debugging
purpose. Without this option, nghttpx creates at least 2
processes: master and worker processes. If this option is
used, master and worker are unified into a single
process. nghttpx still spawns additional process if neverbleed
is used. In the single process mode, the signal handling
feature is disabled.

Name: services.nghttpx.single-thread
Desc:
Run everything in one thread inside the worker process. This
feature is provided for better debugging experience, or for
the platforms which lack thread support. If threading is
disabled, this option is always enabled.

Name: services.nghttpx.tls
Desc:
TLS certificate and key paths. Note that this does not enable
TLS for a frontend listener, to do so, a frontend
specification must set <code class="literal">params.tls

Name: services.nghttpx.tls.crt
Desc: Path to the TLS certificate file.

Name: services.nghttpx.tls.key
Desc: Path to the TLS key file.

Name: services.nghttpx.workers
Desc: Set the number of worker threads.

Name: services.nginx.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Nginx Web Server.

Name: services.nginx.enableQuicBPF
Desc:
Enables routing of QUIC packets using eBPF. When enabled, this allows
to support QUIC connection migration. The directive is only supported
on Linux 5.7+.
Note that enabling this option will make nginx run with extended
capabilities that are usually limited to processes running as root
namely <code class="literal">CAP_SYS_ADMIN

Name: services.nginx.enableReload
Desc:
Reload nginx when configuration file changes (instead of restart).
The configuration file is exposed at <code class="filename">/etc/nginx/nginx.conf

Name: services.nginx.package
Desc:
Nginx package to use. This defaults to the stable version. Note
that the nginx team recommends to use the mainline version which
available in nixpkgs as <code class="literal">nginxMainline

Name: services.nginx.additionalModules
Desc: Additional <a class="link" href="https://www.nginx.com/resources/wiki/modules/"  target="_top">third-party nginx modules
Type: list of attribute set of anything

Name: services.nginx.appendConfig
Desc:
Configuration lines appended to the generated Nginx
configuration file. Commonly used by different modules
providing http snippets. <code class="option">appendConfig

Name: services.nginx.appendHttpConfig
Desc:
Configuration lines to be appended to the generated http block.
This is mutually exclusive with using config and httpConfig for
specifying the whole http block verbatim.

Name: services.nginx.clientMaxBodySize
Desc: Set nginx global client_max_body_size.

Name: services.nginx.commonHttpConfig
Desc:
With nginx you must provide common http context definitions before
they are used, e.g. log_format, resolver, etc. inside of server
or location contexts. Use this attribute to set these definitions
at the appropriate location.

Name: services.nginx.config
Desc: Verbatim <code class="filename">nginx.conf

Name: services.nginx.defaultHTTPListenPort
Desc: If vhosts do not specify listen.port, use these ports for HTTP by default.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nginx.defaultListen
Desc:
If vhosts do not specify listen, use these addresses by default.
This option takes precedence over <code class="option">defaultListenAddresses

Name: services.nginx.defaultListen._.addr
Desc: IP address.

Name: services.nginx.defaultListen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.nginx.defaultListen._.port
Desc: Port number.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nginx.defaultListen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.nginx.defaultListen._.ssl
Desc: Enable SSL.

Name: services.nginx.defaultListenAddresses
Desc:
If vhosts do not specify listenAddresses, use these addresses by default.
This is akin to writing <code class="literal">defaultListen = [ { addr = "0.0.0.0" } ]

Name: services.nginx.defaultMimeTypes
Desc:
Default MIME types for NGINX, as MIME types definitions from NGINX are very incomplete,
we use by default the ones bundled in the mailcap package, used by most of the other
Linux distributions.

Name: services.nginx.defaultSSLListenPort
Desc: If vhosts do not specify listen.port, use these ports for SSL by default.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nginx.eventsConfig
Desc: Configuration lines to be set inside the events block.

Name: services.nginx.gitweb.enable
Desc: If true, enable gitweb in nginx.

Name: services.nginx.gitweb.group
Desc: Group that the CGI process will belong to. (Set to <code class="literal">config.services.gitolite.group

Name: services.nginx.gitweb.location
Desc: Location to serve gitweb on.

Name: services.nginx.gitweb.user
Desc: Existing user that the CGI process will belong to. (Default almost surely will do.)

Name: services.nginx.gitweb.virtualHost
Desc: VirtualHost to serve gitweb on. Default is catch-all.

Name: services.nginx.group
Desc: Group account under which nginx runs.

Name: services.nginx.httpConfig
Desc:
Configuration lines to be set inside the http block.
This is mutually exclusive with the structured configuration
via virtualHosts and the recommendedXyzSettings configuration
options. See appendHttpConfig for appending to the generated http block.

Name: services.nginx.logError
Desc:
Configures logging.
The first parameter defines a file that will store the log. The
special value stderr selects the standard error file. Logging to
syslog can be configured by specifying the “syslog:” prefix.
The second parameter determines the level of logging, and can be
one of the following: debug, info, notice, warn, error, crit,
alert, or emerg. Log levels above are listed in the order of
increasing severity. Setting a certain log level will cause all
messages of the specified and more severe log levels to be logged.
If this parameter is omitted then error is used.

Name: services.nginx.mapHashBucketSize
Desc:
Sets the bucket size for the map variables hash tables. Default
value depends on the processor’s cache line size.

Name: services.nginx.mapHashMaxSize
Desc: Sets the maximum size of the map variables hash tables.

Name: services.nginx.preStart
Desc: Shell commands executed before the service’s nginx is started.

Name: services.nginx.proxyCachePath
Desc:
Configure a proxy cache path entry.
See <a class="link" href="https://nginx.org/en/docs/http/ngx_http_proxy_module.html#proxy_cache_path"  target="_top">https://nginx.org/en/docs/http/ngx_http_proxy_module.html#proxy_cache_path

Name: services.nginx.proxyCachePath._name_.enable
Desc: Whether to enable this proxy cache path entry.

Name: services.nginx.proxyCachePath._name_.inactive
Desc:
Cached data that has not been accessed for the time specified by
the inactive parameter is removed from the cache, regardless of
its freshness.

Name: services.nginx.proxyCachePath._name_.keysZoneName
Desc: Set name to shared memory zone.

Name: services.nginx.proxyCachePath._name_.keysZoneSize
Desc: Set size to shared memory zone.

Name: services.nginx.proxyCachePath._name_.levels
Desc:
The levels parameter defines structure of subdirectories in cache: from
1 to 3, each level accepts values 1 or 2. Сan be used any combination of
1 and 2 in these formats: x, x:x and x:x:x.

Name: services.nginx.proxyCachePath._name_.maxSize
Desc: Set maximum cache size

Name: services.nginx.proxyCachePath._name_.useTempPath
Desc:
Nginx first writes files that are destined for the cache to a temporary
storage area, and the use_temp_path=off directive instructs Nginx to
write them to the same directories where they will be cached. Recommended
that you set this parameter to off to avoid unnecessary copying of data
between file systems.

Name: services.nginx.proxyResolveWhileRunning
Desc:
Resolves domains of proxyPass targets at runtime and not only at startup.
This can be used as a workaround if nginx fails to start because of not-yet-working DNS.

Name: services.nginx.proxyTimeout
Desc: Change the proxy related timeouts in recommendedProxySettings.

Name: services.nginx.recommendedBrotliSettings
Desc:
Enable recommended brotli settings.
Learn more about compression in Brotli format <a class="link" href="https://github.com/google/ngx_brotli/"  target="_top">here

Name: services.nginx.recommendedGzipSettings
Desc:
Enable recommended gzip settings.
Learn more about compression in Gzip format <a class="link" href="https://docs.nginx.com/nginx/admin-guide/web-server/compression/"  target="_top">here

Name: services.nginx.recommendedOptimisation
Desc: Enable recommended optimisation settings.

Name: services.nginx.recommendedProxySettings
Desc: Whether to enable recommended proxy settings if a vhost does not specify the option manually.

Name: services.nginx.recommendedTlsSettings
Desc: Enable recommended TLS settings.

Name: services.nginx.recommendedZstdSettings
Desc:
Enable recommended zstd settings.
Learn more about compression in Zstd format <a class="link" href="https://github.com/tokers/zstd-nginx-module"  target="_top">here

Name: services.nginx.resolver
Desc: Configures name servers used to resolve names of upstream servers into addresses

Name: services.nginx.resolver.addresses
Desc: List of resolvers to use

Name: services.nginx.resolver.ipv4
Desc:
By default, nginx will look up both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses while resolving.
If looking up of IPv4 addresses is not desired, the ipv4=off parameter can be
specified.

Name: services.nginx.resolver.ipv6
Desc:
By default, nginx will look up both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses while resolving.
If looking up of IPv6 addresses is not desired, the ipv6=off parameter can be
specified.

Name: services.nginx.resolver.valid
Desc:
By default, nginx caches answers using the TTL value of a response.
An optional valid parameter allows overriding it

Name: services.nginx.serverNamesHashBucketSize
Desc:
Sets the bucket size for the server names hash tables. Default
value depends on the processor’s cache line size.

Name: services.nginx.serverNamesHashMaxSize
Desc: Sets the maximum size of the server names hash tables.

Name: services.nginx.serverTokens
Desc: Show nginx version in headers and error pages.

Name: services.nginx.sslCiphers
Desc: Ciphers to choose from when negotiating TLS handshakes.

Name: services.nginx.sslDhparam
Desc: Path to DH parameters file.

Name: services.nginx.sslProtocols
Desc: Allowed TLS protocol versions.

Name: services.nginx.sso.enable
Desc: Whether to enable nginx-sso service.

Name: services.nginx.sso.package
Desc: The nginx-sso package to use.

Name: services.nginx.sso.configuration
Desc:
nginx-sso configuration
(<a class="link" href="https://github.com/Luzifer/nginx-sso/wiki/Main-Configuration"  target="_top">documentation

Name: services.nginx.statusPage
Desc: Enable status page reachable from localhost on http://127.0.0.1/nginx_status.

Name: services.nginx.streamConfig
Desc: Configuration lines to be set inside the stream block.

Name: services.nginx.tailscaleAuth.enable
Desc: Whether to enable tailscale.nginx-auth, to authenticate nginx users via tailscale.

Name: services.nginx.tailscaleAuth.package
Desc: Alias of <code class="option">services.tailscaleAuth.package

Name: services.nginx.tailscaleAuth.expectedTailnet
Desc:
If you want to prevent node sharing from allowing users to access services
across tailnets, declare your expected tailnets domain here.

Name: services.nginx.tailscaleAuth.group
Desc: Alias of <code class="option">services.tailscaleAuth.group

Name: services.nginx.tailscaleAuth.socketPath
Desc: Alias of <code class="option">services.tailscaleAuth.socketPath

Name: services.nginx.tailscaleAuth.user
Desc: Alias of <code class="option">services.tailscaleAuth.user

Name: services.nginx.tailscaleAuth.virtualHosts
Desc: A list of nginx virtual hosts to put behind tailscale.nginx-auth

Name: services.nginx.typesHashMaxSize
Desc: Sets the maximum size of the types hash tables (<code class="literal">types_hash_max_size

Name: services.nginx.upstreams
Desc: Defines a group of servers to use as proxy target.

Name: services.nginx.upstreams._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the upstream verbatim.

Name: services.nginx.upstreams._name_.servers
Desc:
Defines the address and other parameters of the upstream servers.
See <a class="link" href="https://nginx.org/en/docs/http/ngx_http_upstream_module.html#server"  target="_top">the documentation
Type: attribute set of (attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string))

Name: services.nginx.upstreams._name_.servers._name_.backup
Desc:
Marks the server as a backup server. It will be passed
requests when the primary servers are unavailable.

Name: services.nginx.user
Desc: User account under which nginx runs.

Name: services.nginx.validateConfigFile
Desc: Whether to enable validating configuration with pkgs.writeNginxConfig.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts
Desc: Declarative vhost config

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.acmeFallbackHost
Desc:
Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful
if you want multiple hosts to be able to verify the same domain name.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.acmeRoot
Desc: Directory for the ACME challenge, which is <span class="strong"><strong>public

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,
configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.listen._.addr
Desc: Listen address.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.listen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.listen._.port
Desc:
Port number to listen on.
If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.listen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.listen._.ssl
Desc: Enable SSL.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.locations
Desc: Declarative location config

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.fastcgiParams
Desc:
FastCGI parameters to override.  Unlike in the Nginx
configuration file, overriding only some default parameters
won’t unset the default values for other parameters.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds index directive.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc:
Adds proxy_pass directive and sets recommended proxy headers if
recommendedProxySettings is enabled.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.proxyWebsockets
Desc: Whether to support proxying websocket connections with HTTP/1.1.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.recommendedProxySettings
Desc: Enable recommended proxy settings.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.return
Desc: Adds a return directive, for e.g. redirections.
Type: null or string or signed integer

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.root
Desc: Root directory for requests.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.locations._name_.tryFiles
Desc: Adds try_files directive.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.onlySSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.quic
Desc:
Whether to enable the QUIC transport protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.redirectCode
Desc: HTTP status used by <code class="literal">globalRedirect

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.rejectSSL
Desc:
Whether to listen for and reject all HTTPS connections to this vhost. Useful in
<a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.default'>default

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.reuseport
Desc:
Create an individual listening socket .
It is required to specify only once on one of the hosts.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.root
Desc: The path of the web root directory.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.serverAliases
Desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.serverName
Desc: Name of this virtual host. Defaults to attribute name in virtualHosts.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.sslCertificate
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.sslCertificateKey
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate key.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.sslTrustedCertificate
Desc: Path to root SSL certificate for stapling and client certificates.

Name: services.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.useACMEHost
Desc:
A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

Name: services.ngircd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the ngircd IRC server.

Name: services.ngircd.package
Desc: The ngircd package to use.

Name: services.ngircd.config
Desc: The ngircd configuration (see ngircd.conf(5)).

Name: services.nifi.maxJavaHeapSize
Desc: Set the initial heap size for the JVM in MB.

Name: services.nifi.proxyHost

Name: services.nifi.proxyPort

Name: services.nifi.user
Desc: User account where Apache NiFi runs.

Name: services.nitter.cache.redisConnections

Name: services.nitter.cache.redisHost

Name: services.nitter.cache.redisPort

Name: services.nitter.cache.rssMinutes

Name: services.nitter.config.base64Media

Name: services.nitter.preferences.autoplayGifs

Name: services.nitter.preferences.bidiSupport

Name: services.nitter.preferences.hideBanner

Name: services.nitter.preferences.hidePins

Name: services.nitter.preferences.hideReplies

Name: services.nitter.preferences.hideTweetStats

Name: services.nitter.preferences.infiniteScroll

Name: services.nitter.preferences.mp4Playback

Name: services.nitter.preferences.theme

Name: services.nitter.redisCreateLocally

Name: services.nitter.server.address

Name: services.nix-serve.enable

The path to the file used for signing derivation data.

An attribute set describing an HTTP to GCS proxy that allows us to use GCS

Name: services.nix-store-gcs-proxy._name_.address

Name: services.nixops-dns.enable

Whether to enable the nixops-dns resolution

Name: services.nixops-dns.dnsmasq
Desc:
Enable dnsmasq forwarding to nixops-dns. This allows to use
nixops-dns for <code class="literal">services.nixops-dns.domain

Whether to enable cron’ed NNCP TCP daemon caller.

<a class='xref' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-programs.nncp.settings'><code class="option">programs.nncp.settings

Name: services.nncp.daemon.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable NNCP TCP synronization daemon.
The daemon will take configuration from
<a class='xref' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-programs.nncp.settings'><code class="option">programs.nncp.settings

Name: services.nncp.daemon.extraArgs
Desc: Extra command-line arguments to pass to daemon.

Name: services.nncp.daemon.socketActivation.enable
Desc: Whether to enable socket activation for nncp-daemon.

Name: services.nncp.daemon.socketActivation.listenStreams
Desc:
TCP sockets to bind to.
See <a class='xref' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-systemd.sockets._name_.listenStreams'><code class="option">systemd.sockets.<name>.listenStreams

Name: services.nntp-proxy.enable
Desc: Whether to enable NNTP-Proxy.

Name: services.nntp-proxy.listenAddress
Desc: Proxy listen address (IPv6 literal addresses need to be enclosed in “[” and “]” characters)

Name: services.nntp-proxy.port
Desc: Proxy listen port
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nntp-proxy.prohibitPosting
Desc: Whether to prohibit posting to the upstream server

Name: services.nntp-proxy.sslCert
Desc: Proxy ssl certificate path

Name: services.nntp-proxy.sslKey
Desc: Proxy ssl key path

Name: services.nntp-proxy.upstreamMaxConnections
Desc: Upstream server maximum allowed concurrent connections

Name: services.nntp-proxy.upstreamPassword
Desc: Upstream server password

Name: services.nntp-proxy.upstreamPort
Desc: Upstream server port
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nntp-proxy.upstreamServer
Desc: Upstream server address

Name: services.nntp-proxy.upstreamUser
Desc: Upstream server username

Name: services.nntp-proxy.users
Desc: NNTP-Proxy user configuration

Name: services.nntp-proxy.users._name_.maxConnections
Desc: Maximum number of concurrent connections to the proxy for this user

Name: services.nntp-proxy.users._name_.passwordHash
Desc:
SHA-512 password hash (can be generated by
<code class="literal">mkpasswd -m sha-512 <password>

Name: services.nntp-proxy.users._name_.username
Desc: Username

Name: services.nntp-proxy.verbosity
Desc: Verbosity level

Name: services.node-red.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Node-RED service.

Name: services.node-red.package
Desc: The node-red package to use.

Name: services.node-red.configFile
Desc:
Path to the JavaScript configuration file.
See <a class="link" href="https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/packages/node_modules/node-red/settings.js"  target="_top">https://github.com/node-red/node-red/blob/master/packages/node_modules/node-red/settings.js

Name: services.node-red.define
Desc: List of settings.js overrides to pass via -D to Node-RED.

Name: services.node-red.group
Desc:
Group under which Node-RED runs.If left as the default value this group
will automatically be created on system activation, otherwise the
sysadmin is responsible for ensuring the group exists.

Name: services.node-red.openFirewall
Desc: Open ports in the firewall for the server.

Name: services.node-red.port
Desc: Listening port.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.node-red.safe
Desc: Whether to launch Node-RED in --safe mode.

Name: services.node-red.user
Desc:
User under which Node-RED runs.If left as the default value this user
will automatically be created on system activation, otherwise the
sysadmin is responsible for ensuring the user exists.

Name: services.node-red.userDir
Desc:
The directory to store all user data, such as flow and credential files and all library data. If left
as the default value this directory will automatically be created before the node-red service starts,
otherwise the sysadmin is responsible for ensuring the directory exists with appropriate ownership
and permissions.

Name: services.node-red.withNpmAndGcc
Desc:
Give Node-RED access to NPM and GCC at runtime, so ‘Nodes’ can be
downloaded and managed imperatively via the ‘Palette Manager’.

Name: services.nomad.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Nomad, a distributed, highly available, datacenter-aware scheduler.

Name: services.nomad.enableDocker
Desc: Enable Docker support. Needed for Nomad’s docker driver.

Name: services.nomad.package
Desc: The nomad package to use.

Name: services.nomad.credentials
Desc: Credentials envs used to configure nomad secrets.

Name: services.nomad.dropPrivileges
Desc: Whether the nomad agent should be run as a non-root nomad user.

Name: services.nomad.extraPackages
Desc: Extra packages to add to <code class="envar">PATH

Name: services.nomad.extraSettingsPaths
Desc: Additional settings paths used to configure nomad. These can be files or directories.

Name: services.nomad.extraSettingsPlugins
Desc: Additional plugins dir used to configure nomad.

Name: services.nomad.settings
Desc: Configuration for Nomad. See the <a class="link" href="https://www.nomadproject.io/docs/configuration"  target="_top">documentation

Name: services.novacomd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Novacom service for connecting to WebOS devices.

Name: services.nscd.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable the Name Service Cache Daemon.
Disabling this is strongly discouraged, as this effectively disables NSS Lookups
from all non-glibc NSS modules, including the ones provided by systemd.

Name: services.nscd.enableNsncd
Desc:
Whether to use nsncd instead of nscd from glibc.
This is a nscd-compatible daemon, that proxies lookups, without any caching.
Using nscd from glibc is discouraged.

Name: services.nscd.package
Desc:
package containing the nscd binary to be used by the service.
Ignored when enableNsncd is set to true.

Name: services.nscd.config
Desc:
Configuration to use for Name Service Cache Daemon.
Only used in case glibc-nscd is used.

Name: services.nscd.group
Desc: User group under which nscd runs.

Name: services.nscd.user
Desc: User account under which nscd runs.

Name: services.nsd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable NSD authoritative DNS server.

Name: services.nsd.bind8Stats
Desc: Whether to enable BIND8 like statistics.

Name: services.nsd.dnssecInterval
Desc: How often to check whether dnssec key rollover is required

Name: services.nsd.extraConfig
Desc: Extra nsd config.

Name: services.nsd.hideVersion
Desc: Whether NSD should answer VERSION.BIND and VERSION.SERVER CHAOS class queries.

Name: services.nsd.identity
Desc: Identify the server (CH TXT ID.SERVER entry).

Name: services.nsd.interfaces
Desc: What addresses the server should listen to.

Name: services.nsd.ipFreebind
Desc:
Whether to bind to nonlocal addresses and interfaces that are down.
Similar to ip-transparent.

Name: services.nsd.ipTransparent
Desc: Allow binding to non local addresses.

Name: services.nsd.ipv4
Desc: Whether to listen on IPv4 connections.

Name: services.nsd.ipv4EDNSSize
Desc: Preferred EDNS buffer size for IPv4.

Name: services.nsd.ipv6
Desc: Whether to listen on IPv6 connections.

Name: services.nsd.ipv6EDNSSize
Desc: Preferred EDNS buffer size for IPv6.

Name: services.nsd.keys
Desc: Define your TSIG keys here.

Name: services.nsd.keys._name_.algorithm
Desc: Authentication algorithm for this key.

Name: services.nsd.keys._name_.keyFile
Desc:
Path to the file which contains the actual base64 encoded
key. The key will be copied into “/var/lib/nsd/private” before
NSD starts. The copied file is only accessibly by the NSD
user.

Name: services.nsd.logTimeAscii
Desc: Log time in ascii, if false then in unix epoch seconds.

Name: services.nsd.nsid
Desc: NSID identity (hex string, or “ascii_somestring”).

Name: services.nsd.port
Desc: Port the service should bind do.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nsd.ratelimit.enable
Desc: Whether to enable ratelimit capabilities.

Name: services.nsd.ratelimit.ipv4PrefixLength
Desc: IPv4 prefix length. Addresses are grouped by netblock.

Name: services.nsd.ratelimit.ipv6PrefixLength
Desc: IPv6 prefix length. Addresses are grouped by netblock.

Name: services.nsd.ratelimit.ratelimit
Desc:
Max qps allowed from any query source.
0 means unlimited. With an verbosity of 2 blocked and
unblocked subnets will be logged.

Name: services.nsd.ratelimit.size
Desc:
Size of the hashtable. More buckets use more memory but lower
the chance of hash hash collisions.

Name: services.nsd.ratelimit.slip
Desc:
Number of packets that get discarded before replying a SLIP response.
0 disables SLIP responses. 1 will make every response a SLIP response.

Name: services.nsd.ratelimit.whitelistRatelimit
Desc:
Max qps allowed from whitelisted sources.
0 means unlimited. Set the rrl-whitelist option for specific
queries to apply this limit instead of the default to them.

Name: services.nsd.remoteControl.enable
Desc: Whether to enable remote control via nsd-control.

Name: services.nsd.remoteControl.controlCertFile
Desc:
Path to the client certificate signed with the server certificate.
This file is used by nsd-control and generated by nsd-control-setup.

Name: services.nsd.remoteControl.controlKeyFile
Desc:
Path to the client private key, which is used by nsd-control
but not by the server. This file is generated by nsd-control-setup.

Name: services.nsd.remoteControl.interfaces
Desc: Which interfaces NSD should bind to for remote control.

Name: services.nsd.remoteControl.port
Desc: Port number for remote control operations (uses TLS over TCP).
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nsd.remoteControl.serverCertFile
Desc:
Path to the server self signed certificate, which is used by the server
but and by nsd-control. This file is generated by nsd-control-setup.

Name: services.nsd.remoteControl.serverKeyFile
Desc:
Path to the server private key, which is used by the server
but not by nsd-control. This file is generated by nsd-control-setup.

Name: services.nsd.reuseport
Desc:
Whether to enable SO_REUSEPORT on all used sockets. This lets multiple
processes bind to the same port. This speeds up operation especially
if the server count is greater than one and makes fast restarts less
prone to fail

Name: services.nsd.rootServer
Desc:
Whether this server will be a root server (a DNS root server, you
usually don’t want that).

Name: services.nsd.roundRobin
Desc: Whether to enable round robin rotation of records.

Name: services.nsd.serverCount
Desc: Number of NSD servers to fork. Put the number of CPUs to use here.

Name: services.nsd.statistics
Desc:
Statistics are produced every number of seconds. Prints to log.
If null no statistics are logged.

Name: services.nsd.tcpCount
Desc: Maximum number of concurrent TCP connections per server.

Name: services.nsd.tcpQueryCount
Desc:
Maximum number of queries served on a single TCP connection.
0 means no maximum.

Name: services.nsd.tcpTimeout
Desc: TCP timeout in seconds.

Name: services.nsd.verbosity
Desc: Verbosity level.

Name: services.nsd.version
Desc:
The version string replied for CH TXT version.server and version.bind
queries. Will use the compiled package version on null.
See hideVersion for enabling/disabling this responses.

Name: services.nsd.xfrdReloadTimeout
Desc: Number of seconds between reloads triggered by xfrd.

Name: services.nsd.zonefilesCheck
Desc: Whether to check mtime of all zone files on start and sighup.

Name: services.nsd.zonefilesWrite
Desc:
Write changed secondary zones to their zonefile every N seconds.
If the zone (pattern) configuration has “” zonefile, it is not written.
Zones that have received zone transfer updates are written to their zonefile.
0 disables writing to zone files.

Name: services.nsd.zones
Desc:
Define your zones here. Zones can cascade other zones and therefore
inherit settings from parent zones. Look at the definition of
children to learn about inheritance and child zones.
The given example will define 3 zones (example.(com|org|net).). Both
example.com. and example.org. inherit their configuration from
serverGroup1.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.allowAXFRFallback
Desc:
If NSD as secondary server should be allowed to AXFR if the primary
server does not allow IXFR.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.allowNotify
Desc: Listed primary servers are allowed to notify this secondary server.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.children
Desc:
Children zones inherit all options of their parents. Attributes
defined in a child will overwrite the ones of its parent. Only
leaf zones will be actually served. This way it’s possible to
define maybe zones which share most attributes without
duplicating everything. This mechanism replaces nsd’s patterns
in a save and functional way.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.data
Desc:
The actual zone data. This is the content of your zone file.
Use imports or pkgs.lib.readFile if you don’t want this data in your config file.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.dnssec
Desc: Whether to enable DNSSEC.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.dnssecPolicy.algorithm
Desc: Which algorithm to use for DNSSEC

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.dnssecPolicy.coverage
Desc: The length of time to ensure that keys will be correct; no action will be taken to create new keys to be activated after this time.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.dnssecPolicy.keyttl
Desc: TTL for dnssec records

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.dnssecPolicy.ksk
Desc: Key policy for key signing keys

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.dnssecPolicy.ksk.keySize
Desc: Key size in bits

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.dnssecPolicy.ksk.postPublish
Desc: How long after deactivation to keep a key in the zone

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.dnssecPolicy.ksk.prePublish
Desc: How long in advance to publish new keys

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.dnssecPolicy.ksk.rollPeriod
Desc: How frequently to change keys

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.dnssecPolicy.zsk
Desc: Key policy for zone signing keys

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.dnssecPolicy.zsk.keySize
Desc: Key size in bits

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.dnssecPolicy.zsk.postPublish
Desc: How long after deactivation to keep a key in the zone

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.dnssecPolicy.zsk.prePublish
Desc: How long in advance to publish new keys

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.dnssecPolicy.zsk.rollPeriod
Desc: How frequently to change keys

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.maxRefreshSecs
Desc:
Limit refresh time for secondary zones. This is the timer which
checks to see if the zone has to be refetched when it expires.
Normally the value from the SOA record is used, but this  option
restricts that value.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.maxRetrySecs
Desc:
Limit retry time for secondary zones. This is the timeout after
a failed fetch attempt for the zone. Normally the value from
the SOA record is used, but this option restricts that value.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.minRefreshSecs
Desc: Limit refresh time for secondary zones.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.minRetrySecs
Desc: Limit retry time for secondary zones.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.multiMasterCheck
Desc:
If enabled, checks all masters for the last zone version.
It uses the higher version from all configured masters.
Useful if you have multiple masters that have different version numbers served.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.notify
Desc:
This primary server will notify all given secondary servers about
zone changes.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.notifyRetry
Desc: Specifies the number of retries for failed notifies. Set this along with notify.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.outgoingInterface
Desc:
This address will be used for zone-transfer requests if configured
as a secondary server or notifications in case of a primary server.
Supply either a plain IPv4 or IPv6 address with an optional port
number (ip@port).

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.provideXFR
Desc:
Allow these IPs and TSIG to transfer zones, addr TSIG|NOKEY|BLOCKED
address range 192.0.2.0/24, 1.2.3.4&255.255.0.0, 3.0.2.20-3.0.2.40

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.requestXFR
Desc: Format: <code class="literal">[AXFR|UDP] <ip-address> <key-name | NOKEY>

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.rrlWhitelist
Desc: Whitelists the given rrl-types.

Name: services.nsd.zones._name_.zoneStats
Desc:
When set to something distinct to null NSD is able to collect
statistics per zone. All statistics of this zone(s) will be added
to the group specified by this given name. Use “%s” to use the zones
name as the group. The groups are output from nsd-control stats
and stats_noreset.

Name: services.ntfy-sh.enable
Desc: Whether to enable <a class="link" href="https://ntfy.sh"  target="_top">ntfy-sh

Name: services.ntfy-sh.package
Desc: The ntfy-sh package to use.

Name: services.ntfy-sh.group
Desc: Primary group of ntfy-sh user.

Name: services.ntfy-sh.settings
Desc: Configuration for ntfy.sh, supported values are <a class="link" href="https://ntfy.sh/docs/config/#config-options"  target="_top">here

Name: services.ntfy-sh.settings.base-url
Desc: Public facing base URL of the service

Name: services.ntfy-sh.user
Desc: User the ntfy-sh server runs under.

Name: services.ntopng.enable
Desc:
Enable ntopng, a high-speed web-based traffic analysis and flow
collection tool.

Name: services.ntopng.configText
Desc:
Overridable configuration file contents to use for ntopng. By
default, use the contents automatically generated by NixOS.

Name: services.ntopng.extraConfig
Desc:
Configuration lines that will be appended to the generated ntopng
configuration file. Note that this mechanism does not work when the
manual <code class="option">configText

Name: services.ntopng.httpPort
Desc: Sets the HTTP port of the embedded web server.

Name: services.ntopng.interfaces
Desc: List of interfaces to monitor. Use “any” to monitor all interfaces.

Name: services.ntopng.redis.address
Desc: Redis address - may be a Unix socket or a network host and port.

Name: services.ntopng.redis.createInstance
Desc: Local Redis instance name. Set to <code class="literal">null

Name: services.ntp.enable
Desc:
Whether to synchronise your machine’s time using ntpd, as a peer in
the NTP network.

Name: services.ntp.extraConfig
Desc: Additional text appended to <code class="filename">ntp.conf

Name: services.ntp.extraFlags
Desc: Extra flags passed to the ntpd command.

Name: services.ntp.restrictDefault
Desc: The restriction flags to be set by default.

Name: services.ntp.restrictSource
Desc: The restriction flags to be set on source.

Name: services.ntp.servers
Desc: The set of NTP servers from which to synchronise.

Name: services.ntpd-rs.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Network Time Service (ntpd-rs).

Name: services.ntpd-rs.package
Desc: The ntpd-rs package to use.

Name: services.ntpd-rs.metrics.enable
Desc: Whether to enable ntpd-rs Prometheus Metrics Exporter.

Name: services.ntpd-rs.settings
Desc: Settings to write to <code class="filename">ntp.toml

Name: services.ntpd-rs.useNetworkingTimeServers
Desc: Use source time servers from <code class="varname">networking.timeServers

Name: services.nullidentdmod.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the nullidentdmod identd daemon.

Name: services.nullidentdmod.userid
Desc: User ID to return. Set to null to return a random string each time.

Name: services.nullmailer.enable
Desc: Whether to enable nullmailer daemon.

Name: services.nullmailer.config.adminaddr
Desc:
If set, all recipients to users at either “localhost” (the literal string)
or the canonical host name (from the me control attribute) are remapped to this address.
This is provided to allow local daemons to be able to send email to
“somebody@localhost” and have it go somewhere sensible instead of being  bounced
by your relay host. To send to multiple addresses,
put them all on one line separated by a comma.

Name: services.nullmailer.config.allmailfrom
Desc: If set, content will override the envelope sender on all messages.

Name: services.nullmailer.config.defaultdomain
Desc:
The content of this attribute is appended to any host name that
does not contain a period (except localhost), including defaulthost
and idhost. Defaults to the value of the me attribute, if it exists,
otherwise the literal name defauldomain.

Name: services.nullmailer.config.defaulthost
Desc:
The content of this attribute is appended to any address that
is missing a host name. Defaults to the value of the me control
attribute, if it exists, otherwise the literal name defaulthost.

Name: services.nullmailer.config.doublebounceto
Desc:
If the original sender was empty (the original message was a
delivery status or disposition notification), the double bounce
is sent to the address in this attribute.

Name: services.nullmailer.config.helohost
Desc:
Sets  the  environment variable $HELOHOST which is used by the
SMTP protocol module to set the parameter given to the HELO command.
Defaults to the value of the me configuration attribute.

Name: services.nullmailer.config.idhost
Desc:
The content of this attribute is used when building the message-id
string for the message. Defaults to the canonicalized value of defaulthost.

Name: services.nullmailer.config.maxpause
Desc:
The maximum time to pause between successive queue runs, in seconds.
Defaults to 24 hours (86400).
Type: null or string or signed integer

Name: services.nullmailer.config.me
Desc:
The fully-qualifiled host name of the computer running nullmailer.
Defaults to the literal name me.

Name: services.nullmailer.config.pausetime
Desc:
The minimum time to pause between successive queue runs when there
are messages in the queue, in seconds. Defaults to 1 minute (60).
Each time this timeout is reached, the timeout is doubled to a
maximum of maxpause. After new messages are injected, the timeout
is reset.  If this is set to 0, nullmailer-send will exit
immediately after going through the queue once (one-shot mode).
Type: null or string or signed integer

Name: services.nullmailer.config.remotes
Desc:
A list of remote servers to which to send each message. Each line
contains a remote host name or address followed by an optional
protocol string, separated by white space.

Name: services.nullmailer.config.sendtimeout
Desc:
The  time to wait for a remote module listed above to complete sending
a message before killing it and trying again, in seconds.
Defaults to 1 hour (3600).  If this is set to 0, nullmailer-send
will wait forever for messages to complete sending.
Type: null or string or signed integer

Name: services.nullmailer.group
Desc: Group to use to run nullmailer-send.

Name: services.nullmailer.remotesFile
Desc: Path to the <code class="literal">remotes

Name: services.nullmailer.setSendmail
Desc: Whether to set the system sendmail to nullmailer’s.

Name: services.nullmailer.user
Desc: User to use to run nullmailer-send.

Name: services.nylon._name_.enable
Desc: Enables nylon as a running service upon activation.

Name: services.nylon._name_.acceptInterface
Desc: Tell nylon which interface to listen for client requests on, default is “lo”.

Name: services.nylon._name_.allowedIPRanges
Desc:
Allowed client IP ranges are evaluated first, defaults to ARIN IPv4 private ranges:
[ “192.168.0.0/16” “127.0.0.0/8” “172.16.0.0/12” “10.0.0.0/8” ]

Name: services.nylon._name_.bindInterface
Desc: Tell nylon which interface to use as an uplink, default is “enp3s0f0”.

Name: services.nylon._name_.deniedIPRanges
Desc:
Denied client IP ranges, these gets evaluated after the allowed IP ranges, defaults to all IPv4 addresses:
[ “0.0.0.0/0” ]
To block all other access than the allowed.

Name: services.nylon._name_.logging
Desc: Enable logging, default is no logging.

Name: services.nylon._name_.name
Desc: The name of this nylon instance.

Name: services.nylon._name_.nrConnections
Desc: The number of allowed simultaneous connections to the daemon, default 10.

Name: services.nylon._name_.port
Desc: What port to listen for client requests, default is 1080.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.nylon._name_.verbosity
Desc: Enable verbose output, default is to not be verbose.

Name: services.nzbget.enable
Desc: Whether to enable NZBGet, for downloading files from news servers.

Name: services.nzbget.package
Desc: The nzbget package to use.

Name: services.nzbget.group
Desc: Group under which NZBGet runs

Name: services.nzbget.settings
Desc:
NZBGet configuration, passed via command line using switch -o. Refer to
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/nzbget/nzbget/blob/master/nzbget.conf"  target="_top">https://github.com/nzbget/nzbget/blob/master/nzbget.conf
Type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)

Name: services.nzbget.user
Desc: User account under which NZBGet runs

Name: services.nzbhydra2.enable
Desc: Whether to enable NZBHydra2, Usenet meta search.

Name: services.nzbhydra2.package
Desc: The nzbhydra2 package to use.

Name: services.nzbhydra2.dataDir
Desc: The directory where NZBHydra2 stores its data files.

Name: services.nzbhydra2.openFirewall
Desc: Open ports in the firewall for the NZBHydra2 web interface.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.enable
Desc: Whether to enable oauth2-proxy.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.package
Desc: The oauth2-proxy package to use.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.approvalPrompt
Desc: OAuth approval_prompt.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.azure.resource
Desc: The resource that is protected.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.azure.tenant
Desc: Go to a tenant-specific or common (tenant-independent) endpoint.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.basicAuthPassword
Desc: The password to set when passing the HTTP Basic Auth header.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.clientID
Desc: The OAuth Client ID.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.clientSecret
Desc: The OAuth Client Secret.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.cookie.domain
Desc: Optional cookie domains to force cookies to (ie: <code class="literal">.yourcompany.com

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.cookie.expire
Desc: Expire timeframe for cookie.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.cookie.httpOnly
Desc: Set HttpOnly cookie flag.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.cookie.name
Desc: The name of the cookie that the oauth_proxy creates.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.cookie.refresh
Desc: Refresh the cookie after this duration; 0 to disable.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.cookie.secret
Desc: The seed string for secure cookies.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.cookie.secure
Desc: Set secure (HTTPS) cookie flag.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.customTemplatesDir
Desc: Path to custom HTML templates.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.email.addresses
Desc: Line-separated email addresses that are allowed to authenticate.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.email.domains
Desc:
Authenticate emails with the specified domains. Use
<code class="literal">*

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.extraConfig
Desc: Extra config to pass to oauth2-proxy.

Desc: Display username / password login form if an htpasswd file is provided.

Desc:
Additionally authenticate against a htpasswd file. Entries must be
created with <code class="literal">htpasswd -s

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.httpAddress
Desc:
HTTPS listening address.  This module does not expose the port by
default. If you want this URL to be accessible to other machines, please
add the port to <code class="literal">networking.firewall.allowedTCPPorts

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.keyFile
Desc:
oauth2-proxy allows passing sensitive configuration via environment variables.
Make a file that contains lines like
OAUTH2_PROXY_CLIENT_SECRET=asdfasdfasdf.apps.googleuserscontent.com
and specify the path here.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.loginURL
Desc: Authentication endpoint.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.nginx.domain
Desc:
The domain under which the oauth2-proxy will be accesible and the path of cookies are set to.
This setting must be set to ensure back-redirects are working properly
if oauth2-proxy is configured with <code class="option">services.oauth2-proxy.cookie.domain

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.nginx.proxy
Desc: The address of the reverse proxy endpoint for oauth2-proxy

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.nginx.virtualHosts
Desc:
Nginx virtual hosts to put behind the oauth2 proxy.
You can exclude specific locations by setting <code class="literal">auth_request off;
Type: (attribute set of (submodule)) or (list of string) convertible to it

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.allowed_email_domains
Desc: List of email domains to allow access to this vhost, or null to allow all.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.allowed_emails
Desc: List of emails to allow access to this vhost, or null to allow all.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.nginx.virtualHosts._name_.allowed_groups
Desc: List of groups to allow access to this vhost, or null to allow all.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.oidcIssuerUrl

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.passBasicAuth
Desc: Pass HTTP Basic Auth, X-Forwarded-User and X-Forwarded-Email information to upstream.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.passHostHeader
Desc: Pass the request Host Header to upstream.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.profileURL
Desc: Profile access endpoint.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.provider
Desc: OAuth provider.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.proxyPrefix
Desc: The url root path that this proxy should be nested under.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.redeemURL
Desc: Token redemption endpoint.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.redirectURL
Desc: The OAuth2 redirect URL.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.requestLogging
Desc: Log requests to stdout.

In case when running behind a reverse proxy, controls whether headers

Desc: OAuth scope specification.

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.setXauthrequest
Desc: Set X-Auth-Request-User and X-Auth-Request-Email response headers (useful in Nginx auth_request mode). Setting this to ‘null’ means using the upstream default (false).

Desc: GAP-Signature request signature key.

Desc:
Skip authentication for requests matching any of these regular
expressions.

Type: (list of string) or string convertible to it

Name: services.oauth2-proxy.validateURL
