Name: services.outline.cdnUrl
Desc:
If using a Cloudfront/Cloudflare distribution or similar it can be set
using this option. This will cause paths to JavaScript files,
stylesheets and images to be updated to the hostname defined here. In
your CDN configuration the origin server should be set to public URL.

Name: services.outline.concurrency
Desc:
How many processes should be spawned. For a rough estimate, divide your
server’s available memory by 512.

Name: services.outline.databaseUrl
Desc:
URI to use for the main PostgreSQL database. If this needs to include
credentials that shouldn’t be world-readable in the Nix store, set an
environment file on the systemd service and override the
<code class="literal">DATABASE_URL

Name: services.outline.debugOutput
Desc: Set this to <code class="literal">http

Name: services.outline.defaultLanguage
Desc:
The default interface language. See
<a class="link" href="https://translate.getoutline.com/"  target="_top">translate.getoutline.com

Name: services.outline.forceHttps
Desc:
Auto-redirect to HTTPS in production. The default is
<code class="literal">true

Name: services.outline.googleAnalyticsId
Desc:
Optionally enable Google Analytics to track page views in the knowledge
base.

Name: services.outline.googleAuthentication
Desc:
To configure Google auth, you’ll need to create an OAuth Client ID at
https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/credentials

Name: services.outline.googleAuthentication.clientId
Desc: Authentication client identifier.

Name: services.outline.googleAuthentication.clientSecretFile
Desc: File path containing the authentication secret.

Name: services.outline.group
Desc:
Group under which the service should run. If this is the default value,
the group will be created.

Name: services.outline.logo
Desc:
Custom logo displayed on the authentication screen. This will be scaled
to a height of 60px.

Name: services.outline.maximumImportSize
Desc:
The maximum size of document imports. Overriding this could be required
if you have especially large Word documents with embedded imagery.

Name: services.outline.oidcAuthentication
Desc:
To configure generic OIDC auth, you’ll need some kind of identity
provider. See the documentation for whichever IdP you use to fill out
all the fields. The redirect URL is
<code class="literal">https://[publicUrl]/auth/oidc.callback

Name: services.outline.oidcAuthentication.authUrl
Desc: OIDC authentication URL endpoint.

Name: services.outline.oidcAuthentication.clientId
Desc: Authentication client identifier.

Name: services.outline.oidcAuthentication.clientSecretFile
Desc: File path containing the authentication secret.

Name: services.outline.oidcAuthentication.displayName
Desc: Display name for OIDC authentication.

Name: services.outline.oidcAuthentication.scopes
Desc: OpenID authentication scopes.

Name: services.outline.oidcAuthentication.tokenUrl
Desc: OIDC token URL endpoint.

Name: services.outline.oidcAuthentication.userinfoUrl
Desc: OIDC userinfo URL endpoint.

Name: services.outline.oidcAuthentication.usernameClaim
Desc:
Specify which claims to derive user information from. Supports any
valid JSON path with the JWT payload

Name: services.outline.port
Desc: Listening port.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.outline.publicUrl
Desc: The fully qualified, publicly accessible URL

Name: services.outline.rateLimiter.enable
Desc: Whether to enable rate limiter for the application web server.

Name: services.outline.rateLimiter.durationWindow
Desc: Length of a throttling window.

Name: services.outline.rateLimiter.requests
Desc: Maximum number of requests in a throttling window.

Name: services.outline.redisUrl
Desc:
Connection to a redis server. If this needs to include credentials
that shouldn’t be world-readable in the Nix store, set an environment
file on the systemd service and override the
<code class="literal">REDIS_URL

Name: services.outline.secretKeyFile
Desc:
File path that contains the application secret key. It must be 32
bytes long and hex-encoded. If the file does not exist, a new key will
be generated and saved here.

Name: services.outline.sentryDsn
Desc: Optionally enable <a class="link" href="https://sentry.io/"  target="_top">Sentry

Name: services.outline.sentryTunnel
Desc:
Optionally add a
<a class="link" href="https://docs.sentry.io/platforms/javascript/troubleshooting/#using-the-tunnel-option"  target="_top">Sentry proxy tunnel

Name: services.outline.slackAuthentication
Desc:
To configure Slack auth, you’ll need to create an Application at
https://api.slack.com/apps

Name: services.outline.slackAuthentication.clientId
Desc: Authentication key.

Name: services.outline.slackAuthentication.secretFile
Desc: File path containing the authentication secret.

Name: services.outline.slackIntegration
Desc:
For a complete Slack integration with search and posting to channels
this configuration is also needed. See here for details:
https://wiki.generaloutline.com/share/be25efd1-b3ef-4450-b8e5-c4a4fc11e02a

Name: services.outline.slackIntegration.appId
Desc: Application ID.

Name: services.outline.slackIntegration.messageActions
Desc: Whether to enable message actions.

Name: services.outline.slackIntegration.verificationTokenFile
Desc: File path containing the verification token.

Name: services.outline.smtp
Desc:
To support sending outgoing transactional emails such as
“document updated” or “you’ve been invited” you’ll need to provide
authentication for an SMTP server.

Name: services.outline.smtp.fromEmail
Desc: Sender email in outgoing mail.

Name: services.outline.smtp.host
Desc: Host name or IP address of the SMTP server.

Name: services.outline.smtp.passwordFile
Desc: File path containing the password to authenticate with.

Name: services.outline.smtp.port
Desc: TCP port of the SMTP server.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.outline.smtp.replyEmail
Desc: Reply address in outgoing mail.

Name: services.outline.smtp.secure
Desc: Use a secure SMTP connection.

Name: services.outline.smtp.tlsCiphers
Desc: Override SMTP cipher configuration.

Name: services.outline.smtp.username
Desc: Username to authenticate with.

Name: services.outline.sslCertFile
Desc:
File path that contains the Base64-encoded certificate for HTTPS
termination. This is only required if you do not use an external reverse
proxy. See
<a class="link" href="https://wiki.generaloutline.com/share/dfa77e56-d4d2-4b51-8ff8-84ea6608faa4"  target="_top">the documentation

Name: services.outline.sslKeyFile
Desc:
File path that contains the Base64-encoded private key for HTTPS
termination. This is only required if you do not use an external reverse
proxy. See
<a class="link" href="https://wiki.generaloutline.com/share/dfa77e56-d4d2-4b51-8ff8-84ea6608faa4"  target="_top">the documentation

Name: services.outline.storage
Desc:
To support uploading of images for avatars and document attachments an
s3-compatible storage can be provided. AWS S3 is recommended for
redundancy however if you want to keep all file storage local an
alternative such as <a class="link" href="https://github.com/minio/minio"  target="_top">minio

Name: services.outline.storage.accessKey
Desc: S3 access key.

Name: services.outline.storage.acl
Desc: ACL setting.

Name: services.outline.storage.forcePathStyle
Desc: Force S3 path style.

Name: services.outline.storage.localRootDir
Desc: If <code class="literal">storageType

Name: services.outline.storage.region
Desc: AWS S3 region name.

Name: services.outline.storage.secretKeyFile
Desc: File path that contains the S3 secret key.

Name: services.outline.storage.storageType
Desc: File storage type, it can be local or s3.

Name: services.outline.storage.uploadBucketName
Desc: Name of the bucket where uploads should be stored.

Name: services.outline.storage.uploadBucketUrl
Desc:
URL endpoint of an S3-compatible API where uploads should be
stored.

Name: services.outline.storage.uploadMaxSize
Desc: Maxmium file size for uploads.

Name: services.outline.user
Desc:
User under which the service should run. If this is the default value,
the user will be created, with the specified group as the primary
group.

Name: services.outline.utilsSecretFile
Desc:
File path that contains the utility secret key. If the file does not
exist, a new key will be generated and saved here.

Name: services.owamp.enable
Desc: Whether to enable OWAMP server.

Name: services.owncast.enable
Desc: Whether to enable owncast, a video live streaming solution.

Name: services.owncast.dataDir
Desc: The directory where owncast stores its data files. If left as the default value this directory will automatically be created before the owncast server starts, otherwise the sysadmin is responsible for ensuring the directory exists with appropriate ownership and permissions.

Name: services.owncast.group
Desc: Group under which owncast runs.

Name: services.owncast.listen
Desc: The IP address to bind the owncast web server to.

Name: services.owncast.openFirewall
Desc: Open the appropriate ports in the firewall for owncast.

Name: services.owncast.port
Desc: TCP port where owncast web-gui listens.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.owncast.rtmp-port
Desc: TCP port where owncast rtmp service listens.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.owncast.user
Desc: User account under which owncast runs.

Name: services.oxidized.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the oxidized configuration backup service.

Name: services.oxidized.configFile
Desc: Path to the oxidized configuration file.

Name: services.oxidized.dataDir
Desc: State directory for the oxidized service.

Name: services.oxidized.group
Desc: Group under which the oxidized service runs.

Name: services.oxidized.routerDB
Desc: Path to the file/database which contains the targets for oxidized.

Name: services.oxidized.user
Desc: User under which the oxidized service runs.

Name: services.pacemaker.enable
Desc: Whether to enable pacemaker.

Name: services.pacemaker.package
Desc: The pacemaker package to use.

Name: services.pantalaimon-headless.instances
Desc: Declarative instance config.

Name: services.pantalaimon-headless.instances._name_.dataPath
Desc: The directory where <code class="literal">pantalaimon

Name: services.pantalaimon-headless.instances._name_.extraSettings
Desc:
Extra configuration options. See
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/matrix-org/pantalaimon/blob/master/docs/man/pantalaimon.5.md"  target="_top">pantalaimon(5)

Name: services.pantalaimon-headless.instances._name_.homeserver
Desc: The URI of the homeserver that the <code class="literal">pantalaimon

Name: services.pantalaimon-headless.instances._name_.listenAddress
Desc:
The address where the daemon will listen to client connections
for this homeserver.

Name: services.pantalaimon-headless.instances._name_.listenPort
Desc:
The port where the daemon will listen to client connections for
this homeserver. Note that the listen address/port combination
needs to be lib.unique between different homeservers.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.pantalaimon-headless.instances._name_.logLevel
Desc: Set the log level of the daemon.

Name: services.pantalaimon-headless.instances._name_.ssl
Desc:
Whether or not SSL verification should be enabled for outgoing
connections to the homeserver.

Name: services.pantheon.apps.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Pantheon default applications.

Name: services.pantheon.contractor.enable
Desc: Whether to enable contractor, a desktop-wide extension service used by Pantheon.

Name: services.paperless.enable
Desc: Enable Paperless.

Name: services.paperless.package
Desc: The paperless-ngx package to use.

Name: services.paperless.address
Desc: Web interface address.

Name: services.paperless.consumptionDir
Desc: Directory from which new documents are imported.

Name: services.paperless.consumptionDirIsPublic
Desc: Whether all users can write to the consumption dir.

Name: services.paperless.dataDir
Desc: Directory to store the Paperless data.

Name: services.paperless.database.createLocally
Desc: Configure local PostgreSQL database server for Paperless.

Name: services.paperless.environmentFile
Desc: Path to a file containing extra paperless config options in the systemd <code class="literal">EnvironmentFile

Name: services.paperless.mediaDir
Desc: Directory to store the Paperless documents.

Name: services.paperless.openMPThreadingWorkaround
Desc: Whether to enable a workaround for document classifier timeouts.

Name: services.paperless.passwordFile
Desc: A file containing the superuser password.

Name: services.paperless.port
Desc: Web interface port.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.paperless.settings
Desc: Extra paperless config options.
Type: attribute set of (boolean or floating point number or signed integer or string or path or package or list of (boolean or floating point number or signed integer or string or path or package) or attribute set of (boolean or floating point number or signed integer or string or path or package))

Name: services.paperless.user
Desc: User under which Paperless runs.

Name: services.parsedmarc.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable parsedmarc, a DMARC report monitoring service
.

Name: services.parsedmarc.provision.elasticsearch
Desc: Whether to set up and use a local instance of Elasticsearch.

Name: services.parsedmarc.provision.geoIp
Desc: Whether to enable and configure the <a class='link' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.geoipupdate.enable'>geoipupdate

Name: services.parsedmarc.provision.grafana.dashboard
Desc:
Whether the official parsedmarc grafana dashboard should
be provisioned to the local grafana instance.

Name: services.parsedmarc.provision.grafana.datasource
Desc:
Whether the automatically provisioned Elasticsearch
instance should be added as a grafana datasource. Has no
effect unless
<a class='xref' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.parsedmarc.provision.elasticsearch'><code class="option">services.parsedmarc.provision.elasticsearch

Name: services.parsedmarc.provision.localMail.enable
Desc:
Whether Postfix and Dovecot should be set up to receive
mail locally. parsedmarc will be configured to watch the
local inbox as the automatically created user specified in
<a class='xref' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.parsedmarc.provision.localMail.recipientName'><code class="option">services.parsedmarc.provision.localMail.recipientName

Name: services.parsedmarc.provision.localMail.hostname
Desc: The hostname to use when configuring Postfix.

Name: services.parsedmarc.provision.localMail.recipientName
Desc:
The DMARC mail recipient name, i.e. the name part of the
email address which receives DMARC reports.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings
Desc:
Configuration parameters to set in
<code class="filename">parsedmarc.ini
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.elasticsearch.cert_path
Desc:
The path to a TLS certificate bundle used to verify
the server’s certificate.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.elasticsearch.hosts
Desc:
A list of Elasticsearch hosts to push parsed reports
to.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.elasticsearch.password
Desc:
The password to use when connecting to Elasticsearch,
if required.
Type: null or path or attribute set of path

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.elasticsearch.ssl
Desc: Whether to use an encrypted SSL/TLS connection.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.elasticsearch.user
Desc:
Username to use when connecting to Elasticsearch, if
required.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.general.save_aggregate
Desc: Save aggregate report data to Elasticsearch and/or Splunk.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.general.save_forensic
Desc: Save forensic report data to Elasticsearch and/or Splunk.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.imap.host
Desc: The IMAP server hostname or IP address.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.imap.password
Desc: The IMAP server password.
Type: null or path or attribute set of path

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.imap.port
Desc: The IMAP server port.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.imap.ssl
Desc: Use an encrypted SSL/TLS connection.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.imap.user
Desc: The IMAP server username.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.mailbox.delete
Desc: Delete messages after processing them, instead of archiving them.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.mailbox.watch
Desc: Use the IMAP IDLE command to process messages as they arrive.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.smtp.from
Desc: The <code class="literal">From

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.smtp.host
Desc: The SMTP server hostname or IP address.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.smtp.password
Desc: The SMTP server password.
Type: null or path or attribute set of path

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.smtp.port
Desc: The SMTP server port.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.smtp.ssl
Desc: Use an encrypted SSL/TLS connection.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.smtp.to
Desc: The addresses to send outgoing mail to.

Name: services.parsedmarc.settings.smtp.user
Desc: The SMTP server username.

Name: services.parsoid.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable Parsoid – bidirectional
wikitext parser.

Name: services.parsoid.extraConfig
Desc: Extra configuration to add to parsoid configuration.

Name: services.parsoid.interface
Desc: Interface to listen on.

Name: services.parsoid.port
Desc: Port to listen on.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.parsoid.wikis
Desc: Used MediaWiki API endpoints.

Name: services.parsoid.workers
Desc: Number of Parsoid workers.

Name: services.passSecretService.enable
Desc: Whether to enable pass secret service.

Name: services.passSecretService.package
Desc: The pass-secret-service package to use.

Name: services.patroni.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Patroni.

Name: services.patroni.dataDir
Desc: Folder where Patroni data will be written, this is where the pgpass password file will be written.

Name: services.patroni.environmentFiles
Desc: Environment variables made available to Patroni as files content, useful for providing secrets from files.
Type: attribute set of (null or string or path or package)

Name: services.patroni.group
Desc:
The group for the service. If left as the default value this group will automatically be created,
otherwise the sysadmin is responsible for ensuring the group exists.

Name: services.patroni.name
Desc: The name of the host. Must be unique for the cluster.

Name: services.patroni.namespace
Desc: Path within the configuration store where Patroni will keep information about the cluster.

Name: services.patroni.nodeIp
Desc: IP address of this node.

Name: services.patroni.otherNodesIps
Desc: IP addresses of the other nodes.

Name: services.patroni.postgresqlDataDir
Desc:
The data directory for PostgreSQL. If left as the default value
this directory will automatically be created before the PostgreSQL server starts, otherwise
the sysadmin is responsible for ensuring the directory exists with appropriate ownership
and permissions.

Name: services.patroni.postgresqlPackage
Desc:
PostgreSQL package to use.
Plugins can be enabled like this <code class="literal">pkgs.postgresql_14.withPackages (p: [ p.pg_safeupdate p.postgis ])

Name: services.patroni.postgresqlPort
Desc: The port on which PostgreSQL listens.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.patroni.restApiPort
Desc: The port on Patroni’s REST api listens.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.patroni.scope
Desc: Cluster name.

Name: services.patroni.settings
Desc: The primary patroni configuration. See the <a class="link" href="https://patroni.readthedocs.io/en/latest/SETTINGS.html"  target="_top">documentation

Name: services.patroni.softwareWatchdog
Desc:
This will configure Patroni to use the software watchdog built into the Linux kernel
as described in the <a class="link" href="https://patroni.readthedocs.io/en/latest/watchdog.html#setting-up-software-watchdog-on-linux"  target="_top">documentation

Name: services.patroni.user
Desc:
The user for the service. If left as the default value this user will automatically be created,
otherwise the sysadmin is responsible for ensuring the user exists.

Name: services.pcscd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable PCSC-Lite daemon, to access smart cards using SCard API (PC/SC).

Name: services.pcscd.extraArgs
Desc: Extra command line arguments to be passed to the PCSC daemon.

Name: services.pcscd.plugins
Desc: Plugin packages to be used for PCSC-Lite.

Name: services.pcscd.readerConfig
Desc: Configuration for devices that aren’t hotpluggable.

Name: services.pdns-recursor.enable
Desc: Whether to enable PowerDNS Recursor, a recursive DNS server.

Name: services.pdns-recursor.api.address
Desc: IP address Recursor REST API server will bind to.

Name: services.pdns-recursor.api.allowFrom
Desc: IP address ranges of clients allowed to make API requests.

Name: services.pdns-recursor.api.port
Desc: Port number Recursor REST API server will bind to.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.pdns-recursor.dns.address
Desc: IP addresses Recursor DNS server will bind to.

Name: services.pdns-recursor.dns.allowFrom
Desc: IP address ranges of clients allowed to make DNS queries.

Name: services.pdns-recursor.dns.port
Desc: Port number Recursor DNS server will bind to.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.pdns-recursor.dnssecValidation
Desc:
Controls the level of DNSSEC processing done by the PowerDNS Recursor.
See https://doc.powerdns.com/md/recursor/dnssec/ for a detailed explanation.

Name: services.pdns-recursor.exportHosts
Desc: Whether to export names and IP addresses defined in /etc/hosts.

Name: services.pdns-recursor.forwardZones
Desc: DNS zones to be forwarded to other authoritative servers.

Name: services.pdns-recursor.forwardZonesRecurse
Desc: DNS zones to be forwarded to other recursive servers.

Name: services.pdns-recursor.luaConfig
Desc:
The content Lua configuration file for PowerDNS Recursor. See
<a class="link" href="https://doc.powerdns.com/recursor/lua-config/index.html"  target="_top">https://doc.powerdns.com/recursor/lua-config/index.html

Name: services.pdns-recursor.resolveNamecoin
Desc: Resolve <code class="literal">.bit

Name: services.pdns-recursor.serveRFC1918
Desc:
Whether to directly resolve the RFC1918 reverse-mapping domains:
<code class="literal">10.in-addr.arpa

Name: services.pdns-recursor.settings
Desc:
PowerDNS Recursor settings. Use this option to configure Recursor
settings not exposed in a NixOS option or to bypass one.
See the full documentation at
<a class="link" href="https://doc.powerdns.com/recursor/settings.html"  target="_top">https://doc.powerdns.com/recursor/settings.html
Type: attribute set of (null or signed integer or string or boolean or path or list of (signed integer or string or boolean or path))

Name: services.pdnsd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable pdnsd.

Name: services.pdnsd.cacheDir
Desc: Directory holding the pdnsd cache

Name: services.pdnsd.extraConfig
Desc:
Extra configuration directives that should be added to
<code class="literal">pdnsd.conf

Name: services.pdnsd.globalConfig
Desc:
Global configuration that should be added to the global directory
of <code class="literal">pdnsd.conf

Name: services.pdnsd.serverConfig
Desc:
Server configuration that should be added to the server directory
of <code class="literal">pdnsd.conf

Name: services.peerflix.enable
Desc: Whether to enable peerflix service.

Name: services.peerflix.downloadDir
Desc: Peerflix temporary download directory.

Name: services.peerflix.stateDir
Desc: Peerflix state directory.

Name: services.peering-manager.enable
Desc: Enable Peering Manager.

Name: services.peering-manager.enableLdap
Desc: Enable LDAP-Authentication for Peering Manager.

Name: services.peering-manager.enableOidc
Desc: Enable OIDC-Authentication for Peering Manager.

Name: services.peering-manager.enableScheduledTasks
Desc: Set up <a class="link" href="https://peering-manager.readthedocs.io/en/stable/setup/8-scheduled-tasks/"  target="_top">scheduled tasks

Name: services.peering-manager.extraConfig
Desc: Additional lines of configuration appended to the <code class="literal">configuration.py

Name: services.peering-manager.ldapConfigPath
Desc: Path to the Configuration-File for LDAP-Authentication, will be loaded as <code class="literal">ldap_config.py

Name: services.peering-manager.listenAddress
Desc: Address the server will listen on.

Name: services.peering-manager.oidcConfigPath
Desc: Path to the Configuration-File for OIDC-Authentication, will be loaded as <code class="literal">oidc_config.py

Name: services.peering-manager.peeringdbApiKeyFile
Desc: Path to a file containing the PeeringDB API key.

Name: services.peering-manager.plugins
Desc: List of plugin packages to install.
Type: function that evaluates to a(n) list of package

Name: services.peering-manager.port
Desc: Port the server will listen on.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.peering-manager.secretKeyFile
Desc: Path to a file containing the secret key.

Name: services.peering-manager.settings
Desc: Configuration options to set in <code class="literal">configuration.py

Name: services.peering-manager.settings.ALLOWED_HOSTS
Desc:
A list of valid fully-qualified domain names (FQDNs) and/or IP
addresses that can be used to reach the peering manager service.

Name: services.peertube.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Peertube.

Name: services.peertube.enableWebHttps
Desc: Whether clients will access your PeerTube instance with HTTPS. Does NOT configure the PeerTube webserver itself to listen for incoming HTTPS connections.

Name: services.peertube.package
Desc: PeerTube package to use.

Name: services.peertube.configureNginx
Desc: Configure nginx as a reverse proxy for peertube.

Name: services.peertube.dataDirs
Desc: Allow access to custom data locations.

Name: services.peertube.database.createLocally
Desc: Configure local PostgreSQL database server for PeerTube.

Name: services.peertube.database.host
Desc: Database host address or unix socket.

Name: services.peertube.database.name
Desc: Database name.

Name: services.peertube.database.passwordFile
Desc: Password for PostgreSQL database.

Name: services.peertube.database.port
Desc: Database host port.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.peertube.database.user
Desc: Database user.

Name: services.peertube.group
Desc: Group under which Peertube runs.

Name: services.peertube.listenHttp
Desc: The port that the local PeerTube web server will listen on.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.peertube.listenWeb
Desc: The public-facing port that PeerTube will be accessible at (likely 80 or 443 if running behind a reverse proxy). Clients will try to access PeerTube at this port.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.peertube.localDomain
Desc: The domain serving your PeerTube instance.

Name: services.peertube.redis.enableUnixSocket

not the PostgreSQL database of the outgoing connection.

Name: services.pgbouncer.settings.pgbouncer.max_user_connections

Do not allow more than this many server connections per user (regardless of database).
This considers the PgBouncer user that is associated with a pool,

or in absence of that the user the client has connected as.

This tells pgmanage whether or not to only allow super users to
login. The recommended value is true and will restrict users who are not

test if the user is a superuser.

Name: services.pgmanage.tls
Desc:
These options tell pgmanage where the TLS Certificate and Key files
reside. If you use these options then you’ll only be able to access
pgmanage through a secure TLS connection. These options are only
necessary if you wish to connect directly to pgmanage using a secure TLS
connection. As an alternative, you can set up pgmanage in a reverse proxy
configuration. This allows your web server to terminate the secure
connection and pass on the request to pgmanage. You can find help to set
up this configuration in:
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/pgManage/pgManage/blob/master/INSTALL_NGINX.md"  target="_top">https://github.com/pgManage/pgManage/blob/master/INSTALL_NGINX.md

Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.pixelfed.nginx.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.pixelfed.nginx.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.pixelfed.nginx.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.pixelfed.nginx.listen

Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.pixelfed.nginx.listen._.proxyProtocol

Name: services.pixelfed.nginx.listen._.ssl

Name: services.pixelfed.nginx.locations._name_.root
Desc: Root directory for requests.

Name: services.pixelfed.nginx.locations._name_.tryFiles
Desc: Adds try_files directive.

Name: services.postfixadmin.hostName
Desc: Hostname to use for the nginx vhost

Name: services.postfixadmin.setupPasswordFile
Desc:
Password file for the admin.
Generate with <code class="literal">php -r "echo password_hash('some password here', PASSWORD_DEFAULT);"

Name: services.postgresql.enable
Desc: Whether to enable PostgreSQL Server.

Name: services.postgresql.enableJIT
Desc: Whether to enable JIT support.

Name: services.postgresql.enableTCPIP
Desc:
Whether PostgreSQL should listen on all network interfaces.
If disabled, the database can only be accessed via its Unix
domain socket or via TCP connections to localhost.

Name: services.postgresql.package
Desc: The postgresql package to use.

Name: services.postgresql.authentication
Desc:
Defines how users authenticate themselves to the server. See the
<a class="link" href="https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/auth-pg-hba-conf.html"  target="_top">PostgreSQL documentation for pg_hba.conf

Name: services.postgresql.checkConfig
Desc: Check the syntax of the configuration file at compile time

Name: services.postgresql.dataDir
Desc:
The data directory for PostgreSQL. If left as the default value
this directory will automatically be created before the PostgreSQL server starts, otherwise
the sysadmin is responsible for ensuring the directory exists with appropriate ownership
and permissions.

Name: services.postgresql.ensureDatabases
Desc:
Ensures that the specified databases exist.
This option will never delete existing databases, especially not when the value of this
option is changed. This means that databases created once through this option or
otherwise have to be removed manually.

Name: services.postgresql.ensureUsers
Desc:
Ensures that the specified users exist.
The PostgreSQL users will be identified using peer authentication. This authenticates the Unix user with the
same name only, and that without the need for a password.
This option will never delete existing users or remove DB ownership of databases
once granted with <code class="literal">ensureDBOwnership = true;

Name: services.postgresql.ensureUsers._.ensureClauses
Desc:
An attrset of clauses to grant to the user. Under the hood this uses the
<a class="link" href="https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/sql-alteruser.html"  target="_top">ALTER USER syntax

Name: services.postgresql.ensureUsers._.ensureClauses.bypassrls
Desc: Grants the user, created by the ensureUser attr, replication permissions. From the postgres docs:

Name: services.postgresql.ensureUsers._.ensureClauses.createdb
Desc: Grants the user, created by the ensureUser attr, createdb permissions. From the postgres docs:

Name: services.postgresql.ensureUsers._.ensureClauses.createrole
Desc: Grants the user, created by the ensureUser attr, createrole permissions. From the postgres docs:

Name: services.postgresql.ensureUsers._.ensureClauses.inherit
Desc: Grants the user created inherit permissions. From the postgres docs:

Name: services.postgresql.ensureUsers._.ensureClauses.login
Desc: Grants the user, created by the ensureUser attr, login permissions. From the postgres docs:

Name: services.postgresql.ensureUsers._.ensureClauses.replication
Desc: Grants the user, created by the ensureUser attr, replication permissions. From the postgres docs:

Name: services.postgresql.ensureUsers._.ensureClauses.superuser
Desc: Grants the user, created by the ensureUser attr, superuser permissions. From the postgres docs:

Name: services.postgresql.ensureUsers._.ensureDBOwnership
Desc:
Grants the user ownership to a database with the same name.
This database must be defined manually in
<a class='xref' href='/manual/nixos/unstable/options#opt-services.postgresql.ensureDatabases'><code class="option">services.postgresql.ensureDatabases

Name: services.postgresql.ensureUsers._.name
Desc: Name of the user to ensure.

Name: services.postgresql.extensions
Desc: List of PostgreSQL extensions to install.
Type: (function that evaluates to a(n) list of path) or (list of path) convertible to it

Name: services.postgresql.identMap
Desc: Defines the mapping from system users to database users.

Name: services.postgresql.initdbArgs
Desc: Additional arguments passed to <code class="literal">initdb

Name: services.postgresql.initialScript
Desc: A file containing SQL statements to execute on first startup.

Name: services.postgresql.recoveryConfig
Desc: Contents of the <code class="filename">recovery.conf

Name: services.postgresql.settings
Desc:
PostgreSQL configuration. Refer to
<a class="link" href="https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/config-setting.html#CONFIG-SETTING-CONFIGURATION-FILE"  target="_top">https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/config-setting.html#CONFIG-SETTING-CONFIGURATION-FILE
Type: attribute set of (boolean or floating point number or signed integer or string)

Name: services.postgresql.settings.log_line_prefix
Desc:
A printf-style string that is output at the beginning of each log line.
Upstream default is <code class="literal">'%m [%p] '

Name: services.postgresql.settings.port
Desc: The port on which PostgreSQL listens.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.postgresql.settings.shared_preload_libraries
Desc: List of libraries to be preloaded.
Type: null or (string or (list of string) convertible to it)

Name: services.postgresqlBackup.enable
Desc: Whether to enable PostgreSQL dumps.

Name: services.postgresqlBackup.backupAll
Desc:
Backup all databases using pg_dumpall.
This option is mutual exclusive to
<code class="literal">services.postgresqlBackup.databases

Name: services.postgresqlBackup.compression
Desc: The type of compression to use on the generated database dump.

Name: services.postgresqlBackup.compressionLevel
Desc:
The compression level used when compression is enabled.
gzip accepts levels 1 to 9. zstd accepts levels 1 to 19.

Name: services.postgresqlBackup.databases
Desc: List of database names to dump.

Name: services.postgresqlBackup.location
Desc: Path of directory where the PostgreSQL database dumps will be placed.

Name: services.postgresqlBackup.pgdumpOptions
Desc:
Command line options for pg_dump. This options is not used
if <code class="literal">config.services.postgresqlBackup.backupAll

Name: services.postgresqlBackup.startAt
Desc: This option defines (see <code class="literal">systemd.time

Name: services.postgresqlWalReceiver.receivers
Desc:
PostgreSQL WAL receivers.
Stream write-ahead logs from a PostgreSQL server using <span class="command"><strong>pg_receivewal

Name: services.postgresqlWalReceiver.receivers._name_.compress
Desc:
Enables gzip compression of write-ahead logs, and specifies the compression level
(<code class="literal">0

Name: services.postgresqlWalReceiver.receivers._name_.connection
Desc:
Specifies parameters used to connect to the server, as a connection string.
See <a class="link" href="https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq-connect.html#LIBPQ-CONNSTRING"  target="_top">Section 34.1.1 of the PostgreSQL manual

Name: services.postgresqlWalReceiver.receivers._name_.directory
Desc: Directory to write the output to.

Name: services.postgresqlWalReceiver.receivers._name_.environment
Desc:
Environment variables passed to the service.
Usable parameters are listed in <a class="link" href="https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq-envars.html"  target="_top">Section 34.14 of the PostgreSQL manual

Name: services.postgresqlWalReceiver.receivers._name_.extraArgs
Desc: A list of extra arguments to pass to the <span class="command"><strong>pg_receivewal

Name: services.postgresqlWalReceiver.receivers._name_.postgresqlPackage
Desc: The postgresql package to use.

Name: services.postgresqlWalReceiver.receivers._name_.slot
Desc: Require <span class="command"><strong>pg_receivewal

Name: services.postgresqlWalReceiver.receivers._name_.statusInterval
Desc:
Specifies the number of seconds between status packets sent back to the server.
This allows for easier monitoring of the progress from server.
A value of zero disables the periodic status updates completely,
although an update will still be sent when requested by the server, to avoid timeout disconnect.

Name: services.postgresqlWalReceiver.receivers._name_.synchronous
Desc:
Flush the WAL data to disk immediately after it has been received.
Also send a status packet back to the server immediately after flushing, regardless of <code class="option">statusInterval

Name: services.postgrey.enable
Desc: Whether to run the Postgrey daemon

Name: services.postgrey.IPv4CIDR
Desc: Strip N bits from IPv4 addresses if lookupBySubnet is true

Name: services.postgrey.IPv6CIDR
Desc: Strip N bits from IPv6 addresses if lookupBySubnet is true

Name: services.postgrey.autoWhitelist
Desc: Whitelist clients after successful delivery of N messages

Name: services.postgrey.delay
Desc: Greylist for N seconds

Name: services.postgrey.greylistAction
Desc: Response status for greylisted messages (see access(5))

Name: services.postgrey.greylistHeader
Desc: Prepend header to greylisted mails; use %%t for seconds delayed due to greylisting, %%v for the version of postgrey, %%d for the date, and %%h for the host

Name: services.postgrey.greylistText
Desc: Response status text for greylisted messages; use %%s for seconds left until greylisting is over and %%r for mail domain of recipient

Name: services.postgrey.lookupBySubnet
Desc: Strip the last N bits from IP addresses, determined by IPv4CIDR and IPv6CIDR

Name: services.postgrey.maxAge
Desc: Delete entries from whitelist if they haven’t been seen for N days

Name: services.postgrey.privacy
Desc: Store data using one-way hash functions (SHA1)

Name: services.postgrey.retryWindow
Desc: Allow N days for the first retry. Use string with appended ‘h’ to specify time in hours

Name: services.postgrey.socket
Desc: Socket to bind to

Name: services.postgrey.whitelistClients
Desc: Client address whitelist files (see postgrey(8))

Name: services.postgrey.whitelistRecipients
Desc: Recipient address whitelist files (see postgrey(8))

Name: services.postsrsd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the postsrsd SRS server for Postfix.

Name: services.postsrsd.domain
Desc: Domain name for rewrite

Name: services.postsrsd.excludeDomains
Desc: Origin domains to exclude from rewriting in addition to primary domain

Name: services.postsrsd.forwardPort
Desc: Port for the forward SRS lookup

Name: services.postsrsd.group
Desc: Group for the daemon

Name: services.postsrsd.reversePort
Desc: Port for the reverse SRS lookup

Name: services.postsrsd.secretsFile
Desc: Secret keys used for signing and verification

Name: services.postsrsd.separator
Desc: First separator character in generated addresses

Name: services.postsrsd.timeout
Desc: Timeout for idle client connections in seconds

Name: services.postsrsd.user
Desc: User for the daemon

Name: services.power-profiles-daemon.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable power-profiles-daemon, a DBus daemon that allows
changing system behavior based upon user-selected power profiles.

Name: services.power-profiles-daemon.package
Desc: The power-profiles-daemon package to use.

Name: services.powerdns.enable
Desc: Whether to enable PowerDNS domain name server.

Name: services.powerdns.extraConfig
Desc:
PowerDNS configuration. Refer to
<a class="link" href="https://doc.powerdns.com/authoritative/settings.html"  target="_top">https://doc.powerdns.com/authoritative/settings.html

Name: services.powerdns.secretFile
Desc:
Environment variables from this file will be interpolated into the
final config file using envsubst with this syntax: <code class="literal">$ENVIRONMENT

Name: services.powerdns-admin.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the PowerDNS web interface.

Name: services.powerdns-admin.config
Desc:
Configuration python file.
See <a class="link" href="https://github.com/ngoduykhanh/PowerDNS-Admin/blob/v0.4.2/configs/development.py"  target="_top">the example configuration

Name: services.powerdns-admin.extraArgs
Desc: Extra arguments passed to powerdns-admin.

Name: services.powerdns-admin.saltFile
Desc:
The salt used for serialization.
This should be set, otherwise the default is used.
Set this to null to ignore this setting and configure it through another way.

Name: services.powerdns-admin.secretKeyFile
Desc:
The secret used to create cookies.
This needs to be set, otherwise the default is used and everyone can forge valid login cookies.
Set this to null to ignore this setting and configure it through another way.

The contents of the configuration. file of the CUPS Browsed daemon

Name: services.printing.clientConf

The contents of the client configuration.

Name: services.printing.cups-pdf.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable the cups-pdf virtual pdf printer backend.
By default, this will install a single printer <code class="literal">pdf

Permits to raise one or more cups-pdf instances.
Each instance is named by an attribute name, and the attribute’s values control the instance’ configuration.

Name: services.printing.cups-pdf.instances._name_.enable
Desc: Whether to enable this cups-pdf instance.

Whether to enable a CUPS printer queue for this instance.
The queue will be named after the instance and will use the <code class="filename">CUPS-PDF_opt.ppd

Name: services.printing.cups-pdf.instances._name_.settings
Desc:
Settings for a cups-pdf instance, see the descriptions in the template config file in the cups-pdf package.
The key value pairs declared here will be translated into proper key value pairs for <code class="filename">cups-pdf.conf
Type: null or signed integer or string or path or package

Name: services.printing.cups-pdf.instances._name_.settings.AnonDirName
Desc: path for anonymously created PDF files

Name: services.printing.cups-pdf.instances._name_.settings.GhostScript

Name: services.printing.cups-pdf.instances._name_.settings.Out

Gutenprint (i.e. a derivation with
<code class="literal">meta.isGutenprint = true

Name: services.printing.extraFilesConf

Extra contents of the configuration file of the CUPS daemon

List of paths to Privoxy action files. These paths may either be

Name: services.privoxy.settings.filterfile

List of paths to Privoxy filter files. These paths may either be
absolute or relative to the privoxy configuration directory.

Name: services.privoxy.settings.listen-address

Name: services.privoxy.userActions

Name: services.prometheus.package
Desc: The prometheus package to use.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanager.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Prometheus Alertmanager.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanager.package
Desc: The prometheus-alertmanager package to use.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanager.checkConfig
Desc: Check configuration with <code class="literal">amtool check-config

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanager.clusterPeers
Desc: Initial peers for HA cluster.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanager.configText
Desc:
Alertmanager configuration as YAML text. If non-null, this option
defines the text that is written to alertmanager.yml. If null, the
contents of alertmanager.yml is generated from the structured config
options.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanager.configuration
Desc: Alertmanager configuration as nix attribute set.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanager.environmentFile
services.prometheus.alertmanager.extraFlags
Desc: Extra commandline options when launching the Alertmanager.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanager.listenAddress
Desc:
Address to listen on for the web interface and API. Empty string will listen on all interfaces.
“localhost” will listen on 127.0.0.1 (but not ::1).

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanager.logFormat
Desc: If set use a syslog logger or JSON logging.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanager.logLevel
Desc: Only log messages with the given severity or above.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanager.openFirewall
Desc: Open port in firewall for incoming connections.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanager.port
Desc: Port to listen on for the web interface and API.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanager.webExternalUrl
Desc:
The URL under which Alertmanager is externally reachable (for example, if Alertmanager is served via a reverse proxy).
Used for generating relative and absolute links back to Alertmanager itself.
If the URL has a path portion, it will be used to prefix all HTTP endoints served by Alertmanager.
If omitted, relevant URL components will be derived automatically.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanagerIrcRelay.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Alertmanager IRC Relay.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanagerIrcRelay.package
Desc: The alertmanager-irc-relay package to use.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanagerIrcRelay.extraFlags
Desc: Extra command line options to pass to alertmanager-irc-relay.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanagerIrcRelay.settings
Desc:
Configuration for Alertmanager IRC Relay as a Nix attribute set.
For a reference, check out the
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/google/alertmanager-irc-relay#configuring-and-running-the-bot"  target="_top">example configuration

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanagerNotificationQueueCapacity
Desc: The capacity of the queue for pending alert manager notifications.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanagerWebhookLogger.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Alertmanager Webhook Logger.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanagerWebhookLogger.package
Desc: The alertmanager-webhook-logger package to use.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanagerWebhookLogger.extraFlags
Desc: Extra command line options to pass to alertmanager-webhook-logger.

Name: services.prometheus.alertmanagers
Desc:
A list of alertmanagers to send alerts to.
See <a class="link" href="https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/configuration/configuration/#alertmanager_config"  target="_top">the official documentation

Name: services.prometheus.checkConfig
Desc: Check configuration with <code class="literal">promtool check

Name: services.prometheus.configText
Desc:
If non-null, this option defines the text that is written to
prometheus.yml. If null, the contents of prometheus.yml is generated
from the structured config options.

scrape will be treated as failed. 0 means no limit.

Name: services.prometheus.scrapeConfigs._.label_value_length_limit

entire scrape will be treated as failed. 0 means no limit.

required if using an application credential to authenticate. Some providers
allow you to create an application credential to authenticate rather than a
password.

required if using an application credential to authenticate. Some providers
allow you to create an application credential to authenticate rather than a
password.

credential to authenticate.

Desc: The availability of the endpoint to connect to. Must be one of public, admin or internal.

Name: services.prometheus.scrapeConfigs._.openstack_sd_configs._.domain_id
Desc:
At most one of domain_id and domain_name must be provided if using username
with Identity V3. Otherwise, either are optional.

Name: services.prometheus.scrapeConfigs._.openstack_sd_configs._.domain_name
Desc:
At most one of domain_id and domain_name must be provided if using username
with Identity V3. Otherwise, either are optional.

Name: services.prometheus.scrapeConfigs._.openstack_sd_configs._.identity_endpoint
Desc:
identity_endpoint specifies the HTTP endpoint that is required to work with
the Identity API of the appropriate version. While it’s ultimately needed by
all of the identity services, it will often be populated by a provider-level
function.

Name: services.prometheus.scrapeConfigs._.openstack_sd_configs._.password
Desc:
password for the Identity V2 and V3 APIs. Consult with your provider’s
control panel to discover your account’s preferred method of authentication.

The port to scrape metrics from. If using the public IP address, this must
instead be specified in the relabeling rule.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Desc:

Some providers allow you to specify a project_name instead of the project_id.
Some require both. Your provider’s authentication policies will determine
how these fields influence authentication.

Name: services.prometheus.scrapeConfigs._.openstack_sd_configs._.project_name

how these fields influence authentication.

Desc: Number of history message sent to participants by default.

Desc: If set, the MUC rooms will only be accessible to the members by default.

Desc: If set, the MUC rooms will be moderated by default.

Desc: If set, the MUC rooms will display the public JIDs by default.

Name: services.prosody.muc._.roomLockTimeout
Desc:
Timeout after which the room is destroyed or unlocked if not
configured, in seconds

Name: services.prosody.muc._.roomLocking
Desc:
Enables room locking, which means that a room must be
configured before it can be used. Locked rooms are invisible
and cannot be entered by anyone but the creator

Name: services.prosody.muc._.tombstoneExpiry
Desc:
This settings controls how long a tombstone is considered
valid. It defaults to 31 days. After this time, the room in
question can be created again.

Name: services.prosody.muc._.tombstones
Desc:
When a room is destroyed, it leaves behind a tombstone which
prevents the room being entered or recreated. It also allows
anyone who was not in the room at the time it was destroyed
to learn about it, and to update their bookmarks. Tombstones
prevents the case where someone could recreate a previously
semi-anonymous room in order to learn the real JIDs of those
who often join there.

Name: services.prosody.muc._.vcard_muc

Name: services.prosody.s2sInsecureDomains
Desc:
Some servers have invalid or self-signed certificates. You can list
remote domains here that will not be required to authenticate using
certificates. They will be authenticated using DNS instead, even
when s2s_secure_auth is enabled.

Name: services.prosody.s2sRequireEncryption
Desc:
Force servers to use encrypted connections? This option will
prevent servers from authenticating unless they are using encryption.
Note that this is different from authentication.

Name: services.prosody.s2sSecureAuth
Desc:
Force certificate authentication for server-to-server connections?
This provides ideal security, but requires servers you communicate
with to support encryption AND present valid, trusted certificates.
For more information see https://prosody.im/doc/s2s#security

Name: services.prosody.s2sSecureDomains
Desc:
Even if you leave s2s_secure_auth disabled, you can still require valid
certificates for some domains by specifying a list here.

Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful

Desc: Directory for the ACME challenge, which is <span class="strong"><strong>public

Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.

Name: services.radicle.httpd.nginx.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.radicle.httpd.nginx.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Name: services.radicle.httpd.nginx.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.radicle.httpd.nginx.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,

Name: services.radicle.httpd.nginx.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.radicle.httpd.nginx.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.radicle.httpd.nginx.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.radicle.httpd.nginx.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.radicle.httpd.nginx.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.radicle.httpd.nginx.listen._.port
Desc:

Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.radicle.httpd.nginx.listen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.radicle.httpd.nginx.listen._.ssl

Name: services.rutorrent.nginx.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable nginx virtual host management.
Further nginx configuration can be done by adapting <literal>services.nginx.virtualHosts.<name></literal>.
See <xref linkend=“opt-services.nginx.virtualHosts”/> for further information.

Name: services.rutorrent.nginx.exposeInsecureRPC2mount
Desc:
If you do not enable one of the <literal>rpc</literal> or <literal>httprpc</literal> plugins you need to expose an RPC mount through scgi using this option.
Warning: This allow to run arbitrary commands, as the rtorrent user, so make sure to use authentification. The simplest way would be to use the <literal>services.nginx.virtualHosts.<name>.basicAuth</literal> option.

Name: services.rutorrent.plugins
Desc:
List of plugins to enable. See the list of <link xlink:href=“https://github.com/Novik/ruTorrent/wiki/Plugins#currently-there-are-the-following-plugins”>available plugins</link>. Note: the <literal>unpack</literal> plugin needs the nonfree <literal>unrar</literal> package.
You need to either enable one of the <literal>rpc</literal> or <literal>httprpc</literal> plugin or enable the <xref linkend=“opt-services.rutorrent.nginx.exposeInsecureRPC2mount”/> option.

Name: services.rutorrent.poolSettings

Desc: User which runs the ruTorrent service.

The time format is described in <a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.time.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">systemd.time

Name: services.seafile.gc.persistent
Desc:
Takes a boolean argument. If true, the time when the service
unit was last triggered is stored on disk. When the timer is
activated, the service unit is triggered immediately if it
would have been triggered at least once during the time when
the timer was inactive. Such triggering is nonetheless
subject to the delay imposed by RandomizedDelaySec=. This is
useful to catch up on missed runs of the service when the
system was powered down.

Name: services.seafile.gc.randomizedDelaySec
Desc:
Add a randomized delay before each garbage collection.
The delay will be chosen between zero and this value.
This value must be a time span in the format specified by
<a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.time.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">systemd.time

Desc:
Whether to enable SKS (synchronizing key server for OpenPGP) and start the database
server. You need to create “${dataDir}/dump/*.gpg” for the initial
import.

Name: services.sks.package
Desc: The sks package to use.

Name: services.sks.dataDir
Desc:
Data directory (-basedir) for SKS, where the database and all
configuration files are located (e.g. KDB, PTree, membership and
sksconf).

Name: services.sks.extraDbConfig
Desc:
Set contents of the files “KDB/DB_CONFIG” and “PTree/DB_CONFIG” within
the ${dataDir} directory. This is used to configure options for the
database for the sks key server.

Name: services.sks.hkpAddress
Desc:
Domain names, IPv4 and/or IPv6 addresses to listen on for HKP
requests.

Name: services.sks.hkpPort
Desc: HKP port to listen on.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.sks.webroot
Desc:
Source directory (will be symlinked, if not null) for the files the
built-in webserver should serve. SKS (${pkgs.sks.webSamples})
provides the following examples: “HTML5”, “OpenPKG”, and “XHTML+ES”.
The index file can be named index.html, index.htm, index.xhtm, or
index.xhtml. Files with the extensions .css, .es, .js, .jpg, .jpeg,
.png, or .gif are supported. Subdirectories and filenames with
anything other than alphanumeric characters and the ‘.’ character
will be ignored.

Name: services.skydns.enable

Desc: Skydns path of TLS certificate authority public key.

Desc: Skydns list of etcd endpoints to connect to.

Name: services.skydns.etcd.tlsKey
Desc: Skydns path of TLS client certificate - private key.

Name: services.skydns.etcd.tlsPem
Desc: Skydns path of TLS client certificate - public key.

Name: services.skydns.extraConfig
Desc: Skydns attribute set of extra config options passed as environment variables.

Name: services.skydns.nameservers

Desc:
The directory where slimserver stores its state, tag cache,
playlists etc.

Desc: Whether to enable slskd.

Name: services.slskd.package
Desc: The slskd package to use.

Name: services.slskd.domain
Desc:
If non-null, enables an nginx reverse proxy virtual host at this FQDN,
at the path configurated with <code class="literal">services.slskd.web.url_base

Name: services.slskd.environmentFile
Desc:
Path to the environment file sourced on startup.
It must at least contain the variables <code class="literal">SLSKD_SLSK_USERNAME

Name: services.slskd.group
Desc: Group under which slskd runs.

Name: services.slskd.nginx
Desc: This option customizes the nginx virtual host set up for slskd.

Name: services.slskd.nginx.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.slskd.nginx.acmeFallbackHost
Desc:
Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful
if you want multiple hosts to be able to verify the same domain name.

Name: services.slskd.nginx.acmeRoot
Desc: Directory for the ACME challenge, which is <span class="strong"><strong>public

Name: services.slskd.nginx.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.slskd.nginx.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.slskd.nginx.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.slskd.nginx.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.slskd.nginx.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Name: services.slskd.nginx.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.slskd.nginx.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,
configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.slskd.nginx.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.slskd.nginx.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.slskd.nginx.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.slskd.nginx.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.slskd.nginx.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.slskd.nginx.listen._.addr
Desc: Listen address.

Name: services.slskd.nginx.listen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.slskd.nginx.listen._.port
Desc:
Port number to listen on.
If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.slskd.nginx.listen._.proxyProtocol

HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
