Name: services.xserver.displayManager.session
Desc:
List of sessions supported with the command used to start each
session.  Each session script can set the
<code class="varname">waitPID

Name: services.xserver.displayManager.sessionCommands
Desc:
Shell commands executed just before the window or desktop manager is
started. These commands are not currently sourced for Wayland sessions.

Name: services.xserver.displayManager.setupCommands
Desc: Shell commands executed just after the X server has started.

Name: services.xserver.displayManager.startx.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable the dummy “startx” pseudo-display manager,
which allows users to start X manually via the “startx” command
from a vt shell. The X server runs under the user’s id, not as root.
The user must provide a ~/.xinitrc file containing session startup
commands, see startx(1). This is not automatically generated
from the desktopManager and windowManager settings.

Name: services.xserver.displayManager.sx.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable the “sx” pseudo-display manager, which allows users
to start manually via the “sx” command from a vt shell. The X server
runs under the user’s id, not as root. The user must provide a
~/.config/sx/sxrc file containing session startup commands, see
sx(1). This is not automatically generated from the desktopManager
and windowManager settings. sx doesn’t have a way to directly set
X server flags, but it can be done by overriding its xorgserver
dependency.

Name: services.xserver.displayManager.sx.package
Desc: The sx package to use.

Name: services.xserver.displayManager.sx.addAsSession
Desc:
Whether to add sx as a display manager session. Keep in mind that sx
expects to be run from a TTY, so it may not work in your display
manager.

Name: services.xserver.displayManager.xpra.enable
Desc: Whether to enable xpra as display manager.

Name: services.xserver.displayManager.xpra.auth
Desc: Authentication to use when connecting to xpra

Name: services.xserver.displayManager.xpra.bindTcp
Desc: Bind xpra to TCP

Name: services.xserver.displayManager.xpra.desktop
Desc: Start a desktop environment instead of seamless mode

Name: services.xserver.displayManager.xpra.extraOptions
Desc: Extra xpra options

Name: services.xserver.displayManager.xpra.pulseaudio
Desc: Whether to enable pulseaudio audio streaming.

Name: services.xserver.displayManager.xserverArgs
Desc: List of arguments for the X server.

Name: services.xserver.displayManager.xserverBin
Desc: Path to the X server used by display managers.

Name: services.xserver.dpi
Desc:
Force global DPI resolution to use for X server. It’s recommended to
use this only when DPI is detected incorrectly; also consider using
<code class="literal">Monitor

Name: services.xserver.excludePackages
Desc: Which X11 packages to exclude from the default environment

Desc: Additional contents (sections) included in the X server configuration file

Desc: Lines to be added to every Display subsection of the Screen section.

Name: services.xserver.filesSection
Desc: Contents of the first <code class="literal">Files

Desc:
Set the X server FontPath. Defaults to null, which

See <a class="link" href="https://imwheel.sourceforge.net/imwheel.1.html"  target="_top">official man pages

Name: services.xserver.monitorSection

Desc:
The screen resolutions for the X server.  The first element

Desc: Contents of the first Screen section of the X server configuration file.

Name: services.xserver.serverFlagsSection
Desc: Contents of the ServerFlags section of the X server configuration file.

Name: services.xserver.serverLayoutSection

Name: services.xserver.synaptics.accelFactor
Desc: Cursor acceleration (how fast speed increases from minSpeed to maxSpeed).

Path for touchpad device.  Set to null to apply to any

Name: services.xserver.synaptics.fingersMap

Desc: Whether to enable horizontal edge drag-scrolling.

Desc: Whether to enable horizontal two-finger drag-scrolling.

Name: services.xserver.synaptics.maxSpeed
Desc: Cursor speed factor for highest-speed finger motion.

Name: services.xserver.synaptics.minSpeed

Name: services.xserver.synaptics.palmDetect
Desc: Whether to enable palm detection (hardware support required)

Name: services.xserver.synaptics.palmMinWidth

Name: services.xserver.synaptics.palmMinZ

Name: services.xserver.synaptics.scrollDelta
Desc: Move distance of the finger for a scroll event.

Name: services.xserver.synaptics.tapButtons
Desc: Whether to enable tap buttons.

Name: services.xserver.synaptics.twoFingerScroll
Desc: Whether to enable two-finger drag-scrolling. Overridden by horizTwoFingerScroll and vertTwoFingerScroll.

Name: services.xserver.synaptics.vertEdgeScroll
Desc: Whether to enable vertical edge drag-scrolling.

Name: services.xserver.synaptics.vertTwoFingerScroll
Desc: Whether to enable vertical two-finger drag-scrolling.

Upscale the default X cursor to be more visible on high-density displays.

Name: services.xserver.videoDrivers
Desc:
The names of the video drivers the configuration

Don’t combine those with “incompatible” OpenGL implementations,

Name: services.xserver.windowManager.xmonad.config

Configuration from which XMonad gets compiled. If no value is
specified, a vanilla xmonad binary is put in PATH, which will
attempt to recompile and exec your xmonad config from $HOME/.xmonad.
This setup is then analogous to other (non-NixOS) linux distributions.

Additional command-line arguments to pass to
<span class="command"><strong>xautolock

Name: services.xserver.xautolock.nowlocker

Name: services.xserver.xautolock.time

Name: services.xserver.xkb.dir
Desc: Path used for -xkbdir xserver parameter.

Name: services.xserver.xkb.extraLayouts
Desc:
Extra custom layouts that will be included in the xkb configuration.
Information on how to create a new layout can be found here:
<a class="link" href="https://www.x.org/releases/current/doc/xorg-docs/input/XKB-Enhancing.html#Defining_New_Layouts"  target="_top">https://www.x.org/releases/current/doc/xorg-docs/input/XKB-Enhancing.html#Defining_New_Layouts

Name: services.xserver.xkb.extraLayouts._name_.compatFile
Desc:
The path to the xkb compat file.
This file sets the compatibility state, used to preserve
compatibility with xkb-unaware programs.
It must contain a <code class="literal">xkb_compat "name" { ... }

Name: services.xserver.xkb.extraLayouts._name_.description
Desc: A short description of the layout.

Name: services.xserver.xkb.extraLayouts._name_.geometryFile
Desc:
The path to the xkb geometry file.
This (completely optional) file describes the physical layout of
keyboard, which maybe be used by programs to depict it.
It must contain a <code class="literal">xkb_geometry "name" { ... }

Name: services.xserver.xkb.extraLayouts._name_.keycodesFile
Desc:
The path to the xkb keycodes file.
This file specifies the range and the interpretation of the raw
keycodes sent by the keyboard.
It must contain a <code class="literal">xkb_keycodes "name" { ... }

Name: services.xserver.xkb.extraLayouts._name_.languages
Desc:
A list of languages provided by the layout.
(Use ISO 639-2 codes, for example: “eng” for english)

Name: services.xserver.xkb.extraLayouts._name_.symbolsFile
Desc:
The path to the xkb symbols file.
This is the most important file: it defines which symbol or action
maps to each key and must contain a
<code class="literal">xkb_symbols "name" { ... }

Name: services.xserver.xkb.extraLayouts._name_.typesFile
Desc:
The path to the xkb types file.
This file specifies the key types that can be associated with
the various keyboard keys.
It must contain a <code class="literal">xkb_types "name" { ... }

Name: services.xserver.xkb.layout
Desc: X keyboard layout, or multiple keyboard layouts separated by commas.

Name: services.xserver.xkb.model
Desc: X keyboard model.

Name: services.xserver.xkb.options
Desc: X keyboard options; layout switching goes here.

Name: services.xserver.xkb.variant
Desc: X keyboard variant.

Name: services.xserver.xrandrHeads
Desc:
Multiple monitor configuration, just specify a list of XRandR
outputs. The individual elements should be either simple strings or
an attribute set of output options.
Type: list of ((submodule) or string convertible to it)

Name: services.xserver.xrandrHeads._.monitorConfig
Desc: Extra lines to append to the <code class="literal">Monitor

Name: services.xserver.xrandrHeads._.output
Desc:
The output name of the monitor, as shown by
<span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">xrandr

Name: services.xserver.xrandrHeads._.primary
Desc: Whether this head is treated as the primary monitor,

Desc: Whether to enable XtreemFS.

Name: services.xtreemfs.dir.enable
Desc: Whether to enable XtreemFS DIR service.

Name: services.xtreemfs.dir.address
Desc:
If specified, it defines the interface to listen on. If not
specified, the service will listen on all interfaces (any).

Name: services.xtreemfs.dir.extraConfig
Desc:
Configuration of XtreemFS DIR service.
WARNING: configuration is saved as plaintext inside nix store.
For more options: https://www.xtreemfs.org/xtfs-guide-1.5.1/index.html

Name: services.xtreemfs.dir.httpPort
Desc:
Specifies the listen port for the HTTP service that returns the
status page.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.xtreemfs.dir.port
Desc: The port to listen on for incoming connections (TCP).
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.xtreemfs.dir.replication.enable
Desc: Whether to enable XtreemFS DIR replication plugin.

Name: services.xtreemfs.dir.replication.extraConfig
Desc:
Configuration of XtreemFS DIR replication plugin.
WARNING: configuration is saved as plaintext inside nix store.
For more options: https://www.xtreemfs.org/xtfs-guide-1.5.1/index.html

Name: services.xtreemfs.dir.syncMode
Desc:
The sync mode influences how operations are committed to the disk
log before the operation is acknowledged to the caller.

Name: services.xtreemfs.dir.uuid
Desc:
Must be set to a unique identifier, preferably a UUID according to
RFC 4122. UUIDs can be generated with <code class="literal">uuidgen

Name: services.xtreemfs.homeDir
Desc: XtreemFS home dir for the xtreemfs user.

Name: services.xtreemfs.mrc.enable
Desc: Whether to enable XtreemFS MRC service.

Name: services.xtreemfs.mrc.address
Desc:
If specified, it defines the interface to listen on. If not
specified, the service will listen on all interfaces (any).

Name: services.xtreemfs.mrc.extraConfig
Desc:
Configuration of XtreemFS MRC service.
WARNING: configuration is saved as plaintext inside nix store.
For more options: https://www.xtreemfs.org/xtfs-guide-1.5.1/index.html

Name: services.xtreemfs.mrc.httpPort
Desc:
Specifies the listen port for the HTTP service that returns the
status page.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.xtreemfs.mrc.port
Desc: The port to listen on for incoming connections (TCP).
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.xtreemfs.mrc.replication.enable
Desc: Whether to enable XtreemFS MRC replication plugin.

Name: services.xtreemfs.mrc.replication.extraConfig
Desc:
Configuration of XtreemFS MRC replication plugin.
WARNING: configuration is saved as plaintext inside nix store.
For more options: https://www.xtreemfs.org/xtfs-guide-1.5.1/index.html

Name: services.xtreemfs.mrc.syncMode
Desc:
The sync mode influences how operations are committed to the disk
log before the operation is acknowledged to the caller.

Name: services.xtreemfs.mrc.uuid
Desc:
Must be set to a unique identifier, preferably a UUID according to
RFC 4122. UUIDs can be generated with <code class="literal">uuidgen

Name: services.xtreemfs.osd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable XtreemFS OSD service.

Name: services.xtreemfs.osd.address
Desc:
If specified, it defines the interface to listen on. If not
specified, the service will listen on all interfaces (any).

Name: services.xtreemfs.osd.extraConfig
Desc:
Configuration of XtreemFS OSD service.
WARNING: configuration is saved as plaintext inside nix store.
For more options: https://www.xtreemfs.org/xtfs-guide-1.5.1/index.html

Name: services.xtreemfs.osd.httpPort
Desc:
Specifies the listen port for the HTTP service that returns the
status page.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.xtreemfs.osd.port
Desc: The port to listen on for incoming connections (TCP and UDP).
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.xtreemfs.osd.uuid
Desc:
Must be set to a unique identifier, preferably a UUID according to
RFC 4122. UUIDs can be generated with <code class="literal">uuidgen

Name: services.yandex-disk.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Yandex-disk client. See https://disk.yandex.ru/

Name: services.yandex-disk.directory
Desc: The directory to use for Yandex.Disk storage

Name: services.yandex-disk.excludes
Desc: Comma-separated list of directories which are excluded from synchronization.

Name: services.yandex-disk.password
Desc: Your yandex.com password. Warning: it will be world-readable in /nix/store.

Name: services.yandex-disk.user
Desc: The user the yandex-disk daemon should run as.

Name: services.yandex-disk.username
Desc: Your yandex.com login name.

Name: services.yggdrasil.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the yggdrasil system service.

Name: services.yggdrasil.package
Desc: The yggdrasil package to use.

Name: services.yggdrasil.configFile
Desc:
A file which contains JSON or HJSON configuration for yggdrasil. See
the <code class="option">settings

Name: services.yggdrasil.denyDhcpcdInterfaces
Desc:
Disable the DHCP client for any interface whose name matches
any of the shell glob patterns in this list.  Use this
option to prevent the DHCP client from broadcasting requests
on the yggdrasil network.  It is only necessary to do so
when yggdrasil is running in TAP mode, because TUN
interfaces do not support broadcasting.

Name: services.yggdrasil.extraArgs
Desc: Extra command line arguments.

Name: services.yggdrasil.group
Desc: Group to grant access to the Yggdrasil control socket. If <code class="literal">null

Name: services.yggdrasil.openMulticastPort
Desc:
Whether to open the UDP port used for multicast peer discovery. The
NixOS firewall blocks link-local communication, so in order to make
incoming local peering work you will also need to configure
<code class="literal">MulticastInterfaces

Name: services.yggdrasil.persistentKeys
Desc:
Whether to enable persistent keys. If enabled then keys will be generated once and Yggdrasil
will retain the same IPv6 address when the service is
restarted. Keys are stored at /var/lib/yggdrasil/keys.json
.

Name: services.yggdrasil.settings
Desc: Configuration for yggdrasil, as a Nix attribute set.

Name: services.ympd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable ympd, the MPD Web GUI.

Name: services.ympd.mpd.host
Desc: The host where MPD is listening.

Name: services.ympd.mpd.port
Desc: The port where MPD is listening.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.ympd.webPort
Desc: The port where ympd’s web interface will be available.
Type: string or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.your_spotify.enable
Desc: Whether to enable your_spotify.

Name: services.your_spotify.enableLocalDB
Desc: Whether to enable a local mongodb instance.

Name: services.your_spotify.package
Desc: The your_spotify package to use.

Name: services.your_spotify.clientPackage
Desc: Client package to use.

Name: services.your_spotify.nginxVirtualHost
Desc:
If set creates an nginx virtual host for the client.
In most cases this should be the CLIENT_ENDPOINT without
protocol prefix.

Name: services.your_spotify.settings
Desc: Your Spotify Configuration. Refer to <a class="link" href="https://github.com/Yooooomi/your_spotify"  target="_top">Your Spotify

Name: services.your_spotify.settings.API_ENDPOINT
Desc:
The endpoint of your server
This api has to be reachable from the device you use the website from not from the server.
This means that for example you may need two nginx virtual hosts if you want to expose this on the
internet.
Has to include a protocol Prefix (e.g. <code class="literal">http://

Name: services.your_spotify.settings.CLIENT_ENDPOINT
Desc:
The endpoint of your web application.
Has to include a protocol Prefix (e.g. <code class="literal">http://

Name: services.your_spotify.settings.MONGO_ENDPOINT
Desc: The endpoint of the Mongo database.

Name: services.your_spotify.settings.PORT
Desc: The port of the api server
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.your_spotify.settings.SPOTIFY_PUBLIC
Desc:
The public client ID of your Spotify application.
Refer to: <a class="link" href="https://github.com/Yooooomi/your_spotify#creating-the-spotify-application"  target="_top">Creating the Spotify Application

Name: services.your_spotify.spotifySecretFile
Desc:
A file containing the secret key of your Spotify application.
Refer to: <a class="link" href="https://github.com/Yooooomi/your_spotify#creating-the-spotify-application"  target="_top">Creating the Spotify Application

Name: services.youtrack.enable
Desc: Whether to enable YouTrack service.

Name: services.youtrack.package
Desc: Package to use.

Name: services.youtrack.address
Desc: The interface youtrack will listen on.

Name: services.youtrack.autoUpgrade
Desc: Whether YouTrack should auto upgrade it without showing the upgrade dialog.

Name: services.youtrack.environmentalParameters
Desc:
Environmental configuration parameters, set imperatively. The values doesn’t get removed, when removed in Nix.
See https://www.jetbrains.com/help/youtrack/server/2023.3/youtrack-java-start-parameters.html#environmental-parameters
for more information.
Type: attribute set of (signed integer or string or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive))

Name: services.youtrack.environmentalParameters.listen-address
Desc: The interface YouTrack will listen on.

Name: services.youtrack.environmentalParameters.listen-port
Desc: The port YouTrack will listen on.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.youtrack.generalParameters
Desc:
General configuration parameters and other JVM options.
See https://www.jetbrains.com/help/youtrack/server/2023.3/youtrack-java-start-parameters.html#general-parameters
for more information.

Name: services.youtrack.statePath
Desc:
Path were the YouTrack state is stored.
To this path the base version (e.g. 2023_1) of the used package will be appended.

Name: services.youtrack.virtualHost
Desc:
Name of the nginx virtual host to use and setup.
If null, do not setup anything.

Name: services.yubikey-agent.enable
Desc:
Whether to start yubikey-agent when you log in.  Also sets
SSH_AUTH_SOCK to point at yubikey-agent.

Name: services.yubikey-agent.package
Desc: The yubikey-agent package to use.

Name: services.zabbixAgent.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Zabbix Agent.

Name: services.zabbixAgent.package
Desc: The agent package to use.

Name: services.zabbixAgent.extraPackages
Desc: Packages to be added to the Zabbix <code class="envar">PATH

Name: services.zabbixAgent.listen.ip
Desc: List of comma delimited IP addresses that the agent should listen on.

Name: services.zabbixAgent.listen.port
Desc: Agent will listen on this port for connections from the server.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.zabbixAgent.modules
Desc: A set of modules to load.

Name: services.zabbixAgent.openFirewall
Desc: Open ports in the firewall for the Zabbix Agent.

Desc: The IP address or hostname of the Zabbix server to connect to.

Zabbix Agent configuration. Refer to
<a class="link" href="https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/manual/appendix/config/zabbix_agentd"  target="_top">https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/manual/appendix/config/zabbix_agentd
Type: attribute set of (signed integer or string or list of string)

Name: services.zabbixProxy.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Zabbix Proxy.

Name: services.zabbixProxy.package

Name: services.zabbixProxy.database.createLocally

Name: services.zabbixProxy.database.name

Desc:
A file containing the password corresponding to
<code class="option">database.user

Name: services.zabbixProxy.database.port
Desc: Database host port.

Name: services.zabbixProxy.database.socket
Desc: Path to the unix socket file to use for authentication.

Name: services.zabbixProxy.database.user

Name: services.zabbixProxy.extraPackages

List of comma delimited IP addresses that the trapper should listen on.

Desc: Path to the unix socket file to use for authentication.

Name: services.zabbixServer.database.type
Desc: Database engine to use.

Name: services.zabbixServer.database.user
Desc: Database user.

Name: services.zabbixServer.extraPackages
Desc: Packages to be added to the Zabbix <code class="envar">PATH

Name: services.zabbixServer.listen.ip
Desc:
List of comma delimited IP addresses that the trapper should listen on.
Trapper will listen on all network interfaces if this parameter is missing.

Desc: Listen port for trapper.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Desc: Open ports in the firewall for the Zabbix Server.

Desc:
Zabbix Server configuration. Refer to
<a class="link" href="https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/manual/appendix/config/zabbix_server"  target="_top">https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/manual/appendix/config/zabbix_server
Type: attribute set of (signed integer or string or list of string)

Name: services.zabbixWeb.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Zabbix web interface.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.package
Desc: The web package to use.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.database.host
Desc: Database host address.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.database.name
Desc: Database name.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.database.passwordFile
Desc:
A file containing the password corresponding to
<code class="option">database.user

Name: services.zabbixWeb.database.port
Desc: Database host port.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.zabbixWeb.database.socket
Desc: Path to the unix socket file to use for authentication.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.database.type
Desc: Database engine to use.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.database.user
Desc: Database user.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.extraConfig
Desc: Additional configuration to be copied verbatim into <code class="filename">zabbix.conf.php

Name: services.zabbixWeb.frontend
Desc: Frontend server to use.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.hostname
Desc: Hostname for either nginx or httpd.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost
Desc: Apache configuration can be done by adapting <code class="literal">services.httpd.virtualHosts.<name>

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.enableUserDir
Desc: Whether to enable serving <code class="filename">~/public_html

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.acmeRoot
Desc:
Directory for the acme challenge which is PUBLIC, don’t put certs or keys in here.
Set to null to inherit from config.security.acme.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.adminAddr
Desc: E-mail address of the server administrator.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.documentRoot
Desc:
The path of Apache’s document root directory.  If left undefined,
an empty directory in the Nix store will be used as root.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.extraConfig
Desc:
These lines go to httpd.conf verbatim. They will go after
directories and directory aliases defined by default.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that permanently redirects (301)
all plain HTTP traffic to HTTPS. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected permanently to
the given URL.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.hostName
Desc: Canonical hostname for the server.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTP 2. HTTP/2 is supported in all multi-processing modules that come with httpd. <span class="emphasis"><em>However, if you use the prefork mpm, there will
be severe restrictions.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.listen
Desc: Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.listen._.ip
Desc: IP to listen on. 0.0.0.0 for IPv4 only, * for all.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.listen._.port
Desc: Port to listen on
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.listen._.ssl
Desc: Whether to enable SSL (https) support.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.locations
Desc: Declarative location config. See <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/core.html#location"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/core.html#location

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests. See <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_alias.html#alias"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_alias.html#alias

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds DirectoryIndex directive. See <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_dir.html#directoryindex"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_dir.html#directoryindex

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc: Sets up a simple reverse proxy as described by <a class="link" href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/howto/reverse_proxy.html#simple"  target="_top">https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/howto/reverse_proxy.html#simple

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.logFormat
Desc: Log format for Apache’s log files. Possible values are: combined, common, referer, agent.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.onlySSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.robotsEntries
Desc: Specification of pages to be ignored by web crawlers. See <a class="link" href="http://www.robotstxt.org/"  target="_top">http://www.robotstxt.org/

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.servedDirs
Desc: This option provides a simple way to serve static directories.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.servedFiles
Desc: This option provides a simple way to serve individual, static files.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.serverAliases
Desc: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.sslServerCert
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.sslServerChain
Desc: Path to server SSL chain file.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.sslServerKey
Desc: Path to server SSL certificate key.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.httpd.virtualHost.useACMEHost
Desc:
A host of an existing Let’s Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<a class="link" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits"  target="_top">rate limit

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost
Desc: Nginx configuration can be done by adapting <code class="literal">services.nginx.virtualHosts.<name>

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.enableACME
Desc:
Whether to ask Let’s Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <code class="option">useACMEHost

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.acmeFallbackHost
Desc:
Host which to proxy requests to if ACME challenge is not found. Useful
if you want multiple hosts to be able to verify the same domain name.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.acmeRoot
Desc: Directory for the ACME challenge, which is <span class="strong"><strong>public

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.addSSL
Desc:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<code class="literal">listen

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.default
Desc: Makes this vhost the default.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.forceSSL
Desc:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that redirects (defaults
to 301, configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.globalRedirect
Desc:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected (defaults to 301,
configurable with <code class="literal">redirectCode

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.http2
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/2 protocol.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx’s implementation, to disable
HTTP/2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2, then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.http3
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/3 protocol.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.http3_hq
Desc:
Whether to enable the HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.
This requires using <code class="literal">pkgs.nginxQuic

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.kTLS
Desc:
Whether to enable kTLS support.
Implementing TLS in the kernel (kTLS) improves performance by significantly
reducing the need for copying operations between user space and the kernel.
Required Nginx version 1.21.4 or later.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.listen
Desc:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <code class="literal">addSSL

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.listen._.addr
Desc: Listen address.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.listen._.extraParameters
Desc: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.listen._.port
Desc:
Port number to listen on.
If unset and the listen address is not a socket then nginx defaults to 80.
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.listen._.proxyProtocol
Desc: Enable PROXY protocol.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.listen._.ssl
Desc: Enable SSL.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.listenAddresses
Desc:
Listen addresses for this virtual host.
Compared to <code class="literal">listen

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.locations
Desc: Declarative location config

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.locations._name_.alias
Desc: Alias directory for requests.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.locations._name_.basicAuth
Desc: Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.locations._name_.basicAuthFile
Desc:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost.
Can be created by running <span class="command"><strong>nix-shell --packages apacheHttpd --run 'htpasswd -B -c FILENAME USERNAME'

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.locations._name_.extraConfig
Desc: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.locations._name_.fastcgiParams
Desc:
FastCGI parameters to override.  Unlike in the Nginx
configuration file, overriding only some default parameters
won’t unset the default values for other parameters.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.locations._name_.index
Desc: Adds index directive.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.locations._name_.priority
Desc:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with <code class="literal">lib.mkOrder

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.locations._name_.proxyPass
Desc:
Adds proxy_pass directive and sets recommended proxy headers if
recommendedProxySettings is enabled.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.locations._name_.proxyWebsockets
Desc: Whether to support proxying websocket connections with HTTP/1.1.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.locations._name_.recommendedProxySettings
Desc: Enable recommended proxy settings.

Name: services.zabbixWeb.nginx.virtualHost.locations._name_.return
Desc: Adds a return directive, for e.g. redirections.
Type: null or string or signed integer

Name: services.zapret.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Zapret DPI bypass service…

Name: services.zapret.package
Desc: The zapret package to use.

Name: services.zapret.blacklist
Desc:
Specify a list of domains NOT to bypass. All other domains will be bypassed.
You can specify either whitelist or blacklist, but not both.
If neither are specified, then bypass all domains.

Name: services.zapret.configureFirewall
Desc:
Whether to setup firewall routing so that system http(s) traffic is forwarded via this service.
Disable if you want to set it up manually.

Name: services.zapret.httpMode
Desc:
By default this service only changes the first packet sent, which is enough in most cases.
But there are DPIs that monitor the whole traffic within a session.
That requires full processing of every packet, which increases the CPU usage.

Name: services.zapret.httpSupport
Desc:
Whether to route http traffic on port 80.
Http bypass rarely works and you might want to disable it if you don’t utilise http connections.

Name: services.zapret.params
Desc:
Specify the bypass parameters for Zapret binary.
There are no universal parameters as they vary between different networks, so you’ll have to find them yourself.

Name: services.zapret.qnum
Desc:
Routing queue number.
Only change this if you already use the default queue number somewhere else.

Name: services.zapret.udpPorts
Desc:
List of UDP ports to route.
Port ranges are delimited with a colon like this “50000:50099”.

Name: services.zapret.udpSupport
Desc:
Enable UDP routing.
This requires you to specify <code class="literal">udpPorts

Name: services.zapret.whitelist
Desc:
Specify a list of domains to bypass. All other domains will be ignored.
You can specify either whitelist or blacklist, but not both.
If neither are specified, then bypass all domains.

Add a randomized delay before each ZFS autoscrub.
The delay will be chosen between zero and this value.
This value must be a time span in the format specified by
<a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.time.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">systemd.time

Name: services.znapzend.enable
Desc: Whether to enable ZnapZend ZFS backup daemon.

Name: services.znapzend.autoCreation
Desc: Automatically create the destination dataset if it does not exist.

Name: services.znapzend.features.compressed
Desc: Whether to enable compressed feature which adds the options <code class="literal">-Lce

Name: services.znapzend.features.lowmemRecurse
Desc:
Whether to enable use lowmemRecurse on systems where you have too many datasets, so a
recursive listing of attributes to find backup plans exhausts the
memory available to <span class="command"><strong>znapzend

Name: services.znapzend.features.oracleMode
Desc:
Whether to enable destroying snapshots one by one instead of using one long argument list.
If source and destination are out of sync for a long time, you may have
so many snapshots to destroy that the argument gets is too long and the
command fails
.

Name: services.znapzend.features.recvu
Desc: Whether to enable recvu feature which uses <code class="literal">-u

Name: services.znapzend.features.sendRaw
Desc: Whether to enable sendRaw feature which adds the options <code class="literal">-w

Name: services.znapzend.features.skipIntermediates
Desc:
Whether to enable the skipIntermediates feature to send a single increment
between latest common snapshot and the newly made one. It may skip
several source snaps if the destination was offline for some time, and
it should skip snapshots not managed by znapzend. Normally for online
destinations, the new snapshot is sent as soon as it is created on the
source, so there are no automatic increments to skip
.

Name: services.znapzend.features.zfsGetType
Desc: Whether to enable using zfsGetType if your <span class="command"><strong>zfs get

Name: services.znapzend.logLevel
Desc:
The log level when logging to file. Any of debug, info, warning, err,
alert. Default in daemonized form is debug.

Name: services.znapzend.logTo
Desc: Where to log to (syslog::<facility> or <filepath>).

Name: services.znapzend.mailErrorSummaryTo
Desc: Email address to send a summary to if “send task(s) failed”.

Name: services.znapzend.noDestroy
Desc: Does all changes to the filesystem except destroy.

Name: services.znapzend.pure
Desc:
Do not persist any stateful znapzend setups. If this option is
enabled, your previously set znapzend setups will be cleared and only
the ones defined with this module will be applied.

Desc: The dataset to use for this source.

Desc: Additional destinations.

Name: services.znapzend.zetup._name_.destinations._name_.dataset
Desc: Dataset name to send snapshots to.

Name: services.znapzend.zetup._name_.destinations._name_.host
Desc:
Host to use for the destination dataset. Can be prefixed with
<code class="literal">user@

Name: services.znapzend.zetup._name_.destinations._name_.label
Desc: Label for this destination. Defaults to the attribute name.

Name: services.znapzend.zetup._name_.destinations._name_.plan
Desc: The znapzend backup plan to use for the source.

Desc:
Command to run after sending the snapshot to the destination.
Intended to run a remote script via <span class="command"><strong>ssh

Name: services.znapzend.zetup._name_.destinations._name_.presend
Desc:
Command to run before sending the snapshot to the destination.

Desc: Whether to use <span class="command"><strong>mbuffer

Desc: Port to use for <span class="command"><strong>mbuffer
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: services.znapzend.zetup._name_.mbuffer.size
Desc: The size for <span class="command"><strong>mbuffer

Name: services.znapzend.zetup._name_.plan
Desc: The znapzend backup plan to use for the source.

Name: services.znapzend.zetup._name_.postsnap
Desc:
Command to run after snapshots are taken on the source dataset,
e.g. for database unlocking. See also <code class="option">presnap

Name: services.znapzend.zetup._name_.presnap
Desc:
Command to run before snapshots are taken on the source dataset,
e.g. for database locking/flushing. See also
<code class="option">postsnap

Name: services.znapzend.zetup._name_.recursive
Desc: Whether to do recursive snapshots.

Specify delay (in seconds) before sending snaps to the destination.

Desc:
The timestamp format to use for constructing snapshot names.

Type: string containing all of the characters %Y, %m, %d, %H, %M, %S

Configuration settings for the generated config
file.

Name: specialisation
Desc:
Additional configurations to build. If
<code class="literal">inheritParentConfig

Name: specialisation._name_.configuration
Desc: Arbitrary NixOS configuration.

Name: specialisation._name_.inheritParentConfig
Desc: Include the entire system’s configuration. Set to false to make a completely differently configured system.

Name: swapDevices
Desc:
The swap devices and swap files.  These must have been
initialised using <span class="command"><strong>mkswap

Name: swapDevices._.device
Desc: Path of the device or swap file.

Name: swapDevices._.discardPolicy
Desc:
Specify the discard policy for the swap device. If “once”, then the
whole swap space is discarded at swapon invocation. If “pages”,
asynchronous discard on freed pages is performed, before returning to
the available pages pool. With “both”, both policies are activated.
See swapon(8) for more information.

Name: swapDevices._.encrypted.enable
Desc: The block device is backed by an encrypted one, adds this device as a initrd luks entry.

Name: swapDevices._.encrypted.blkDev
Desc: Location of the backing encrypted device.

Name: swapDevices._.encrypted.keyFile
Desc:
Path to a keyfile used to unlock the backing encrypted
device. When systemd stage 1 is not enabled, at the time
this keyfile is accessed, the <code class="literal">neededForBoot

Name: swapDevices._.encrypted.label
Desc: Label of the unlocked encrypted device. Set <code class="literal">fileSystems.<name?>.device

Name: swapDevices._.label
Desc: Label of the device.  Can be used instead of <code class="varname">device

Name: swapDevices._.options
Desc: Options used to mount the swap.

Name: swapDevices._.priority
Desc:
Specify the priority of the swap device. Priority is a value between 0 and 32767.
Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
null lets the kernel choose a priority, which will show up as a negative value.

Name: swapDevices._.randomEncryption
Desc: Encrypt swap device with a random key. This way you won’t have a persistent swap device.

Name: swapDevices._.randomEncryption.enable
Desc: Encrypt swap device with a random key. This way you won’t have a persistent swap device.

Name: swapDevices._.randomEncryption.allowDiscards
Desc:
Whether to allow TRIM requests to the underlying device. This option
has security implications; please read the LUKS documentation before
activating it.

Name: swapDevices._.randomEncryption.cipher
Desc: Use specified cipher for randomEncryption.

Name: swapDevices._.randomEncryption.keySize
Desc: Set the encryption key size for the plain device.

Name: swapDevices._.randomEncryption.sectorSize
Desc: Set the sector size for the plain encrypted device type.

Name: swapDevices._.randomEncryption.source
Desc: Define the source of randomness to obtain a random key for encryption.

Name: swapDevices._.size
Desc:
If this option is set, ‘device’ is interpreted as the
path of a swapfile that will be created automatically
with the indicated size (in megabytes).

Name: system.activatable
Desc: Whether to add the activation script to the system profile.

Name: system.activationScripts
Desc:
A set of shell script fragments that are executed when a NixOS
system configuration is activated.  Examples are updating
/etc, creating accounts, and so on.  Since these are executed
every time you boot the system or run
<span class="command"><strong>nixos-rebuild

Name: system.autoUpgrade.enable
Desc:
Whether to periodically upgrade NixOS to the latest
version. If enabled, a systemd timer will run
<code class="literal">nixos-rebuild switch --upgrade

Name: system.autoUpgrade.allowReboot
Desc:
Reboot the system into the new generation instead of a switch
if the new generation uses a different kernel, kernel modules
or initrd than the booted system.
See <code class="option">rebootWindow

Name: system.autoUpgrade.channel
Desc:
The URI of the NixOS channel to use for automatic
upgrades. By default, this is the channel set using
<span class="command"><strong>nix-channel

Name: system.autoUpgrade.dates
Desc:
How often or when upgrade occurs. For most desktop and server systems
a sufficient upgrade frequency is once a day.

Name: system.autoUpgrade.fixedRandomDelay
Desc:
Make the randomized delay consistent between runs.
This reduces the jitter between automatic upgrades.
See <code class="option">randomizedDelaySec

Name: system.autoUpgrade.flags
Desc: Any additional flags passed to <span class="command"><strong>nixos-rebuild

Name: system.autoUpgrade.flake
Desc:
The Flake URI of the NixOS configuration to build.
Disables the option <code class="option">system.autoUpgrade.channel

Name: system.autoUpgrade.operation
Desc:
Whether to run
<code class="literal">nixos-rebuild switch --upgrade

Name: system.autoUpgrade.persistent
Desc:
Takes a boolean argument. If true, the time when the service
unit was last triggered is stored on disk. When the timer is
activated, the service unit is triggered immediately if it
would have been triggered at least once during the time when
the timer was inactive. Such triggering is nonetheless
subject to the delay imposed by RandomizedDelaySec=. This is
useful to catch up on missed runs of the service when the
system was powered down.

Name: system.autoUpgrade.randomizedDelaySec
Desc:
Add a randomized delay before each automatic upgrade.
The delay will be chosen between zero and this value.
This value must be a time span in the format specified by
<a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.time.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">systemd.time

Name: system.autoUpgrade.rebootWindow
Desc:
Define a lower and upper time value (in HH:MM format) which
constitute a time window during which reboots are allowed after an upgrade.
This option only has an effect when <code class="option">allowReboot

Name: system.autoUpgrade.rebootWindow.lower
Desc: Lower limit of the reboot window

Name: system.autoUpgrade.rebootWindow.upper
Desc: Upper limit of the reboot window

Whether to include the build closure of the whole system in

Packages to which no replacements should be applied.

List of packages to override without doing a full rebuild.

Desc:
The distinguished name to bind to the LDAP server with. If this

Desc:
The path to a file containing the credentials to use when binding

Specifies the time limit (in seconds) to use when connecting

Name: users.ldap.daemon.enable
Desc:
Whether to let the nslcd daemon (nss-pam-ldapd) handle the
LDAP lookups for NSS and PAM. This can improve performance,
and if you need to bind to the LDAP server with a password,
it increases security, since only the nslcd user needs to
have access to the bindpw file, not everyone that uses NSS
and/or PAM. If this option is enabled, a local nscd user is
created automatically, and the nslcd service is started
automatically when the network get up.

Name: users.ldap.daemon.extraConfig
Desc:
Extra configuration options that will be added verbatim at
the end of the nslcd configuration file (<code class="literal">nslcd.conf(5)

Name: users.ldap.daemon.rootpwmoddn
Desc:
The distinguished name to use to bind to the LDAP server
when the root user tries to modify a user’s password.

Name: users.ldap.daemon.rootpwmodpwFile
Desc:
The path to a file containing the credentials with which to bind to
the LDAP server if the root user tries to change a user’s password.

Name: users.ldap.extraConfig
Desc:
Extra configuration options that will be added verbatim at
the end of the ldap configuration file (<code class="literal">ldap.conf(5)

Name: users.ldap.loginPam

Name: users.ldap.nsswitch

Name: users.ldap.server

Name: users.ldap.timeLimit
Desc:
Specifies the time limit (in seconds) to use when performing
searches. A value of zero (0), which is the default, is to
wait indefinitely for searches to be completed.

Name: users.ldap.useTLS
Desc:
If enabled, use TLS (encryption) over an LDAP (port 389)
connection.  The alternative is to specify an LDAPS server (port
636) in <code class="option">users.ldap.server
