Name: users.mysql.pam.table
Desc: The name of table that maps unique login names to the passwords.

Name: users.mysql.pam.updateTable
Desc:
The name of the table used for password alteration. If not defined, the value
of the <code class="literal">table

Name: users.mysql.pam.userColumn
Desc: The name of the column that contains a unix login name.

Name: users.mysql.pam.verbose
Desc:
If enabled, produces logs with detailed messages that describes what
<code class="literal">pam_mysql

Name: users.mysql.pam.where
Desc: Additional criteria for the query.

Name: users.mysql.passwordFile
Desc: The path to the file containing the password for the user

Name: users.mysql.user
Desc: The username to use when connecting to the database

Name: users.users
Desc:
Additional user accounts to be created automatically by the system.
This can also be used to set options for root.

Name: users.users._name_.packages
Desc:
The set of packages that should be made available to the user.
This is in contrast to <code class="option">environment.systemPackages

Name: users.users._name_.autoSubUidGidRange
Desc:
Automatically allocate subordinate user and group ids for this user.
Allocated range is currently always of size 65536.

Name: users.users._name_.createHome
Desc:
Whether to create the home directory and ensure ownership as well as
permissions to match the user.

Name: users.users._name_.cryptHomeLuks
Desc:
Path to encrypted luks device that contains
the user’s home directory.

Name: users.users._name_.description
Desc:
A short description of the user account, typically the
user’s full name.  This is actually the “GECOS” or “comment”
field in <code class="filename">/etc/passwd
Type: string, not containing newlines or colons

Name: users.users._name_.expires
Desc:
Set the date on which the user’s account will no longer be
accessible. The date is expressed in the format YYYY-MM-DD, or null
to disable the expiry.
A user whose account is locked must contact the system
administrator before being able to use the system again.
Type: null or string matching the pattern [[:digit:]]{4}-[[:digit:]]{2}-[[:digit:]]{2}

Name: users.users._name_.extraGroups
Desc: The user’s auxiliary groups.

Name: users.users._name_.group
Desc: The user’s primary group.

Name: users.users._name_.hashedPassword
Desc:
Specifies the hashed password for the user.
The options <code class="option">hashedPassword
Type: null or (string, not containing newlines or colons)

Name: users.users._name_.hashedPasswordFile
Desc:
The full path to a file that contains the hash of the user’s
password. The password file is read on each system activation. The
file should contain exactly one line, which should be the password in
an encrypted form that is suitable for the <code class="literal">chpasswd -e

Name: users.users._name_.home
Desc: The user’s home directory.
Type: path, not containing newlines or colons

Name: users.users._name_.homeMode
Desc: The user’s home directory mode in numeric format. See chmod(1). The mode is only applied if <code class="option">users.users.<name>.createHome

Name: users.users._name_.ignoreShellProgramCheck
Desc:
By default, nixos will check that programs.SHELL.enable is set to
true if the user has a custom shell specified. If that behavior isn’t
required and there are custom overrides in place to make sure that the
shell is functional, set this to true.

Name: users.users._name_.initialHashedPassword
Desc:
Specifies the initial hashed password for the user, i.e. the
hashed password assigned if the user does not already
exist. If <code class="option">users.mutableUsers
Type: null or (string, not containing newlines or colons)

Name: users.users._name_.initialPassword
Desc:
Specifies the initial password for the user, i.e. the
password assigned if the user does not already exist. If
<code class="option">users.mutableUsers

Name: users.users._name_.isNormalUser
Desc:
Indicates whether this is an account for a “real” user.
This automatically sets <code class="option">group

Name: users.users._name_.isSystemUser
Desc:
Indicates if the user is a system user or not. This option
only has an effect if <code class="option">uid

Name: users.users._name_.linger
Desc:
Whether to enable lingering for this user. If true, systemd user
units will start at boot, rather than starting at login and stopping
at logout. This is the declarative equivalent of running
<code class="literal">loginctl enable-linger

Name: users.users._name_.name
Desc:
The name of the user account. If undefined, the name of the
attribute set will be used.
Type: string, not containing newlines or colons

Name: users.users._name_.openssh.authorizedKeys.keyFiles
Desc:
A list of files each containing one OpenSSH public key that should be
added to the user’s authorized keys. The contents of the files are
read at build time and added to a file that the SSH daemon reads in
addition to the the user’s authorized_keys file. You can combine the
<code class="literal">keyFiles

Name: users.users._name_.openssh.authorizedKeys.keys
Desc:
A list of verbatim OpenSSH public keys that should be added to the
user’s authorized keys. The keys are added to a file that the SSH
daemon reads in addition to the the user’s authorized_keys file.
You can combine the <code class="literal">keys

Name: users.users._name_.openssh.authorizedPrincipals
Desc:
A list of verbatim principal names that should be added to the user’s
authorized principals.

Name: users.users._name_.pamMount
Desc:
Attributes for user’s entry in
<code class="filename">pam_mount.conf.xml

Name: users.users._name_.password
Desc:
Specifies the (clear text) password for the user.
Warning: do not set confidential information here
because it is world-readable in the Nix store. This option
should only be used for public accounts.
The options <code class="option">hashedPassword

Name: users.users._name_.shell
Desc:
The path to the user’s shell. Can use shell derivations,
like <code class="literal">pkgs.bashInteractive
Type: null or package or (path, not containing newlines or colons)

Name: users.users._name_.subGidRanges
Desc:
Subordinate group ids that user is allowed to use.
They are set into <code class="filename">/etc/subgid

Name: users.users._name_.subGidRanges._.count
Desc: Count of subordinate group ids

Name: users.users._name_.subGidRanges._.startGid
Desc:
Start of the range of subordinate group ids that user is
allowed to use.

Name: users.users._name_.subUidRanges
Desc:
Subordinate user ids that user is allowed to use.
They are set into <code class="filename">/etc/subuid

Name: users.users._name_.subUidRanges._.count
Desc: Count of subordinate user ids

Name: users.users._name_.subUidRanges._.startUid
Desc:
Start of the range of subordinate user ids that user is
allowed to use.

Name: users.users._name_.uid
Desc:
The account UID. If the UID is null, a free UID is picked on
activation.

Name: users.users._name_.useDefaultShell
Desc:
If true, the user’s shell will be set to
<code class="option">users.defaultUserShell

Name: virtualisation.additionalPaths
Desc:
A list of paths whose closure should be made available to
the VM.

Name: virtualisation.anbox.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Anbox.

Name: virtualisation.anbox.extraInit
Desc: Extra shell commands to be run inside the container image during init.

Name: virtualisation.anbox.image
Desc: Base android image for Anbox.

Name: virtualisation.anbox.imageModifications
Desc: Commands to edit the image filesystem.

Name: virtualisation.anbox.ipv4.container.address
Desc: IPv4 Container address.

Name: virtualisation.anbox.ipv4.container.prefixLength
Desc:
Subnet mask of the Container address, specified as the number of
bits in the prefix (<code class="literal">24

Name: virtualisation.anbox.ipv4.dns
Desc: Container DNS server.

Name: virtualisation.anbox.ipv4.gateway.address
Desc: IPv4 Host address.

Name: virtualisation.anbox.ipv4.gateway.prefixLength
Desc:
Subnet mask of the Host address, specified as the number of
bits in the prefix (<code class="literal">24

Name: virtualisation.appvm.enable
Desc: This enables AppVMs and related virtualisation settings.

Name: virtualisation.appvm.user
Desc: AppVM user login. Currently only AppVMs are supported for a single user only.

Name: virtualisation.bios
Desc: An alternate BIOS (such as <code class="literal">qboot

Name: virtualisation.bootLoaderDevice
Desc: The path (inside th VM) to the device to boot from when legacy booting.

Name: virtualisation.bootPartition
Desc: The path (inside the VM) to the device containing the EFI System Partition (ESP).

Name: virtualisation.containerd.enable
Desc: Whether to enable containerd container runtime.

Name: virtualisation.containerd.args
Desc: extra args to append to the containerd cmdline

Name: virtualisation.containerd.configFile
Desc:
Path to containerd config file.
Setting this option will override any configuration applied by the settings option.

Name: virtualisation.containerd.settings
Desc: Verbatim lines to add to containerd.toml

Name: virtualisation.containers.enable
Desc: This option enables the common /etc/containers configuration module.

Name: virtualisation.containers.containersConf.cniPlugins
Desc: CNI plugins to install on the system.

Name: virtualisation.containers.containersConf.settings
Desc: containers.conf configuration

Name: virtualisation.containers.ociSeccompBpfHook.enable
Desc: Enable the OCI seccomp BPF hook

Name: virtualisation.containers.policy
Desc:
Signature verification policy file.
If this option is empty the default policy file from
<code class="literal">skopeo

Name: virtualisation.containers.registries.block
Desc: List of blocked repositories.

Name: virtualisation.containers.registries.insecure
Desc: List of insecure repositories.

Name: virtualisation.containers.registries.search
Desc: List of repositories to search.

Name: virtualisation.containers.storage.settings
Desc: storage.conf configuration

Name: virtualisation.cores
Desc:
Specify the number of cores the guest is permitted to use.
The number can be higher than the available cores on the
host system.

Name: virtualisation.cri-o.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Container Runtime Interface for OCI (CRI-O).

Name: virtualisation.cri-o.extraPackages
Desc: Extra packages to be installed in the CRI-O wrapper.

Name: virtualisation.cri-o.logLevel
Desc: Log level to be used

Name: virtualisation.cri-o.pauseCommand
Desc: Override the default pause command

Name: virtualisation.cri-o.pauseImage
Desc: Override the default pause image for pod sandboxes

Name: virtualisation.cri-o.runtime
Desc: Override the default runtime

Name: virtualisation.cri-o.settings
Desc:
Configuration for cri-o, see
<a class="link" href="https://github.com/cri-o/cri-o/blob/master/docs/crio.conf.5.md"  target="_top">https://github.com/cri-o/cri-o/blob/master/docs/crio.conf.5.md

Name: virtualisation.cri-o.storageDriver
Desc: Storage driver to be used

Name: virtualisation.directBoot.enable
Desc:
If enabled, the virtual machine will boot directly into the kernel instead of through a bootloader.
Read more about this feature in the <a class="link" href="https://qemu-project.gitlab.io/qemu/system/linuxboot.html"  target="_top">QEMU documentation on Direct Linux Boot

Name: virtualisation.directBoot.initrd
Desc:
In direct boot situations, you may want to influence the initrd to load
to use your own customized payload.

Name: virtualisation.diskImage
Desc:
Path to the disk image containing the root filesystem.
The image will be created on startup if it does not
exist.

Name: virtualisation.diskSize
Desc: The disk size in megabytes of the virtual machine.

Name: virtualisation.docker.enable
Desc:
This option enables docker, a daemon that manages
linux containers. Users in the “docker” group can interact with
the daemon (e.g. to start or stop containers) using the
<span class="command"><strong>docker

Name: virtualisation.docker.enableNvidia
Desc: <span class="strong"><strong>Deprecated

Name: virtualisation.docker.enableOnBoot
Desc:
When enabled dockerd is started on boot. This is required for
containers which are created with the
<code class="literal">--restart=always

Name: virtualisation.docker.package
Desc: The docker package to use.

Name: virtualisation.docker.autoPrune.enable
Desc:
Whether to periodically prune Docker resources. If enabled, a
systemd timer will run <code class="literal">docker system prune -f

Name: virtualisation.docker.autoPrune.dates
Desc:
Specification (in the format described by
<a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.time.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">systemd.time

Name: virtualisation.docker.autoPrune.flags
Desc: Any additional flags passed to <span class="command"><strong>docker system prune

Name: virtualisation.docker.daemon.settings
Desc:
Configuration for docker daemon. The attributes are serialized to JSON used as daemon.conf.
See https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/dockerd/#daemon-configuration-file

Name: virtualisation.docker.daemon.settings.live-restore
Desc:
Allow dockerd to be restarted without affecting running container.
This option is incompatible with docker swarm.

Name: virtualisation.docker.extraOptions
Desc:
The extra command-line options to pass to
<span class="command"><strong>docker

Name: virtualisation.docker.extraPackages
Desc: Extra packages to add to PATH for the docker daemon process.

Name: virtualisation.docker.listenOptions
Desc:
A list of unix and tcp docker should listen to. The format follows
ListenStream as described in systemd.socket(5).

Name: virtualisation.docker.liveRestore
Desc: Alias of <code class="option">virtualisation.docker.daemon.settings.live-restore

Name: virtualisation.docker.logDriver
Desc: This option determines which Docker log driver to use.

Name: virtualisation.docker.rootless.enable
Desc:
This option enables docker in a rootless mode, a daemon that manages
linux containers. To interact with the daemon, one needs to set
<span class="command"><strong>DOCKER_HOST=unix://$XDG_RUNTIME_DIR/docker.sock

Name: virtualisation.docker.rootless.package
Desc: The docker package to use.

Name: virtualisation.docker.rootless.daemon.settings
Desc:
Configuration for docker daemon. The attributes are serialized to JSON used as daemon.conf.
See https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/dockerd/#daemon-configuration-file

Name: virtualisation.docker.rootless.setSocketVariable
Desc: Point <span class="command"><strong>DOCKER_HOST

Name: virtualisation.docker.storageDriver
Desc:
This option determines which Docker
<a class="link" href="https://docs.docker.com/storage/storagedriver/select-storage-driver/"  target="_top">storage driver

Name: virtualisation.efi.OVMF
Desc: OVMF firmware package, defaults to OVMF configured with secure boot if needed.

Name: virtualisation.efi.firmware
Desc: Firmware binary for EFI implementation, defaults to OVMF.

Name: virtualisation.efi.keepVariables
Desc: Whether to keep EFI variable values from the generated system image

Name: virtualisation.efi.variables
Desc:
Platform-specific flash binary for EFI variables, implementation-dependent to the EFI firmware.
Defaults to OVMF.

Name: virtualisation.emptyDiskImages
Desc:
Additional disk images to provide to the VM. The value is
a list of size in megabytes of each disk. These disks are
writeable by the VM.

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems
Desc:
The file systems to be mounted.  It must include an entry for
the root directory (<code class="literal">mountPoint = "/"

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.autoFormat
Desc:
If the device does not currently contain a filesystem (as
determined by <span class="command"><strong>blkid

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.autoResize
Desc:
If set, the filesystem is grown to its maximum size before
being mounted. (This is typically the size of the containing
partition.) This is currently only supported for ext2/3/4
filesystems that are mounted during early boot.

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.depends
Desc:
List of paths that should be mounted before this one. This filesystem’s
<code class="option">device
Type: list of string (with check: non-empty without trailing slash)

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.device
Desc: Location of the device.

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.encrypted.enable
Desc: The block device is backed by an encrypted one, adds this device as a initrd luks entry.

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.encrypted.blkDev
Desc: Location of the backing encrypted device.

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.encrypted.keyFile
Desc:
Path to a keyfile used to unlock the backing encrypted
device. When systemd stage 1 is not enabled, at the time
this keyfile is accessed, the <code class="literal">neededForBoot

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.encrypted.label
Desc: Label of the unlocked encrypted device. Set <code class="literal">fileSystems.<name?>.device

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.fsType
Desc: Type of the file system.

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.label
Desc: Label of the device (if any).

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.mountPoint
Desc: Location of the mounted file system.
Type: string (with check: non-empty without trailing slash)

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.neededForBoot
Desc:
If set, this file system will be mounted in the initial ramdisk.
Note that the file system will always be mounted in the initial
ramdisk if its mount point is one of the following:
<code class="filename">/

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.noCheck
Desc: Disable running fsck on this filesystem.

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.options
Desc: Options used to mount the file system.

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.overlay.lowerdir
Desc: The list of path(s) to the lowerdir(s).
Type: null or (non-empty (list of (string or path in the Nix store)))

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.overlay.upperdir
Desc: The path to the upperdir.

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.overlay.workdir
Desc: The path to the workdir.

Name: virtualisation.fileSystems._name_.stratis.poolUuid
Desc: UUID of the stratis pool that the fs is located in

Name: virtualisation.forwardPorts
Desc:
When using the SLiRP user networking (default), this option allows to
forward ports to/from the host/guest.

Name: virtualisation.forwardPorts._.from
Desc: Controls the direction in which the ports are mapped:

Name: virtualisation.forwardPorts._.guest.address
Desc: The IPv4 address on the guest VLAN.

Name: virtualisation.forwardPorts._.guest.port
Desc: The guest port to be mapped.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: virtualisation.forwardPorts._.host.address
Desc: The IPv4 address of the host.

Name: virtualisation.forwardPorts._.host.port
Desc: The host port to be mapped.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: virtualisation.forwardPorts._.proto
Desc: The protocol to forward.

Name: virtualisation.graphics
Desc:
Whether to run QEMU with a graphics window, or in nographic mode.
Serial console will be enabled on both settings, but this will
change the preferred console.

Name: virtualisation.host.pkgs
Desc:
Package set to use for the host-specific packages of the VM runner.
Changing this to e.g. a Darwin package set allows running NixOS VMs on Darwin.
Type: An evaluation of Nixpkgs; the top level attribute set of packages

Name: virtualisation.hypervGuest.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Hyper-V Guest Support.

Name: virtualisation.hypervGuest.videoMode
Desc: Resolution at which to initialize the video adapter.

Name: virtualisation.incus.enable
Desc: Whether to enable incusd, a daemon that manages containers and virtual machines.

Name: virtualisation.incus.package
Desc: The incus-lts package to use.

Name: virtualisation.incus.agent.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Incus agent.

Name: virtualisation.incus.clientPackage
Desc: The incus client package to use. This package is added to PATH.

Name: virtualisation.incus.lxcPackage
Desc: The lxc package to use.

Name: virtualisation.incus.preseed
Desc:
Configuration for Incus preseed, see
<a class="link" href="https://linuxcontainers.org/incus/docs/main/howto/initialize/#non-interactive-configuration"  target="_top">https://linuxcontainers.org/incus/docs/main/howto/initialize/#non-interactive-configuration

Name: virtualisation.incus.socketActivation
Desc:
Whether to enable socket-activation for starting incus.service. Enabling this option
will stop incus.service from starting automatically on boot.
.

Name: virtualisation.incus.softDaemonRestart
Desc: Allow for incus.service to be stopped without affecting running instances.

Name: virtualisation.incus.startTimeout
Desc:
Time to wait (in seconds) for incusd to become ready to process requests.
If incusd does not reply within the configured time, <code class="literal">incus.service

Name: virtualisation.incus.ui.enable
Desc: Whether to enable (experimental) Incus UI.

Name: virtualisation.incus.ui.package
Desc: The ui package to use.

Name: virtualisation.installBootLoader
Desc: Install boot loader to target image.

Name: virtualisation.interfaces
Desc: Network interfaces to add to the VM.

Name: virtualisation.interfaces._name_.assignIP
Desc:
Automatically assign an IP address to the network interface using the same scheme as
virtualisation.vlans.

Name: virtualisation.interfaces._name_.vlan
Desc: VLAN to which the network interface is connected.

Name: virtualisation.kvmgt.enable
virtualisation.kvmgt.device
Desc: PCI ID of graphics card. You can figure it with <span class="command"><strong>ls /sys/class/mdev_bus

Name: virtualisation.kvmgt.vgpus
Desc: Virtual GPUs to be used in Qemu. You can find devices via <span class="command"><strong>ls /sys/bus/pci/devices/*/mdev_supported_types

Name: virtualisation.kvmgt.vgpus._name_.uuid
Desc: UUID(s) of VGPU device. You can generate one with <code class="literal">libossp_uuid

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.enable
Desc:
This option enables libvirtd, a daemon that manages
virtual machines. Users in the “libvirtd” group can interact with
the daemon (e.g. to start or stop VMs) using the
<span class="command"><strong>virsh

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.package
Desc: The libvirt package to use.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.allowedBridges
Desc: List of bridge devices that can be used by qemu:///session

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.extraConfig
Desc:
Extra contents appended to the libvirtd configuration file,
libvirtd.conf.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.extraOptions
Desc: Extra command line arguments passed to libvirtd on startup.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.hooks
Desc: Hooks related options.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.hooks.daemon
Desc:
Hooks that will be placed under /var/lib/libvirt/hooks/daemon.d/
and called for daemon start/shutdown/SIGHUP events.
Please see https://libvirt.org/hooks.html for documentation.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.hooks.libxl
Desc:
Hooks that will be placed under /var/lib/libvirt/hooks/libxl.d/
and called for libxl-handled xen domains begin/end events.
Please see https://libvirt.org/hooks.html for documentation.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.hooks.lxc
Desc:
Hooks that will be placed under /var/lib/libvirt/hooks/lxc.d/
and called for lxc domains begin/end events.
Please see https://libvirt.org/hooks.html for documentation.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.hooks.network
Desc:
Hooks that will be placed under /var/lib/libvirt/hooks/lxc.d/
and called for networks begin/end events.
Please see https://libvirt.org/hooks.html for documentation.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.hooks.qemu
Desc:
Hooks that will be placed under /var/lib/libvirt/hooks/qemu.d/
and called for qemu domains begin/end/migrate events.
Please see https://libvirt.org/hooks.html for documentation.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.nss
Desc: libvirt NSS module options.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.nss.enable
Desc:
This option enables the older libvirt NSS module. This method uses
DHCP server records, therefore is dependent on the hostname provided
by the guest.
Please see https://libvirt.org/nss.html for more information.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.nss.enableGuest
Desc:
This option enables the newer libvirt_guest NSS module. This module
uses the libvirt guest name instead of the hostname of the guest.
Please see https://libvirt.org/nss.html for more information.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.onBoot
Desc:
Specifies the action to be done to / on the guests when the host boots.
The “start” option starts all guests that were running prior to shutdown
regardless of their autostart settings. The “ignore” option will not
start the formerly running guest on boot. However, any guest marked as
autostart will still be automatically started by libvirtd.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.onShutdown
Desc:
When shutting down / restarting the host what method should
be used to gracefully halt the guests. Setting to “shutdown”
will cause an ACPI shutdown of each guest. “suspend” will
attempt to save the state of the guests ready to restore on boot.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.parallelShutdown
Desc:
Number of guests that will be shutdown concurrently, taking effect when onShutdown
is set to “shutdown”. If set to 0, guests will be shutdown one after another.
Number of guests on shutdown at any time will not exceed number set in this
variable.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.qemu
Desc: QEMU related options.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.qemu.package
Desc: The qemu package to use. <code class="literal">pkgs.qemu

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.qemu.ovmf
Desc: QEMU’s OVMF options.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.qemu.ovmf.enable
Desc:
Allows libvirtd to take advantage of OVMF when creating new
QEMU VMs with UEFI boot.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.qemu.ovmf.packages
Desc: List of OVMF packages to use. Each listed package must contain files names FV/OVMF_CODE.fd and FV/OVMF_VARS.fd or FV/AAVMF_CODE.fd and FV/AAVMF_VARS.fd

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.qemu.runAsRoot
Desc:
If true,  libvirtd runs qemu as root.
If false, libvirtd runs qemu as unprivileged user qemu-libvirtd.
Changing this option to false may cause file permission issues
for existing guests. To fix these, manually change ownership
of affected files in /var/lib/libvirt/qemu to qemu-libvirtd.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.qemu.swtpm
Desc: QEMU’s swtpm options.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.qemu.swtpm.enable
Desc: Allows libvirtd to use swtpm to create an emulated TPM.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.qemu.swtpm.package
Desc: The swtpm package to use.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.qemu.verbatimConfig
Desc:
Contents written to the qemu configuration file, qemu.conf.
Make sure to include a proper namespace configuration when
supplying custom configuration.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.qemu.vhostUserPackages
Desc: Packages containing out-of-tree vhost-user drivers.

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.shutdownTimeout
Desc:
Number of seconds we’re willing to wait for a guest to shut down.
If parallel shutdown is enabled, this timeout applies as a timeout
for shutting down all guests on a single URI defined in the variable URIS.
If this is 0, then there is no time out (use with caution, as guests might not
respond to a shutdown request).

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.sshProxy
Desc: Weither to configure OpenSSH to use the <a class="link" href="https://libvirt.org/ssh-proxy.html"  target="_top">SSH Proxy

Name: virtualisation.libvirtd.startDelay
Desc:
Number of seconds to wait between each guest start.
If set to 0, all guests will start up in parallel.

Name: virtualisation.lxc.enable
Desc:
This enables Linux Containers (LXC), which provides tools
for creating and managing system or application containers
on Linux.

Name: virtualisation.lxc.package
Desc: The lxc package to use.

Name: virtualisation.lxc.bridgeConfig
Desc: This is the config file for override lxc-net bridge default settings.

Name: virtualisation.lxc.defaultConfig
Desc:
Default config (default.conf) for new containers, i.e. for
network config. See <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">lxc.container.conf

Name: virtualisation.lxc.lxcfs.enable
Desc:
This enables LXCFS, a FUSE filesystem for LXC.
To use lxcfs in include the following configuration in your
container configuration:

Name: virtualisation.lxc.systemConfig
Desc:
This is the system-wide LXC config. See
<span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">lxc.system.conf

Name: virtualisation.lxc.unprivilegedContainers
Desc: Whether to enable support for unprivileged users to launch containers.

Name: virtualisation.lxc.usernetConfig
Desc:
This is the config file for managing unprivileged user network
administration access in LXC. See <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">lxc-usernet

Name: virtualisation.lxd.enable
Desc:
This option enables lxd, a daemon that manages
containers. Users in the “lxd” group can interact with
the daemon (e.g. to start or stop containers) using the
<span class="command"><strong>lxc

Name: virtualisation.lxd.package
Desc: The lxd-lts package to use.

Name: virtualisation.lxd.agent.enable
Desc: Whether to enable LXD agent.

Name: virtualisation.lxd.lxcPackage
Desc: The lxc package to use.

Name: virtualisation.lxd.preseed
Desc:
Configuration for LXD preseed, see
<a class="link" href="https://documentation.ubuntu.com/lxd/en/latest/howto/initialize/#initialize-preseed"  target="_top">https://documentation.ubuntu.com/lxd/en/latest/howto/initialize/#initialize-preseed

Name: virtualisation.lxd.recommendedSysctlSettings
Desc:
Enables various settings to avoid common pitfalls when
running containers requiring many file operations.
Fixes errors like “Too many open files” or
“neighbour: ndisc_cache: neighbor table overflow!”.
See https://lxd.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production-setup/
for details.

Name: virtualisation.lxd.startTimeout
Desc:
Time to wait (in seconds) for LXD to become ready to process requests.
If LXD does not reply within the configured time, lxd.service will be
considered failed and systemd will attempt to restart it.

Name: virtualisation.lxd.ui.enable
Desc: Whether to enable (experimental) LXD UI.

Name: virtualisation.lxd.ui.package
Desc: The lxd-ui package to use.

Name: virtualisation.lxd.zfsSupport
Desc: Enables lxd to use zfs as a storage for containers.

Name: virtualisation.memorySize
Desc: The memory size in megabytes of the virtual machine.

Name: virtualisation.mountHostNixStore
Desc: Mount the host Nix store as a 9p mount.

Name: virtualisation.msize
Desc:
The msize (maximum packet size) option passed to 9p file systems, in
bytes. Increasing this should increase performance significantly,
at the cost of higher RAM usage.

Name: virtualisation.multipass.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Multipass, a simple manager for virtualised Ubuntu instances.

Name: virtualisation.multipass.package
Desc: The multipass package to use.

Name: virtualisation.multipass.logLevel
Desc: The logging verbosity of the multipassd binary.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.backend
Desc: The underlying Docker implementation to use.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers
Desc: OCI (Docker) containers to run as systemd services.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.autoStart
Desc:
When enabled, the container is automatically started on boot.
If this option is set to false, the container has to be started on-demand via its service.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.capAdd
Desc: Capabilities to add to container
Type: lazy attribute set of (null or boolean)

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.capDrop
Desc: Capabilities to drop from container
Type: lazy attribute set of (null or boolean)

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.cmd
Desc: Commandline arguments to pass to the image’s entrypoint.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.dependsOn
Desc: Define which other containers this one depends on. They will be added to both After and Requires for the unit.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.devices
Desc: List of devices to attach to this container.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.entrypoint
Desc: Override the default entrypoint of the image.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.environment
Desc: Environment variables to set for this container.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.environmentFiles
Desc: Environment files for this container.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.extraOptions
Desc: Extra options for <span class="command"><strong>podman run

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.hostname
Desc: The hostname of the container.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.image
Desc: OCI image to run.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.imageFile
Desc:
Path to an image file to load before running the image. This can
be used to bypass pulling the image from the registry.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.imageStream
Desc: Path to a script that streams the desired image on standard output.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.labels
Desc: Labels to attach to the container at runtime.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.log-driver
Desc:
Logging driver for the container.  The default of
<code class="literal">"journald"

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.login.passwordFile
Desc: Path to file containing password.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.login.registry
Desc: Registry where to login to.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.login.username
Desc: Username for login.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.networks
Desc: Networks to attach the container to

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.ports
Desc: Network ports to publish from the container to the outer host.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.preRunExtraOptions
Desc: Extra options for <span class="command"><strong>podman

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.privileged
Desc: Give extended privileges to the container

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.pull
Desc: Image pull policy for the container. Must be one of: always, missing, never, newer

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.user
Desc:
Override the username or UID (and optionally groupname or GID) used
in the container.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.volumes
Desc: List of volumes to attach to this container.

Name: virtualisation.oci-containers.containers._name_.workdir
Desc: Override the default working directory for the container.

Name: virtualisation.podman.enable
Desc:
This option enables Podman, a daemonless container engine for
developing, managing, and running OCI Containers on your Linux System.

Name: virtualisation.podman.enableNvidia
Desc: <span class="strong"><strong>Deprecated

Name: virtualisation.podman.autoPrune.enable
Desc:
Whether to periodically prune Podman resources. If enabled, a
systemd timer will run <code class="literal">podman system prune -f

Name: virtualisation.podman.autoPrune.dates
Desc:
Specification (in the format described by
<a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.time.html" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">systemd.time

Name: virtualisation.podman.autoPrune.flags
Desc: Any additional flags passed to <span class="command"><strong>podman system prune

Name: virtualisation.podman.defaultNetwork.settings
Desc: Settings for podman’s default network.

Name: virtualisation.podman.dockerCompat
Desc: Create an alias mapping <span class="command"><strong>docker

Name: virtualisation.podman.dockerSocket.enable
Desc:
Make the Podman socket available in place of the Docker socket, so
Docker tools can find the Podman socket.

Name: virtualisation.podman.extraPackages
Desc: Extra packages to be installed in the Podman wrapper.

Name: virtualisation.podman.networkSocket.enable
Desc:
Make the Podman and Docker compatibility API available over the network
with TLS client certificate authentication.

Name: virtualisation.podman.networkSocket.listenAddress
Desc: Interface address for receiving TLS connections.

Name: virtualisation.podman.networkSocket.openFirewall
Desc: Whether to open the port in the firewall.

Name: virtualisation.podman.networkSocket.port
Desc: TCP port number for receiving TLS connections.
Type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: virtualisation.podman.networkSocket.server
Desc: Choice of TLS proxy server.

Name: virtualisation.podman.networkSocket.tls.cacert
Desc: Path to CA certificate to use for client authentication.

Name: virtualisation.podman.networkSocket.tls.cert
Desc: Path to certificate describing the server.

Name: virtualisation.podman.networkSocket.tls.key
Desc: Path to the private key corresponding to the server certificate.

Name: virtualisation.qemu.package
Desc: QEMU package to use.
Default: if hostPkgs.stdenv.hostPlatform.qemuArch == pkgs.stdenv.hostPlatform.qemuArch then config.virtualisation.host.pkgs.qemu_kvm else config.virtualisation.host.pkgs.qemu

Name: virtualisation.qemu.consoles
Desc:
The output console devices to pass to the kernel command line via the
<code class="literal">console

Name: virtualisation.qemu.diskInterface
Desc: The interface used for the virtual hard disks.

Name: virtualisation.qemu.drives
Desc: Drives passed to qemu.

Name: virtualisation.qemu.drives._.deviceExtraOpts
Desc: Extra options passed to device flag.

Name: virtualisation.qemu.drives._.driveExtraOpts
Desc: Extra options passed to drive flag.

Name: virtualisation.qemu.drives._.file
Desc: The file image used for this drive.

Name: virtualisation.qemu.drives._.name
Desc: A name for the drive. Must be unique in the drives list. Not passed to qemu.

Name: virtualisation.qemu.guestAgent.enable
Desc: Enable the Qemu guest agent.

Name: virtualisation.qemu.networkingOptions
Desc:
Networking-related command-line options that should be passed to qemu.
The default is to use userspace networking (SLiRP).
See the <a class="link" href="https://wiki.qemu.org/Documentation/Networking"  target="_top">QEMU Wiki on Networking

Name: virtualisation.qemu.options
Desc:
Options passed to QEMU.
See <a class="link" href="https://www.qemu.org/docs/master/system/qemu-manpage"  target="_top">QEMU User Documentation

Name: virtualisation.qemu.virtioKeyboard
Desc: Enable the virtio-keyboard device.

Name: virtualisation.resolution
Desc: The resolution of the virtual machine display.

Name: virtualisation.restrictNetwork
Desc:
If this option is enabled, the guest will be isolated, i.e. it will
not be able to contact the host and no guest IP packets will be
routed over the host to the outside. This option does not affect
any explicitly set forwarding rules.

Name: virtualisation.rootDevice
Desc: The path (inside the VM) to the device containing the root filesystem.

Name: virtualisation.rosetta.enable
Desc: Whether to enable <a class="link" href="https://developer.apple.com/documentation/apple-silicon/about-the-rosetta-translation-environment"  target="_top">Rosetta

Name: virtualisation.rosetta.mountTag
Desc: The VirtioFS mount tag for the Rosetta runtime, exposed by the host’s virtualisation software.

Name: virtualisation.sharedDirectories
Desc:
An attributes set of directories that will be shared with the
virtual machine using VirtFS (9P filesystem over VirtIO).
The attribute name will be used as the 9P mount tag.

Name: virtualisation.sharedDirectories._name_.securityModel
Desc: The security model to use for this share:

Name: virtualisation.sharedDirectories._name_.source
Desc: The path of the directory to share, can be a shell variable

Name: virtualisation.sharedDirectories._name_.target
Desc: The mount point of the directory inside the virtual machine

Name: virtualisation.spiceUSBRedirection.enable
Desc:
Install the SPICE USB redirection helper with setuid
privileges. This allows unprivileged users to pass USB devices
connected to this machine to libvirt VMs, both local and
remote. Note that this allows users arbitrary access to USB
devices.

Name: virtualisation.tpm.enable
Desc: Whether to enable a TPM device in the virtual machine with a driver, using swtpm.

Name: virtualisation.tpm.package
Desc: The swtpm package to use.

Name: virtualisation.tpm.deviceModel
Desc: QEMU device model for the TPM, uses the appropriate default based on th guest platform system and the package passed.

Name: virtualisation.useBootLoader
Desc:
Use a boot loader to boot the system.
This allows, among other things, testing the boot loader.

Name: virtualisation.useDefaultFilesystems
Desc:
If enabled, the boot disk of the virtual machine will be
formatted and mounted with the default filesystems for
testing. Swap devices and LUKS will be disabled.

Name: virtualisation.useEFIBoot
Desc:
If enabled, the virtual machine will provide a EFI boot
manager.
useEFIBoot is ignored if useBootLoader == false.

Name: virtualisation.useHostCerts
Desc: If enabled, when <code class="literal">NIX_SSL_CERT_FILE

Name: virtualisation.useNixStoreImage
Desc:
Build and use a disk image for the Nix store, instead of
accessing the host’s one through 9p.

Name: virtualisation.useSecureBoot
Desc: Enable Secure Boot support in the EFI firmware.

Name: virtualisation.virtualbox.guest.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the VirtualBox service and other guest additions.

Name: virtualisation.virtualbox.guest.clipboard
Desc: Whether to enable clipboard support.

Name: virtualisation.virtualbox.guest.dragAndDrop
Desc: Whether to enable drag and drop support.

Name: virtualisation.virtualbox.guest.seamless
Desc: Whether to enable seamless mode. When activated windows from the guest appear next to the windows of the host.

Name: virtualisation.virtualbox.host.enable
Desc: Whether to enable VirtualBox.

Name: virtualisation.virtualbox.host.enableExtensionPack
Desc: Whether to install the Oracle Extension Pack for VirtualBox.

Name: virtualisation.virtualbox.host.enableHardening
Desc:
Enable hardened VirtualBox, which ensures that only the binaries in the
system path get access to the devices exposed by the kernel modules
instead of all users in the vboxusers group.

Name: virtualisation.virtualbox.host.enableKvm
Desc:
Enable KVM support for VirtualBox. This increases compatibility with Linux kernel versions, because the VirtualBox kernel modules
are not required.

Name: virtualisation.virtualbox.host.enableWebService
Desc: Build VirtualBox web service tool (vboxwebsrv) to allow managing VMs via other webpage frontend tools. Useful for headless servers.

Name: virtualisation.virtualbox.host.package
Desc: The virtualbox package to use.

Name: virtualisation.virtualbox.host.addNetworkInterface
Desc: Automatically set up a vboxnet0 host-only network interface.

Name: virtualisation.virtualbox.host.headless
Desc:
Use VirtualBox installation without GUI and Qt dependency. Useful to enable on servers
and when virtual machines are controlled only via SSH.

Name: virtualisation.vlans
Desc:
Virtual networks to which the VM is connected.  Each
number «N» in this list causes
the VM to have a virtual Ethernet interface attached to a
separate virtual network on which it will be assigned IP
address
<code class="literal">192.168.«N».«M»

Name: virtualisation.vmVariant
Desc: Machine configuration to be added for the vm script produced by <code class="literal">nixos-rebuild build-vm

Name: virtualisation.vmVariantWithBootLoader
Desc: Machine configuration to be added for the vm script produced by <code class="literal">nixos-rebuild build-vm-with-bootloader

Name: virtualisation.vmware.guest.enable
Desc: Whether to enable VMWare Guest Support.

Name: virtualisation.vmware.guest.package
Desc: Package providing open-vm-tools.
Default: if config.virtualisation.vmware.headless then pkgs.open-vm-tools-headless else pkgs.open-vm-tools;

Name: virtualisation.vmware.guest.headless
Desc: Whether to disable X11-related features.

Name: virtualisation.vmware.host.enable
Desc: This enables VMware host virtualisation for running VMs.

Name: virtualisation.vmware.host.package
Desc: The vmware-workstation package to use.

Name: virtualisation.vmware.host.extraConfig
Desc: Add extra config to /etc/vmware/config

Name: virtualisation.vmware.host.extraPackages
Desc: Extra packages to be used with VMware host.

Name: virtualisation.vswitch.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable Open vSwitch. A configuration daemon (ovs-server)
will be started.

Name: virtualisation.vswitch.package
Desc: The openvswitch package to use.

Name: virtualisation.vswitch.resetOnStart
Desc:
Whether to reset the Open vSwitch configuration database to a default
configuration on every start of the systemd <code class="literal">ovsdb.service

Name: virtualisation.waydroid.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Waydroid.

Name: virtualisation.writableStore
Desc:
If enabled, the Nix store in the VM is made writable by
layering an overlay filesystem on top of the host’s Nix
store.

Name: virtualisation.writableStoreUseTmpfs
Desc:
Use a tmpfs for the writable store instead of writing to the VM’s
own filesystem.

Name: virtualisation.xen.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the Xen Project Hypervisor, a virtualisation technology defined as a <span class="emphasis"><em>type-1 hypervisor

Name: virtualisation.xen.package
Desc: The Xen Hypervisor package to use.

Name: virtualisation.xen.bootParams
Desc:
Xen Command Line parameters passed to Domain 0 at boot time.
Note: these are different from <code class="literal">boot.kernelParams

Name: virtualisation.xen.debug
Desc: Whether to enable Xen debug features for Domain 0. This option enables some hidden debugging tests and features, and should not be used in production.

Name: virtualisation.xen.dom0Resources.maxMemory
Desc:
Maximum amount of memory (in MiB) that Domain 0 can
dynamically allocate to itself. Does nothing if set
to the same amount as virtualisation.xen.memory, or
if that option is set to 0.

Name: virtualisation.xen.dom0Resources.maxVCPUs
Desc:
Amount of virtual CPU cores allocated to Domain 0 on boot.
If set to 0, all cores are assigned to Domain 0, and
unprivileged domains will compete with Domain 0 for CPU time.

Name: virtualisation.xen.dom0Resources.memory
Desc:
Amount of memory (in MiB) allocated to Domain 0 on boot.
If set to 0, all memory is assigned to Domain 0, and
unprivileged domains will compete with Domain 0 for free RAM.

Name: virtualisation.xen.domains.extraConfig
Desc:
Options defined here will override the defaults for xendomains.
The default options can be seen in the file included from
/etc/default/xendomains.

Name: virtualisation.xen.efi.bootBuilderVerbosity
Desc: The EFI boot entry builder script should be called with exactly one of the following arguments in order to specify its verbosity:

Name: virtualisation.xen.efi.path
Desc: Path to xen.efi. <code class="literal">pkgs.xen

Name: virtualisation.xen.qemu.package
Desc: The QEMU (with Xen Hypervisor support) package to use.

Name: virtualisation.xen.qemu.pidFile
Desc: Path to the QEMU PID file.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.path
Desc:
Path to the Xen Store Daemon. This option is useful to
switch between the legacy C-based Xen Store Daemon, and
the newer OCaml-based Xen Store Daemon, <code class="literal">oxenstored

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings
Desc:
The OCaml-based Xen Store Daemon configuration. This
option does nothing with the C-based <code class="literal">xenstored

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.enableMerge
Desc: Whether to enable transaction merge support.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.conflict.burstLimit
Desc:
Limits applied to domains whose writes cause other domains’ transaction
commits to fail. Must include decimal point.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.conflict.maxHistorySeconds
Desc:
Limits applied to domains whose writes cause other domains’ transaction
commits to fail. Must include decimal point.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.conflict.rateLimitIsAggregate
Desc: If the conflict.rateLimitIsAggregate option is <code class="literal">true

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.perms.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the node permission system.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.perms.enableWatch
Desc: Whether to enable the watch permission system.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.persistent
Desc: Whether to activate the filed base backend.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.pidFile
Desc: Path to the Xen Store Daemon PID file.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.quota.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the quota system.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.quota.maxEntity
Desc: Entity limit for transactions.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.quota.maxOutstanding
Desc: Maximum outstanding requests, i.e. in-flight requests / domain.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.quota.maxPath
Desc: Path limit for the quota system.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.quota.maxRequests
Desc: Maximum number of requests per transaction.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.quota.maxSize
Desc: Size limit for transactions.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.quota.maxWatch
Desc: Maximum number of watches by the Xenstore Watchdog.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.quota.maxWatchEvents
Desc: Maximum number of outstanding watch events per watch.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.quota.transaction
Desc: Maximum number of transactions.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.ringScanInterval
Desc:
Perodic scanning for all the rings as a safenet for lazy clients.
Define the interval in seconds; set to a negative integer to disable.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.xenstored.accessLog.file
Desc: Path to the Xen Store access log file.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.xenstored.log.file
Desc: Path to the Xen Store log file.

Name: virtualisation.xen.store.settings.xenstored.log.level
Desc: Logging level for the Xen Store.

Name: virtualisation.xen.trace
Desc: Whether to enable Xen debug tracing and logging for Domain 0.

Name: xdg.autostart.enable
Desc:
Whether to install files to support the
<a class="link" href="https://specifications.freedesktop.org/autostart-spec/latest"  target="_top">XDG Autostart specification

Name: xdg.icons.enable
Desc:
Whether to install files to support the
<a class="link" href="https://specifications.freedesktop.org/icon-theme-spec/latest"  target="_top">XDG Icon Theme specification

Name: xdg.icons.fallbackCursorThemes
Desc:
Names of the fallback cursor themes, in order of preference, to be used when no other icon source can be found.
Set to <code class="literal">[]

Name: xdg.menus.enable
Desc:
Whether to install files to support the
<a class="link" href="https://specifications.freedesktop.org/menu-spec/latest"  target="_top">XDG Desktop Menu specification

Name: xdg.mime.enable
Desc:
Whether to install files to support the
<a class="link" href="https://specifications.freedesktop.org/shared-mime-info-spec/latest"  target="_top">XDG Shared MIME-info specification

Name: xdg.mime.addedAssociations
Desc:
Adds associations between mimetypes and applications. See the
<a class="link" href="https://specifications.freedesktop.org/mime-apps-spec/latest/associations"  target="_top">
specifications
Type: attribute set of (string or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)

Name: xdg.mime.defaultApplications
Desc:
Sets the default applications for given mimetypes. See the
<a class="link" href="https://specifications.freedesktop.org/mime-apps-spec/latest/default"  target="_top">
specifications
Type: attribute set of (string or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)

Name: xdg.mime.removedAssociations
Desc:
Removes associations between mimetypes and applications. See the
<a class="link" href="https://specifications.freedesktop.org/mime-apps-spec/latest/associations"  target="_top">
specifications
Type: attribute set of (string or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)

Name: xdg.portal.enable
Desc: Whether to enable <a class="link" href="https://github.com/flatpak/xdg-desktop-portal"  target="_top">xdg desktop integration

Name: xdg.portal.config
Desc:
Sets which portal backend should be used to provide the implementation
for the requested interface. For details check <a class="link" href="https://github.com/flatpak/xdg-desktop-portal/blob/1.18.1/doc/portals.conf.rst.in" target="_top"><span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">portals.conf
Type: attribute set of attribute set of (string or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)

Name: xdg.portal.configPackages
Desc:
List of packages that provide XDG desktop portal configuration, usually in
the form of <code class="literal">share/xdg-desktop-portal/$desktop-portals.conf

Name: xdg.portal.extraPortals
Desc:
List of additional portals to add to path. Portals allow interaction
with system, like choosing files or taking screenshots. At minimum,
a desktop portal implementation should be listed. GNOME and KDE already
adds <code class="literal">xdg-desktop-portal-gtk

Name: xdg.portal.lxqt.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the desktop portal for the LXQt desktop environment.

Name: xdg.portal.lxqt.styles
Desc:
Extra Qt styles that will be available to the
<code class="literal">lxqt.xdg-desktop-portal-lxqt

Name: xdg.portal.wlr.enable
Desc: Whether to enable desktop portal for wlroots-based desktops.

Name: xdg.portal.wlr.settings
Desc: Configuration for <code class="literal">xdg-desktop-portal-wlr
Type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))

Name: xdg.portal.xdgOpenUsePortal
Desc: Sets environment variable <code class="literal">NIXOS_XDG_OPEN_USE_PORTAL

Name: xdg.sounds.enable
Desc:
Whether to install files to support the
<a class="link" href="https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Specifications/sound-theme-spec/"  target="_top">XDG Sound Theme specification

Name: xdg.terminal-exec.enable
Desc: Whether to enable xdg-terminal-exec, the <a class="link" href="https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/xdg/xdg-specs/-/merge_requests/46"  target="_top">proposed

Name: xdg.terminal-exec.package
Desc: The xdg-terminal-exec package to use.

Name: xdg.terminal-exec.settings
Desc: Configuration options for the Default Terminal Execution Specification.
Type: attribute set of list of string

Name: zramSwap.enable
Desc:
Enable in-memory compressed devices and swap space provided by the zram
kernel module.
See <a class="link" href="https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/blockdev/zram.txt"  target="_top">
https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/blockdev/zram.txt

Name: zramSwap.algorithm
Desc: Compression algorithm. <code class="literal">lzo

Name: zramSwap.memoryMax
Desc:
Maximum total amount of memory (in bytes) that can be stored in the zram
swap devices.
This doesn’t define how much memory will be used by the zram swap devices.

Name: zramSwap.memoryPercent
Desc:
Maximum total amount of memory that can be stored in the zram swap devices
(as a percentage of your total memory). Defaults to 1/2 of your total
RAM. Run <code class="literal">zramctl

Name: zramSwap.priority
Desc:
Priority of the zram swap devices. It should be a number higher than
the priority of your disk-based swap devices (so that the system will
fill the zram swap devices before falling back to disk swap).

Name: zramSwap.swapDevices
Desc: Number of zram devices to be used as swap, recommended is 1.

Name: zramSwap.writebackDevice
Desc:
Write incompressible pages to this device,
as there’s no gain from keeping them in RAM.
